Summary: The facility was great; clean, well stocked, friendly and helpful staff,  walking distance to Disney. Because of the rain we mostly used the indoor options. Kitchen and hosting staff was exceptional. I truly don't think I've seen better!!! They were very attentive, making sure things were constantly stocked and cleaning up but not in the way. They took time to answer questions while still staying on top of things. Didn't miss a beat! The breakfast had a huge selection of items and changed a little each day for variety. They even had a challenging issue to deal with concerning a non guest and handled it very discretely and professionally, keeping the guests as the top priority. I was VERY pleased with our stay! I HIGHLY recommended this hotel and will definitely be back

The management team of this hotel is awesome. Alejandra Is is a great asset to this company.  Any company would benefit from her skills. Any company would benefit from her skills This hotel has a great pool for the kiddos. It has a putting green ,arcade and basketball court to keep the kids busy.   Very grateful for the free breakfast they give you.  The room is very clean and comfortable. The refrigerator and stove are very helpful to save money. The shuttle to Disneyland is right next to the hotel. There is many restaurants surrounding the hotel. When I go to Disneyland this is my go to hotel. When  Going to Anaheim really consider this hotel!! Thanks again Alejandra and staff you're awesome.

Breakfast here is so nice! So many options. The staff made sure things were full and the area kept clean. Julie was very kind and worked very hard. Our cheer team enjoyed this visit and starting our Disney morning with full belies.

We had a very good experience staying at this hotel. Very clean and comfortable. The breakfast was amazing a lot of variety. Most importantly the staff was very friendly and helpful. I will be staying here whenever I come to Disneyland as its just a minute away one can walk to Disneyland.

The hotel was nicely located near Disneyland, next to the Disneyland parking area. Disneyland gate is just 15 minutes of walk. Our suite was big and clean. The hotel has all the amenities for a perfect family stay. The only comment I have is on Wifi. The Wifi network was weak at our room having frequent connection break. The breakfast was hot and good with moderate spread. The breakfast attendants were excellent in their service. I would recommend this hotel for family trip to Disneyland/LA.

Great staff, very clean facility and room, nice complimentary breakfast with many choices. Dining area keep extremely clean by the hard working staff. Overall, a very good value. Short walk to Disneyland.

Hello everyone As a lifetime Hilton diamond member the Hilton Homewood suites Anaheim checks all the boxes for a weekend getaway with the family. Disney is a couple of blocks away, the rooms are clean and the staff is friendly and accommodating. The hotel offers an isolated parking area meaning no unauthorized people May enter which provides peace of mind. Upon my arrival guest services upgraded my stay from a studio to an awesome suite! Thank you Homewood suites for making our weekend getaway memorable thus far!

Great place to stay close to theme parks Great breakfast and clean modern rooms it has a pool and the staff were friendly and helpful if you go during the week the prices are cheaper than on the weekend close to the restaurants and convenient stores if you need snacks or food

We stayed here mid January for 5 nights and it was an awesome experience. First, the location is perfect for Disneyland. It is a short walk up the street to get to the Toy Story parking lot, and from there you take a shuttle to the parks. Also, in the morning, they have security check at the shuttle parking lot so you skip the much longer security check to get into Disneyland and California Adventure. Also the shuttles run till an hour after the parks close, so plenty of time to get back to the hotel. Having park accessibility like this, is worth its weight in gold.  Next, the breakfast buffett at the Homewood suites is amazing. They have a large selection to choose from, and the food was always tasty and hot. There were also lots of staff around to help if you needed something.

Homewood Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center is an excellent choice for anyone looking for a comfortable and convenient stay in Anaheim. The location is perfect for anyone attending events at the convention center or visiting Disneyland, with easy access to both. The suites are spacious, clean, and well-equipped, with all the amenities you could need, including a kitchenette, comfortable beds, and a large flat-screen TV. The staff is friendly and welcoming, and the complimentary breakfast is delicious and filling. The hotel also offers a shuttle service, making it easy to get there without having to worry about parking. Overall, Homewood Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center is a great choice for anyone visiting Anaheim and looking for a

My daughter and I stayed here last night for our trip to disney for her birthday.  The staff here are so sweet and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable, these types of hotels ruin you for high end ones that have only beds and no breakfast. I love that they took the standard free breakfast offered in many of the same kind of hotel and provided extras like chicken enchiladas and beans and rice. even the sausage they sourced and their potatoes were better quality than other chains. they are doing something super right at this location! I would absolutely return to this hotel next time I stay near Disney, especially with its proximity to the Toy Story parking lot. I also love that they had a tea / coffee station when you walk in.   I saw some reviews complain about $28/night

The lovely staff let me check in before 4pm.  Other than some cookie crumbs from prior guests on a counter, the room looks clean.  The bed was comfortable with clean linen.  Loved the big tv with direct tv with lots of channel.  Appreciated the shower with good water pressure.  There are also a fridge and a microwave.  Got a connecting room and could hear my neighbours very well and smell their food.  The breakfast offers so many choices of food from waffles, pancakes to sausages, bacon, bananas, apples and oranges.  There were lots of seats in the dining room.  The kind staff worked hard to clear tables and fill up food.  Location is convenient for Disney, 20 minute walk or 5 minute walk to the Toy Story parking shuttle.  There are many restaurants within walking distance

Rooms was not up to Hilton standards and definitely not worth the price of the room hair in shower sofa broken down hurt back to sit on bed and pillows not comfortable second time trying this hotel but it will be the last. Hilton needs to pull there name from this hotel not up to Hilton standards of other hotels I stay at
Manager Response: Hello patterson4065, thank you for your feedback regarding your recent stay with us. Please be assured we have taken immediate steps to address the hair in the shower and had maintenance look at the sofa bed in the room. Our housekeeping team has been informed to ensure we maintain the highest standards of cleanliness. We value your feedback and are committed to proving our guest with a comfortable and enjoyable stay.

Summary: Currently staying here for a 9 night stay, and having a wonderful time!  The housekeeping is absolutely incredible, breakfast spread delicious, comfortable beds and spacious suite (2 queen suite)...  Pool is on the cool side, hot tub lovely.  Only oddity is we were watching the poolside movie last night and an employee turned off the show right at the end, maybe 5 minutes remaining.  Weird!  Would stay again!

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but time for new furniture
Summary: We recently stayed for 2 nights and found the hotel and rooms to be nice and clean with a very good breakfast buffet. The downside is #1 the $28.00 charge to park and the spaces at narrower than usual. #2 the sofa bed in the room is very uncomfortable to sit on. Yes, I know it's a sofa bed but this one was so worn out that the center of the couch is 4-5" lower than the sides. Besides that, the room was very good.

Stayed here overnight for business. The breakfast was very good, the hotel was clean and safe. I would definitely stay here again. The only issue I experienced was a very loud child in the next room. But, not the hotels fault.

My family and I stayed here for a well overdue family vacation. There was almost 20 of staying to visit the Disneyland park.  We have stayed at multiple hotels in this area because we‚Äôre big Disneyland fans.  But this visit at this specific hotel was awesome! The staff and I mean all the staff were very friendly and accommodating.  I did not have one encounter where I felt unappreciated.  Amanda Velasquez, was the supervisor that I spoke to. We stayed for 4 nights and the breakfast was so delicious. They even handed out balloons for the kids during breakfast time too. What a nice touch!  Hotel was very clean. Amanda made sure all of our questions were answered and needs were timely met.  Thank You Amanda and team! We will definitely be back.

We absolutely loved this hotel. Took my family to Disney and stayed one week. If I ever go back this is where I would stay. The staff are very friendly and helpful, from the main desk, the buffet staff, the housekeeping staff as well as maintenance. Always a smile on their face and always greeted you with a hello or have a good day. The breakfast is amazing. They change it up every morning so you don't get tired of the same food. And on Wednesday we were surprised with a "Mac 'n Cheese" supper which included drinks, salads, munchies -- everything you would want. The rooms were very clean upon arrival and the housekeeping staff always made sure we were stocked up on the necessities. I don't have anything negative to say. Also the shuttle to the Disney Park was within walking

Summary Heading: A great hotel with an awesome location and breakfast!
Summary: We love this hotel and will be staying here again in the future. Nice and clean. Comfy beds. Kind and helpful staff. The free breakfast is extensive and tasty! We love that it's right beside the Toy Story parking lot so we can just walk over, go through security there and then shuttle to Disneyland. The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is the lack of supplies in the full kitchen. No sharp knife for cutting, no frying pan, no can opener. It was really bare minimum which we didn't realize when we brought groceries we couldn't then prepare. Other than that, highly recommended though!

Hotel team is amazing, from the dedicated front desk team Amanda was able to get me early check in and the next morning Crew during breakfast was great, they offered fajitas with rice and beans and waffles with potatoes and sausage. The team was very helpful.

Summary Heading: Excellent, I felt like I was home!
Summary: This was a great first impression and excellent departure. I met Tiara and Aislinn at the front desk. Tiara was able to get a room upon my request perfectly as I was staying for a conference and needed tranquility. Aislinn was very attentive as I needed help departing as my room card expired and she waited for for me to pull up and exit with no extra charge. I would definitely stay here again! I would recommend this experience and hotel. They even have 2 complimentary waters for your room and a guest reception on Wednesday evenings as a perk!

Summary Heading: Amazing Customer Service, clean, awesome for families
Summary: The staff went above and beyond to accommodate my family when my wife had to go to the ER on the last day of our stay, all during the busy Thanksgiving week.  While we were waiting for her medical answers, I made 2 separate reservations which they were able to mend together and keep us in the same room.  That was a huge stress relief.  On top of that the front desk asked me daily how my wife was doing, and you could tell there was sincerity behind the questions.    The location is a huge plus.  We just went next door to the Toy Story parking lot and caught the disney bus (for free) to the park.  In fact they do the security check at the bus station so no need to go through security once you are dropped off at the park.    This was on top of a very clean hotel, with an awesome

The facility is nice and clean with a lot of amenities. I really wan to point out that the staff is incredibly helpful.  A special shout out to Amanda and Tiara for going out  of their way to help. Give those women a raise for making my life a little easier.

Summary Heading: Clean, friendly staff and great for families
Summary: Perfect stay. Clean rooms/lobby, friendly staff, great location & reasonable price.  Checked in for 3 nights for a family vacation to Disney.   Location: close enough to Disney to be convenient, but not close enough to be high traffic and noisy. We parked our car in the secure lot with no worries and walked 5-10 next door to the Disney parking lot to take the shuttle into Disney.   Amenities: very clean and never saw a mess, even after a herd of breakfast people.  Breakfast is included (eggs, waffles, bacon/sausage, cereal, hot cereal, yogurt, fruits, toasts, and juices/coffees) parking is $28 a night with taxes/fees, small arcade, pool, kiddie pool, jacuzzi, basketball court and small mini golf area. Staff was very nice and attentive.  Room: Family suite was perfect-King bed,

This trip was fantastic. The pool and hot tub were clean and well stocked.  When we got locked out of our room we were quickly moved and comped our parking for our troubles.  Also it was walking distance to disney buses which was great Only issue was breakfast. My entire family wasn't a big fan of it, but it was hot and ready to go. Especially on a big disney day.  Would definitely recommend this place.

Summary Heading: Perfect Hotel for Our Disneyland Stay!
Summary: First time staying at this facility.  Overall, we were very pleased, and will definitely stay here again!  Pros: -Hotel was very clean & modern -Breakfast was great!  Large selection of items, and adequate seating. -Enjoyed the suite, with a separate living room/kitchenette & bedroom. -Literally right next door to Toy Story parking lot.  Left car in hotel parking lot, and we walked to the Toy Story parking lot (5 min walk) and caught the shuttle to Disneyland. -Hotel parking lot was adequate and safe. -Weather was cool, so we didn't make use of the pool and spa but it looked very large and nice.  Cons: -Parking was a little pricey @ $28/night.   -That is the only con I can think of!

Room with a clear view of Disneyland‚Äôs fireworks - spacious room at that! Plenty of parking & digital room key is a plus.  Buffet style breakfast is back üôåüèΩ All staff I‚Äôve come across has been super helpful/ friendly

Stayed at this Homewood this past week for Disneyland and the Oogi Boogie Bash. We were able to take the shuttle next door to the park and save some money in transportation. On the last night back, we did Uber since the kids were tired. The suite itself was so accommodating for our family. we were able to get the kids to bed and still enjoy the TV in the living room. Breakfast is included and they have so many options to choose from. We stayed for 3 days, and my kids enjoyed the waffles every morning. And the 24hr coffee station in the lobby was by far my favorite. If the coffee was out or not hot the front desk would brew fresh coffee pot. With such a spacious layout, free breakfast, 24hr coffee and easy transportation this will be our go to place.

I absolutely hate to leave this review but it's one I wish I would've saw. We stayed here first in August without our children on an adults trip to Disneyland. That stay was great! The location of this hotel just can't be beat as it's walking distance to Disney & it's also right next to the toy story parking lot where you can hop on a bus to disneyland for free. It has a great breakfast and the rooms are a nice size. The first stay we had a standard king guest room. No complaints. Our second visit, however, was from September 26-Oct 1. We stayed in a 1 Bedroom Premium Suite. Well, it was supposed to be, we ended up being moved to a sister property due to finding bed bugs in our room. Let me start by saying, I have never experienced bed bugs before. I felt quite a bit ignorant as

Amazing hotel!  Our room was so spacious with a full kitchen. Very clean. Even though we were told we wouldn‚Äôt have daily housekeeping, they did come in every day and do trash and towels and made our beds. Front desk staff was top notch. Super friendly. Full breakfast in the mornings was amazing. Hot eggs, bacon, sausage, etc. made from scratch. Pool area was huge and never crowded. Close walk to the toy story parking lot shuttles. We would definitely stay here again!

One of my new favorite places to stay in Anaheim. The room/beds were comfortable, room was spacious, shower was great, and the amentities were awesome. We normally stay at the parks all day, but with this hotel & amentities, we enjoyed coming back during the day.

The staff at this particular Homewood Suites were professional, courteous and went above and beyond the norm.  Specifically, Alondra, Kevin and Ciro made our stay a weekend to remember.  Don't hesitate on looking elsewhere for another Hilton hotel, this Homewood sets the Hilton standard with these 3 on board. CORPORATE - please recognize these 3...A++++++

Summary Heading: Read your bill & get a high floor
Summary: We just stayed a night. The room was spacious and beds were comfortable. Unfortunately the people above me were heavy footed night owls, but that‚Äôs not the hotel‚Äôs fault. My shuttle to the airport picked me up early. I tried to check out on my way out but the desk clerk waved me on saying they‚Äôd just auto check me out as he ran to the back. So I left and then got my receipt with a fat parking charge. I did not have a car and had I been able to check out at the desk I could have corrected it in real time. I‚Äôm sure the app has the technology to ask if you are parking a car but they don‚Äôt ask they just charge you. Beware of that. Otherwise it was a good stay.

Nice hotel relatively close to Disneyland.  Rooms are large and comfortable, typical for Homewood Suites.  Friendly staff, clean rooms and complementary breakfast.    If you‚Äôre driving an electric vehicle, be aware that they are limited.  There were no EV chargers available for our use, which was one of the reasons we chose this hotel.    The hotel is somewhat expensive, plus they tack on a $28/day parking fee.

Summary Heading: What a fantastic hotel! I am so happy I found this gem!!!
Summary: Great place to stay‚Ä¶ I will be back. Staff were so accommodating. Rooms are spacious. Hotel was spotless! Full breakfast. Bonus‚Ä¶ BBQ‚Äôs for use at the pool!!  I loved everything about this hotel and will be planning another visit soon!

We stayed at this hotel with a dog for ~4 nights during a convention. It is at a great location to the convention but a tad annoying to walk to Disneyland if that‚Äôs in your plans. We heard you can take the toy story bus and exit by buzz but haven‚Äôt tried it. They have a good dog area (for our corgi) and a bunch of EV chargers - 2 tesla destination chargers and 2 others. Parking at $28 is high but I can‚Äôt really do anything about it. Didn‚Äôt eat breakfast here due to the amazing options in the city. Room was well laid out and hotel was very quiet!

The price of the room went up while I was booking it on the app, I was told my card was declined upon check-in (though my CC company doesn‚Äôt show a decline nor a reason for one.) I wasn‚Äôt offered any additional perk/bump upon check-in for my HH status (as has been customary at every other property) and when I inquired, I was told the hotel was too small and didn‚Äôt offer that. Why is this a Hilton thing if participation varies? This is why I stayed with Hilton, otherwise I would‚Äôve switched back to Marriott.   The room: I got in late and wanted to shower and go to bed. The shower creaked and the whole encasement moved while I was in it, weird and uncomfortable. The body wash provided smelled like a urinal cake and looked like a mixture of colors, I suspect it was refilled with

Very clean room and the staff was super friendly. Breakfast was good. Pool was great. As well as housekeeping. Everything went well and we enjoyed our stay for the time that we went. Housekeeping was fast

Avoid this hotel. It is seriously gross. Our linens were not changed during check in. Our bathtub was dirty. Hair in the bed. Hair in the eggs at breakfast. Trash all over the property. Dirty towels left all over the pool area, dirty bottles etc...even at 1am. Many other hotels in the area. Avoid this one.
Manager Response: Hello JostaJTF, I sincerely apologize for the cleanliness issues you experienced during your recent stay with us. Feedback from our guest is vitally important to ensure our team is performing adequately. Please be assured I am following up accordingly to avoid recurrence. The time taken, along with the effort made to share your comments with us is most appreciated.

Summary Heading: Disclose the $28+tax parking fee at the time of reservation!
Summary: Disclose the $28+tax parking fee at the time of reservation. I reserved the room on the Hilton site - this was an unwelcome surprise on arrival. Not a great way to treat loyal customers. Not shocked, I guess, but colors my view of the rest of the stay. Disappointing.
Manager Response: Hello vermonster08, I'm sorry to hear your stay with us at Homewood was less then exceptional. Due to limited parking around the area we do have a parking fee for all vehicles. Both, our website and the confirmation details from your reservation state our parking fee of 28+tax. Unfortunately, this is not included in the room rate.

Summary: Our family stayed for 5 days at the Homewood suites in Anaheim for our visit to Disneyland. Our time with them was everything we could have hoped for. All of the staff were ready to help us in any way we required! The breakfasts were delicious, with plenty of options for everyone (only suggestion would be the warmth of the hashbrowns). Our room was what we expected upon arrival, and comfortable for our families entire stay. I would also like to mention that our dealings with front desk staff Amanda and Aislynn were outstanding! Wonderful representatives of quality customer service!

We booked the room for a single night stay and thwarted disaster as the city's water line broke and took out the water at the hotel. I've never seen staff so eager to problem solve and offer solutions for each family based on their needs. The property itself was clean and had a lot of activities besides the pool. Basketball,  fire pit, mini golf, a little arcade, gym. Breakfast was delicious and plentiful. Our "family suite" was huge. Bunk beds + a trundle, a huge king size bed and a sleeper sofa. My whole family loved it. But the shining stars of the property were the staff. I'd put everyone's names, but I have too many kids and barely remember their names. Thank you so very much for the stay. We'll be back!!

This hotel was one of the best have ever stayed at for a family vacation. With the kids finally on summer break we went out to Anaheim for Disneyland and some much needed beach time. We came in on a Wednesday and got to enjoy the happy hour when we arrived. The best part is that the beer and wine is free, now a days nothing is free. We spent 2 days at Disneyland one day at the hotel pool and our last day out at the beach. The receptionists always welcomed us when we came back to the hotel. We got a 2 queen suite. It has a kitchen and living room with a pullout sofa. The set up was perfect for us since there are two TVs. Kids got to watch their shows and the adults did too. For the size for the room and free breakfast there was no better deal I found.

We had a 1 bedroom with 2 queens suite. We always check the beds to make sure that they are clean before we commit to the room. Even though our beds had some "stains".... it was far more nicer than the other two that was offered.  Lets just say, the other beddings needed to be burned or hazmat come in and take them away. We decided to keep our room. The sofa was falling apart and it sagged real bad in the middle to the point that if two people sat at the same time, they would lean towards each other. There was only 2 forks and 1 knife in the drawer in the kitchen. No dish towels. 1 trash can. Had to ask for another one for the bathroom. No dish soap either.   The breakfast was nice and clean.The lobby and common areas were clean. Pool area was also clean and nice. The evening

I wish I could give a higher review, but the room I stayed in was a bit below average.   Pros  Quiet rooms, could not hear neighboring guests and they could not hear us (great since we were visiting with two small kids)  Walking distance to shuttle (5 minutes) and Disneyland park (~20 mins) Free breakfast buffet   Cons  Room showed signs of wear and tear (stains on carpet, dirty couch, sunken in mattress, stale smell)

Summary Heading: People is what separates a hotel
Summary: The hotel is generally rated as okay for me. If you want to go by the room alone. Beds/Sheets/Pillows are all expected to be mediocre in this class of a hotel. Glassware not really washed, all the cups were sticky... so had to washed them again.  But what makes this hotel different is really the people. Especially Alejandra and those in the front desk (sometimes Alejandra is there too.. she's everywhere).  I watched Alejandra scrub tables the moment a guest was leaving. I saw her clean up the mess someone made spilling eggs on the floor and walking away from it. She wiped the table clean, got a broom for the eggs and then got on her hands and knees to get the last pieces of eggs out of the carpet.  Then she's greeting and handing balloons to kids, all with a smile. I looked at

Summary Heading: Overall great hotel while visiting Disneyland
Summary: Pros: Tasty and hot breakfast with a variety of items every morning, coffee provided in lobby 24 hours a day, clean/nice size pool, half size basketball court, 15-20 minute walk to Disney entrance, full refrigerator, table for two, living room area, ceiling fain and AC unit in room  Cons: Older mattress and bedding, weak shower pressure, unable to move shower head wasn't centered, dusty spots near bathroom counter area, hair found in different tile areas,

Amazing stay with the whole Homewood team being so nice.the front desk team made a smooth check in for me and my family . Breakfast was so good that I had it every morning. Housekeeping brought towels when we requested. Maintance helped with an issue from my room.

If you.plan to arrive before check in this hotel give you your room at exact 4pm not earlier. The location is great. 2 blocks from Disney and next to the Disney parking lot in where you can take the shuttle.  In the morning if you do not want to make a big line at the entrance to check your backpack ill recommend you to take the Shuttle to avoid those big lines. Hotel rooms are great and very spacious.  For breakfast the have many options ( pancakes, waffles, oatmeal,  fruit, cereals, scramble eggs, potatoes, and more option). They have a basketball court and a super small mini golf. For the swimming pool at the front desk you can request inflatable things for the kids.

Homewood Suites by Hilton was my family's favorite Disneyland Good Neighbor Hotel, so far. For the experience of having a suite with three beds, complimentary hot breakfast, laundry, bathtub, and two televisions, they get 5 stars! However, there were two issues that are not the fault of the hotel. Firstly, we can hear the family above us on the fourth floor. They must have a toddler or two running and jumping from room to room late at night now early in the morning. My teens don't care because they wear headphones to bed, but it really bugs me. I did not complain to them or the front desk and the guests upstairs might not know how noisy the kids feet are. Second issue that many have stated is with housekeeping not picking up the room on a daily basis. Not sure if this is a

This hotel has everything to make a family holiday to Disneyland perfect.  Our family bunk room was spacious and comfortable with excellent kitchen facilities.  The huge breakfast offering, pool, hot tub and basketball were highlights for my children.  No need for a car as the Disney shuttle bus is next door.  Wonderful hotel!

Summary Heading: Great service great place good breakfast
Summary: Good atmosphere and would stay here again in the future I love that they‚Äôre is a complimentary breakfast and if you need something it‚Äôs there right away and they have valet service and carts for your stuff

Man I took my daughter to Disneyland and we had a rough start at first but as soon as we found a place to stay and we got into the hotel it was great the service was amazing they allowed us to eat breakfast and relax while we waited for our room and the stay was great really close to the shuttle‚Äôs and the Disney parking lot and the hostess were really good there was this lady Tiara and she was so nice and friendly and she gave me advice about places to eat and she helped us out a lot. Thank you all at the Homewood suites

We stayed while visiting Disneyland.  The hotel is literally next to ToyStory Disney Parking so it's super convenient if you're visiting Disneyland.  The rooms are spacious and clean and the beds are comfortable.  Breakfast is delicious and they do change it up every morning.  The kitchen staff is super friendly and very attentive.  They have an evening social on Wednesday that is practically a full meal.  All you can drink wine or beer on the Wednesday social.  This is the reason why we stay at this hotel.  Please, please bring back the evening social back to pre-covid conditions.  This is the reason why I recommend this hotel to all those I know.  Julie and Miguelangel were so extremely attentive.    The front office is also super attentive.  Alondra, Tiarra and the young

Summary Heading: Great hotel, location and made my daughters birthday!
Summary: What can I say?! I put in the notes about my daughters birthday and not only did they upgrade our room so she can have bunk beds but gave her balloons with candy in it! It was only a room for dad and daughter. I assumed the breakfast would only Include cereal eggs and bacon but NOPE! It had waffles you can make, sausage, enchiladas, beans, rice, toast, bagels and more. Cleanliness was on point as when ppl got up tables were bussed quickly. New dishes were put out in good time And staff were very friendly! I don‚Äôt write reviews ever but when you go above and beyond for a birthday I‚Äôll make sure to write a review!!! I will def. Stay again at this hotel and the game room for the kid was damn cool!

Summary Heading: Close to Disney, broken ice machines, tiny parking area that turned into valet
Summary: The location is right next door to the Toy Story parking lot for Disney and is nice because you clear security there and are dropped off at the door with no need to go thru security at the park.   When we first got there, we were getting texts from the hotel and I thought that meant the service would be great. However, at arrival, you have to figure out how to get into parking. I asked for a digital key, which I got but it couldnt be used to get into parking. Instead I needed to take my ticket to be validated at front desk in exchange for a key and parking pass to be put on my dash. Not at all convenient and defeats the purpose of a digital key. The parking spots are tiny. We parked 2 days on our own and then they started blocking off the parking lot and forcing you to use valet

This is a great place to stay, very suitable for families. Location is great, you just have to walk to the next parking lot to get to the shuttle to go to Disneyland. The staff are very friendly and accommodating. I will definitely come back here again and will recommend this place to my family and friends.

Two years ago, we gave our four grandchildren a trip to Disneyland only to have it delayed for over two years.  This June 2022, we finally all gathered at the airport for the beginning of an incredible adventure.  All 10 of us stayed at Homewood Suites because of location-location, the room arrangement, breakfast buffet and 10-minute walk to the Disney shuttle.  The staff were friendly and always helpful.  We spent three glorious days in Disneyland and California Adventure. Every night we returned to relax and prepare for the next day.  Homewood Suites was a hit for us and  I highly recommend it.

Summary Heading: Great location, clean room, good for family of 3
Summary: This hotel gets a lot of points for being right by the Disney parking shuttle.  This made getting to the parks super quick and easy.  The hot breakfast and the staff are great also.  Nice to have a full kitchen in the room also.  Downside‚Äîroom amenities are a bit lacking.  Not enough shampoo/conditioner in room, towels are sparse and very thin and small.  It was nice to have complimentary drinks and snacks in the room, but I didn‚Äôt know they were free until I asked.  I felt like I had to ask a lot of questions as there was zero information in the room.

I highly recommend Homewood Suites. The grounds the location and staff is amazing. The rooms are comfortable and nice. The highlight was the delicious hot breakfast. Every morning its different selections very well stocked breakfast staff was excellent.

Summary Heading: With so many available, choose another hotel!
Summary: The room was stinky and stale smelling. The room was dirty and felt like a dungeon. It took so much work to get housekeeping to follow through. We made the best of it but would never stay here again. There are so many hotels to chose from, pick another one!

TL;DR: Great value, location and service! Breakfast was delicious!  Full details:   VARIETY OF ROOM LAYOUTS I highly recommend this hotel for families going to Disneyland. Our group stayed in a one bedroom suite and a King non-suite room. It was perfect for our group that they offer a variety of room layouts so the family with kids could stay in a suite and the grandparents could have a separate room. The rooms were clean and well stocked. The staff were friendly and helpful.  VALUE We did thorough research of the hotels near Disneyland that offers one bedroom suites and this hotel seems to be the best value.  PARKING I was lucky and was able to find street parking nearby to avoid the $28/night parking fee. We had some visitors and they were able to get free day parking in the

The kitchen team was excellent.  Breakfast area was well maintained and exceptionally clean.  There were a large number of families with small children, near Disney Land.  The kitchen staff was able to keep everything stocked and lines moved quickly. It is refreshing to see excellence post-covid where so many other hotels and restaurants seem to struggle.  I especially liked the availability of chicken enchiladas for breakfast!

I was looking for a local place to stay for the long weekend and this hotel just kept pulling me back with all the activities it has and the proximity to Disneyland. We got to enjoy the pool and free breakfast. Parking fee in the area is crazy. Everywhere I looked had a fee, so be prepared to pay 28 a day. Everyone from the staff was really nice and friendly. 10 out of 10 will stay again.

Thoroughly enjoyed my stay: clean and comfortable suite with excellent service throughout the hotel. Easy walk to the convention center. Convenient to bus stops for  the resort shuttle and OCTA bus. Plenty of restaurants on the block or within walking/delivery distance. Staff from front desk to housekeeping were all friendly and welcoming. Would stay again!

Hotel conveniently located to Disneyland parking or quick walk to parks. Clean,  spacious suite. Easy parking. And outstanding customer service. Free breakfast offered but we didn‚Äôt try it. Would return if needed in the future for Disney trips.

Summary Heading: Saved the day, and our trip was better for it
Summary: My family and I were coming down to Disneyland and within a week of the trip the Airbnb we had booked turned out to be a scam. With only a few days notice we called and talked to one of the hotel managers, I‚Äôm not even going to mention her name, because all of the staff were incredible and while singling her out might make her feel good, it would diminish the superior level of service we received during our entire stay. She was just the tip of the spear figuring out a way to make our reservation work, which she did, but when we arrived we were blown away by the facility and the ease of everything in the property itself, and access to everything around it, including the Disney parks. The breakfast was outstanding, the staff were friendly, and they did everything they could to

Summary Heading: The staff was so very Nice and Helpful,,,,,,
Summary: From the breakfast ü•û to just making sure your stay is very comfortable. In fact we were celebrating our 43 anniversary and the front desk staff got together a small Beautiful basket üß∫ of goodies and put it in our room. So when we got back from Disneyland we got a Wonderful surprise and they all signed the ‚ÄúCard‚Äù‚Ä¶Then May 3 it was my wife birthday ü•≥ a kitchen staff got together a little gift üíù with a card and everyone sign it as well. This Truly made our vacation feel so Greatly Appreciate‚Ä¶.THE HILTON HOMEWOOD SUITES is Truly a Friendly place to stay‚Ä¶

We were in a bind being scammed twice from different vrbo's and needed something short notice in a certain budget. Alejandra was amazing in helping our family out. She was kind, considerate and helped us out huge.   All the employees were kind and very helpful. We needed a few blankets, or help with directions etc they were always willing and ready to help. The little touches of water and snacks in the room each day was also very generous. Breakfast each morning was top notch, and always more than enough!!   Location is awesome, very clean, close to Disney and restaurants.  When we come back Anaheim for Disney, this is where we will stay no question.  Thank you so much for an amazing blessing to our trip!! Thank you for

I travel all over the country working different trade shows.  And every time they have me in Anaheim I make sure they book me at Homewood Suites.  I just love it here and I tell my company to always book their staff here.  There breakfasts are better than any other hotel in the area, and every Wednesday evening they have a beer and wine social.  Two free meals included in my stay‚Ä¶cha Ching!!  Right now I  am here working the California Dental Association convention and Julie and Javier were the perfect hosts for this weeks social.  I tried to give them tips and they both declined.  They told me that they don‚Äôt do it for the tips, they just really like to see their guests enjoy their experience.  5 star service all the way.  Thank you Homewood Suites

EXELLENT customer service by amazing friendly lady Amanda!!!!! She is professional, polite and very respectful!!! PM front desk clerk needs more encouragement to be friendly and not rude.  We really like local and food!!! Eggs ü•ö ü•ì for breakfast üòã very tasty and delicious üòã salad for dinner very helpful and healthy üòã

The hotel staff advised us of the requirements for house cleaning services during our 5 day stay. Although we followed the rules the house cleaning staff did not. When it was brought to the attention of the hotel staff we were told the house cleaning company is a third party and they can‚Äôt determine what their policies are. House cleanings we‚Äôre coming into our room unannounced, when the sign on the door stated to not enter, and when it was requested they never showed up.

This hotel is excellent if you‚Äôre planing to visit Disneyland parks or the convention center. I loved my stay and everyone is super kind specially Aislinn and the manager, they helped us make a reservation for a future visit and do our check in   The hotel is rated 4.7 (as displayed) but I bet is not updated cause this is a 5 star hotel, we arrived at 10:00am AND they gave us free breakfast even when free breakfast ended at 9:00 am because they heard my brother said he was hungry   They‚Äôre amazing, personal is amazing, and very clean in all aspects.

Summary Heading: Not up to the usual standard
Summary: I like this hotel, but our recent stay had some rough spots and annoyances, so I'm feeling nitpicky. Starting with beds. King bed was made up with queen size sheets which weren't even big enough to cover the top surface of the bed. Top bunk bed wasn't made up at all, just had sheets stacked on it. Sofa bed is impossible to open up until after you've solved a Mensa-level puzzle of moving, turning, and stacking the small table and useless bench that are jammed in front of it. Parking now costs $27/day plus tax, which is quite unwelcome. One of two non-Tesla EV chargers was broken. Evening reception only on Wednesdays. Pool seemingly unheated. On the plus side, it was nice to have a real breakfast buffet at a hotel instead of the sad "grab and go" thing.
Manager Response: Hello FryGuyToo, thank you for taking the time to review and rate your recent stay at our property. I'm sorry to hear your stay was not as enjoyable as we would have hoped. Your feedback is very important to us; please be assured I have followed up with our housekeeping team to ensure the correct sheets are on all the beds. Unfortunately, yes, the evening social is only Wednesdays for all Homewood's per Hilton standards. Please feel free to reach out to me directly if your travels bring you back to Anaheim. I would love to ensure a future stay is up to expectation. I can be reach at alejandra.jacobo2@hilton.com.

Summary Heading: Nice stay; comfortable for a family of 4
Summary: This was our first stay at a Homewood Suites and we were pleasantly surprised at the amount of space and quality for the price. It's located right next to the Disneyland parking lot so no need to pay for Disney parking. There are plenty of eating options as well outside of Disney that would accommodate nearly all tastes. The staff were welcoming and working working hard to keep everything running smoothly. Breakfast was okay, but not our primary reason for being there. The kitchenette was just the right size. We would stay here again during our next visit.

Great place and 1 block from Disney. Suite rooms have everything you need for a big family. Check in was very fast and convenient, overall a great looking place and service was great. Shuttle to Disney is about 100 yards from hotel.

I stayed during the big convention that takes place at the Anaheim Convention Center. The front desk person gave me a complimentary early check in on the date of arrival. This was very helpful since I had many deliveries coming in. I let the attendant know and they informed me as soon as they arrived. The room itself was large enough to spread out for the 5 days I was there. Overall I enjoyed this location, it‚Äôs about 5-10 minute walk to the convention center and a lot of dining options in the area too.

Great hotel with great location that made our Family trip to Disneyland enjoyable.Great breakfast menu was a great bonus. Staff was friendly and accommodating on arrival and throughout our stay. Within walking distance to a number of excellent restaurants outside of Disneyland.

The rooms were super clean, very comfortable, and the staff was amazing. The staff went above and beyond to help make our stay enjoyable. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Orange County.

Second time staying here. The suites are great for families. The staff and service were exceptional. Breakfast was decent but a little more variety would be nice. Location is good. We walked to the Toy Story parking lot and caught the shuttle to D-Land each day.

We have been staying at this property for our Disneyland visits but it‚Äôs definitely not the same. Rooms were dirtier than I remember, breakfast was yucky, we contracted a bacterial skin infection from the hot tub. Just generally speaking not my best Hilton experience l.

This was my first time that my family and I have visited the Homewood Suite Brand.  Check-in was contactless via cell phone with digital key.  Upon entering the room and "getting the lay of the land" we were quite pleased with the accommodations.  However, I did notice that there were no face clothes or hand towels within the room...only bath towels.  Though I requested such after getting settled they did not arrive until the next day, or should I say I went down to the front desk to get them. I was not too pleased with the shower.  It offered luke warm hot water and there was no good water pressure at all.  Breakfast was offered and due to the Covid-19 protocols it was sufficient (nothing to brag about).  Overall, my visit was very pleasant, the staff was helpful and courtesy.

I would like to preface this by saying we have stayed at this hotel before snd we have stayed with several Hilton Hotels in the past. This trip started out OK. We got a top floor facing Disneyland, room was clean and felt like home. However on the last day of our five night stay, we were packing up to head back to the airport the next morning. While packing our belongings we found items missing from our room. A lounge fly backpack that was just purchased at Disneyland and two Apple watches were nowhere to be found. We search high and low. These items were in our room when we left for the parks at 8:30 AM. When we returned at 5 PM, they were missing. I made a phone call to the front desk. I was told they would give us a call back after having the maintenance man look and see who

Was there for 2 nights.  About a mile walk to Disneyland. Rooms were immaculate,  however could use an update.  I had stayed at a newer Home 2 suites and there were lots of usb outlets.  It took me a little bit to figure out where I was going to charge my stuff.  In this day and age, usbs are a must.  Also the closet door by the bathroom kept slamming shut.  It wouldn‚Äôt stay propped open.   My first night, I got back to the room late and I kept accidentally letting the door slam.    Breakfast was interesting.   They had a line set up and would serve you out of the hot dish containers.   Kind of like cafeteria style.  It seemed this was how they were doing their part to keep things sanitary.   No yogurt?   I need yogurt in the morning.  And anytime I stay at a Hilton property

Great stay, great staff, and great location. Very clean and makes you feel safe. I would come back again and would recommend staying at this location for Disneyland or Any business at the Anaheim convention center.

Summary Heading: Great staff, nice room and decent breakfast.   This Homewood Suits is terrific.
Summary: The Homewood Suites was terrific.  The staff (front desk and breakfast attendants) were very friendly.  The room was clean, beds comfortable (could use softer pillows).  The breakfast choices were decent.  Overall made for a great stay.

We spent a Saturday to the following Sunday there for a total of eight nights. Being right next door to the parking lot and being able to take the shuttle to the parks was a huge plus. Be aware that if you park at the hotel this is a daily charge which was higher than I anticipated, but expected based on the hotel. Breakfasts were limited but sufficient to get everyone going. Would have liked to have had yogurt, but they are making due with restrictions. Had an issue with an upstairs neighbor who refused to quiet down and stomped around until the odd hours of the morning, in spite of sending security up multiple times. They gave my wife and me another quiet room for the night so we could rest. They did their best to help us out. Very friendly staff.

It‚Äôs a nice hotel, the breakfast is good, and the staffs are friendly, and nice. I would recommend this to people if they would need hotels near Disneyland. And one of convenience  of the hotel is that there are lots of store near by.

Summary Heading: You get what you paid for üëåüèΩ
Summary: I have been to many and this one takes it! 20 min walk to Disneyland entrance. Enough of a warm up for those extra steps you will be taking during your time at the park(s). Safe parking lot. Also make sure to get that great breakfast !

Homewood is always my favorite hotel chain to stay and this location is no exception. They have a suite with bunk beds, a trundle, pullout sofa and a king bed. This is perfect for my whole family. Breakfast is also included and the ladies at the breakfast station are really nice. The front desk staff is great and the housekeepers got me the extra items I needed. The location is walking distance to Disneyland and to the parking lot next door where you can get a shuttle.

Summary Heading: Friendly staff, clean environment and awesome location
Summary: I was amazed how clean hotel was kept daily. Staff friendly and location was close to parks and The House of Blues.  I also left 3 personal items behind and th next day, I was able to pick up from the hotel Losr and Found

Summary Heading: Famly Disneyland Trip5 star review for Homewood Suites Anaheim Convention Center
Summary: Family trip to Disney and stayed at Homewood Suites for 5 nights and 6 days. Amazing customer service!! Especially from a young man Eric Ramos. Super informative, kind, went over and beyond to help my  family and I. 5 stars service!!!  From check in to check out my family and I were impressed. Its located next door to Disney, Complimentary hot breakfast served every morning with cereal, fruit, juice, hot tea and coffee. Hotel rooms were clean, cleaning service great, fresh towels requested. I highly recommend  this Homewood suites. My family and I received 5 star service with Aloha spirit from all staff.  Location is perfect for Disney!! My family and I will only stay at Homewood suites Anaheim convention center for our Disney trips.

Fantastic hotel, very clean, great rooms, beautiful pool area! Our only complaint was the shower in the room wasn‚Äôt very hot and the pressure wasn‚Äôt great. I would stay here again without question!  Front desk staff was the most friendly and welcoming we have seen!

The staff was great but the bed was sagging, the couch was dirty, the pool was ice cold, the children could barely stand jumping in (it had said heated pool), and the breakfast was absolutely the worst I have ever seen at a hotel.

Updating my previous review‚Ä¶ this hotel has lived hard in the last 3 years! It‚Äôs looking a little rough. The bathtub was peeling, outlets didn‚Äôt work by the bed, the TV in the bedroom didn‚Äôt work at all and the front one was stuck on Spanish, and the ceiling fan/light combo in the bedroom flickered really badly. Service was very inconsistent- day 1 we had 1 granola bar, that‚Äôs it. Day 2 more snacks appeared as well as a single can of Coke, but no coffee. Day 3 we got 2 cokes and 1 sprite and finally more snacks. It was nice and all, but‚Ä¶ inconsistent. We were told there wouldn‚Äôt be any room service but obviously there was (yay!) however they didn‚Äôt leave any hand towels or washcloths until our 3rd day. The breakfast downstairs was not as great as our last stay but that was

Stayed here because we needed 3 beds.  Sofa bed was very uncomfortable!  Ended up wishing we had gotten a second room and our family would have been happier.  Don‚Äôt be late for breakfast at 9:30 all foodies removed.

Summary Heading: will highlight my room and more
Summary: I was in room 259.  The main ceiling light thinks its in the 1970s as its tripping and flickering for the 1st 5 minutes you turn it on.  The night stand electricity near window did not work either.    Breakfast was super sad.  I was glad to leave for that breakfast.  Lackluster.    I dont appreaciate the extra charge for parking.  Thats no necessary.. but it seem like everyone is doing it
Manager Response: Hello Divebabydive, thank you for taking the time to detail you recent stay with us. I am sad to hear your stay with us was not closer to the 5 bubble experience we hope for all our guest. Please be assured our engineering team has addressed the issues in room 259. We are currently working with our vendors and hope to return to our full breakfast options soon. I hope, if your travels bring you back to Anaheim, you will consider giving us another opportunity to deliver the stay we believe all our guest deserve and we now we can provide.

Summary: I requested that my room be cleaned the day before but it was never cleaned.  The carpet was coming up on the edges in the room.  It was not as nice as I expected for the price.  My thermostat never worked and was not fixed even though I reported it.
Manager Response: Hello Andrea N, thank you for this review and the feedback on your stay with us. I am sorry that you experienced issues with the thermostat in the room; furthermore that after it was reported it was not addressed. I will certainly be following up with the team. I would love to get in touch with you regarding the particular room you were in. Our goal is for all of our guest experiences to be at a 5star. Feel free to email me directly at Alejandra.Jacobo2@hilton.com or by phone at (714) 705-0531.  I hope we get the opportunity to welcome you and your family back.

Summary: Liked location, but the room temperature system made it difficult to be comfortable in the room.  Breakfast was nice but not enough variety.  We did enjoy our stay over all but parking was $24 plus taxes which for 6 nights was over $175  ouch

Summary Heading: Great Hotel With Multiple Ways to get to Disney
Summary: Just finished a week stay at the hotel (Jan 1-8) and wanted to share my experience.  Location - This hotel is right next to the Toy Story parking lot. You can walk approximately 1 mile to the Park or about 1/3 mile to the busses. We usually walked in the morning to the park and rode the bus home at the end of the day. In the am you go through security in the parking lot which can or can not save time, depends on how busy it is. Also you can walk to Garden Walk which has a ton of restaurants and there are a lot of food options nearby. We had a car and parking was never an issue despite being a busy week.  Room - We had a 1 bedroom 2 Queens. The room showed the normal wear and tear any hotel room has. It was clean, the furniture and bed were comfortable and the water hot and

This is a great location is going to Disneyland. Walking distance though can also catch the shuttle from the Toy Story parking lot next door or take the ART bus from one hotel over. The ART bus is the best option for those who want to save their steps for inside the parks, though it can be a 20‚Äì30-minute wait for the bus to arrive.   Hotel was clean and comfortable, with very friendly staff. The majority of guests followed the rules and work masks around the halls and in the elevators. We stayed in a family suite with the bunk beds and for 3 adults and 3 kids this worked out well.  Would have been nice to have 2 bathrooms or at least 2 toilets though. Some small issues came up during the stay including losing power in the bathroom the last morning and losing power in the kitchen

Summary Heading: Good Disney location but terrible breakfast.
Summary: 15 minute walk to Disney which is nice. The room we got on top floor was quiet and peaceful since there are tons of kids in this hotel. The staff was pleasant. The breakfast was absolutely horrible. So bad. I‚Äôve stayed in several Hilton properties during COVID and they always had decent breakfast so this can‚Äôt be an excuse. Your choice was terrible scrambled eggs with some kinds of sausage and potato. Wheat bread and oatmeal and banana and apple. NOTHING ELSE! A hotel full of kids and no donuts. The eggs were so bad. We ended up going to a grocery store to buy breakfast supplies. Overall we enjoyed our stay but don‚Äôt factor an edible breakfast into your decision to stay at this resort.
Manager Response: Hello dgertyjunk, Thank you for your detailed feedback. We sincerely apologize for the minimal selection during our breakfast.  We are working closely with our vendors to be able to bring back the breakfast options we had prior to Covid. Due to the high demand in this area it has certainly been a struggle to have a plentiful supply of a variety of items for all our guest. However, I'm sorry this affected your stay in such a negative way. If your travels bring you back to Anaheim please feel free to contact me directly when making your arrangements to come back, I want to make sure everything is perfect for you. You can reach me on my direct phone line: (714)705-0531.

Summary Heading: Not as good as it used to
Summary: We have been coming to this hotel for years for our Disneyland trips, this recent stay was different.  I know there is a pandemic, but it should not be an excuse for the staff to be rude and display an ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt care‚Äù attitude.  We got assigned room 143 next to the parking lot, the laundry rooms, elevators, and exit doors to the basketball court area. We booked in advance and when we checked in a 4 pm ( earliest time to do so), I would expect to at least have a choice of room. I know that the hospital is busy, but at least the staff should have responded in a nicer way instead of, ‚Äúwell, our hotel if busy and we have a lot of guests, and sometimes you just have to deal with it‚Äù. That was the response I got from a male staff member working that day.  Another example was the
Manager Response: Hello nicusj44, I would like to sincerely apologize for the lack of customer service you experienced during your stay here at Homewood Suites. Please know I am following up with our agents, I feel terrible that you and your family were not able to fully enjoy your time with us due to the location of your suite. Unfortunately our order for hot chocolate had been in backorder for sometime; this in no way should have granted the response you received from our team. I would appreciate the opportunity to speak to you directly; we take our commitment to satisfaction seriously and hope you would allow us the opportunity to regain your loyalty. Please feel free to contact me directly at 714-705-0531 or by email at Alejandra.Jacobo2@hilton.com.

Summary Heading: Excellent service from top to bottom!
Summary: The staff was wonderful and went above and beyond to make our stay hospitable and memorable! The room was very clean and accommodated my family of 6 very comfortably! Breakfast was a little limited due to covid, however it was warm flavorful and delicious:) will definitely be staying here again! 10 out of 10 recommend!!!

Summary Heading: Great hotel, friendly staff, walk to disneyland
Summary: Great hotel, friendly staff, walk to disneyland. The walk was a little further than we thought, about ten minutes walk from the hotel to park entrance. Rooms were clean, easy to get elevators quickly. breakfast was adequate, there were fewer options than a typical homewood breakfast but I assume this is due to covid.

Stayed at homewood suites for 3 days when we visited disney. We got a room facing the toy story parking lot and we were able to see the fireworks right on the day we checked in from the window!. This is super close to the toy story parking lot and we were able to get a shuttle up and down the disneyland. Breakfast was very basic. Kitchen was basic with just 2 cooking utensils with not even salt or sugar. Guest laundry was useful for those beach days, $4 for each cycle of wash and dry.  Room service was expected to be on request but we had the service on all three days.  Overall, an excellent stay.

Been going to Disneyland for decades. First  time staying here‚Ä¶..it is now our go to hotel. Extremely happy with everything‚Ä¶convenient, clean & accommodating. Ver comfortable. I will recommend it to all my friends & family.

Summary Heading: This is the family place to stay!
Summary: You couldn‚Äôt ask for anything better! The free shuttle to Disneyland is so close to the hotel. Free breakfast and kid friendly amenities. Friendly staff and clean! I will gladly stay here again! Thank you for a fabulous holiday

Tiny rooms, 0 amenities, and if you ask for ANYTHING be prepared to ask multiple times. Took us 9 tries to get k cups‚Ä¶.. and they brought us decaf. The ‚Äúbreakfast‚Äù consisted of rotten eggs, stale tater tots, and sausage. The bread area (where you usually find bagels, muffins, etc..) consisted of a loaf of white bread.

I booked my room for my family was different price and I got there was different price it was way higher the the price I was booked online and the elevator we can ride together with worker and no body wash and very small shampoo and conditioner for the whole family

The staff were fantastic. They were courteous and professional and went out of their way to make us feel welcome and valued. The room was very clean. They stocked the room with complimentary snacks which was very thoughtful. The quality of the snacks were much higher than other hotels we‚Äôve stayed at in the area. The bed could have been a little more comfortable, and it was a little pricier than some of the other hotels in the area. But you can‚Äôt beat the location if you‚Äôre going to Disneyland. It‚Äôs a short walk to the Toy Story parking lot / shuttle service.

This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel and we enjoyed it just as much.  The rooms are very comfortable.  They are doing a nice job with breakfast during the pandemic. They do not have all the same selections for breakfast, but had everything we needed.  Staff was a super friendly, especially Shontiara who went above and beyond to make sure our stay was extraordinary.  Thank you all and we look forward to our next visit.

Honestly I am torn between 2 and 3 stars.  I had such high hopes for this hotel and it definitely fell short.  Check in was a breeze, good customer service and my room was ready early.  Room was clean minus a few stains on the bedding.  A few maintenance problems in my room...light above the bed flickered and freezer door in fridge was broken.  The kitchen was not stocked at all.  No plastic or glass cups to be had for brushing teeth.  Room was stocked with 2 disposable coffee cups and that was it.  Pillows are horrible but sheets were great.  Mattress itself was fine.  Noise level - that was an issue! You could hear everything in hallways including a trash bag being opened.  I was beside ice machine and it was incredibly loud.  Coffee pots are the old crappy hotel ones and my

Room nicely accommodated the 6 of us  We would stay there again. Very convenient to Disneyland and shuttle. Beautiful outdoor area. Breakfast was delicious!! Staff was very helpful with additional needs for our stay.

Free Breakfast horrible! AC in rooms would not allow temperature selection below 68F. Was clean and nice besides that.   I was very surprised that this level of property by Hilton really did to come close to my expectations. As a Diamond loyalty member I was extremely dissatisfied.

Summary Heading: Homewood Suites by Hilton Anaheim maingate
Summary: We booked through Costco Travel and secured a 1 bedroom King suite.  Definitely a 3 star however perfect for our family.  Daily breakfast served buffet style and they do mix it up daily.  Also ART transportation available for purchase to disneyland park about a 15 minute commute.  We enjoyed the spacious room, full kitchen.  Would recommend for affordable family stay.  Lots of close by restaurants and target right across the street.  Also amazon fresh delivers and uber eats right to tour door.

Close distance to Disneyland we walked there, it was a nice place to stay for our family Disney trip. It would be better if they shuttled guest to Disneyland. The check in was super fast my room was ready way ahead of time than the time I was told which was a plus

Always stay here. Ben is very accommodating. Clean, friendly staff, will let you check in early and check out late. Basketball courts, swimming pools, jacuzzi. Not much more you can ask for! Recommend this place to all my family and friends when visiting Disneyland.

Loved the suites here. Great stuff. Great Amenities. When we arrived we were greeted and welcomed warmly and kindly. Rooms were clean and spacious and perfect for a family of 4 and can accommodate up to 6.

lt was a great 3 night stay. Breakfast was good. Wish pancakes or waffle had been one of the options to eat. But overall it was good üëç there is nothing bad to say about this hotel. It was a good location.

The hotel was perfect location within distance of a lot of places to eat, beaches and Disneyland. The suite was clean and the bed was super comfy, we even got to see the fireworks from Disneyland from our room window :)

Summary Heading: Fantastic Customer Service & Magical Stay Close to Disneyland!
Summary: Had three suites here for four nights in October 2021.  Everything was FANTASTIC with all three of our suites.  I appreciated the excellent customer service, and help in getting us all on the same floor.  Rooms were very clean, quiet, & well appointed with lots of space.   Felt very safe here and all staff we saw were wearing masks.  Loved the daily housekeeping (available by request) and proximity to Disneyland.   Will be back for sure.   A free, hot breakfast was included.

Great location for Disney and a short walk to Toy story lot for free bus pick up for the park. The hotel room was nice and having a kitchen was helpful for the trip!  Most of the hotel guests were not following the state indoor mask mandate.  The hotel didn‚Äôt enforce it and even had many of there staff not wearing masks. This was disappointing. If a hotel isn‚Äôt following a mandate, what else are they skipping and not following ???

The hotel is clean and and new! Not a hotel that‚Äôs old but renovated. It‚Äôs very nice and clean inside, fantastic location to Disneyland and the staff is so incredibly helpful! They went above and beyond to help us when we had car problems even after we had checked out. We will be coming back to this hotel again and again.

Hotel facilities are a bit dated and the hotel did not have a shower chair available for my wheelchair bound relative     Although hotel staff was very compassionate about not having a shower chair available (they compt the parking fee for the remaining days). Also the sofa bed was not comfortable at all.

Summary Heading: Great Value Hotel close to Disneyland
Summary: This Hilton Hotel stands up to their reputation for good $ value with nice clean rooms and amenities.  Close to Disneyland and the suite rooms include small  kitchen bar with sink, food storage  and microwave.   Great Buffet Breakfast included in price!!

Summary Heading: dirty  room-below average breakfast- long walk to Disney- helpful front desk folks but will look elsewhere next time:.(
Summary: The hotel claims to have a 4.5 star guest rating? I give it 3 stars mostly because of the staff customer service - front desk folks We‚Äôre helpful and responsive checked in an hour early and assisted with double billing challenges.  otherwise for facilities I give it 2 stars.   Very disappointing for the price and a Hilton property  :.(  I/we will likely look to other properties for future hotel needs  negatives:  stained couch and living  room furniture and carpets with sticky stuff? Used and dirty spare linens  Dirty glass ware kitchen cabinets  Slow drain bath sink Dirty / used spare linens Bath fan not operating  Dirty kitchen tile/ hair Dirty ac/ heat vents breakfast buffet meh Way Further from Disney than advertised 1+ mile  Remote batteries dead

We just completed a 5 night stay at this hotel for a trip to Disneyland. We had a King/bunkbed suite for our family of 4.  Pros: - room and indoor/outdoor areas of hotel were clean - room was very quiet, we never heard noise from another room or the hallway. - staff were pleasant and responsive to any needs such as replenishing pool towels and fresh towels for the room. - pool area was fun for the kids - Parking was plentiful and easy to navigate.  Cons: - breakfast was mediocre at best‚Ä¶ scrambled eggs, potatoes and a meat option every day. Cereal, bread for toast and milk/juice. No pastries, yogurt  or pancake/waffle options due to COVID. Also no nightly happy hour. We ended up skipping breakfast and eating at the park or other places 3/5 days.  - rooms/furniture are in need of

Walking distance to Disneyland and other stores; Walgreens and Target a few blocks away.  Use of laundry facilities and complimentary breakfast made this stay great. Room was clean and had our beds turned down and clean towels stocked every day.

Our family stayed at the Homewood Suites in Anaheim for the week and enjoyed our stay. The front desk and cleaning staff were helpful and very nice. They served hot complimentary breakfast every morning.I would definitely come back to this hotel.

Overall, it was beyond awesome. Customer service is excellent. Only issue was the headboard was peeling off. But it was not a deal breaker. Housekeeping was awesome especially Guadalupe. Thank you for making our stay such a memorable one.

I am less than pleased with my stay. I did almost a week of research to try to find a hotel for my family vacation to Disneyland.   I don‚Äôt think any reviews I saw for this place are fitting!   The bed was HARD AS A ROCK. About knocked the wind out of myself when I laid down hard the first time! Even after days at Disney, walking 15+ miles, it was difficult to find a comfortable way to fall asleep.   The fridge in my suite was in the corner of the kitchen and opened up the wrong way! So you had to stand in the corner to try to get into the fridge and if you‚Äôre any bigger than a size 10, you‚Äôre going to have a hard time!! Such an inconvenience!   The items in the room were also in disrepair. The headboards vinyl was ripped to shreds under where the pillows lay. The lamps all had

The room was dirty and poorly maintained. The couch was dirty and the headboard was scratched up. It looked like a large cat had scratched it all up. The breakfast was terrible. COVID protocols were pretty much non-existent other than asking people to socially distance.
Manager Response: Hello disneygil2021,  Thank you for your feedback. I am sorry to hear your stay with us was less then excellent. Please be assured we are following up with our housekeeping and maintenance teams on the condition of the room. We are currently reupholstering all our headboards; hopefully you can see these updated on your next stay with us. We hope to be lucky enough that you will give us another opportunity. Please reach out to me directly to (714) 705-0531 on your next trip to Anaheim so we can make it right for you and your family.

Summary: As soon as we came in to the lobby we were greeted by Maribel Lorena (I made it a point to get her name because she is the main reason I even came here to write this)! She was so sweet and had such a kind welcoming demeanor. She was so helpful and informative and went out of her way to make us feel comfortable to have the best stay. She gave us a run down on the happenings at the hotel and was especially kind to my kids! We would stay here again and again just because of the level of service she provided.   We encountered her a few times during our stay and she remembered us, said hi to my kids and asked them how their stay was (great way to win over us moms) and made us feel so welcomed. Even for our unconventional asks (like cooking utensils for the BBQ) She personally walked

This hotel was a great selection. Very clean and served breakfast each day. The pool and hot tub was very nice and the game room for the kids was nice too! I will definitely stay at this hotel again!!

This trip we traveled with an infant and wanted a larger room. This hotel met my expectations 100%. They had a pack n play already in our room when I got there. We arrived in town early and was able to check us in digitally and early. The breakfast was good and great right before going to the parks. Very quite rooms and the pool area was amazing. My kids loved the multiple pools and hot tub plus the baseball court was a nice surprise for them. The fire pits were a great spot for us adults to relax at while the kids swam. This just became our new hotel for Disneyland!

We love the spacious room, complimentary breakfast & wifi, and the location. Our only complaint this trip is that the internet connection was really bad including the hotel‚Äôs wifi. We needed good Wifi to obtain the virtual cue for couple of the rides at both the Disney parks, but wasn‚Äôt able to get them due to poor internet connection at the hotel at 7am. Other than that, I highly recommend this Hotel to those traveling with big groups as the rooms are big and their complimentary breakfast is great

Summary Heading: Used to be great. Not any more.
Summary: Sadly, this place used to be a nice hotel. Next to a Disney pick-up point for their shuttle, it was my go-to, when taking family and friends to Disneyland.  Not any more.   The whole place now reeks of weed, the rooms are in disrepair and the breakfast resembles a prison cafeteria line.   My daughter and I‚Äôs room seemed ok at first, but then I went in the bedroom - ripped headboard, broken light pieces and stained sheets. How is this ok? How did anyone clean this room and then think it was good to go? Zero attention to detail, or most importantly at this time, no care for hygiene.   I brought these issues up with reception in the morning (my daughter was asleep, by the time I noticed everything and didn‚Äôt want to disturb her), who did nothing about it. I followed up on email -

Perfect for the family with all ages, especially little ones. The location is great, the staff is so accommodating, and the staff keeps it clean and safe. Our two kids, 4 & 5, weren‚Äôt tired of it after 6 days!

familiar hotel, breakfast included, very good facilities, near to Disneyland.  The rooms are clean. My family were very happy. The hotel is safe and near to the restaurants and markets. The hotel have a 2 pools and jacuzzi. Game room and small basket court.

I stay here every time I go to Disneyland because it‚Äôs right next to the toy story parking lot! So convenient and easy to walk to. They also have an area for beverages that you could buy and it‚Äôs always clean. We checked in at midnight after Disneyland and the front desk are always really sweet even when it‚Äôs super late. They have really great attitudes!

Overall, great location, less than 1 mile from Disneyland, but we were disappointed with condition of this property. The mattresses was very uncomfortable and even the headboard was scratched up. The sofa was old and dingy and also not comfortable. The bathroom fixtures had visible rust and the towels didn't seem to be fresh. Very disappointing to be a Hilton property.

The hotel is one of the best in Anaheim city spacious rooms, amazing breakfast very friendly staff and. O parking problems. My entire family had a great time nothing to regret. We are going to be back for sure in the near future.

Summary Heading: A clean, well run hotel but a little far from theme parks
Summary: We stayed 3 nights at the Homewood Suites by Disneyland in August 2021. It‚Äôs a modern, updated hotel that seems well operated and staffed (especially compared to other recent hotel stays in the COVID era).   The rooms are spacious and have full kitchens, which is great for a longer stay. We were upgraded to a king suite and enjoyed the extra room. Everything was mostly clean, other than a weird amount of dust around the light fixtures and some pretty deep scratching on the fabric headboard (latter is cosmetic; the former was kind of gross). Breakfast is free (at least for Hilton Gold members‚Äînot sure for everyone) and is being served in a ‚Äúserved buffet‚Äù style. Options were a bit limited but the line moved quickly and the food was fine. All our interactions with staff were

Great Customer service. All team members are very helpful and kind. Also they have free breakfast in the morning. They offer many different amenities in the hotel. Also have free electric car charging. Notable mention, thank you Julie for your great customer service.

I would have given this place 4 stars had it not been for the inconsistent housekeeping and shabby furniture.  It was generally comfortable and an ok place to crash after long days at Disneyland. But the housekeeping left a lot to be desired. I was informed that they wouldn‚Äôt be coming in unless requested, but somehow they came in anyway. So I had assumed that regular housekeeping services had resumed. My mistake. When we got back to our room on the 3rd day, it had not been cleaned (the trash had not been taken out like previous days, and the towels had not been replaced).   Further, the furniture was shabby (pull out sofa in living room is in dire need of replacing), and the headboard had noticeable scratches and the fabric was peeled off in some sections.  Comfortable,

My granddaughters age 9 and 11 thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this beautiful hotel. The pool area was perfect. They showed a movie outside in the evening- basketball court and a mini golf course. Our suite was very conducive to our needs with a full kitchen. Service was great- thank you for a wonderful stay- we will be back!

We were able to watch Disney's fireworks each night from the comforts of our own room. The staff were so friendly. Breakfast was nice and the swimming pool was very clean. All 5 of us had plenty of space in our room. Bunk beds, trundle, King bed and sofa couch. The Disney shuttle was right next door at the Toy Story parking lot. So easy to come and go.

Thank you to Ben and his wonderful staff. Extremely friendly staff when checking in to hotel. Rooms were very clean and well sanitized. Would recommend this Hotel to anyone coming to tha Anaheim area. Hotel followed all COVID protocol,  Again Thank you for a wonderful stay. Annette

Summary Heading: Friendly staff, clean rooms, great location
Summary: From the people at the front desk to the folks who served breakfast, just pleasant and friendly staff. The room was very clean and spacious, and hotel itself was an easy 10-15 minute walk to Disneyland depending on how tired you were from a long fun day. There were also busses nearby as an option as well. We will stay here again!

I want to say this was my first time staying here I normally stay at the Candy Cane Inn down the street but was unable to this time. Unfortunately I think some hotels use the Covid 19 to save money on such items as a descent breakfast. The hotel served the same small breakfast each one of the days we stayed and they did not provide the usual evening social and did not try to replace it in anyway. I recently stayed at a residence in nearby and they provided all the normal items. The hotel is clean and staff is good. Close to most areas where you need to go.  I may or may not stay here in the future and its time to not skimp on services in the excuse of covid-19.

Summary Heading: Stolen Luggage, Grimy, Used Condom in Stairwell, Gross Breakfast
