Summary: This hotel used to deserve its TripAdvisor Rating, but it has completely lost its way. I have never written a review on TripAdvisor, but I use it, and it helped me find this place when it was once good. As a family of 6, there are limited affordable and comfortable options, and family reviews have helped me out. This was our 3rd time at this hotel, and we have always stayed at least 3 nights. I hope this review helps someone else.  1) We did Valet Parking because it was the same price as parking ourselves, and they greet you when you arrive. Big mistake. They did not lock our car, and my luggage to San Diego and our 6 year olds main birthday present was taken from the back. The hotel is helping us try and locate the luggage, but I doubt anything will come of this, and I should

I usually have great things to say about their breakfast especially the waffles you can make but this time around the breakfast sucked and I still paid full price. Should reduce price for sucky breakfast

This hotel has a lot going for it with the location being walkable to Disneyland and many good food options nearby.  For the electric car owners, there are several Tesla and regular chargers available.  However, these chargers could be taken by non electric cars due to parking issues (See below).  There is self laundry onsite that cost $6 total for wash and dry.  The full size refrigerator and kitchenette are an added bonus.  There are some cosmetic issues in the room with peeling headboards and dirty carpet.  Internet here works great although I had the premium internet free.  If you get free premium internet be prepared to remind the front desk everyday to remove the charges.  I had one internet charge post to my card even after I called the hotel to fix the charges.  Yes,

Be prepared to find parking, took us almost an hour to find a parking spot when we got back to Hotel around 9pm. Even though we paid $20 for each night. We have to called front desk to ask for advised, and they said you go find the valley parking guy and ask him.

Summary Heading: Best place to stay in Anaheim resort area
Summary: The amazing staff and great location made my business stay (April 2021) so enjoyable I returned recently with my family for a leisure trip to Disneyland. The location made walking to Disneyland a breeze, it's so close! The service from hotel staff was incredible, all employees were so professional and enjoyable to speak to! Wether business or leisure, I will not be staying anywhere else besides this place. Highly highly recommend.

We recently stayed here for a trip to Disneyland. Our room type was not available as the bunk bed room they assigned us to had a urine/musty smell on the couch. We were switched to a king bed suite. The manager on duty did try and fix the issue but moving all of our luggage and groceries was a too much after a day at Disney. The hotel is starting to show its age- the handle in our shower/bath was rusted. Kids were climbing the gate over the pool- with staff not controlling it. The kitchen is a plus for sure with kids and the beds are comfy. But overall- I would likely not be staying here on our next Disney trip.

Overall stay was very comfortable. Beds were so comfortable I just fell asleep once I laid down.Hotel served boxed breakfast which was ok: wrapped bagel, cream cheese, 2 hard boiled packaged eggs and yogurt. You also got to pick out cereal and fruits, juices and milk. This is our second time staying here. I would definitely would recommend to stay here.

Stayed at this location room 505 on 7/6/21--7/13/21, in short we had a traumatizing experience on 7/12/21 after returning from Universal Studios to find our room ransacked and robbed of kids ipads, high end shoes, fraud on chase card stolen, and other numerous items. Come to find out there was 3 rooms robbed that night and 2 of them had come together. In short there was no electronic trace of entry while we were gone according to front desk , our family and kids horrified and crying, police notified, and Homewood suites refusing to make things right and compensate us for their obvious lack of security (not checking ids when making new key cards, not locking front doors at certain hours, lack of cameras in hallways and security to name a few.) We are giving Homewood a chance to

Super nice room and was clean, had nice kitchen and was really close to the park after a long day. Had a good experience at the hotel. Fan was nice and bed was comfy, great place to relax after walking all day. The parking was good and the service was nice. Would recommend

Yuck. Pretty much the best way to describe our stay.   Complimentary happy hour snacks/drinks were not offered because of ‚ÄúCOVID‚Äù. ‚ÄúContinental breakfast‚Äù is a box you must pick up and take to your room with items the kitchen chose (a bagel, cream cheese, sugary yogurt and 2 hard-boiled eggs). The cereal selections were Corn Flakes or Raisin Bran - so basically, nothing either of our kids would even eat.   Our room‚Ä¶where do I begin? We had ONE towel in our room for a family of 4. The kitchen lights randomly stopped working during our stay, and we had to turn the dishwasher off during use, because it was smoking/smelled of burning plastic. Our headboards were torn to shreds, and there were spills on the walls and ceilings that hadn‚Äôt been cleaned up.   We stayed here in late

Summary Heading: Great Place to stay with Family!
Summary: On our recent trip to Disney we booked a weekend stay at the Cambria and let‚Äôs just say it was not the best so we ended up checking out 2 hours later. We looked for a hotel with a pool around disney with good reviews and this is how we came around booking our stay at this hotel. We let the staff know our issues and they were quick to accommodate us and our friends in hotel rooms. Check in was a breeze and our rooms had bunk beds! The kids were thrilled. The pool was clean, the hotel itself was clean. And the staff was so nice and went out of their way to make sure our stay was wonderful.   We got the pleasure to meet Ben he is the general manager for this location I believe and his customer service was exceptional.   Thanks for the hospitality and Ben and his staff  for the last

We went to Disney parks this was close to shuttle if needed and a mile walk to the park entrances. Pool very nice with a great outdoor space for relaxing. Team members worked hard to handle all our requests.

No one care for your request and 0 house keeping inspite of multiple request none turned in for house keeping and we left with no shampoo soap, towels but room size is good location is good and walkable to disney

Rooms are clean spacious and comfortable. Hotel overall is clean. The staff is made sure the floors are cleaned and they provide detergent in the kitchen part which was nice and saved us from buying one. It was great room.

This was the best experience we've had with hotels near Disneyland. The room was clean and taken care of. I appreciate the free breakfast. The staff was amazing. The girls at check in were really helpful and accommodating.

Summary Heading: Average stay.  Some complain they got better service at cheaper hotels.
Summary: Nice location, fun atmosphere, close to many restaurants and shopping areas. Breakfast wasn‚Äôt that great, we had the same breakfast everyday and it was not tasty. Also, there was coffee, tea and hot water available all day but the water and coffee was barely warm in the evening. Probably coffee was sitting there all day.

Great hotel with a terrific location to Disneyland and the attractions that our family was interested in. We were very satisfied with the full fridge and suite option that we had. The staff was great and it was a solid location.

Really great room to hold 5 people (2 adults/3 teenagers). The full sized refrigerator comes in very handy when wanting to house lots of bottles of water! My kids loved the basketball court and mini golf area.

Summary Heading: Its a disappointment with the amount of what we paid for!
Summary: We were there 2 years ago, everything was awesome so we figured that this vacation, we will stay there for the 8 days that we are in anaheim. The complimentary was terrible, cant eat the same food for the 8 day stay, washer and dryer is broken ( 2 dryer, 2 washer for the entire building. The cup that was in the cabinet was filthy, coffee stain on the brim of the cup and melted coffee on the bottom of the cup. Housekeeper are there probably twice a week to clean the entire hotel. I understand its pandemic but charging the client $227/ night, $22 for parking lot and miscellaneous fee of Almost $50 a day, not worth it!

Suite was perfect! Very clean, well stocked with towels and shampoo items. The BBQ/pool area was very nice, clean, and the kids pool was perfect for our 4&6 year old grandkids. The poolside movie was an added bonus. Breakfast was a grab and go style but the variety of food was great!  Coffee available all day! Shuttle bus to Disneyland was just next door - we will definitely be returning üòÉ

Summary Heading: Used to be a great location
Summary: This hotel used to be great. Post pandemic the staff is very aloof and don‚Äôt seem to care. The breakfast is horrible and they don‚Äôt have hit food available anymore. They cancelled the evening food and drink. They don‚Äôt tell you any of this when you book. It‚Äôs also more expensive than it sued to be.

We had a great time! Convenient and very family friendly hotel. We loved that there was a basketball court, swimming pool, and gym. We had a good amount of space to not feel like we were squished. The full kitchen was amazing. We saved time and money buy cooking everyday. We would definitely stay again.

Summary Heading: Spacious suites and a great location
Summary: I've been to Disneyland dozens of times and my family and I were pleasantly surprised with our stay at the Homewood Suites. Our double bed room was huge with a full kitchen, spacious living room, large desk, couch bed, and large bathroom. It was perfect to only be a 5 minute walk away from Disneyland and a 3 minute walk away from Denny's. The clean pool was terrific after a long day at Disneyland resort and the staff couldn't have been more friendly and helpful during our stay. I think it's safe to say my whole family now has a new top pick for when we visit the Disneyland Resort and I have a personal favorite if I ever need a place to stay when attending a conference at the Anaheim convention center.

Seems like COVID brought this hotel down. Shortages in staff obvious and food quality was the worst! The grounds had cigarette butts all over especially by the play area for some reason. Could never get a hold of housekeeping and the dishes in our room were dirty . If you don‚Äôt care about any of that and you‚Äôre looking for less in a hotel then it isn‚Äôt horrible. But we wanted a home away from home experience and it was lacking. We have stayed here a few times in the past and it was lovely. Super disappointed

Located in a good location, less than a mile from Disney, a long walk away. Parking was about $25 with taxes bit you can leave your car for the day while at Disney. The hotel has a pool, putting green, basketball hoop and game room to entertain the kids. The breakfast bar wasn‚Äôt open and they only offered breakfast to go as COVID restrictions were still in effect.

We have been enjoying this hotel for over 5 years (20+ visits). We would come down from Northern California with annual passes to Disneyland. There are so many great memories in your hotel. All of the great customer service from Christian, Britany, Victoria, Kat, Adrian, and many more. We have left glowing reviews for you in the past. I decided to surprise my wife and daughter for our 10 year anniversary. Checked in and Amanda took care of us. Our first 2 nights were good, I asked to extend our stay another night. I was told I would be able to, but at a 50% increase of what I paid for the night before. Amanda said I needed to speak with Alejandra about getting a better price at 8:30 next morning. Unfortunately she was not there til later in the day. I spoke to Tiana and she said

First things first we want to say that Adrian and Amanda you are the best customer service agents we have ever worked with. You guys made our stay very easy and not only that, you also upgraded my husband and I because we were returning members! You 2 truly are extraordinary employees and we thank you very much for being amazing.   The hotel is an amazing hotel. The rooms are great. You get a pool, and a gym as well. This hotel is great for family especially if you‚Äôre going to Disneyland. The staff treats everyone as if your family. It doesn‚Äôt matter if it‚Äôs your first time staying there, or if it‚Äôs your 1000 time staying there. The staff ensures that you‚Äôre having a great stay.   We understand that sometimes hotels have little hiccups, for example when we stayed the ice machine

Stayed in this hotel for our most recent Disney trip rather than my standby which is the DoubleTree across the street. This hotel is really nice looking on the outside and has a nice lobby. The rooms are a good size and having the little kitchen is nice, plus the coffee in the mornings. The staff were helpful and polite. My main concern is the room was pretty run down for how new this hotel is, and could have been more tidy. There were numerous hairs under the sheet and a lot of dust and grime throughout the room, most notably on high touch areas like light switches. The room had tons of scuffs on the furniture (to be expected, I guess, in a family friendly hotel). Some of the plugs didn't work and the TV froze constantly. All that being said, this hotel is fine -- the bed was

Summary Heading: Very helpful when a hotel booking website failed.
Summary: Just want to thank the staff at this establishment for quickly getting me and my family room accommodations even though our reservation through Booking.com did not show up. It was very stressful but Adrian and Shontiara were very helpful. I got the room I had originally needed, a family suite with a King bed, triple bunk and fold out sofa that fit my family of 6 perfectly! I hope to visit again some day as my stay here was wonderful!

This was our second time staying in this hotel. We were in the area and had such a good stay last time we wanted to come back. Adrian checked us in and was very courteous and professional! This started our spur of the moment stay off just right!!

Great rooms at a great rate, free breakfast, walking distance from Disneyland, and how can we forget Adrian! Adrian literally treated us as if we were family the moment we walked in. Not only did he hold a conversation with us, but when I asked the young gentleman what upgrades they offered, HE PROVIDED US A SUITE!!! Adrian you are the best, I‚Äôve done customer service my entire life, and you gave us the BEST and most PHENOMENAL customer service!

Our stay at the hotel was excellent. The room was spacious. It included a full kitchen, living room, king size bed and a bunk bed with 3 twin beds. We were very comfortable. The hotel also provided grab and go breakfast which came in handy with our little ones. There was a free shuttle service that we used to quickly get to and from Disneyland. This will be our go to hotel for future trips.

Good for family. Disneyland stay. Service was good. Lots of walking but it‚Äôs ok. Ok overall everything was conveniently located I‚Äôd stay again. Disneyland was about 15min walk. Lots of dinning places near by.

Front Desk team was great when speaking to them in person.   I felt safe given that I stayed at the property during the pandemic.   Quality of the room wasn't that great, I stayed in a 2 queen suite and there was scratch marks on both of the headboards. Kitchen wasn't a complete kitchen to work with given my stay with my children.   Waited long durations of time for housekeeping to bring up towels and other supplies during my 5 night stay.

Loved the front desk staff. Amazing customer service. Not sure where breakfast is served, so we were not able to experience that. There was still trash and recycling left in the room when we arrived to a ‚Äúclean‚Äùroom. Also the kitchen was lovely.

My friend and I wanted to get away for the weekend and we found this hotel which was great because we could have a little more space but also have room to make some meals! The beds were clean and comfy, the kitchen was perfect and all the amenities being provided were still awesome. Breakfast was a bagel, 2 hard boiled eggs, cream cheese, yogurt, and then a choice of milk/juice and fruit! I understand some folks want the big breakfast, but luckily you can always bulk this meal up with some simple items you can cook in the microwave or stove top! We loved the ability to check in from our phone, using the app as a digital key and how contactless things were made for comfort of guests. We will definitely be back!

We usually stay at the very large Hilton at the Anaheim Convention Center, but due to COVID, that hotel was closed.  We selected the Homewood Suites by Hilton, because of the location, price, and that it is fairly new.   We were greeted by two wonderful front desk associates, who checked us in early, and welcomed us warmly as Hilton Honors members.  The room was very clean, nicely appointed, and large.  I had forgotten the Homewood brand has small kitchens, which was a great addition. We will definitely return with family members.

The whole room was very filthy! We had to switch rooms and this room wasn't clean either. The bath has something stuck to the bottom of it. There was tons of hair, stains in the bed, crumbs on the floor, and furniture dirty. This is our 2 year olds first trip to Disneyland. If it wasn't for us having family staying at this hotel we would have tried to stay somewhere else.
Manager Response: Hello Jeremy M, I would like to sincerely apologize for the cleanliness issues you experienced during your stay. Please know I am following up with our executive housekeeper to ensure the condition of the rooms are up to standard. I feel terrible that you and your family were not able to fully enjoy your time with us. I would appreciate the opportunity to speak to you directly; we take our commitment to satisfaction seriously and hope you would allow us the opportunity to regain your loyalty. Please feel free to contact me directly at 714-705-0531 or by email at Alejandra.Jacobo2@hilton.com.

Summary: Clean, comfortable, and convenient! Minutes to Disneyland. Toaster is in the cupboard above the sink. Breakfast is a boxed meal with a bagel, that‚Äôs why the toaster is great, yogurt, and cereal. Coffee is in the lobby. Room is large enough for a family to spread out.

Summary Heading: Great stay and close to Disneyland
Summary: Other than the lack of daily room cleaning, and the fact that people were stomping and running about on the floor above us at all hours of the night, the room was clean, the staff was very friendly and accommodating, and the hotel was close to Disneyland.

Not our first visit to the Homewood Suites Anaheim Convention Center - but our first trip since COVID. They have done a wonderful job adjusting to the new protocols and safety standards - felt very safe and everything was very clean. Always enjoy the breakfast here - and they tried very hard to give you some breakfast even with all the restrictions. We got a box that included bagels, cream cheese (toaster is in your suite), hard boiled eggs and milk or juice. Definitely enough food. Can't wait for the full breakfast again - but definitely better than trying to find something on the way to the parks. In general - the suite style room is definitely a deciding factor for us - especially when travelling as a family - everyone gets their own space. Perfect for when the kids were

Amazing value, super clean, great space with big rooms and common areas, awesome staff... love it! Nice location if going to anaheim this is a myst book hotel. Pool was maintained well, and they had my creamer for my coffee:-)

Our first greeting was floor to ceiling plexiglass at the front desk. It felt more like a bank in a bad part of town. The large open lobby area was dead, no televisions, no bar, just an over sized empty breakfast bar. For a brand new hotel, the kinks still need to be worked out.
Manager Response: Hello dhol619, I am sorry to hear you did not enjoy your recent stay with us and the appearance of the lobby area is not appealing to the eye. For the safety of our guest as well as our team members we are taking many precautions including the plexiglass at the front desk. As well as trying to limiting the amount of traffic in our indoor areas; however our out door suite areas are now entirely open! From our pool, hot tub, gills, and out door patio. When time permits, please contact myself at Alejandra.Jacobo2@hilton.com, or at (714)750-2010. I would love to discuss any future stay you have with us and perhaps make it more memorable.   Alejandra Jacobo Assistant General Manager

Summary: Up for the night prior to visiting Disneyland for my daughters 5th birthday celebration, we chose this hotel for it‚Äôs offering of a low cost suite featuring a King bed/bunk bed combo with a full kitchen to boot. Clean rooms, accessible parking and a 15 minute walk to Disneyland were all bonuses. I‚Äôm a 7 year Diamond member with Hilton (due to traveling for work) and stay at Hilton family hotels on average 150 days a year so when I say this is worth the cost, you can trust me‚Ä¶.. ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

Great place to stay to visit Disneyland property. Wonderful family suites. Even the queen rooms have a little kitchen. Can‚Äôt wait to get back to the evening reception but everything wise everything was almost back to normal except cleaner and safer

The lobby was very clean and the staff welcomed us warmly. The room was spacious but beds were stiff and pillows super thin, very hard to sleep comfortably. Breakfast was the exact same thing all 4 days we were there. Also, very thin floors so you could hear those above you stomp around, and for the price point that was disappointing, like is it too much to build a solid foundation? Overall stay only for the walking distance to Disneyland in my opinion.
Manager Response: Hello AdventureJR27, thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us. We always strive for guest to be as comfortable as possible and I am sorry to hear the noise levels impacted your stay so negatively. Please fee free to contact me directly when booking your next stay. I would love to make sure you are well taken care of.    Alejandra Jacobo Assistant General Manager

Summary: My family and I booked a last minute trip at the Homewood Suites in Anaheim and had a great experience. Staff were friendly and made us feel welcomed. They even offered breakfast, which was a plus. I would come back to this hotel every time I visit California. The hotel was in walking distance to many local food places and convenience stores.

Summary Heading: Best Hotel at the Right Price!
Summary: Let's see, where do we start here...Well, I travel a lot around the country for work and this has to be up there on cleanliness! It was so clean. Also, they were very covid compliant throughout the entire stay! From the front desk to check out!   But the real reason I'm taking the time to write a review is because of the excellent staff! Top tier diamond service at this establishment. Everyone is so friendly and willing to accommodate guests! Even the manager introduced himself in passing and asked about my stay! I felt very welcomed and will definitely ONLY be staying here moving forward when Im in town for business.

Came down and stay here during Easter weekend to visit the family. Great place to stay, staff super friendly and helpful. We check in with ease. Also, with a lot of surrounding amenities like Downtown Disney, the Gardenwalk and ton of places to eat.

I wasn‚Äôt goi g to write anything but it is making me, so might as well say- when I go there they couldn‚Äôt find my reservation and had given the room I pre-checked into away. The room I was given was dusty! and had finger Prints of fridge doors. I wiped room down with my own Clorox wipes. I wish box breakfast had a coupon diff options. 24hr coffee access is awesome though. And location is good.
Manager Response: Hello Disneynerstraveler70, thank you for taking the time to review your stay at Homewood Suites Anaheim Convention Center. I feel terrible that your stay was not closer to a 5 star. Please be assured cleanliness is a top priority; especially in the times we are currently living in. Be assured we have followed up with our housekeeping department to avoid recurrence. When time permits, please feel free to contact me at Alejandra.Jacobo2@Hilton.com to discuss the matter in more detail or if you have a future stay with us I can assist you in booking and ensure a pleasant stay.   Alejandra Jacobo  Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Farther from Disneyland then I expected
Summary: Room was good, beds were not very comfortable and the pillows sucked. Guests don‚Äôt follow the state guidelines. Sanitation stations were empty. First stay at this Homewood Suites Hotel  and first stay in a hotel since Covid.  I think I would have prefer the other Homewood Suites down the road. I‚Äôve stay there before Covid and felt very comfortable. This hotel was very uncomfortable.
Manager Response: Hello thatcat68, thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us. I am extremely sorry to hear your stay with us was uncomfortable. Please be assured we take state guidelines seriously and have followed up with all our hand sanitizer dispenser to ensure they are all working properly. Nonetheless I am sorry they were not refilled accordingly during your stay. Please allow us the opportunity to make this up to you, feel free to contact me at Alejadnra.Jacobo2@hilton.com or at 714-705-0531.   Alejandra Jacobo Assistant General Manager

Summary: I Like the room & having the kitchen utensils etc. The layout of the room was very nice... things seem pretty new.....There was a glob of someone‚Äôs hair on the shower wall when I went to take a shower in the morning which was kind of a disturbing turn off....:(I don‚Äôt know how to cleaning staff could‚Äôve missed it but they did.....oh well....

We selected this hotel for a two night stay while attending an event at Disneyland. It exceeded our expectations. The hotel is clean and modern, the gran and go breakfast is as great as it can be due to Covid, but the absolute highlight of this hotel is Adrian at guest services. The dining recommendations he made for us each night were spot on and he is genuinely interested in making sure you have a great experience. We would definitely recommend the hotel to our friends and family.

I will definitely recommend this place! At the front desk they all have great customer service. Very patient on all your needs. The cleanliness is key for me and everything was spot on. Parking is excellent as well.

They literally saved my life. The original hotel we had booked was closed down and wasn't notified. Homewood Suites was able to accommodate us at the same rate! The breakfast was kind of weak, but considering the circumstances I think it was good.

We did not choose this hotel and it‚Äôs not okay to just switch us with out telling us. You should have canceled our reservation! We should have been allowed to pick our own hotel. We will rethink staying with hilton in the future.
Manager Response: Hello mcissy1227 thank you for taking the time to review and rate your stay. I am sorry to hear you were unsatisfied with your stay with us at Homewood Suites Anaheim Convention Center. We strive to provide the best customer service possible and I'm sorry being relocated from another hotel over shadowed your stay with us. I would love to get in touch with you for any specific details for which made your stay unsatisfactory, and perhaps have you back again for another stay with us. Please feel free to reach out to me directly at (714) 705-0531. I will make sure to take all of your comments into account when helping you plan your next trip.   Alejandra Jacobo  Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Listen to somebody playing Basketball over my head all night
Summary: Hotel is in good location by convention center. Nobody wore masks and really no enforcement. Room heater did not work so was cold. They charge for parking. Hilton Diamond members receive a bottle of water. Was up all night with this pounding in the room above me and thought it might be broken pipes or perhaps a kitchen with roll carts. Come to find out there was a basketball camp and the room above me was playing basketball all night long in preparation for a tournament. Did not know you could even play basketball in a hotel room. I cut my trip short and left very tired asap.
Manager Response: Hello scottp816,  I would like to sincerely apologize for the inconveniences you experienced while staying with us. Wearing a mask while on property is required for all guest and team members. Please be assured I am following up with all team members to follow protocol and enforce this requirement. As far as the noise, I cannot stress how sorry I am that this caused you to check out earlier than expected. I would appreciate the opportunity to speak with you directly regarding your stay with us as we take our commitment to our Suite Assurance Guarantee very seriously. Please feel free to contact me directly alejandr.jacobo2@hilton.com. I look forward to hearing from you!

Summary: I stayed here for 3 nights.  The room was comfortable, the staff was nice, and the price was reasonable.  I‚Äôd like to try their normal breakfast, the box breakfast was meh.  I‚Äôd stay here again.   The only reason I didn‚Äôt give it a 5 was because you have to pay for parking.  I‚Äôm already paying to rent a room (a parking spot in the hotel‚Äôs lot should be included).

We stayed here with our family of 6 (2adults, 4 children). Breakfast was good, lots of variety. Perfect walking distance from the parks as well as target. A short walk to the car rental. The room was clean. The hotel is next to the toy story parking lot for shuttles. We would definitely stay again.

Summary Heading: Definitely a nice option near Disneyland
Summary: I have stayed my fair share of time at different Homewood Suites and this is one of the really good ones.  Initially, I was surprised to be assigned a room on the main floor, given my preference for high floors... but this was actually a good thing at this property. I was assigned a nice room toward the back of the hotel in what I'd consider a quieter area of the property.    Great value with the typical Homewood Suites room setup.  More than enough space, nice table that can be used to eat or as a working area. Comfortable bed and adequate temperature control. Reliable WIFI.  Nice outdoor pool onsite with  sitting area that is a nice place to relax at the end of the day.  At the time of my visit (just before lockdown) they were still offering the full breakfast and the evening

Summary Heading: We enjoyed our stay but the breakfast could use improvement
Summary: We spent two nights here recently to celebrate birthdays away from home.  We requested two adjoining rooms and that's what we got initially.  However, when checking in, there was a large party group checking in ahead of us and they were placed right next to us.  We didn't want to risk the noise and potential loss of sleep so we asked for  a different room.  That was possible but instead of adjoining rooms, we had two rooms down the hall from each other.  All of that worked out.  From what I had been told when I had originally called to ask that our rooms be adjoining, they currently allow 24 or 48 hours per room between guests (sorry can't remember exactly).  The one area that could really use improvement during this time is the grab and go breakfast.  It was a muffin and a

Just a quick trip off during the week and the Homewood Suites Anaheim Resort was the perfect choice. From the moment we checked in we were warmly greeted by Antonio, who was very friendly, efficient and knowledgeable about the area and entertainment available. We were then greeted by the manager Benjamin. He was also very friendly and welcoming. The hotel is nicely decorated and extremely clean. There are several hand sanitizer stations located all around the lobby & elevator areas. Our room was a double queen suite and it was very spacious and very clean.  The kitchen was a nice size with a large nice big fridge and a dining table. The living room was comfy, especially the chairs and also a big TV. The bedroom was well lit with a TV, desk, comfy chair and two beds.  The beds

The check-in was quick and smooth. The staff were very friendly and welcoming. The room was clean and very spacious. The kitchen come with dishwasher, refrigerator, and equipped with cookwares.  There is a pool, mini golf, basketball court, and an arcade.  Great hotel for a getaway!

COVID m-safe, Friendly service, clean Lobby and room, family suite, in room amenities, conveniently located close to Disneyland, friendly staff(Kat, Benjamin), nice heated pool, breakfast, Know our family and receive us like a family.

Stayed over this weekend & I know I will be back! The rooms were clean, comfortable beds and couches, the suites come with a kitchen and are equipped with supplies needed to cook/eat. They have great activities for kids such as mini golf, an arcade and a big nice pool with a plenty of seating along with 2 hot tubs. Most importantly I noticed they are taking all the necessary precautions to maintain safety and cleanliness for COVID. They monitored how many guests were in the pool to avoid crowding and masks are to be worn in all the common areas. I saw  various employees cleaning throughout the day and night, wearing masks and gloves, and breakfast offered was a pick up and go. All the staff were very helpful, welcoming and friendly. Thank you Homewood suites we will definitely
Manager Response: Hello cbee90!  Thank you for your detailed feedback. We greatly appreciate you choosing our hotel and we are even more pleased that you enjoyed our mini golf area, pool, and comfortable rooms. We hope to see you back again soon for your next relaxing vacation.  Best regards,  Mark Morihiro Assistant General Manager

Summary: Great rooms! Clean and spacious suites with ample room. The staff were very friendly. It was clean and the food at breakfast was delicious and fresh. We only made it to the complimentary social one evening and the choices were amazing.  Would stay again

The rooms are quiet and the location is close to Disneyland and next door to the Toy Story Disneyland parking lot.  The tram stop closest to the hotel which we had used on previous stays was no longer active so it's quite a hike through the parking lot to the tram stop.  It isn't that bad a walk but was a disappointment.  Breakfast was standard and did offer hot foods rather than just a simple continental breakfast.  As a Diamond member, however, I was really surprised that I was not given a room that even met at least one of my preferences.  I had even checked in with the hotel at 10 am and the hotel texted me at 4 pm that my room was ready.  WHen I checked in around 6 pm, I was disappointed and the front desk receptionist stated that it was because they were all sold out.

Got a great deal on a large room here for a Disneyland trip. The rooms were clean and spacious with kitchen and treats. The pool/hottub/kiddy pool/arcade area was awesome. The best part was breakfast. Massive area and lots to choose from. Will be staying again

Summary Heading: Great stay, super convenient for conventions and top breakfast.
Summary: Really enjoyed the stay here. Awesome service and very comfortable. The breakfast was also great and made sure we had it even day of our stay. Would definitely use this hotel again and will probably book for the next trade show here.

Close to a free shuttle next door in the toy story parking lot. Breakfast was so yummy we went back for seconds. Beds were really comfortable and we enjoyed the fluffy pillows! We will definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: What a great set up and value!
Summary: We stayed at this hotel last week from a Sunday night to a Saturday! I picked this hotel because it offered a free breakfast, it is within walking distance to the Disney Parking Lot shuttle (which is FREE!) and it offers Suites for rooms which I think is a necessity when staying for any longer than one night with kids and adults!!  This hotel is above and beyond what I expected and needed, and I am so thankful! The breakfast is not just a grab and go, continental type (although it is offered if you want that) but it is a full hot breakfast which was varied throughout our week! I good hearty breakfast is exactly what we needed to start our day!  They also offer an evening social on weeknights (Mon-Thurs) starting at 5 - which is more than the bevy and appies I was expecting! They

Summary Heading: As always....... we want to stay another night!
Summary: We love this hotel. The staff is so friendly and accommodating. The rooms, lobby and dining areas are clean and well maintained. The pool area is inviting (though more shade would be great during the hot summer days).  The breakfast is plentiful, with options to please everyone in your family.  And with the location to Disneyland, by walking or by tram, it  adds an extra convenience to our visit.  When we can only stay one or two nights, it's not enough.

Summary Heading: Suitable for families and well located
Summary: Stayed here as a family of 5 with 2 adults and 3 kids. Our room (338) had a double bed and a bunk with a trundle, which whilst not in seperate rooms, it was fine for 3 nights, as it also had a living room and kitchen area.  Pros: - Kitchen consisted of a micowave, a cooktop, a full size fridge and basic kitchen ware (cutlery, plates cups etc). Also small dining table. Great way to save on costs by having some groceries.  - Free breakfast with our booking. The breakfast wasn‚Äôt amazing, but definitely enough to put some food in the belly before your day. Toast, fruit, cereal, juice and hot selections such as bacon, eggs and waffles also.  - Pool, spa, basketball court, mini golf, and BBQ facilities nearby outdoor fire pits and seating made it an easy night in!  - One of the best

This is a great hotel and the location was perfect.  From the hotel, you can walk to the Disneyland parking lot and catch the bus to Disneyland.  Free breakfast was great to start the morning.  After a long day at Disneyland, their free evening social was very welcomed

The staff worked diligently to mare sure the place was clean and that there was sufficient food for all the guest. The breakfast had a great selection.  The rooms were nice and clean. We liked all the different amenities the hotel had. The kids enjoyed the miniature golfing and arcade area.

Great place to stay with family while visiting Disneyland. Utilize the shuttle at the Disney parking lot right next to the hotel. Take advantage of the great complimentary breakfast. We enjoyed the friendly staff.

We just spent 5 nights and the hotel is excellent! Walking distance to Disneyland. Breakfast and evening social were great and a big bonus to help save a lot of money on meals. Friendly staff - Carlos & Carmen were provided top notch service!

Checked in after a long day at the Park and the staff was so friendly. The breakfast in the morning included chicken enchiladas and refried beans that were excellent. Room was clean and quiet. Just a quick overnight, but we enjoyed our stay.

Great place to come home to after a long day of business meetings.  People at the front desk were welcoming, the food was good, the rooms very clean and pleasant.  The Homewood Suites were close to the Convention Center and the walk to and from was welcome and refreshing.  Thanks.

While on a school trip to Disneyland we stayed at the Homewood - our families were very happy with the  amenities at this hotel.  The suites with the kitchenette worked well for our group, the daily breakfasts were good and evening light food (Mon-Thurs) was appreciated.  The service is very friendly and the hotel is kept clean. 10-15 min walk to the entrance of Disneyland.  Can also take a shuttle next door (Toy Story Transport Centre).  Would recommend staying here - well set up for groups but make sure you book well in advance.

Not impressed this time. Check in took forever. Bathroom was not clean and even though there was complimentary breakfast and evening social there was nothing for my child to eat who is celiac even though I was told when booking that there would be.  My son was ill the day we were checking out and I requested a late check out which I was willing to pay for and the front desk told me that he could sleep on a chair in the lobby.
Manager Response: Hello sophia712020,  We sincerely apologize for any shortfalls in our customer service. We will make sure to take your comments to heart for improvement purposes for the future. Please feel free to contact me directly when thinking of booking to come back to the area. I would love to help. You can reach me on my direct phone line: (714)705-0531. I look forward to speaking with you!

Summary Heading: Great family hotel for Disneyland visit
Summary: We booked two rooms for a family trip to Disneyland.  Only one of our four daughters was able to be on this trip so we only had a total of six people.  They assigned our rooms right across the hall from each other so we didn't have far to go to visit. We booked one premium one bedroom king suite and one family suite with a king bed and a set of bunk beds that also had a pull out trundle bed. The premium room included 4 drinks daily: coke, diet coke, Sprite and apple juice along with two bags of chips,  and about 6 or 7 assorted candy bars and snack bars. Those snacks came in handy each day to take to the theme parks for our two grandchildren.  We also were able to speak to the front desk and exchange the sodas that we didn't like for other sodas. Everyone at this hotel is very

The breakfast was pretty good, and the staff is very friendly and helpful. Letti and Anney greeted us every morning and made sure we got everything we asked for. Loved the fresh coffee. The room was nice and big.

This is a terrific place to stay within easy walking distance of the Convention Center, Disney, and the Anaheim Garden Walk. The suite was very clean and comfortable, and the staff are all very nice and helpful, from the front desk to the cleaning staff! The complimentary breakfast is very good, and the dining area is huge and very clean. Martha and Anney was especially sweet. Their Social Hour is great! You can use this as your dinner, if you choose!

Enjoyed pretty much everything about this hotel and what it was to offer. Location was perfect, a quick bus ride or lyft to Disney, could also walk, but our kids were all walked out by the end of the day. Rooms were spacious and had everything you need. Enjoyed the breakfast and dinner buffet spreads, great food available. Downside is that for some reason most people acted like animals running around grabbing everything and piling their plates as high as they could go, it was like sizzler on crack. Maybe adding some Xanax to the buffet would slow these people down.. Also available was an on site laundry, beautiful pool area with hot tub and an arcade room.  Anways, perfect stay, couldn't think of any other place to stay when in town.

My family and I had a pleasant stay at Homewood Suites Anaheim Resort. The rooms were beautiful and clean. Apart from that the breakfast was amazing as there is a variety of foods to chose from. Also a special thank you to Carlos for checking up on us, ensuring we were enjoying our breakfast and providing great customer service!

Summary Heading: Enchiladas for breakfast? Don't mind if I do.
Summary: Seriously...no better way to start off breakfast than enchiladas. It's close to Disney (walking distance to the toy story lot bus which delivers you to the front door), and close to the convention center too (about an 8min walk).  Friendly people and clean facilities make this a must stay. You won't be disappointed!

Great stay and great location, lots of great restaurants close by and Disney is within walking distance.  Staff is great! Rooms are spacious!  I was in town for a conference brought my family and they enjoyed all the great tourist attractions that the city offers.

Summary Heading: Expensive, but well worth the price
Summary: Two rooms, one handicap-accessible for me and my wife, the other for daughter, son-in-law and two grandchildren (5.5 and 1 year old) while we went to Disney.  Rooms spacious and comfortable, good amenities. Complimentary breakfast both mornings, complimentary supper (including wine) Thursday but not Friday.quite good. Daughter and grandson had fun in outdoor pool (hey, it‚Äôs February!). Easy walk to theme park. Were there ANY negatives?  No hotel has good in-room coffee, and this was no exception.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel close to convention center
Summary: This hotel was right around the corner from the convention Center so it was convenient to walk each day to my conference. The staff was very friendly from check in to check out. The room was very clean and comfortable and they honored my request for a room in a quiet location. Alejandra in reservations was a big help before we arrived and during our stay.

Summary Heading: Stayed here to go to Disneyland
Summary: We had never been to a Homewood suites before. We were all impressed with the the customer service. They brought us a pack n play quickly, the breakfast was delicious, and Carlos was super kind and helpful.  We‚Äôll be coming back. Thanks Carlos.

The Homewood Suites Anaheim is a great location for people attending conventions in Anaheim.  It is a very short walk to the convention center.  The two room suites are great to spread out and you can hold a meeting without people sitting on your bed.  :)   The breakfast is really good with many options that vary each day.  A great perk was the weekday social which was wine and beer along with enough food to make a full meal.    For those of you going to Disney it is a simple walk to the park or 1/2 block walk to pick up the Disney bus at the parking lot next door.  Lots of restaurants within a two block radius The convention rate was a little high but that is thru the convention. The rooms have a little bit of wear but considering the Disney traffic they are in great shape.

travelling with children, the property gives you easy walking access to Disneyland. My children are slightly older 14/16 years and loved the walk to and from, which also gave us easy dinner stops after a long day!  The hotel is clean and the rooms are nice enough.  Having a sofa bed was another bonus. The included buffet breakfast was ordinary and staff did not really have much of a care factor, but hey no big deal. Bottom line...when we had been out all day, this place was easy to get back too. Oh and 10mins from outlet mall.

Summary Heading: Great place for family Disney stay
Summary: Our extended family occupied three suites.  The Homewood Suites is extremely convenient to walk to the Disney parking lot next door for the shuttle or to walk to restaurants.  The staff, especially in the dining area, is great.  The breakfast buffet and dining area are well maintained.  The breakfast staff even organized an impromptu birthday celebration for an 8 year old at breakfast complete with balloons, singing Happy Birthday, a decorated muffin, and a gift.

The temperature was terrible, kept waking up to a hot room that was supposedly supposed to be that way, as told by maintenance. The bed was extremely uncomfortable. The afternoon social however, was a nice touch.
Manager Response: Thank you for your detailed feedback. We sincerely apologize for any lack of comfortability that you experienced throughout your stay. We always strive for everyone to have the best experience possible with us and you have identified some opportunities for improvement. Rest assured we have addressed the issues mentioned with out team and we look forward to having you stay with us again. Please feel free to contact me directly when making your arrangements to come back, I want to make sure everything is perfect for you. You can reach me on my direct phone line: (714)705-0531.

Summary: The staff was extremely accommodating and friendly.  The room was great and very quiet.  We arrived at 9 AM and they actually had a room available but since we wanted to be near our family we declined  and waited until later to get the room.  We were given a ticket and allowed to park the car while we went to Disneyland.

Fabulous base for visiting Disneyland. Homewood Suites offered all the conveniences of home within a short walk to Disneyland. The complimentary breakfast was a great start to the day and offered variety to suit all tastes.

This is our first choice when visiting the Disneyland resort with family. The large rooms and complimentary breakfast make this a great choice. The property is well kept and the staff is friendly and accommodating. In addition it is a short 5-7 minute walk to the Toy Story parking lot buses.

Summary Heading: Great location, clean rooms and awesome breakfast.
Summary: Really enjoyed my stay here. Extremely close to the convention centre, awesome friendly service and a great breakfast. Rooms were clean and quiet. I‚Äôm already looking into booking again for the same time next year. Only downside was the price but this was due to the trade show. (NAMM).

Staff was friendly and helpful.  Room was clean and spacious.   Had a great breakfast server named Carlos Duke.  Made sure we had everything we needed and was friendly!   Would definitely stay at the same hotel next year!

I stayed here for a trade show at the Anaheim Convention Center.  The hotel is very close and is an easy walk. The rooms are spacious and clean. The service is excellent. This is particularly true at breakfast. There are good options and there is staff making sure everything is well and clean. Carlos was very courteous and thanked me for letting him know that the coffee was running low. I would definitely stay here for next years show!

Overall nice hotel in a very good location.  Spacious rooms that are beginning to look a bit dated, but are clean and comfortable (except for the sofa bed).  Of note, while the Toy Story shuttle is next to the hotel, it's part of a huge parking lot and the pick up and drop off locations are still a considerable walk if you have small children.

Summary Heading: Best Secret at Disney- Homewood Suites-Anaheim
Summary: Great place to stay, a lot of choices of breakfast, staff is great, always willing to help.  Fitness room has a lot of variety.  Some of the dryers were out of service, but we did not have to wait on a dryer.  The pool area was great w 3 gas grills a fire pit, game room, basket ball, putting area, and hot tub.  The Disney Shuttle is about a 7-8 minute walk, never had to wait for a shuttle, they were continuous. Past Security at Disney within 15 min of leaving hotel.

The hotel was right next to the bus shuttle parking lot for Disneyland. Made it an easy one minute walk to the parking lot from the hotel. Multiple times during our day we would go back and forth to the hotel and Disneyland. Made vacation life easy. Had to pay a high price for parking the rental car although. Only downside of the stay.

Location is great.  With small kids, 0.3 mile to Disneyland was actually more walking than it seems.  However, Homewood Suites is right by the Disneyland parking shuttle which is free and takes you right to the gate. The food service was a great break from theme-park food and was done very well. The queen beds were very comfortable, but the sofabed was not at all. Rooms were clean, the shower was nice, the floors were well insulated so we didn't have to hear our neighbors.

Business trip, not Disneyland. 10 million rugrats with no parental control. Absolutely no common courtesy but I‚Äôm not sure todays ‚Äúparents‚Äù are capable of teaching common courtesy, or demonstrating it. Not the hotel‚Äôs fault but hotel is responsible for stopping the noise after 10 pm.
Manager Response: Hi Mr. Nolte,   We sincerely apologize that your stay was anything less than perfect with us. I believe we have already made contact with you and resolved your concern. However, if any additional follow-up is needed. Please feel free to contact me anytime on my direct phone line: (714)705-0531. In case I am not available, please leave me a voice message and I will make sure to return your call as soon as possible. Thank you and have a great day!

Summary: The housekeeper didn‚Äôt turn our jackets to lost and found... And when I called one am later said never found like ok sure 3 michael kors jacket When I called the manager she spoke to head housekeeper said nothing found Shocked they would lie and keep them 2 children jackets one adult
Manager Response: Hello!  Thank you for your detailed feedback. I believe we were actually able to recover the jackets mentioned in your review. We also sent them back to you and tried to contact you to confirm that you received them. Please feel free to contact me anytime for any additional follow-up. I would love to connect with you. You can reach me on my direct phone line: (714) 705-0531. In case I am not in office, please leave me a voice message and I will return your call as soon as possible.  Best regards,

Summary: Great hotel Amazing complimentary buffet breakfast everyday which we all enjoyed, fruit cereal pancakes waffles bacon etc coffee and juice, busy restaurant but staff work really hard so always a clean table. They do a managers social which is a selection of snack food and beer or wine on some days (mon to thurs when we visited) again all complimentary which was fantastic and really helped save some pennies  Location is ideal for Disneyland as an easy walk or hop on the buses nearby, loads of restaurants and a good mall nearby  Easy access to the freeway, we drove to San Diego, LA, Newport, Huntington etc without getting lost !  Would love to go back one day

The hotel and all of the amenities were wonderfully clean, the staff was courteous and attentive, and the daily full breakfast was most convenient. The suites were bigger than expected and easily accommodated our group of 4.

Summary Heading: Great location, great breakfast, great location and quiet
Summary: We stayed in for 3 nights and 4 days and really liked it.  The location was only a mile from Disneyland and there is a free shuttle right down the road.  The beds are comfortable and the rooms quiet.  Each room comes with a microwave, fridge, safe for belongings, large TV.  The pool is open until 10:00 which is also a bonus.  The complimentary breakfast was very good.  They have their own waffle maker, yogurt, fruit, muffins, bagels, toast, a good selection of cereal, orange juice, sausage, eggs, potatoes. Also free USA newspaper every morning.  I will definitely stay here again

We went to Disneyland for 2 days after the new year and stayed here. Over all, it was a good stay. The rooms were clean and spacious, and there was enough space to fit 5 people in our room (6 if one would sleep on the couch :)) The digital key we were given for the room did not work for some reason, but we had the regular key and were totally fine with it. The breakfast was good, but some of the food we could tell was leftover from the nights before. The complimentary socials were nice but the food was not great. Even our teenagers had fun even though most of the kids in the hotel were much younger than them. The best part of the hotel however, was that it is a short walk from the toy story parking lot to take the shuttle to Disneyland. The one complaint I had was that the first

We stayed here october and was excited to stay in this newer , higher end hilton.  I was so disappointed at how dirty and worn it already was.  What a missed opportunity in this newer property.  Just really dirty overall in our room.  The breakfast choices are great, was super crowded in breakfast area.  Employees were nice , check in our room was not ready but they called up to housekeeping and got it done.  We had passed on this hotel before because of higher prices, but went for it this time, so that is why i was disappointed more so, expected more.
Manager Response: Hello mwood333,  We apologize that the cleanliness of your room was not up to standard. Please know that this is not typical of our property. We will make sure to take your comments to heart and do everything we can to improve. Please let us know next time you are in the area. We will share your comments with our cleaning team and make sure to follow-up appropriately. We look forward to your next stay in the Anaheim area!

Summary: Sorry for the late review.  We stayed here in mid December for 2 nights for a quick visit to Disneyland. The whole property is very clean and neat. Looks almost new. The staff are very nice and welcoming. Our room was outstanding. A living room with a flat screen TV and sofa with pull-out double bed. A full kitchen. Utensils and all. It even has a dishwasher. The 2 queen bedroom was large and also had a flat screen TV.  Bathroom was sparkling clean. The sink sits outside the bathroom so you can wash up while someone else is showering. Very convenient. In the evening we sat in the pool area and enjoyed the fire pit. Nice. This hotel offers a convenient hot breakfast. The food was bland. But that's okay. We didn't come here for the food. They also offer an evening social hour with

This hotel is fantastic!  The suites are nice and clean.  The breakfast was always delicious with enough food throughout the three hour duration.  The food and beverage staff worked hard and kept everything stocked and clean.  I will definitely be coming back and will highly recommend this hotel.

Nice new Homewood Suites.  The location is definitely a plus when going to Disneyland.  The accommodations are nice and the staff was helpful.  Very busy hotel around Christmas.  Parking is additional which adds up quickly.

I stay at this hotel whenever I am in Anaheim. It is always of the highest quality. Walking distance to Disneyland and Convention Center. The rooms and amenities are fantastic (breakfast and evening socials).

Summary Heading: Great place and excellent customer service
Summary: Very clean and great stay for families. Reasonably priced for everything you get with a good breakfast included. Very close proximity to Disneyland can easily walk there. Would definitely stay here again

Here for NYE to watch Disney fireworks. Called yesterday and Rep preassigned a room for us to ensure we get a room facing Disney. Checked in and was told the room was merely a ‚Äúrequest‚Äù and not a guarantee. I was even given a room number, would have been nice to know that was merely a ‚Äúrequest.‚Äù This is the only reason we checked in here...sure we can watch some fireworks at Downtown but decided to use my Honors points so my kids doesn‚Äôt have to deal with crowd and cold weather tonight. Wish I would have known about not being able to reserve specific rooms so I would not have wasted 50k of my points.  Room is ok. Has a small window facing the pool.
Manager Response: Hello filamcalifornication,  We are sincerely apologetic that your stay with us was anything but the very best. We would love to help change your perception and invite you to come back whenever you are in the Anaheim area. Please feel free to contact me directly, I would love to assist.  Best regards,  Mark Morihiro Assistant General Manager Homewood Suites Anaheim Resort (714)705-0531

Summary: The rooms are spacious and maintained very well. The most awesome thing about the property is the staff. Our daughter lost her lovey, a teeny raggedy stuffed puppy and we thought all hope was lost. Housekeeping was able to locate and return the puppy to us. We are definitely going to return to this property next time we come to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Good rooms but feels like a zoo
Summary: On a positive, the king suite was pretty good . However breakfast felt like feeding time at the zoo. There were people scrambling for food everywhere. Breakfast was very basic and cafateria like. On several occassions the cutlery and crockery were not clean. I do realise that this place targets families with Disney on their mind, but attention to cleanliness is fundamental in my mind.
Manager Response: Hello 312brendenj,  Thank you so much for your kind mention about your king suite. We will share your comments with our food and Beverage crew for improvement purposes. Cleanliness is extremely important to us and we always try to exceed expectations. We look forward to having you stay with us again in the near future.  Thank you,  Mark Morihiro

Summary: I've stayed in enough Hiltons to have come to expect comfort.  In the last five months, I've stayed at four Hiltons and this one was by far the worst.  The bed was so uncomfortable that I actually slept better on the sofa pullout.  The bedding is flimsy and it slides right of during the night so you're cold on top of being uncomfortable.  The lights strobe for about five to ten minutes.

Our family was very happy staying at Homewood Suites, Anaheim Convention Center. The rooms are spacious. The breakfast was large enough that we only required a small snack in the afternoon and then came back for the evening reception. The area was clean and we enjoyed swimming and using the hot tub. The hotel is very close to the Toy Story bus parking lot, so we were able to walk to the bus stop and ride to the park very easily. Overall great stay!

We loved staying here! The rooms were great, the staff were delightful to work with and the breakfast was phenomenal every morning. Carlos was particularly helpful and went out of his way to be kind.  We will definitely stay here again!

This place was amazing, clean, and super convenient. I would stay here again in a heartbeat! Plus free breakfast, can't go wrong! It is also walking distance to the park, a little way down the street, but totally doable.

We booked a King bed/bunk bed 1 bedroom suite. It was spacious enough with a full sized kitchen. The self serve laundry was helpful, considering it was raining every other day we were there. Staff were helpful and generally very pleasant. Location was good to Disneyland,  as the hotel was located next to the Disney carpark which provides free shuttle to the Disney Park. Plenty of parking available for those who drive there. Easy to get to from LAX. Food options available nearby. Complimentary breakfast daily, simple but enough to start the day. Complimentary social on week night evenings, is good if you're taking it easy, or its a rainy evening

Summary Heading: You get a lot for your money
Summary: I presented at the Anaheim convention center. It was about a 5-7 minute walk. Very clean. Great size rooms with full fridge and microwave. Weekdays they have dinner and drinks included for happy hour. And everyday is a full breakfast buffet.  Great customer service. Easily walk to Walgreens down the street or find many restaurants nearby. Nice size pool. Heated although still on the cooler side.  Only improvement is the pullout couch bed. Horrible. Request a roll out bed and that is so much better! Highly reccomend this hotel.

We had a great stay in these spacious rooms. Carlos was super helpful and brought our little kids toys at breakfast. Thanks, Carlos!  Easy and free bus ride to the park. Beer and wine receptions in the evening and and a nice breakfast in the am.  ‚ù§

This hotel is seriously amazing. Free hot buffet style breakfast every morning. Free evening appetizers and beer/wine. A 3 minute walk to the Toy Story Parking lot where there are free shuttles to and from Disneyland all day up until an hour after the park closes. Our hotel room (a king suite) was super clean, spacious and had all the amenities we were looking for and more. They loaded our room with free snacks, sodas, juice, waters, etc. The shower is spacious and the water pressure is perfect. The mattress was so comfortable and the sheets/comforter were silky soft. If you're going to Disneyland you need to stay here. Customer service is A+++++ as well.

I can't say enough good about this hotel. The service from the moment we walked through the door was outstanding! The hotel is very clean and the rooms are awesome, so big and comfortable. The beds and pillows and towels were also top notch and after long days at Disney, we slept like rocks!  The proximity to the park was also a plus. We walked to the Toy Story lot every morning and hopped on the shuttle which dropped us off right at the gate. We have already booked next year so don't change a thing. Enjoyed the hot breakfast every morning and pretty much everything about this hotel! Keep up the good work. Your great customer service means everything!

Summary Heading: So many good things but poor beds = will not return
Summary: There was so much to love about this hotel: convenient access to Disneyland shuttles (hotel is next to toy story lot), great free breakfast, and generally clean. That said, the bed was among the *least comfortable* I‚Äôve slept on in recent memory. Horribly uncomfortable bed and very thin bedding and bad pillows (and very few pillows to the room considering it sleeps 6).  Despite full busy days at Disneyland, I was barely able to sleep at night because the beds were so uncomfortable.  Unless they get new beds I won‚Äôt be returning.
Manager Response: Hello ering816,  Thank you for the detailed feedback. We feel terrible that your experience with us was not the best. We always strive for guests to be as comfortable as possible and it sounds like you have identified an opportunity for improvement. Rest assured we will take your comments to heart and do everything we can to recover from this. Please feel free to contact me directly when booking your next stay. I would love to make sure you are well taken care of on your next Anaheim venture.  Best regards,  Mark Morihiro (714)705-0531

Summary: This was a family trip to Disney for 4 nights/three days. The hotel is conveniently located close to the park and easy to catch the shuttle. The complimentary breakfast and evening social is great and convenient. Good stay.

Summary Heading: Great price for such proximity to Disneyland!
Summary: The hotel staff were accommodating by allowing us to check-in even though we arrived a couple of hours early. Also, the free complimentary light dinner was a pleasant surprise. The best feature of this hotel was its location, as it is in a walkable distance of Disneyland. I would also recommend the use of their pool facility since it was clean and not overcrowded.

We love this hotel and all the amenities!  Great location, great staff and good service!  It has a wonderful breakfast in the mornings and good social in the evenings.  With that being said, we were also there in February and I felt that the evening social meals aren't as nice but it filled our tummies and was good.  The extras they offer such as getting groceries delivered are such a nice touch.   The kids love the pool, arcade, putting green and basketball courts and the rooms are a nice size and we love the extra little living room space and kitchen.  We stayed in the king room with the bunks.  The beds are very comfortable.  We loved sitting around the firepit in the evening and relaxing. The only real thing I can complain about and suggest for the entire week we were there

Would absolutely stay here again!  Complimentary breakfast has great variety and friendly staff, comfortable beds, spacious for families, and a very quick Uber ride away from Disneyland.  No complaints here!

Overall the experience was good. Food was great to start the morning, and they do an excellent job of keeping it supplied.  One thing about Hilton Hotels, there coffee is not the best. Pool was clean and plenary of room. Parking a little expensive, located next to the shuttles for an easy walk. Delivered to the gate for easy access to both parks.

This Hotel is amazing! From the huge FREE Continental Breakfast each morning from 6:30-9:30am, the FREE appetizer/ light meal Wine & Beer Monday to Thursday, the FREE Grocery Delivery Service delivered right into our Suites, the Huge Dining area, clean rooms, putting green, bball court, small and larger swimming pool, hot tub, fitness center, arcade room, self laundry room, and many many other perks; we will DEFINITELY stay here again AND recommend this Hotel to others.  Thank you Homewood for making our stay the best it could possibly be!

In Anaheim for a week long conference. Loved staying at the Homewood. Great location, great staff, excellent amenities! Usually we stay at the Hilton across the street. However, they were booked so we decided to stay here instead. So glad we did. I will be making this my go to hotel for any conference or Disney trips in the future!

The stay was amazing. They have free breakfast and free social hour. It was very nice to be able to wake up in the morning and continue my home routine. The gym was well kept and quaint as well. It had the necessary components. Great stay. Highly recommend.

This hotel has everything you need to have an easy & relaxing trip to Disneyland with a large family.  Pros: Spacious rooms w/ kitchenette           Complimentary Breakfast (different options each day)           Complimentary Evening Reception (Mon-Thursday ) with different options everyday             Heated pool, basketball court, putting green.          Next to Toy Story parking lot for free shuttle to Disneyland            Walking distance to many restaurants, Walgreens & Starbucks             & So much more  Only Con: $25 per day parking no matter what Hilton Status  I would definitely stay here again (planning a trip for next year at same time)  Pictures of Complimentary Breakfast/Reception below-

I stayed as part of a group for a conference at the Anaheim Convention Center. The hotel room was very clean and spacious. The kitchen are provided utensils, plates, coffee, tea, and even a big fridge. I also made use of the fitness center, which was very nice before starting a busy day of work. Highly recommend!

This was my first time staying at a Homewood Suites and was frankly blown away by how pleasant my stay was. The fully equipped kitchenette (with plates, utensils, pots, pans, full-sized refrigerator, microwave, and dish washer) allowed me to cook for myself like I do at home, reducing the stress and wasted money of eating out as a food allergy sufferer. The room was clean and had sleekly-designed furnishings, and the staff were friendly and helpful. I'm recommending Homewood Suites to everyone I know and will make a point try and stay with them whenever possible!
Manager Response: Hello cdunc92,  Thank you so much for the nice feedback! We greatly appreciate all of the kind words and we will make sure to pass along your words of praise to our staff. We always try to keep our rooms updated and fresh, we appreciate you for noticing that. Thank you again for your kind recommendation, we always love when guests love us so much that they want to tell their friends.

Summary: Very nice modern rooms with sizable bathroom and a kitchenette with fridge-freezer, cooker hotplates, microwave and dishwasher. Laundry facilities are on-site. A decent sized pool and Jacuzzi and a gym. Breakfast is free (like the Evening Social) but does tend to get a bit repetitive after 3 days. Parking is $22 per night. A short walk to the Anaheim Convention Centre. Transport to the parks is relatively easy (and free) because the hotel is adjacent to the Toy Story car park and its direct Disneyland shuttle. Overall, preferable to the Hilton Anaheim.
Manager Response: Hello Tiptoptraveller,  Thank you so much for the kind review of our property. Our on-site laundry is always very easy to use and convenient, especially when the weather is a little rainier like it has been lately. We are glad you were able to use the convenient shuttle service that picks up nearby. We look forward to having you back in the area!

Summary Heading: Great hotel in the middle of everything!
Summary: I attended the 2019 SWE National Conference last week and stayed at the Homewood Suites Anaheim Convention Center location. I was very happy with the location, the service, the cleanliness of my suite and the services (I loved their breakfast). Hands down it was the best value for the money and I would recommend it to individuals, groups and families.
Manager Response: Hello LMelgarejo,  Thank you so much for the nice review! We are pleased that you enjoyed the cleanliness of our suites and our breakfast. We would love to have you come stay with us again next time you are in town. Thank you again!

Summary: The hotel was clean and staff very friendly and helpful.  Nice big pool and grills if you're in the mood to cook! Free breakfast was a great start to the day. Convenient to walk next door and hop on  a shuttle to Disney.
Manager Response: Hello Matthew C,  Thank you so much for the kind feedback. We are glad you were able to utilize our suite outdoor area and take advantage of our delicious breakfast. We look forward to having you stay with us again for your next Disneyland vacation.

Summary Heading: Loved our 8 nights here, highly recommend for families
Summary: Stayed 8 nights here in a 1KG/BUNK BEDS FAMILY STE for US1808.  Booking direct only 6 weeks out. So many things to love about this hotel - the huge free breakfast, the nightly receptions Mon-Thrs, the great pool, basketball court for kids, the location and the room and sleep quality of the beds.  We walked to Disney most days and then got the bus back for the nightly reception  and a swim and then headed back to the parks refreshed.  Kids loved the pool.  The room was large and had a full fridge/freezer, separate room to bedroom where we had a very comfortable king bed and then bunk beds.  Walk is about 15-18 mins to Disney.  Free breakfast and coffee downstairs was great.  Service great.  Would love to come back here and would be my go to place now in Anaheim.
Manager Response: Hello Onie13,  Thank you so much for the nice review of our property! As always, we appreciate the consideration in choosing to stay with us and we are pleased that everyone had fun. Our pool is always a hit with the kids and we are glad you were able to enjoy it! We look forward to your next Disneyland venture.

Summary: Everyone was super welcoming & helpful. We could easily walk to Disneyland in 10-20 mins (1 adult & an 8yo) feeling very safe, day or night, or go around the corner to catch the free Disney shuttle from the Buzz Lightyear area of the Toy Story parking lot & be there in time. Breakfast was substantial & Carlos & Anney took great care of us üòÄ Front desk, everyone just so nice. We loved the hot tub! Quick Uber from John Wayne airport. Great experience üëçüèºüëçüèº
Manager Response: Hello 705maryk,  Thank you so much for the nice review! We are pleased that you enjoyed our location and convenient shuttle transportation. We will make sure to pass along your words of praise to Anney and Carlos. They always go above and beyond for our guests. We are very pleased that you had a great experience with us.

Summary: Great stay at Homewood Suites, loved the amenities especially the complimentary breakfast (huge breakfast bar). The rooms were large and felt like I had my own apartment. Very clean, quick service from staff when you needed it. Right across Anaheim convention center, so did not need to use my car. This a very nice hotel that has everything you need. I used the business center to print off some last minute items, that was very helpful to have onsite. I would certainly recommend staying here if you are going to the convention center or Disney!
Manager Response: Hello Aahmad2019,  Thank you so much for the nice review! We are glad you loved our amenities and especially the breakfast. We are also pleased that the room was big enough to accommodate your whole family and you were able to take advantage of our surrounding area. We look forward to having you stay with us for your next Disneyland venture!

Summary: Great place, they have a kitchenette in the rooms so works great if one is travelling with their family. Really close to Disney and they offer shuttle service at a reasonable price. Universal Studios are fairly far but most of the travel companies offer a pick up from the hotel. The only downside is that they do not have a restaurant at the hotel but other than that the hotel is wonderful.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the nice review! We are glad you were able to take advantage of our convenient location and we apologize that our restaurant only serves breakfast from 6:30am -9:30am everyday and dinner from 5pm-7pm Monday through Thursday. We look forward to having you stay with us for your next Anaheim venture!

Summary Heading: Great for families going to Disney
Summary: This hotel is perfect for families going to Disney. The bunkbeds in the room are great for the kids, and it‚Äôs conveniently located next to the Disney parking lot to ride the shuttle to the park. The weeknight dinners were wonderful for our family
Manager Response: Julie W,  Thank you so much for your kind review. We greatly appreciate the consideration in choosing to stay with us and we are glad you were able to take advantage of the weeknight dinners! We look forward to your next stay with us.

Summary: Awesome staff, food, facilities, and location. This hotel is amazing. The staff was the absolute best from the front desk, food service, maid service, literally everyone we met was great. The morning breakfasts had something for everyone from picky eaters to dieters. The weekday evening socials were a nice get away. The rooms were large enough to spread out after a long day at Disneyland.
Manager Response: Hello Angel K,  Thank you so much for the nice review! We truly appreciate your acknowledgment of our breakfast selection and friendly staff. We are glad that everything went well throughout your stay and we look forward to your next Anaheim adventure.

Summary: AWESOME: Staff, Breakfast, Pool, Basketball Area, Mini Golf, Arcade, and Room. Staff was really nice and really helpful, my family and I would definitely be staying in the hotel in the near future again..
Manager Response: Hello Onclau9!  Thank you so much for the nice review. We truly appreciate the nice words and acknowledgment of our staff. We look forward to your next Anaheim venture!

Summary Heading: Homewood Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center
Summary: Very pleased with our FAMILY stay at this Homewood Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center.  Three separate roooms booked for our trip to Disneyland California to celebrate my grandaughters 11th birthday.  Would definitely stay at this location again.
