My family stayed at this hotel when on vacation at Disneyland. This hotel and staff is first class. I‚Äôve never stayed in a hotel that treated their customers so well. The rooms were fantastic. Rooms were the cleanest I‚Äôve ever seen. Every time we walked by the front desk we were asked if they could help us with anything or if we needed any help at all. The pool area was neat and clean. The food that was served for meals wasn‚Äôt the normal hotel/motel food. It was good, hot and filling.  I will only stay at this hotel from now on each time we return to California.

The manager seemed to always be there. He was always smiling and happy to serve. The staff was responsive to all your needs. Breakfast was great and the evening social is fantastic. I would recommend anyone to stay here.

Summary Heading: Our Stay near the Mouse House
Summary: We recently booked two rooms with Homewood for ourselves and our kids and grandkids.  My wife and I booked the standard King and our kids used the Family Suite.  The rooms were very clean and modern and the Family Suite worked out very well for our kids and their children.  The only draw back was the mattress on the King bed.  It was a bit thin and not up to the standard I've experienced with Hilton.  It's a good thing we were very tired from out days at the Mouse House.  But after three nights the springs in the mattress made themselves known.     The staff at the hotel were amazing and very appreciative of our business.  That was very refreshing.  The breakfast meal and evening reception were very nice and sufficient.    We would stay again.

Has complementary breakfast, free teas and coffees daily.  Great size bedrooms with kitchenette. Good living space.  About a 20 min walk to the Disneyland park gates though. Park Shuttle isn‚Äôt too far from the hotel.  Location is a bit further for my liking... otherwise very modern and clean hotel.

Great hotel.  Second visit in two years.  Good pool for everyone including kids.  Food and free drinks are a plus.  Plenty of places to eat nearby, also CVS and Walgreens close to buy any food or drinks you may require.  My tip for Disney is take a break in late afternoon, head back to Disney after fireworks at 9pm.  Did this all 4 days, hardly lined up for a ride between 9pm and midnight.  Some rides you could just stay on and keep going around.  Splash mountain and pirates of Caribbean line could be 60 mins during day.  After 9 pm usually not one person in line!   Cheers

This was our first visit to Disneyland and the hotel stay was absolutely great! We stayed from May 21st to May 25th and it couldn't have been better. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk to Disney (unless you're wearing Converse) so that's a perk. Also, they serve a complimentary breakfast AND dinner each day. Their breakfast is delicious, but I can't say the same about their dinner. Still, being able to eat 2 free meals saves money so that you're able to buy more stuff at Disney. The staff are all great and very friendly. I'd definitely recommend this place to others!

Summary Heading: Everything You Require for a Comfortable Stay
Summary: Our family of 4, 3 adults and 1 teenager stayed for 7 nights end April/ early May. We were very impressed with our suite, 2 separate rooms, one with 2 queen beds and another with a kitchenette and TV and lounge area. We found everything to be   very clean. Sure there were a few minor wear and tear issues but you certainly wouldn't complain about it! Coming from Australia and considering the dollar exchange rate, we welcomed the included breakfast and evening social. The money you spend on food adds up so quickly, especially at Disneyland. Again, it's not 5 star food but because it was part of the package and plentiful we were impressed. I don't understand why other reviewers complain about it. We enjoyed our complimentary wine and beer at the evening social. I was surprised at

The Homewood is not far from Disney. You can meet all kinds of people on the walk to the park.   The eating area is spacious reducing stress in the morning. The cleaning staff was hardworking and friendly.   My wife and I stayed in room 223 from May 19th to the 22nd. One benefit of this room is you can watch the Disney fireworks from the room if you leave the park early. Bonus!!!

My wife and I visited Disney and stayed at the Homewood as it is not a long walk to the park. Upon check out, Victoria was very professional in helping me out of a stressful situation. This resonates throughout the entire staff. I was even impressed with the cheerfulness of the buffet staff when drawing art on the morning menu at 6:15 AM.   If we return to Disney, we will definitely stay again.

Summary Heading: Couldn't be better. Wonderful grounds, room, pool, breakfast and staff
Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights as part of an extended California trip. It was the best Hilton on our trip.  The room had 2 queen beds, a bunk bed and a pull out sofa. As well as a full kitchen and a small living room. The room was comfortable and clean. Great beds and linens as expected. The shower had good water pressure and hot water.  The staff was genuinely friendly and helpful. Which is often hot or miss at Hiltons.  The breakfast was above and beyond the usual Hilton breakfast. It had unusual offerings such as chicken enchiladas as well as eggs, bacon etc, fresh fruit, cereal and much more.  The location was convenient. There is a shuttle that can take you to Disney or it's a nice 10-15 minute walk.  The pool is heated and beautiful. They also had a basketball court and.

Summary Heading: Love the hotel hate the roach
Summary: This is the third time we have stayed at this hotel and it has always been a pleasure.  The staff is always very nice and the front desk clerks always go above and beyond.  I heard one clerk listening to a girl talk about her Disneyland experience which she probably hears every day and she acted like she was interested.  The food is also good and the rooms are clean.  However on this visit there was a roach in the hallway near my room on the first floor.  It was next to room #134.  I told the staff and they seemed concerned and got rid of it.  I was told if you see one roach then their are many more.  I hope the hotel has the building fumigated.  Besides that small issue the hotel is still GREAT!!!
Manager Response: Hello JasonC185,  Thank you so much for your detailed feedback. We appreciate your consideration in choosing to stay with us and we are pleased that you had a great time. I received notification that our professional pest extermination company has been informed of your findings and the area near room 134 has been serviced. We always take any comments like these to heart, and act accordingly as soon as possible. We hope you think of us next time you are in town and we look forward to having you stay with us again soon.  Best regards,  Mark Morihiro

Summary: Great location.  Shuttles to Disney were right behind the hotel; however, it was a reasonable walk if that's necessary.  There was a car rental that was a five minute walk away, as well as drug stores and restaurants that were close.  The hotel had great amenities and the free breakfast was a good way to start the day.  I would definitely stay again.

Very nice pool, fun arcade and friendly staff. My family enjoyed our stay and would recommend the hoomewood suites to anyone vacationing in anaheim. The rooms are also  well kept. Free breakfast also another perk this hotel provides. Will come back soon. I would like to specially point out Stephanie she was super attentive, and truly made us feel welcomed. It was an awesome experience!

Summary Heading: Perfect for a large family get together
Summary: We had organized a family get together with family members coming from San Francisco, Alberta and Ontario Canada.  There were several very young children with us so meal time is always a challenge. All the requests I had made were honoured by the hotel. All the staff we had contact with were friendly and helpful. We had 5 rooms near each other so visiting was easy.  The rooms were kept clean and beds super comfortable.  The family suites with bunk beds were great with the families, but a playpen was also provided for the 1 year old.The rooms that had the fireworks view were worth the extra money and we got together each night in one of the units to watch the display. The challenge of meal times were made easier for us as we could eat as a group (sit together) at the Breakfast

If you want an amazing breakfast and amazing light dinner during the week this hotel is for you! Everything from the front desk employees to the pool and arcade room are perfect! We enjoyed our stay and plan to stay again next time we are in Anaheim!

Really impressed by this hotel considering its below average costs. It's not often you get so much included in a hotel of this type but was pleasantly surprised. And in the room and around the site you have great facilities. Everything feels fresh, modern and clean. Every member of staff I spoke to was pleasant and approachable. Everyone says hi and is happy to help. Big shout out to Mark the Duty Manager who was very helpful and went the extra mile when I lost a personal item

Summary Heading: Perfect stay for Disneyland or convention center
Summary: A terrific place to stay, whether you are going to the Convention Center or Disneyland.  We went to Disneyland, and there is a very convenient free shuttle within a 5 minute walk.  Or you can walk the entire way.  Either way, you can avoid the parking crowds, hassle and cost.  Breakfast was nice, and the dinner "social hour" food during the week was way more than just a snack.  Front desk employees were SO SO nice and helpful--I really felt welcomed by them.  I would definitely stay here again.

We waited a long time for the price to be reasonable to stay here as the NZD dollar never helps and this property looked beautiful. The lady who settled us in was super friendly and helpful with information on the area. We were able to get our room early as our flight was an early landing one and we were prepared to leave our luggage and kill a few hours around downtown Disney so the early check in was a really nice gesture. We never cause any issues so that was bacialy the only interaction apart from leaving we had with staff.   Our room however was really small dark and super basic. Breakfast and the dinners were okay, there was never much of a wait and we ofter sat outside to eat.   In other reviews people note about using the Disney bus which you can catch next door, but it
Manager Response: Hello MsAKellyN!  Thank you for the detailed feedback. We appreciate all of your nice comments and we are glad that your interactions with our staff were positive. My apologies for the way that the room appeared. We will make sure to share your experience with the team and see what can be done to correct this. We apologize that you didn't get the best value out of your stay. Please feel free to contact me directly. I would love to see how we can help correct this: (714)705-0531. - Mark

Summary: We stayed here this week for our trip to Disneyland. The stay was just ok.   The beds were pretty terrible. I don‚Äôt have back problems, but every morning I would wake up with a very sore back, and I would toss and turn all night. My husband had back surgery just 6 months ago and the beds were a nightmare for him. We were also awakened several times to the people above us or next door watching tv or jumping.   The breakfast was your typical American breakfast. Very little fruit or healthy options to choose from.   There‚Äôs no door on the bathroom sink area. I like to get up before my kids and get myself ready. With this setup you can‚Äôt do that, at least not with a light. So, in order to get up early and let my kids sleep later, I would get ready in the morning in the dark. Not the
Manager Response: Hello LeahnRich,  Thank you for the detailed review. We greatly appreciate your consideration in choosing to stay with us and we apologize that your experience was not the best. We are pleased to hear that you had good experiences with our staff. However, we apologize that you did not think our set-up in the bathroom was an convenient as it could be. We will share you experiences with the Toy Story shuttle with other guests that ask about it. Usually they are quicker than that, and it would be a good thing for everyone to keep in mind. Please let us know next time you are in the area, we would love to accommodate you!

Summary: Did plenty of research prior to booking and this hotel had lots of great reviews so figured we couldn't go wrong. Very happy to have been met by a lovely assistant who checked us in efficiently after a long flight. Once we go to the room the very first thing I noticed was how sticky the desk was where I went to put my toitletry bag down. This turned out to be a theme throughout the room. The fridge and kitchen area hadn't been thoroughly cleaned and the bathroom was definitely starting to show it's age. We were excited to meet our extended family who were also staying for breakfast the next morning, but the place was packed so ended up squeezing in bunches where we could. We also tried the hotel's social hour which was a great idea and we loved the idea of a light meal during
Manager Response: Hello Caniwi_Dev,  Thank you for sharing your experience with us. We are pleased that the person checking you in met your expectations. However, we feel terrible that the first thing you noticed was the lack of cleanliness inside your suite. We will follow-up with the team that cleaned your room and make sure this does not happen again. We look forward to the opportunity to have you back again, hopefully we can correct your impression of us.

Summary: We booked this hotel after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor, and we werent disappointed.  The quality of food and choice of the complimentary breakfast and evening happy hour were amazing. Everyone was so friendly from the wonderful Assistant Manager Mark Morinho to the reception and restaurant staff, they were so cheerful and helpful.  Fantastic stay.

This is the hotel to stay at , save yourself a lot of money , have excellent service and accommodations at Hilton . Clean and spacious rooms , kitchen area with all the essentials, a large pool , great continental breakfast , super close to Disneyland shuttle in toy story parking lot . Can‚Äôt say enough about this hotel .. .

Me and my family stayed here for 2 nights. The hotel is newer and very clean. All the employees we encountered were nice and helpful. Our room had a full kitchen and a separate bedroom. The complimentary breakfast was good and they had many options. The short walk to the Toy Story parking lot for Disneyland was great. We didn‚Äôt swim in the pool but the hot tub was nice to relax in after a long day. We requested a room that faced Disneyland for a view of the fireworks and they were able to accommodate our request. Overall this is a great place to stay and I would definitely recommend it.

Summary Heading: Best Place to Stay With the Family!
Summary: My stay here was absolutely amazing. Everyone was very kind and helped with questions we had to get to Disney. The location is great because you can easily walk there, or also take the bust that can get you there before it opens. It makes life very easy. The breakfast was wonderful, and there were many options available regardless of what your diet it.

We stayed here for Spring Break 2019 and overall had a great stay. The food was lovely, the staff fantastic, and my kids loved the outdoor area with the basketball, mini golf, pools and hot tub.   We stayed on points, and the only room available for 50,000 points was a king studio with a sofa bed. It was too small for 4 people and all of our stuff so I would not choose that room again. I would stay at the hotel again, though!  We had some frustration with housekeeping (all hotels should have "please make up room" hang tags, but alas this one did not) and the assistant manager Mark resolved it to above our level of expectation. I was impressed.

Summary Heading: perfect spot for Family Disney Trip
Summary: Complimentary Breakfast and Social hour M-TH. Great spot for family Disneyland trip. Walking distance from the parks and half a block from the disneyland parking shuttles. Option for bunk beds suites with an adjoining room.

Great place to stay for Disneyland.  Room was very clean and in excellent condition.  The breakfast was excellent and a great way to start the day.  We would definitely come and stay again and would recommend to others.

Summary Heading: Excellent Place to Stay While at Disneyland!
Summary: Extremely clean and very roomy rooms. Very kind and thoughtful staff. Breakfast included daily and on many weeknights dinner is included,  Free Shuttle just around the corner that goes to Disneyland every few minutes.  We loved our stay!

Our family stayed at the hotel for 4 nights while visiting the Disneyland. It was a great experience. Great location. We could take the free shuffle from Disney which is just a 3-5 minute walk to the Disneyland every morning and come back in the evening. I would stay at the same hotel if coming back to visit the Disneyland and would also recommend it to anyone who's visiting the Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Great deal for family of 6, few hangups
Summary: We stayed 7 nights the first week of May. The great: -Staff are super friendly.  Nice little touches like free balloons to kids during breakfast.   -Front desk has a private car service with available car seats  to/from airport at same price as the taxi ($55 before tax/tip).   -constant buses at Toystory shuttle just within 5 minutes walking. -any north facing rooms has unobstructed views of Disney fireworks thanks to the parking lot.  We were on the 3rd floor and the Hilton app allows you to choose your room before you arrive. -free breakfast and evening social (Mon-Thurs) meant less time and $ wasted on meals.  This benefit cannot be overstated - such a relief for me not to have to think about what and where to eat all the time for our group of 6. -lots of veggies in the

Loved the breakfast and evening social great location for Disney everything was easy and smooth no surprises. Staff was exceptional! We loved staying at this hotel and would come again, would stay at any Hilton  or after this experience

hotel was very clean. the rooms are spacious. I would stay again. Disney shuttle is very close to hotel. the breakfast is good too. During the week there is complimentary dinner and a social with snacks.

I'm such a fan of this chain. The full kitchen and suite layout are perfect for a small family, and it's a nice retreat from the hubbub of the theme parks. Really great provisions in the downstairs buffet--nothing fancy but fills the kids' bellies. It's a fairly short walk to the parking lot with the shuttle buses. The only deduction is for the lack of weekend buffet service. Recommended!

Could not pick a fault with the 7 nights we had here. Great service, nice food, top location and overall experience.  The evening complimentary dinner (plus beer/wine) was a nice surprise.  Did not encounter any issues and would definitely stay here again. Thoroughly recommend.

Room was clean and comfortable. We had 2 queens and a pull out couch and slept 4 adults 2 kids comfortably. Nice kitchenette but we did not use. Great location for Disney as the parking lot with free shuttles is just across the street. You can even check the line for the shuttle from our window. This hotel is a great choice because of the hearty breakfast. It looked like everyday they serve: Belgium waffles. Strawberry compote whip cream butter syrup powdered sugar cinnamon yummmmm Eggs- scrambled or boiled Oatmeal- brown sugar raisins coconut Bread- bagels cream cheese, wheat, English muffin, peanut butter jelly Fruit- apples, oranges, bananas, melon Yogurt One day we were there they also had biscuits and gravy, sausage patties, country fried potatoes. The other day they served

The Homewood Suites is a very nice hotel, in a great location, and is well maintained.  The staff is friendly and professional.  Everyone at the hotel is willing and anxious to help in any way possible.

Recently stayed here for my trip to Disneyland and wow amazing. Staff was very kind and friendly at the front desk no problem checking in. Great breakfast and dinner. Really enjoyed the arcade and pool side fire place. Definitely would recommend this to my friends and family! My go to hotel on my next visit!

We stayed here from Feb 24th to March 6th 2019. We had a one bedroom suite with a full kitchen. Our room was very clean and bright. We overlooked looked the back of the hotel, pool area. It was nice and quiet too.  The front desk staff were all very helpful and accommodating. Shout out to Brittany and Christian your customer service was excellent.  Housekeeping - Guadalupe A. - superior housekeeping - thanks for being so great at what you do. Our room was always so clean.  Footnote - after we left and returned home I couldn‚Äôt find a bag containing two brand pairs of shoes for my teenage son.  We looked everywhere at home. After a month I thought I will try the hotel on the off chance we left the bag in the room. Even though we double checked. Mirabelle ( sp ?) at the front desk

My stay here overall was amazing and the staff was extremely kind. Everyone was very helpful and made my stay even more enjoyable; it was nice to come back from a long day and see a kind face. I can definitely say that i will be coming back.

This is our preferred hotel in Anaheim. We suggest it to friends and family too. The rooms have small kitchens which can be stocked thanks to the hotel staff who make daily grocery runs for no charge. Excellent when traveling with kids and or trying to eat healthy.  They have a large breakfast in the morning. While it can get crowded, the staff is excellent at keeping food stocked. Week nights they have a reception which is essentially a light dinner. Perfect refuel before heading back to the park. Love this place!

This is an excellent hotel to stay at if you are going to the Disney parks. It is right next to the Toy Story parking lot where you can take the Disneyland shuttle right to the gate for free. The hotel staff is excellent! The food at the breakfast and dinner social are delicious, better than any hotel I‚Äôve been at!

The staff at this hotel is the most friendly i have encountered while traveling . Me and some friends came to celebrate my bday at Disney. This hotel has a nice breakfast buffet and even better dinner with free beer and wine !! We didn‚Äôt even have to buy food on our trip . Stephanie and Margarita really made us feel at home . Will definitely be coming back here for summer vacay . Worth every penny!

We are avid travelers and have stayed at many Hilton and other hotels.  This was by far one of the best stays we have had.  Great quality for the price.  Rooms are very clean but could use a renovation.  Don't get me wrong...they aren't bad just could you a refresh...but you are getting a great stay at a great price.  That is the only negative and I can't say it's a true negative because the hotel is so clean.   The staff were so friendly and we felt like we were at our home away from home.  Highlights of the stay were definitely at the breakfast / evening happy hour.  They literally are serving full breakfast and full dinner.  We were shocked with the quality of the food.  This is unlike any other complimentary happy hour at any other hotel we have stayed at.   If you are

The staff was super friendly, i loved that they have an arcade right by the pool . Breakfast buffet is always busy due to the delicious food also the staff was always on point cleaning up making sure everything is up to us the customers standards everything was great THE STAFF IS VERY LOVELY AND FRIENDLY !!!

5-Stars!  Awesome place!  I plan on staying here anytime I return.  Having breakfast and dinner is a huge benefit.  The place was very clean and the family suites are everything you need when taking a large family to Disneyland.

Excellent customer service, I had forgotten they provided cribs until a front desk member reminded me. I had a great stay and would definitely recommend friends and family to stay. Close to Disneyland and if any case you can also purchase tickets there.
Manager Response: Greetings!  I'm glad our staff was able to anticipate your needs properly. We are thrilled about your recommendation, and look forward to providing your friends and family with the same great service. Disneyland tickets are always purchasable at the front desk and it is always a great time to stop by. We look forward to seeing you back again soon!  Thank you,  Mark Morihiro

Summary: My friend and I stayed at homewood suites for 4 nights on our trip to Disneyland. Upon check in, we were greeted by the friendly front desk staff and given complimentary waters and instructions on our stay. A large breakfast buffet was included in our stay which was constantly replenished despite it being busy and we always left with a good solid base before trekking to Disney. There is a shuttle about a 3-5 minute walk away at the toy story parking lot which runs very frequently from early to late and was super convenient. When we realized we forgot something back at our room, we headed back and saw the cleaning staff had already been in and cleaned up our room. Such good service and so quick and thorough! The front desk staff were also great when requesting items not found in
Manager Response: Hello VIAdventureSeeker,  Thank you so much your kind feedback. I am pleased that your 4 night stay with us went accordingly and everything was convenient for you. I agree with you, the best way to start a Disneyland day is always with our hot breakfast buffet. We will pass along your words of praise to our Housekeeping staff. They always do a great job and keep our hotel looking new. We will also look into the pool towel size and see what can be done. We appreciate your recommendation with that. Please give us a call when planning your next trip back, we look forward to assisting you on your future Disneyland adventures.  Best regards,  Mark Morihiro

Summary Heading: Would stay somewhere else before booking here
Summary: We just got back from 5 nights at this hotel.  I was hopeful the family suite would be great for our family of 4.  In theory, it should have been (a room with a bedroom, living room and kitchen), but it fell short.  We walked into a sticky kitchen floor, a couch where the arm was visibly dirty (a quick shampoo/cleaning of the couch would have taken care of this and we just laid a towel over the arm), the couch needs to be replaced because there was no support in the cushions left and the side of the bed I slept on had no support left in it (the other side was okay) and my back was not happy.  We also had a gluten free (allergy) person in our party and had trouble getting information about the breakfast/happy hour food so decided not to feed her from the hotel and went elsewhere.
Manager Response: Greetings!  Thank you so much for your detailed feedback. We greatly appreciate your consideration in choosing our property. We always strive for having amazing service, and it sounds like you have identified a couple opportunities for improvement. We will make sure to follow-up and put systems in place in order to ensure that your concerns are addressed. We feel terrible that you are electing to stay elsewhere. We always want our guests to feel at home, and this is definitely not the norm. If possible, we would love to have you back again for another stay with us. Please feel free to reach out to me directly at (714) 705-0531. I will make sure to take all of your comments into account when helping you plan your next trip. I hope you are having a great day, and I look forward to assisting you.  Best regards,  Mark Morihiro Asst. General Manager

Summary: Our family stayed here for 3 nights while attending the Disney Parks and the location could not be better.  We walked a block and a half to get on the Disney shuttle each morning and did not need to wait for a hotel shuttle or pay for parking at the parks.  The breakfast was one of the best (full) hotel breakfasts we have had and there was plenty of seating.  Tables were spread out so it did not feel crowded even when it appeared to be a "busy" time.  The staff was quick to pick up our dishes and wipe tables for the next guests. Rooms were clean and spacious.  One of the evenings we did hear kids running above us, but we understand that is not within the hotel's control.  Beds were comfortable and we slept well overall.  We would definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: Hello Holly R,  Thank you so much for staying with us. We appreciate all of the kind and informative feedback! We will make sure to have our breakfast crew identified for their hard work. They always produce amazing quality food that makes everyone hungry. We will make sure your comments are taken to heart. Our most sincere apologies for any noise during your stay, and we thank you again for your understanding. We hope you contact us when planning your next trip back to Anaheim. We would love to be your, "Home away from home!"  Best regards,  Mark Morihiro

Summary: I have visited this hotel more than 8 times. The location is close to Disney and great restaurants. The evening reception has always had healthy and delicious foods available slings with spectacular hospitality from Carmen. She remembers me from previous visits and has watched my grandchildren grow through pictures. I love seeing her, she makes my trip.
Manager Response: Good evening Bakingforyou,  Thank you so much for your patronage. We appreciate you for always choosing us, when there are so many options in our area. I would like to say that Carmen is truly a special employee, and adds so much joy and energy to the team. Carmen loves people, she always knows how to make me, and everyone else around her laugh. We will make sure your comments are passed along. I'm sure she can't wait to see your grandchildren again and catch up. We look forward to seeing you back again soon. I'll tell Carmen you say, "Hello!"  Best regards,  Mark Morihiro

Summary: Top notch hotel.  Stay here several times a year.  Always receive the best service at the evening reception from Carmen.  Always attentive and polite.  She goes out of her way to make the evening special.  She is the best!!
Manager Response: Hello Curtis S,  Thank you so much for all the positive feedback. I feel like I was just talking about how great Carmen was earlier today. We greatly appreciate you for identifying her.  I will make sure Carmen knows that you appreciate her. She continually puts her best foot forward, and always helps the team have fun at work. We are pleased that you have visited us so many times and look forward to seeing you back again soon!  Best regards,  Mark Morihiro

Summary: Loved everything about this hotel!  It is very family friendly and has everything you need.  It is very easy to go back and forth from Disney.  We loved the bunk bed rooms with kids.  The evening social hour and breakfast were added bonuses.

Summary Heading: BEST place for young families to get the most out of their Disney vacation!
Summary: My customer service experience with this hotel began long before we arrived.   I had booked one night on Air Miles, and 4 nights online, and because the Air Miles booking didn't offer the same room category, I had emailed the hotel asking if it would be possible to link our reservations and match the category, so we could avoid checking in and checking back out on day 2 with two young kids. The GM Benjamin Ly and Reservation Supervisor Alejandra Jacobo were amazing to deal with and treated us like we had been long-time guests. I had a good feeling about this place from that moment on, and it did not disappoint!  I had done lots of research in advance to figure out the best hotel to book. With two young kids, a room with a separate space for them to go to bed earlier and

We had a great stay here for several reasons. Staff was super friendly & helpful. Free breakfast (everyday) & dinner (mon-thurs) made it cheaper for meals. Nice pool & patio area. Separate bedroom & living room area was good for separation. The best surprise was the free shuttle next door at the Toy Story Parking lot. The hotel is 2 large blocks away from the main gate. Too far to walk a few times a day with little ones. To get the free shuttle, you walk around the block & catch a bus to the main drop off area to Disneyland/California Adventure. It is busy at times but so well run & efficient. My only 2 minor complaints are, I hate when hotels ask you to reuse towels but don‚Äôt provide sufficient space or hooks/bars to hang them. There needs to be more in the bathroom area &

Very nice property. Clean and well maintained. the staff is very friendly. Breakfast has plenty of offerings and is kept well stocked regardless of volume of guests. The evening social has "meh" offerings the staff was very friendly and the wine was fine. I would definitely stay again at this property or other homeweed suites

It was great to have the breakfast and lunch meal included as part of the stay.  It really saved us a lot time when enjoying our outings.  That said, one server stands out, Ms Elsa Lopez Margarita.  She made us feel like kings and queens. She was very courteous and we saw her helping hotel guess across the room.  Checking on us several times to ensure our dining experience was excellent.  Keep up the good work HomeWood Suites at Hilton this is just another reason we try to pick your hotels when we travel.

I would like commencement to miss Carmen for her overall hospitality and going above and beyond and meeting the needs of the guess she was a part of the night teen witch attended to our tables at dinner time she is truly one-of-a-kind and should be commended for her overall Southern California hospitality she went above and beyond and making sure that the needs and wants of the guests or me met to the company standards of overall friendliness kind smile on her face making sure that the magic was kept alive and the experience of being so close to Disney I could truly say that hurt overall personality perseverance in friendliness I miss Carmen should be welcomed ended with a 5-star rating for going above and beyond the needs of both friends family and doing more than just her job

We stayed here for 4 nights with our family of 5. The King Suite with bunks was perfect for us. Spent 2 days at Disneyland and 1 day in Burbank at Warner Brothers tour. Easy 1 mile walk to park entrance. Took Toy Story shuttle at night as it drops right next door. Free breakfast is terrific- lots of options from 7:00-9:30am. Pool and hot tub were great. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was always made up. Many family friendly restaurants in the area such as Outback Steak, Joe‚Äôs Crab shack and Red Robin. All were close and good. Target and Walgreens near by for essentials. Would stay here again!

Just got back 5th to 15th April 2019. Hotel was great and in a great location for Disney. I can not fault the hotel only that the parking is expensive but this is the going rate for the area. The safe is really awkward to get to but not a major issue.

Summary Heading: Property was great...service and management in early learning stages
Summary: Property was great.  Service was lacking!  Could not provide upgraded room that was purchased and checked into via mobile app.  Service while at hotel was sub par.  Bags not moved as promised and employee that ended up doing it complained and moved one by one.
Manager Response: Hello melissadoppsj,  Thank you for the nice comments about our property. We sincerely apologize that you did not experience the service that we pride ourselves in. We will make sure to follow-up and share your comments with our team. Your experience with us was definitely not the norm and we want to do everything we can to prevent this from happening in the future. Please feel free to contact us directly, we would love to make-up for any short falls that you experienced.

Summary: This is an ideal hotel for families. The hotel is located within comfortable walking distance of the Disneyland attractions and a number of restaurants and fast food outlets. Our accommodation was clean and modern with a kitchenette and a comfortable sitting area.

Summary Heading: We really couldn't have asked for more...
Summary: This was our first time staying at a Homewood Suites and we were really impressed by the quality of the accommodation and all the extras in terms of breakfast and dinner on a night. A big shout out to Elsa Lopez who was a credit to the team here. Always taking the opportunity to go above and beyond. Very smiley and helpful too. The perfect location. Perfect stay and if you're staying in the area then you really must stay here! :-)

This was a wonderful stay, staff and Manager were fantastic!  The buffet breakfast was magnificent, a great variety of delicious food. My partner was sick at the time and the Manager was so helpful and kind, would stay again and recommend to everyone. Thank you.

This is our favorite Anaheim hotel. Staff is great and rooms are perfect for families! Love the bunk bed suites for the kids! Breakfast is awesome and pool/recreation area is great for letting the kids play and parents can play on the putting green!

Great location.  Walking distance, close proximity to restaurants and Disneyland shuttle.  Suites are clean and spacious, with full kitchen.  Complimentary Breakfast offers a variety of options. Friendly staff.  We will be back

Summary Heading: Our family's first choice for a Good Neighbor Hotel
Summary: The Homewood Suites near the Anaheim convention center is our family's first choice for a good neighbor hotel when visiting the Disneyland parks.  It is conveniently located next to the Toy Story lot where we can catch a short bus trip into the Disney transportation area.  There is breakfast included as well as an afternoon snack and refreshment period (with wine and beer).  The suites have enough room for our family of 5.  Although we usually stay here when visiting Disneyland, we've also stayed here when my son is playing in a basketball tournament at the nearly American Sports Center and compared with other hotels we've stayed at, I think only Homewoods Suites has a basketball court onsite!!  Across the street from Homewood, you will find some really excellent restaurants

This is a great choice if you are close to Disneyland and breakfast & evening social are important to you.  PROS:  Large family suite with full functional kitchen and separate living/sleeping area.  Enough cookware to make a simple meal, plus a full fridge and small oven plus microwave.  Beds were comfortable enough, we spotted new mattresses for the fold out sofas arriving in the lobby.  Felt roomy, with TV's in both rooms.  The family made breakfast work, and even the evening social three of our nights.  This saved on food dollars.  CONS:  Beds are just comfortable enough, but would not be my first choice (Hotel Indigo if you're curious has the best beds...they are like heaven after a long day!).  The breakfast and evening social are far from gluten, paleo, or whole 30

I was a little nervous about the location but the shuttle was super easy.Suite slept party of five but did bring an air mattress for pull out couch.Had full fridge and stove top.Evening social had more food than I expected and saved money.Had a 5 day pass but could‚Äôve used one day just hanging at hotel.Kids loved the pool and game room.Some nice bbq grills in pool area.We had a great all around experience here at Homewood Suites.Very friendly staff.

Extremely well run hotel. Our second stay here. We get a suite for our family of 6. Very clean and staff is extremely friendly and helpful. They even sang to my daughter with a birthday muffin balloons and little gift pack for her birthday. They were very knowledgeable about ingredients at breakfast and evening reception so I knew what we could eat with allergies. Very good breakfast buffet with lots of options and they restock it fast. The walk is a little far from the parks but doable. You can also hop on the disney parking lot shuttle for free next door if desired. Pool area is great. Would be appreciated if rooms were stocked for 6 (towels, dishes etc) instead of the standard 4 when larger families have booked. I'm sure we will be back again!

Stayed here for a short family trip to Disneyland. Checking was extremely easy and the staff was very friendly. Rooms were very clean and our family of four were very comfortable in our 2 beds suite. Beds were very comfortable and bathroom provided consistent hot water. Fridge in room is always helpful! You can walk to Disney, or walk up the street to the shuttle which drops you off right outside the ticket gates.

We had the King suite with bunk beds.  This is a great layout for a family of four.  I hated sitting on the sleeper couch, it was uncomforatable.  Breakfast was awesome.  Every moring they had a chef's choice.  The chicken enchiladas sound odd for breakfast but they were great!  I didn't love bed, but I slept very well!  The social hour was great after a long day at the parks.

Summary Heading: As excellent as how most reviewers said, or even better!
Summary: I reserved a suite room from hotel website and made a requests on some baby amenities for my 18 months old baby. Mark, Assistant General Manager contacted me shortly on my requests and keep me updated ( through email prior check in and also during check-in) As we are pampered by hotel services in North East Asia where kettles and other babies amenities are most likely available, I later realized some items I requested are not commonly available in US hotels right after I checked in here. A brand new kettle was put in kitchen - I think it was bought because my request! I showed my husband the warranty card and instruction insert in the box - he was also surprised. I stayed at another hotel in San Diego in following week and definitely I could tell the difference in service.   We

We had an early flight and got in hours before check-in. The front desk held our bags, told us there was 15 minutes left on breakfast if we wanted to eat, said they would receive our grocery delivery if we weren't back (including refrigerating anything that needed it) and offered us bottled water as we headed out to the park. Weeknights they offer a "light" meal (we never went away hungry) with complimentary beer and wine. This is not the cheapest hotel near Disney, but it is infinitely the best value for the money. Cost aside, it is also the friendliest place I've ever stayed, from the front desk to the dining room. This is the only place I will ever stay when I go to Disneyland and I can't recommend them highly enough.

The location is good if you‚Äôre going to Disney as it is a short walk to the the large parking lots for Disney. No need to pay for the Disney parking. My only complaint is the front desk staff gave us the wrong information about when the buses to Disney started. Otherwise, all staff were friendly and helpful.   It‚Äôs a large hotel with all the amenities: pool, business centre, washers & dryers, and a nice seating area by the pool with a heater.   The room was huge and very comfortable. It had a nice little kitchenette. It was very clean.   They have a free breakfast and another free meal, although we didn‚Äôt go to that one. The breakfast was standard type items and a few extras. It‚Äôs very busy but there was always seating and lots of staff on hand to fill up the items.   In short,

We just returned from our stay at this Homewood Suites, and we now are adding Homewood Suites to our list of hotel chains that we will check out first when we travel.  The service at this hotel was top notch.  The morning breakfast provided a large variety of items that the whole family enjoyed.  Also, in the evening, the hotel provides a happy hour.  This happy hour is not just snacks - it is enough to be your dinner.  All of the food was great and they keep everything stocked well so even if you come in late, you still get plenty of food. Also, they are very generous with the drinks they serve during happy hour, which included Sutter Home wines and 2 beers on tap (those beers changed nightly while we were there).   The location of this hotel was great for those going to

Summary Heading: Excellent Stay at a Premium Property - Easy Walk to Disney
Summary: This is our second visit to Homewood Suites.  I couldn't bear to pay $500 for a basic room at a Disney hotel when this lovely property is less than half that price for a suite that sleeps 6 with a kitchenette and two TVs!  Check in was smooth and easy.  Our room on the second floor faced the Toy Story parking lot (which you can use to get a free bus ride to and from Disney).  The room was extremely clean and the beds were comfy.  The sofa bed is a little worn, and probably should have been replaced, but overall the room was lovely.  Ate the free breakfast on two days, and it was good, with a nice selection of hot and cold items.  The entire property was clean and orderly.  It's a 15 minute walk to Disney, which was very easy, even for those who are not big on walking.  At night,

Summary Heading: Another great stay at our favorite hotel near Disneyland!
Summary: This spring break we had another wonderful stay at our go-to hotel near Disneyland. The service at this hotel is excellent--the staff always goes above and beyond to make us feel welcome! Special thank you to Portia at the front desk, to Julie and Victor in the kitchen, and to the amazing team in the dining area: Carmen, Elsa, Martha, Anney and Letty. As always, the food at both breakfast and the evening reception is plentiful and delicious! Our only recommendation would be to have more vegetarian options available, such as a vegetable soup to go with the chicken noodle soup.  The facilities continue to be well-kept and the location is perfect!

This is my third year in a row staying at Homewood Suites in Anaheim. It is conveniently located right across the street from the Anaheim Convention Center and right next to Disneyland (all within walking distance). The weather is always great in this area and Homewood has always made it convenient and easy for me to stay, even when I bring my car with me. The best (and my favorite) part about this hotel is the customer service. Their manager, Mark, is the kindest person and truly provided me with the best customer service I could've ever expected. He went above and beyond to make sure I was taken care of. This type of excellent service is the reason why i'm happy to come back again each year. God bless Mark! Thank you, Homewood Suites, for such an amazing team leader. He should

Summary Heading: Great service and an excellent location.
Summary: The hotel was very clean.  We knew there was free breakfast when we booked and the quality and variety were better than expected.  We didn't know there was evening food provided Monday to Thursday.  This was a pleasant surprise and an added value.  The staff were all very friendly and helpful.  One day, the room service put diapers from washcloths on our children's stuffed animals, and they thought it was great.  I've already recommended this place to some family and friends.

Stayed for 6 nights. Close to convention center. Very spacious rooms. Fully equipped kitchen. Clean. Steady complimentary internet. Mattress was not comfortable IMO. Parking fees, although on a par with other hotels in the area, are high IMO.

We we're here for Spring Break as a family to enjoy Disneyland.  Housekeeping, maintenance, and the meal service staff (Elsa and Margarita to name just a few) really made the difference.  As family trips go there are always a few mishaps.  The staff at Homewood Suites allowed us to keep our focus on making memories of the fun stuff.  We are grateful for their service.  Highly recommend.

Summary Heading: A good substitute when we needed an alternative place to stay
Summary: We were not able to book consecutive days for our stay at the Hilton Anaheim Convention center. The desk clerk suggested we stay at the Homewood Suites across the street on the one day we could not get with our original hotel booking. It turned out to be a good suggestion.

Summary Heading: Made our visit to Disneyland just the best!
Summary: Stayed for 7 nights with my daughter and her family of 8.  We booked 2 rooms.  The breakfast is wonderful, the evening meal is excellent, the pool area is well designed & clean. 6 minute walk to the Disney free bus that takes you to the front of Disney. Hotel is 3 years old and is a super deal when you factor in the meals you get.

This is a newer hotel.  I am a lover of Hilton hotels but the room choices I had were much smaller than the rooms I am accustomed at Homewood Suites.  Location is great since my event was at the Convention Center.  I normally stay at the Embassy a few blocks further down the street.  If want a shorter walk to Disney or the Convention Center, stay here.  It roomsize and breakfast choice are more important stay at the Embassy.

This hotel was amazing. It accommodated us for an extra night no problem and was cleaned excellently every day. Breakfast was great and you can‚Äôt best the location! Loved it all. We will 100% be coming back the next time we are going to Disneyland.

Easy to find and easy short walk to the Disney lot for free shuttle to theme park, this Homewood Suites was a great find! Rooms looking new and comfortable, way better than normal free breakfast and evening goodies. Pool and hot tub well maintained as was everything about this Homewood Suites location.

Free breakfast and dinner. Very clean, helpful and right at the entrance to Disneyland so you can jump right on the trolley. The hotel does have a charge of 19.99 plus tax for parking per day so be aware of that

Perfect location for an event at the Anaheim Convention Ctr. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Clean, comfortable and good customer service would bring me back again. Enjoyed the breakfast area also.

Summary Heading: Nice property, excellent staff, subpar food
Summary: The Assistant GM, Mark Morihiro, was wonderful, genuine, and very kind.  The location and rooms were good, but the facilities were wonderful for a family with kids.    The downside is the food quality.  I expected a higher quality of food for the price and reputation of this hotel.  The breakfast was very similar to a Hampton Inn.  What made the dining experience worse was the rush of families that made a real mess of the place.  Food messes everywhere.  I had 3 kids with me as well, so children present is not the issue with me.  The lower quality food, mixed with the wild nature of too many people scrambling for food made for a poor experience.  We ended up grabbing a yogurt or bagel and fruit and calling it good.  They were continually out of some of the hot dishes and the

Summary Heading: Great value for families; convenient to convention centre
Summary: Stayed at this hotel while attending a conference at the Marriott. Very helpful front desk staff, very attentive and eager to deal with any issues quickly.  The included breakfast Monday through Thursday is a great value and seemed to be very popular with families in town for Disney. The evening happy hour is a lovely way to wind down and the food was good each evening with red and white wine and two beer on tap. Pool, hot tub, basketball and bbqs available and comfortable seating around the fire table to stay warm on cool evenings. Room was clean and had a well equipped kitchen with coffee and tea available as well as in the lobby. Next door to the Disney parking lot for pick up to the parks. Good choice for those looking for convenience and value in Anaheim.

We have stayed here now for four times. We stayed in September 2018 and in December 2018. We love the friendliness of the employees and the comfort of the rooms. The rooms have always been clean and comfortable. The restaurant is open for breakfast and we have had breakfast as part of our package. The employee's are top notch and are the best...They remembered us from our September trip to when we went back in December.  Perfect hotel for a Disney trip.

Great location for Disneyland. Quick walk to the free park shuttle.  We arrived early and they let us park without checking in and told us about the shuttle. Came back that afternoon and was really surprised to see just how much food and drink was offered at the social hour! We didn't eat, just grabbed a drink.  Room was spotless! The staff was helpful and friendly each time I had questions. (Extra towels were sent up in less then 10 minutes!) Would definitely stay again, and recommend!

We stayed here for 4 nights last July and it was fabulous. We enjoyed the proximity to the Disney, we walked a block and got on the free shuttles to Disney and never had to wait more than a few minutes. The breakfasts daily were awesome!! The suites are nice with the separate living quarters and the bunk beds with the trundle, it fit our family of 5 perfectly. The staff was accommodating and nice, and it is a busy place. We will stay here again.

I'm so glad we stayed here. We were originally booked at another hotel and saw this place and decided to switch...glad I did.   First of all, we drove here from Washington. We made good time and were ahead of schedule. We arrived on a Saturday instead of Sunday and they were able to accommodate us for the extra night and gave us the same rate as the rest of our stay.  The hotel staff is great. Everyone, including the housekeepers and grounds keepers made us feel welcomed.  It is very clean and well maintained. The room was stocked well and had plenty of room.  The breakfast was outstanding and the staff that handled the breakfast was even more outstanding.  The evening meal was a nice thing. Good food and again, awesome staff.  It's close enough that we walked to and from Disney

I was loooking for a place to stay while atteending a convention. Thsi hotle is a great location. I was able to walk to convention center each day and not move my car. Easy parking at hotel, walking distance to restaurants.  Clean and super friendly staff.  I will stay there again and recommened it.

We stayed here for 5 nights for a Disneyland trip and feel we couldn't have chosen a better place for our stay.  First, the service was exceptional.  Everyone, especially Maribel and Victoria, went far above and beyond my expectations to help us fulfill our every need and whim.  Despite being a very busy hotel, they were friendly, professional, and efficient as they somehow managed to accommodate us from our early arrival to our late departure and everything between them.  (We even needed help trying to figure out the best way to get to an In-N-Out Burger.)  Second, our suite was perfect.  The kitchen was actually stocked with everything we needed; the separate living area was comfortable and let us have some space; and the beds and pillows were incredibly comfortable after long

Summary Heading: Amazing service by all staff and the hotel manager
Summary: Hotel service was amazing all the staff including housekeeping. One night we came back to our room and found that they had made an Elephant Towel and put it on the bed the kids love it housekeeping made there night with the kind gift. The night social is also really good we where very impressed with our stay.

This was the best hotel stay we had at Disneyland. The complementary breakfast was fantastic. We would definitely stay again. The evening social was really nice too. The Manager personally greated us every day.

This is a reasonably priced hotel near Disneyland. We were able to walk right Nextdoor and take the shuttle bus into Disneyland. The only complaint was the mattresses were not that comfortable. For families that have more than 4 people this place works great.

This property has a great staff and they went way out of the norm to make our stay awesome. We had a problem with our door not opening and the staff worked tirelessly to resolve the problem and get us onto our vacation.We will definitely stay their again!

15-20 minute walk to Disney Park entrance. Like all Homewoods we have stayed at, clean and comfortable rooms, nice breakfast buffet, excellent excersize room and pool. Enjoyed very much and recommend highly!

Upon arriving we were quickly given a room even though we were quite early before check in times begin.  The room was spacious, comfortable, and clean.  We stayed for 6 nights on a family vacation.  We had breakfast every morning and it was delicious every time.  Don't let the crowds deter you from breakfast.  It's worth the rowdiness in the morning.  We also ate Monday-Thursday during the evening social.  The food was like a meal so that saved us a lot of money having breakfast and dinner free from the hotel.  We also took extra bagels and cream cheese for two days worth of lunches.  Elsa was particularly a great help during meal times.   The hotel is very close to the Toy Story parking lot that Disney runs busses for free.  We rode the bus to Disneyland for the three days we

Excellent hospitality!  Maria A was the housekeeper for our room and she made things magically for my kids.  The whole hotel staff was amazing.  Ranging from breakfast to all the other options available!

I took my family to Disneyland for a little vacation and we decided to get a room for a few days and all I‚Äôve got to say is that this Hotel is amazing. The room was great size and clean and the staff was very friendly and the on duty manager Stephanie was very helpful. She‚Äôs great w kids. She even helped me to my room w the little ones. I will definitely go back when we go to Disneyland again üëçüèºüëçüèº

Summary Heading: Great for family to visit Disneyland
Summary: This review is loooong overdue.  We stayed in August 2018 for a few days and had a great stay.  It was ideal for Disneyland.  Having breakfast ready was great and the walk to the shuttle was so quick.  Having dinner prepared was also really convenient.  The food was not great but got the job done.  However the cookies don't come out until the very end so a kind employee named Elsa Lopez (Margarita) took pity on our kids and made sure they got them.  She really made their night and I appreciate her going above and beyond.

This hotel is a wonderful treasure. The staff is wonderful, the hotel is spotless and the amount of choices for their hot breakfasts and manager's reception is amazing. This is our go to spot when going to Disneyland. We highly recommend!

This is our second stay at Homewood Suites since last December. Complimentary bottles of water. A copious  Breakfast with wonderful people such as Leti, Dulce Escobar or Annie Ochoa, to mention a few, are attentive and caring and ready to help.  Monday to Thursdays afternoons of relaxation with enough food to sustain a Chardoney or a bear. Secure parking and comfortable welcoming sheets at night.  Grateful! Excellent money to value.  We will come again, I‚Äôm sure.

Summary Heading: Perfect hotel for family visit to Disneyland
Summary: We rented two rooms for our family visit to Disneyland. With a phone call before arrival, I was able to secure two rooms next to each other in a very quiet location.  The rooms were spacious and served us very well.  The hotel offers a delicious full breakfast every morning.  In addition, they have a social hour Monday - Thursday evenings, which served as our dinner those nights.  It was so nice to be able to eat these two meals in our hotel during very full days at Disneyland.  My grandsons thoroughly enjoyed the pool and their parents loved the hot tub.  The staff was very helpful.  Rooms were clean and well stocked with all we needed for a perfect stay.

Very much enjoyed our stay.  Was surprised by the quality of the food and social hour.  Exceeded our expectations!  Staff was very accommodating and pleasant.  Rooms were clean and more than comfortable.  Complimentary grocery delivery extra bonus

If your going to book a hotel, book here.  We were extremely surprised by these suites.  Everything is automated at check in and they make you feel at home.  The Kitchen was a great addition and nice to be able to cook (instead of dine out every night) when away for a few days.  Highly recommend!

Summary Heading: A great experience for a good price
Summary: On my past visit to Disneyland, I stayed at the Disneyland hotel. I have to say that this hotel (Homewood Suites Anaheim convention center) was better in every way when speaking in terms of warmth and efficiency of staff, quality of food on the premises, quickness of response to requests, and quiet. The price difference is remarkable and makes this property an exceptional value. Perhaps you don't get the elaborate pool playscape as you do at the Disney hotel, but you get a good clean pool.  While the rooms at this Homewood Suites are a bit dated, they are clean and well kept. In regards to service and cheerfulness of staff, my overall experience at this hotel was much better than at the Disney property. The complimentary beer and wine were of good quality, as were the

Summary Heading: Large Rooms with kitchen and living room
Summary: I love the large room, kitchen, and living room area that is offered here. This makes it feel more open and livable for the duration of our stay. I would definitely stay here again when going to Disneyland. Disneyland shuttles are right around the corner so easy access to the parks.

Stayed here for 3 nights with young family. Staff are friendly and the hotel serves a great breakfast as well.We ate one night in the free dinner too. So convenient being next door to the free shuttle. Good sized room suite kitchenette. I wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to stay here again or strongly recommend to others

Our family had a wonderful stay here.  The hotel is clean and comfortable, and the staff was tremendous.  Elsa Lopez Margarita took great care of us in the dining room.  The included breakfasts and dinner apps were a nice bonus.  The power went out in the neighborhood for a night we were there.  This night was comped without being requested.  Though this was an inconvenience at the time, the kids have fond memories using the flashlights and glow sticks handed out by the staff.

Stayed here for Disney and the fact you are next to the 'Toy Story' shuttle lot is a real bonus. The room for our fam. was perfect with a bunk bed, king and seperate space with sofa, tv and kitchen area. All very clean and shiny. Breakfast buffet was wonderful and the facilities include a hot tub and pool. Surrounded by places to eat and we used door dash to order food, too. Difficult to beat IMO if you're looking for a family orientated option for Disney.

Summary Heading: Room was clean. But some pungent smell in the room
Summary: Our stay at the hotel Suite was good. Close to Disney and other attractions. Room was clean. Bathroom was not spacious. Only issue that we had while staying at this hotel is, there was some pungent smell in the room. Overall, We enjoyed our stay.

I don't normally give out such high marks but this location was perfect for our trip to Disneyland.  The location was great.  Being a short walk to the Toy Story lot saved us a ton of extra walking.  We were able to walk right up and board a bus each day for the short drive to Disney.   The hotel offered a huge breakfast every morning with plenty of choices.  The staff did a tremendous job of keeping things filled.  Also the complimentary evening social was an added bonus.  Again there was a nice variety and it was always well stocked.  The staff even handed out balloons and prizes to the kids. The suite with a kitchen was an added bonus.  We were able to shop at a local grocery store nearby and make a quick meal which saved some money.  They had all the pans and utensils

Summary Heading: We will definitely return and we have already told our friends and family about this gem.
Summary: Breakfast was fresh and perfect for families, helped pare down our food on trip cost.  Mon- Thurs they offer an amazing "light dinner" -- which was pasta, great salad, soup, breadstick and fruit.  More than we needed after a full day of travel.

We've stayed here multiple times, we love it here. In the summer we can BBQ by the pool, Disney enjoy a nice clean hotel. Our last visit was the greatest by far. A few family members stayed here with us as we celebrated our child's birthday in Disneyland. Because I also have family in the area, we got an ok from the hotel and had them join us in the dinning area for a cake party. Doesnt seem like much but it was, they went above and beyond as they reserved the space for us, made a sign, decorated with Toy Story characters,  blew up balloons I had purchased and was going to go get blown up elsewhere, the convenience üôå. Not only that, they set up their big screen & DVD in the dining area with my kids favorite, Toy Story. It was perfect as we ate. Not to forget, the golf putting

This property is super clean with friendly and professional guest services. Rooms are clean and spacious with all amenities that one needs. Breakfast is immaculate and constantly refreshed. Housekeeping is super excellent as the rooms are cleaned spotlessly each day. Evening reception is plentiful and fresh. I definitely go back to this Oasis when I go back to Anaheim. Thanks Homewood Staff!

We would stay here again anytime! It was clean, had in room kitchens, a good breakfast and dinner reception, loved that it was by the toy story parking lot, good service, free grocery service, daily water bottles, nice pool area... we couldnt have asked for better! It had everything we were looking for! This is where we'll stay if we come back to Disneyland again!

Summary Heading: Highly Recommend if going to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for fourteen nights in January! From the moment we arrived we were glad we had booked this accommodation. Travelling from Australia overnight we arrived in LA at 7.15am then caught the Disneyland bus to our hotel in Anaheim arriving at approximately 9.30am. We were happily given an early bookin to our suite. There are lots of eating options close by with the Cheesecake Factory just about two blocks away. The Toy Story Car Park which has free shuttle buses to Disneyland is a five minute walk! So easy especially when it is time to come home with tired kids. The breakfasts have enough variety for everyone and changes daily. Like us, if you all can‚Äôt make it down for breakfast you can bring it up on a tray to your room. The evening meals are from Monday to

This hotel was amazing!  From the great suites to the breakfast and evening social (which was awesome), to the accessibility to the toy story shuttle, the value of this place will make it hard to stay anywhere else!  All the staff was hardworking, very nice and always willing to help.  Elsa at the evening social was awesome, making sure I knew that the cookies were out for the kids, to clearing our plates as soon as we were done (which was beyond was she needed to do!) we will hopefully be back soon!

This was our last minute trip and after spending $1000 just for Disneyland tickets We were searching for reasonably priced close by hotels and this place didn‚Äôt disappoint us a bit . Top notch service from check in to check out! Britney checked us in and she was amazing and anticipated our needs and gave us nice suite with bunk beds for our little ones, gave us the info we needed without a frown. Upon check out Christian was on top of his game making guest happy, satisfied and leaving with great taste while wanting to come back here for their next visit . The hotel offers a great full breakfast and we were able to use it once but we missed our complimentary dinner:( which we were looking forward too.Disneyland charges $8.99 for tiny slice of pizza and after getting ripped off

Another great Homewood Suites location, this one in Anaheim.  The studio rooms are quite spacious and it is always spotless.  It's also literally next to the Toy Story Parking lot for Disney, so if you are going to one of their properties you can just walk over and grab the bus and ride to the main gates for Disneyland and California Adventure.  Also if you get a room with a window along the North face you can see the fireworks show at Disneyland.

We loved staying at Homewood Suites in Anaheim. We received the best service ever from your staff and outstanding accommodations ever at your Hotel. The rooms were very clean and comfortable.  And, the daily full Breakfast was delicious (lots of variety everyday, healthy and everything was so good, just like home cooked).  We will definitely stay at your hotel whenever we come to Anaheim.  Your staff was outstanding, so caring throughout our stay and made us feel very special and comfortable.  Please thank (tremendously !) your excellent and personable Manager Mark and staff: Victoria, Gywn, Britney Kat, and Christian for the great time we had in Anaheim.  Please give Special Recognition to your wonderful Staff.

Best hotel ever!!  I was impressed by the courteous staff, cleanliness of hotel, complementary breakfast and happy hour, ease of check-in/check-out.  I had the best night's sleep in their comfortable bed.  I would highly recommend this hotel to others.  It was by far the best experience I've ever had at any hotel.

Absolutely amazing stay!  The staff is next level amazing. I would have thought them Disney trained cast members. Exceptional value!! Stayed in Feb with two small children ages 5 and 3.  So much for kids to do. Free rides to Disney via Disney parking shuttles. Fresh coffee all day long (parent fuel).

I'd stay here again.  Good value, spacious room, decent breakfast, good location relative to Disneyland.  Grab a cheap Uber or Lyft to and from Disneyland and your feet will thank you at the end of the day.

Staff went above and beyond normal service. They were professional and friendly. They treated you like they genuinely cared. By far favorite hotel stay! Hotel was nice and we loved the bunk beds. Breakfast and dinner was delicious!

Clean, quiet rooms, and a friendly and helpful staff made this a great stay.  The complimentary breakfast and the food provided at the evening social were unexpected benefits, but make this hotel a sure thing on our next visit to the area.  We had a great stay.

We recently stayed at homewood suites on 2010 s harbour boulevard in Anaheim. What a amazing stay we had! Staff was all top notch! Rooms and the hotel were spotless everyday and all of our needs were taken care of.  The free breakfast buffet and the mangers special from Monday to Thursday (free supper and drinks) Was also amazing. The kitchen staff led by Victor did a great job!! Rosa and Carmen were very helpful and friendly in the restaurant area as well!! Mark morihiro (assistant gm)was also very awesome to deal with! He had a very positive attitude everyday and made sure everything was perfect for us!!  Thank homewood suites and all of the staff, you made our holiday great!!

Staff were incredibly helpful and the customer service was to be commended. Thanks to everyone for making our stay so pleasant and memorable. I would recommend this Hilton to anyone who is looking for great facilities and close to Disneyland buses and restaurants

Really enjoyed our stay - we even stayed an extra night for a total of 5 nights.  The customer service is second to none.  Some of the highlights were the Happy Hour every night where we were taken care of Managers and wonderful staff like Carmen.  Our room was beautifully cleaned every day by Maria who even made us a swan for the bed.  The staff at the front desk were all amazing and helpful.  I am sure that they are trained never to use the word "No".  They accommodated us with all our requests.  Perfect location in walking to distance to Disney.  Breakfast is wonderful and the quality of the food is very good.  Lots of salads and fresh fruit.  Would love to come and stay again.

Best hotel ever!The entire staff was helpful and friendly.Our room was spacious and had a large kitchen,sitting room with tv,bedroom with tv and bathroom.The hotel was not loud and the pool was great.Breakfast was free and I could not believe the quality and variety.love love love this hotel!

We had a great experience at Homewood suites.  Loved the suite format with bunk beds.  Perfect for our kids.  Arcade, mini gold and bball were all greatly appreciated and utilized.  So great to have somewhere to send the kids.  Breakfast and happy hour were great.  Generous amount of food.  What really made the trip great was the amazing staff.  EVERYONE was lovely.  The reception, the kitchen staff.  We even forgot our sandwiches one day at breakfast and the cleaning team saved them for us!

So far our stay has been amazing. Everyone is so friendly. A special shoutout to ELSA who was serving dinner. She made us feel like we were at a restaurant.  She took care of us from beggining to end, and made our meal extra special.  Everything else about this hotel has met or exceeded our expectations. Thank you. We will be back. Notes: Breakfast is great, even for vegetarians. Quiet. Friendly staff. Housekeeping is wonderful. Fun activities for the family, including basketball,  put put and swimming.

Summary Heading: Rooms need a Dresser; Closet isn't adequate
Summary: The rooms are terrific except for the lack of a Dresser.  The closet wasn't adequate for 2 people and a weekend of clothes.  Kitchen was nice and well stocked with pots, pans, etc.  Many, many items provided for breakfast.  No social hour Friday - Sunday. :(

Summary Heading: Top notch hotel and amenities!  + Amazijg Staff and Service
Summary: I stayed at this hotel for a very busy convention.  The main reason I chose the vote was location and the reviews on the AMAZING breakfast.  We eat our breakfast and did not eat again until later in the evening.  I have stayed at many hotels that claim breakfast included or hot breakfast included,  this place is the TOP NOTCH breakfast & evening food included and I eat...  Besides the food the room was super clean and smelt great everyday!  You know when you get the room that smells musty,  these rooms smelt fresh and had great shampoo, conditioner and soap included.  Now to the staff.  All the way from the room cleaners to the morning and even late night staff at the counter are always smiling.  It goes a long way,  I‚Äôve paid boat loads for hotels and the staff is not happy and

Summary Heading: Amazing staff and top notch place to stay!
Summary: Stayed here for a week during an extremely busy time for a business convention.   Everything was top notch the staff was excellent and very friend. Went above and beyond!   Very good breakfast everyday. Hot, fresh and delicious.   Everything was very clean and well kept.   Will definitely be back here and highly recommended to anyone! Hands down one of the best places I have ever stayed.

Just got back from our first Disney visit with the kids (ages 6 and 8). I booked for free though Chase Sapphire Ultimate Rewards but wow this place was amazing for the price. I have stayed in 5-star, Michelin starred restaurants on site hotels and Motel 6‚Äôs. For a trip for a young family, this place can‚Äôt be beat. New, clean, literally next door to the shuttle, WiFi, great pool/hot tub, laundry for when you get soaked on Splash Mountain, quiet, valet parking... what really pushed it to five stars for me is the food. Our suite came with candies, snacks, sodas etc every day which the kids were delighted with (and those little bags of pretzels and granola bars saved me about $80 in park food!) the breakfast was more than enough with good coffee. The complimentary ‚Äúlight bites‚Äù was

Summary Heading: This is my favorite hotel in Anaheim
Summary: I don't write reviews, but this hotel is amazing. We've stayed at a few other hotels around Disneyland (including other much more expensive hotels), and this hotel is, by far, our favorite.  The hotel is clean and nice.  The complimentary happy hour and breakfast are great.  The pool area is great for kids and families, and the rooms are perfect for families with kids.

Chose this hotel mainly because of the distance from Disneyland! I did a lot of research on the amenities of different hotels around the area and this hotel stood out *i am a hilton honors member* The convenience of having a kitchen complete with a small stove, fridge, microwave was fantastic traveling with my family that includes a one year old. The suite size was a little small, but good enough, for my family of 5 + baby. They had a pack and play (or crib) available which was perfect. The room we stayed in had 2 full/queen sized beds + sofa bed. 2 tvs. The hotel itself was clean. The room was clean. No complaints! The location of this hotel was perfect. A few minutes (literally down the road) from Disneyland. Target, CVS down the road. Lots of restaurants around the area too!

Summary Heading: Unbelievable place for our large, young family.
Summary: Anytime we come to Disneyland, we won‚Äôt stay anywhere else. This place has large rooms for our family, breakfast, dinner, is directly next door to the free Disney shuttle, and the staff‚Äôs customer service is off the charts helpful and genuinely friendly.I can not say enough good things about this place, it is worth every penny!

This is by far the best hotel I‚Äôve ever stayed at in Anaheim while visiting Disneyland, and as an annual passport with my girlfriend we visit Disneyland quite often and we always have exceptional service here at home wood with a special thanks to Ben. Ben helps with reserving our rooms in advance so we have a easy time checking in when we arrive with no problems. We‚Äôve even been able to check in early on occasions. I recommend home wood suites here on S Habor to all my friends and family. Thank you Ben for always being a great help!!

Nice, clean hotel with very nice staff! very accommodating to our needs and went out of their way to be so sweet to my special needs child even had a cupcake and balloons delivered to our room for him. Definitely staying here again!

Summary Heading: Ruined the start of our holiday, had the worst customer experience+placed under maintenance room.......
Summary: Long story short(believe it or not this is the shortened version and as crazy as it sounds, is true.HA!), went to check in after our 14hr flight with our check-in voucher and no record of our reservation due to supposed stuff up with a third party(used a travel agent) which happens and we understand but the rudeness and lack of care by the supposed "manager on duty" was horrible & ruined the experience! I will NEVER voluntarily stay at a Hilton because of it and lost a whole day due to the stuff up. Left us waiting for over an hour while they investigated the matter with no communication, came back to say nothing could be done, offered no solution or help, had to ask myself to call our 24/7 global number for our travel agent to which the "manager" at the time said the number was
