Manager Response: Hello HayleyPuck,  I am completely taken back by your review, and I cannot apologize enough for the lack of service you received from our team, specifically the front desk, who are typically prime examples of guest service. This does not sit well with me at all, and please know that I will be following up accordingly to ensure that incidents such as yours do not happen again. When time permits, I would like to speak with you further about this incident, and to discuss what I can do for you to regain your patronage, as the last thing I would ever want is for a guest of our hotel  to be extremely dissatisfied. Please reach me directly via e-mail at Benjamin.Ly@hilton.com  I look forward to hearing from you,  Benjamin Ly  General Manager

Summary: We stayed in November for 14 nights. We had requested a fireworks room. Ended up on the ground floor outside the basketball court. Incredibly noisy and could hear the toilets flushing overhead. The homeless people at night around the hotel at all of the bus stops were also a little  offputting. I felt like because we booked through an agent we got a raw deal and definitely felt like we weren't given the same level of service as other people at the hotel. Food often ran out at breakfast and the buffet was often quite untidy and messy.
Manager Response: Hello Scotsgirl7911,  On behalf of the entire team, we apologize for creating the feeling towards your family that you were not given the same level of service as other guests. We would never discount our level of guest service based on how a guest made their reservation, or for any other reason. Please know that we do our very best in accommodating all guest requests, and unfortunately we were not able to accommodate your request of having a fireworks view room this time around. I would like to welcome you back to the hotel to provide us a 2nd chance at making it right, and I would like to personally assist in making your reservation when you plan on visiting the Anaheim area again, please reach out directly to me via e-mail at Benjamin.Ly@hilton.com.  I look forward to hearing from you,  Benjamin Ly  General Manager

Summary Heading: Great Experience with Excellent Customer Service! Great value!
Summary: What a wonderful stay at this property. Excellent customer service from everyone that I encountered. I stayed in a one bedroom suite with my 18 yr old son, my married daughter, my son-in-law and my 2 yr old granddaughter. We were here for four nights while we visited friends and family in the area and also spent two days at Disney.   The hotel is extremely clean and attention to detail is apparent. We used almost all areas of this hotel besides our suite including the laundry room, fitness center, arcade, basketball court, lobby bathrooms,  as well as the dining area for the included breakfast and evening meal. Nowhere did I encounter any area that needed attention. The associates cleaning the rooms were all friendly and had a smile, and everyone at the front desk was extremely

I realize there are a lot of hotel options near Disneyland, but this one is the best simply because of the staff. They always had a smile on their face, filled requests super fast, and seemed like they really enjoyed their job. I dealt with Christian the most and that man deserves a raise! He was the best. I loved the little touches this hotel does, like the towel animals in the room, water bottles in the lobby, and movies by the pool. The rooms were super large and clean. And the beds were comfortable. This was our second stay at this hotel, and we will definitely keep returning.

Summary Heading: Overcrowded and a major price increase...not worth it anymore...
Summary: This hotel has become all to popular. Okay you may seem it to be a good thing but lately many times we have gone, breakfast is overcrowded and lately often runs out of food. Same thing with their evening reception. Either you get there early and wait or not much is left. Also because of it being so overcrowded, seating is tough to get. The pool is also becoming a bit overcrowded so it you are looking to have a relaxing swim, forget it. There was someone having a BBQ there as they they allow you to use it but apparently several of the people were visiting the hotel residents and took up most of the pool and the area around it. Management seemed not to care. And lastly if you drive be prepared to not have a lot of parking. My husband is handicapped and we have trouble finding a
Manager Response: Hello sissygirl99,  Thank you for taking the time to provide such valuable feedback! Clearly, your recent stay with us did not exceed your expectations, and for that, I cannot apologize enough. I can completely empathize with you on every regard for the amount of guests we have in our hotel, and for the raise in prices over the years. Please know that we try to do our best to manage guest control, and part of the reason we have such large amount of guests in our hotel is due to our competitive pricing in the Anaheim market. Nonetheless, I see your frustration, and I please request that you contact me directly so I can make it right by you, our loyal guest. You can reach me at 714-750-2010 or via e-mail at Benjamin.Ly@hilton.com.  Again, please accept my sincere apologies, and I look forward to hearing from you.  Sincerely,  Benjamin Ly  General Manager

Summary: We have stayed in many hotels in the area and this one just has some special touches that make it worth going back for another stay.   Let me start off with saying it is a little farther from the main gate and a bit of a walk if you decide to walk BUT it is literally right next door to the Toy Story Disneyland parking lot.  You walk a half block and take the free shuttle to the parks.  They have numerous buses lined up so waiting is minimal on both ends, coming and going.  This is a huge plus for anyone that has stayed around this area.  The other things that set this hotel apart from the rest are: 1) the free full breakfast choices.  The chicken breakfast enchilada was delicious and we were hoping they had that every day of our stay.  The seating area for the breakfast was

Thankyou to all tge staff here but especially thankyou to Elsa Lopez Margarita. She is is so kind and attentive. The evening snacks consisted of her running around after everyone there. She is so lovely to the kids aswell.thbakyou for makimg our stay so lovely. Can't wait to be back next week! Our room was spacious. We had a ground floor suite with a garden, king bed and a bunk bed. Thankyou

This is a family-friendly property with easy access to Disneyland. The staff are super friendly and attentive. The complimentary breakfast buffet is robust and varied -- a great way to start the day. We were only able to take advantage of the evening snacks on one day, but they were enjoyed as well. The suite layout was great and I appreciated the large desk in the bedroom area. The kitchen is stocked with snacks and we hadn't realized that the snacks were complimentary as well, or they would have been a welcome addition to our day at Disneyland. The Toy Story parking area at Disneyland is a short walk from the hotel, and from there, you can catch a shuttle to the Park which is really convenient! Overall a great stay and highly recommend this hotel property.

Just stayed 11 nights at this hotel and staff and service was awesome. Complementary breakfast but also four nights a week nibbles and drinks for free!! Water bottles are also free which is great when heading out for the day. Rooms are well maintained but being a busy hotel the cleaners are in the hallway all day long LOL. Caught the free shuttle to Disneyland from the car park next door which was great. They arranged a great driver to collect us from LA and airport transfer. Pool, games room and basketball court great for the kids. BBQ area would be perfect during summer. Only reason four not five star was the breakfast options. Ended up just getting bagels each day and eating in the room as the breakfast area is very busy. Food was maybe a reflection on what the USA has to

We stayed here with our two children for our trip to Disneyland.  We walked to and from the park everyday but there is also a free shuttle across the street.  The complimentary breakfast was delicious and really a full hot buffet.  The suites were spacious and clean and the staff was exceptional.  We didn‚Äôt have a kettle to boil water for our baby and the general manager went out and purchased one free of charge that he had delivered to our room within an hour.  I cannot rave enough about this place.

Our daughter and her family and my husband and I enjoyed a 6 day stay at Homewood Suites.  The breakfast offered daily and dinner on weekdays makes a family stay very affordable.  The Walk to the Disneyland bus is a convenient 1 1/2 blocks.  We loved our stay!

This hotel offers 1 bedroom suite with 2 queens and a sofa bed ,small kitchen. Some rooms offer a fireworks view. This is great since my kids were to tired to stay at the park until night fall.  The staff was always friendly and pleasing to deal with. The breakfast was fairly good with a variety including waffles,eggs,fruit. There is also a evening ‚Äúdinner ‚Äú service that is a good money saver.   The hotel backs on to the toy story parking lot. It is about 1 block walk to the free shuttle that runs frequently.  The pool is heated and has a bbq area that was really good when you get tired of eating out.  They charge for parking approx 18 a day . We found that renting a car was great. Allowed us to go to universal on our own terms. We also visited Huntington Beach. We were able to
Manager Response: Greetings!  Thank you so much for your feedback from your recent stay with us.  We greatly appreciate all of your details and recommendations. I noticed you mentioned some concerns that you had while staying with us. I would love to make sure these are addressed properly, and apologize for any inconvenience that you may have endured. Please feel free to call me on my direct line (714)705-0531, whenever you have a chance. I would love to speak with you and see how we can improve for the future.  Best regards,  Mark Morihiro Asst. General Manager Homewood Suites Anaheim Resort

Summary: We booked a suite with 2 queen beds that had an electric stove, full size fridge, microwave and a living area with a pull out sofa. Other room, which had a door to shut between the two rooms, had 2 queen beds. Very room (505 square feet).  All the staff was excellent! Evening meal through the week was outstanding! Pasta, salad, bread sticks, beer , wine and lots of different juices for the kids to choose from!  Excellent pool/hot tub... had a movie wall. Fire pit!  Basketball ball court and mini put put... 20 minutes to walk to Disneyland!   This hotel will not disappoint!!  Ask for a room to watch the fireworks!!

Very nice staff!!!! Everything was great!!! I just wish there were toothbrushes since I forgot mine!!! Other than that everything was great!! The evening social was a nice touch!!!! Nice variety of food and drinks!!!!! Coffee and water always available!!!

Online description of room accommodations is inaccurate which makes a BIG difference if traveling/sleeping  with young children. We booked 2 ‚ÄúQueen beds‚Äù. In reality the beds are ‚Äúfull size‚Äù (we measured to be certain), yet still had to pay original price for less than what we signed up for. Front desk didn‚Äôt have much to say or do about it. Beds did not have ‚Äúblankets‚Äù instead they use a mattress cover as a blanket (weird & uncomfortable). Pull out couch bed is so cheap the ‚Äúleg end‚Äù is higher than ‚Äúhead end‚Äù...our children were extremely uncomfortable and couldn‚Äôt watch tv laying down. Shower head is VERY high making it near impossible to shower/wash hair for young kids. No ‚Äúadjustable shower wand‚Äù option. Bathing for small kids was rough. Long walk to Disneyland if you have
Manager Response: Hello cjm0505,   Please accept my sincere apologies for the description of our room accommodations, as well as the sizing of our mattresses, and the height of our shower head. I hate the fact that we did not exceed your expectations, and please know that I will be re-visiting the verbiage to ensure that there are no inaccuracies. However, for the size of the mattress, which I understand you measured them personally, but please know that as part of the Hilton brand, we are required to purchase and supply our hotel with these specific mattresses from that said vendor. Nonetheless, I will communicate your feedback and follow up accordingly.   If there is anything you would like to discuss further, or had any plans of returning to the Anaheim area, please do not hesitate in contacting me directly at the hotel via telephone at 714-750-2010, or via e-mail at Benjamin.Ly@hilton.com, so I can better assist you.   Thank you,   Benjamin Ly  General Manager

Summary: Within a mile walk to Disney parks and VERY friendly staff, this location came recommended by friends. The stay would have been more highly rated IF a) the dishes were clean, b) the beds were comfortable, and c) the kitchenette had a conventional oven.
Manager Response: Hello Janelle M,  Thank you for providing this feedback, and please accept my sincere apologies for the cleanliness of the dishes in your suite, as well as the comfortability of the mattresses. Clearly, our high standards of cleanliness were not met, and with that, your expectations were not met too. I cannot apologize enough, and please know that we will communicate your feedback to the entire team to ensure that inconveniences such as yours do not go overlooked. Being that we were a recommendation to you, I would love to welcome you back to our hotel for another stay so we can make it right by you, our valued guest. Please do not hesitate in contacting me directly at the hotel via telephone 714-750-2010, or via email at Benjamin.Ly@hilton.com, so I can better assist you.  Sincerely,  Benjamin Ly  General Manager

Summary: Our family was visiting California for the first time and we chose this hotel for it's proximity to the places we were visiting. The rooms were very spacious and clean. The water pressure in the shower was amazing! The staff was attentive and friendly. I didn't visit the breakfast area on our stay, but the rest of my family did and they enjoyed it. We stayed on the side of the hotel that faces Disneyland and we were able to see the fireworks from our room. That was fun for our kids. We had a great stay and would definitely stay again.

We loved this hotel! The location to Disneyland was great. We were able to walk 2 minutes to catch a shuttle every 15 min. There were also tons of restaurants around to walk to. The staff was super friendly and welcoming and we loved the complimentary social hour and breakfast. We had a room with bunk beds that my kids loved! The room was spacious and we were comfortable with three kids. We also loved the pool, game room, basketball court and movie night. We highly reccommend this hotel.

We are Disneyland passholders and usually stay at a different hotel nearby. However we were looking for a larger hotel room for our growing family and decided to try Homewood Suites.   Omg this hotel is amazing!!! First of all, the parking is so easy! A lot of other hotels nearby have horrible parking lots.   Check in and check out is a breeze on the Hilton App. Pick your own room from the app - whaaaaat?! So cool.   Free dinner and alcohol drinks Mon-Thurs night. Whatttt?!?!?! We had so much fun socializing with other families! Dinner is different each night. We had soup, salad, vege, fruit bar. Tomorrow night is italian pasta and salads. Plus free wine and beer. Oh and fresh baked cookies!! Amazing. Kitchen employees Carmen, Victor, and Miguel made our evening so enjoyable -

Second time at the hotel and was again thoroughly impressed with the level of service provided by the staff, from front desk to breakfast and even the complimentary evening snacks.  Great location as it is beside the Toy Story parking lot which gets us into the parking shuttle to Disneyland for free,  Only complain I have is related to the parking spot for electric car (they have 4 EV chargers on site which is a deciding factor for me in choosing the property), was blocked by gas vehicles (and of one them being the hotel shuttle van).  Appreciate that the hotel offer EV charging but if you allow gas cars to park there, what's the point?  Definitely would stay here again and recommend to friends and family
Manager Response: Hello Hendry L,  Thank you for taking the time to provide such wonderful feedback, and for being a return guest for our hotel! I cannot thank you enough for your patronage. Also, I am glad that the EV chargers we have on-site are a great amenity for you, however, please know that we do our best managing our guest parking area. With that being said, we do not own or operate a hotel shuttle van.  Nonetheless, we do appreicate your feedback, and we will use it to improve moving forward.  Sincerely,  Benjamin Ly  General Manager

Summary: Homewood definitely upped their game lately with customer service.  Everyone was friendly and accommodating.  Free breakfast was great but free dinner Monday through Thursday with beer and wine was a nice surprise.  Elsa was especially friendly and accommodating and we really appreciated her.  Disneyland is a mile away with a parking lot and shuttle right next door.  The pool and jacuzzi looked nice but it was too cold to go in an outdoor pool.

We visit Anaheim most years from Scotland, to go to Disney then travel around CA. We usually always try to choose a Hilton brand as my husband‚Äôs a Hilton Honors member. As this one is rather new, we thought we‚Äôd give it a try. We flew in from the UK that day, landed 7pm-ish & drove straight to the hotel. The pull out couch wasn‚Äôt made up, even though they new there were 3 adults checking into our king suite. When I called down to ask for the sofa to be made up, she said it would be taken care of. I reminded the clerk at the front desk about an hour later, when we nipped out for some food. When we returned a further hour or so later, it still hadn‚Äôt been done. I called again, and a lady from housekeeping appeared shortly afterwards. I have to say she was pretty mad about it. She
Manager Response: Hello Keriza,  Thank you for providing such valuable feedback, and please accept my sincere apologies for our lack of guest service, especially from our staff member who assisted you and your family with making up the pull-out bed. I cannot express how unfortunate it is to read this, and please know that I am following up with the team so we can prevent issues such as yours. Clearly, we dropped the ball on guest service, which is exactly what we pride ourselves on each and every day we operate. I understand that you and your family travel from Scotland, but I ask that when you plan on returning to the Anaheim area, please reconsider booking with us again, and allow our team a chance at redeeming your loyalty and patronage. Please do not hesitate in contacting me directly via the hotel at 714-750-2010, or at Benjamin.Ly@hilton.com to assist you with your future accommodations, or to discuss this matter further.  Sincerely,  Benjamin Ly  General Manager

Summary: What a nice stay! We booked a suite with 2 queens in the bedroom, a small kitchenette, living room, and an additional room with a king bed attached to the suite. We had great views of the Disneyland fireworks from our rooms.   The breakfasts were decent and we always found something to eat. They do rotate through their hot items, so what you had one day may not be there the next. My daughter sampled the pho one evening and said that it was good.   Every one of the employees that we encountered were exceptionally nice. Always smiling and asking if we needed anything.   This was our second stay here and I‚Äôm certain that we will be back. We are fans.

Great room! This is my favorite place to stay when visiting Disneyland. The Toy Story parking lot will get you to the park quickly and free of charge. The morning complimentary breakfast is good, along with evening snacks and adult beverages. Pool, spa, and basketball court is nice also.

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel, Didn't Like the Parking Fee and Situation
Summary: It was my first time staying at this hotel although I travel to SoCal to visit Disneyland roughly six times per year. The location is great and is within walking distance to the park (I'd say 20 - 40 minutes depending on your speed), or a very short 3 minute Uber ride in bad weather.  We were given a ground floor suite that was upgraded since I'm a Hilton Diamond member. I was very pleased with how my status was recognized. In the large two room suite, we had a spacious sitting area with full sized sofa, a desk and t.v., and the kitchen was stocked with a basket of complimentary snacks (granola bars, cookies, chips) and canned soft drinks!  The room was quiet and comfortable, and looked and felt brand new. The condition of everything was top-notch, and even the carpet was clean.

great hotel.large rooms and very friendly staff. breakfast was one of the better ones that we have had at hotel. location was very good also. only thing we wish they would of had was a shuttle to park.

We stayed with two teenagers for 4 nights our room faced the fireworks at Disney each night which was great. There was a seperate living area with a kitchenette and pullout couch bed so lots of room for us all. Lots of variety for breakfast and the evening drinks and food on week nights was great after a big day at the theme parks. Staff were all super friendly and rooms were lovely and clean. Walked to Disney in about 20ish mins or bused from the car park next door. There was a big Target about a 20 min walk in the opposite direction from Disney for supplies. Would highly recommend.

Summary Heading: Met our expectations and then some!
Summary: We were at Disney for a five day stay. We stayed at another hotel for 2 nights and then moved over to Homewood! Wow! we were impressed by the friendly and welcoming service at the front desk from the beginning! The breakfast and social hour difinitley a bonus! During the social hour Elsa Lopez was amazing! She was friendly and checked in on us several times during our meal! We will be back again!!

Our room was great! Super clean and all new fixtures. The kitchenette was perfect for our week long stay. The hotel had a wonderful breakfast every morning. Tons of options! They even served a free dinner on some nights!  The 5 minute walk to the Toy Story Parking Lot was amazing! We just hopped right on a Disney bus and was on Disney property within 10 minutes. This saved a ton of money on park parking.  The hotel staff were so nice and accommodating.  The location of the hotel is close to everything!  Overall, I definitely suggest this hotel! It was perfect!

everything was perfect, the only thing I could say was that the check in I could not do before 4:00 pm although on the reservation I mentioned that I would arrive between 10:00 am and 11:00 am. but definitely the room they assigned us and the service as well as the facilities were wonderful. Thank you very much for a beautiful stay in our family trip.

Summary Heading: Fantastic hotel for our Disney vacation
Summary: Our family of five stayed here from April 22 - May 2nd 2018 for our second Disney vacation. We have stayed at many hotels over the years and this one has the best housekeeping staff. We could not believe how clean our room was each day when we returned from Disney. A few of the days we went out later on in the afternoon and we were pleasantly surprised that the housekeeping staff had returned after we left to clean and replenish the towels. We loved the free breakfast and the light dinners. We had a fantastic room with a view of the fireworks which the kids just loved. The staff at this hotel were wonderful and very friendly. When we arrived at the pool to find that the pool towels were empty we called to the front desk and someone immediately brought a huge stack of them down.

Summary Heading: Fantastic Family Hotel for Disneyland Visit!
Summary: Great place to stay with a family! We stayed in the the King bunk suite. Has kitchenette with loungeroom and separate bedroom with king bed and bunks that are separated from the main bed. Very spacious and family friendly for a 10 day stay.  Our room also faced Disneyland so you could see the fireworks from our room :)  Free buffet breakfast very convenient with a short walk to free Toy Story shuttle leaving every 5 minutes!  Short walk to Walgreens, Denny's, ihop and pizza shop. Very well located.  Clean rooms with very friendly staff!

Always enjoy our stay at this property. Great complimentary meals and service. The rooms can be a little noisy early evenings since there are a lot of small kids jumping on the floors which can be heard below in the rooms and along the hallways. Overall a perfect location. Will be staying there again for sure since it‚Äôs the perfect location for Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Clean, Modern, and Easy Access to Convention Center
Summary: Stayed here while attending a convention. Easy walk to the convention center, dining (casual and upscale), and entertainment.  This hotel appears new and is very modern. I stayed in a king bed room (not a suite) that was fully equipped (including mini-fridge) with more than ample space. The room was very clean. I appreciated the walk-in shower and safe located in the closet.   Breakfast and evening reception were well-stocked. Although there were many places to sit, I could see how this area could be overloaded with many visitors and families coming to Disneyland. All common areas of the hotel appear to be well-maintained and were very clean.  Opportunities for improvement: 1) Rushed check-in w/ no mention of Diamond status.  2) The daily convention rate seemed high compared to

We love staying at this hotel with our family of 5.  The 2 room suites are key to staying here so we can have an area separate from the kids.  And, the full size fridge in the mini kitchen is so awesome.  The daily breakfasts have something for everyone and the social hour is such a great perk for the kids And the adults!  Elsa Lopez in the dining room area is so attentive during the evening social and always has a smile on her face.  The holidays here were like being with family and the front desk personnel were always so gracious and helpful to us and our kids who kept bugging them about the Elf on the Shelf!

Do not hesitate to book at this hotel. We stayed with a family of 4 small children. Plenty of room for all of us. Bunk beds were a hit with the kids. Staff was really great at helping us with anything we needed. Nice easy walk to the park with 4 little kids and a stroller. Free breakfast and quick dinner if you need it.

13 members of our family in age frrom 2 - 77 spent a week at the hotel while enjoying Disneyland. The staff from the front desk to kitchen were very accomidating and did everything in their power to make our stay as enjoyable as possible. I would strongly recommend this hotel. It is within walking distance of Disneyland. Although our room was designated Handicap, I was very thankful that we took a commode with us

Had a wonderful stay. Was very surprised to find the free breakfast and happy hour/ meal in the evening also!  Elsa Lopez was one of the lovely ladies taking care of us during the evening in the happy hour/meal time and she was so pleasant and bubbly even with all the chaos of the families and kids.  We enjoyed her spirit the first night that we looked for her each night we were able to be there.

The breakfast staff was exceptional. The meal selections were great. Breakfast. The front desk staff was friendly, helpful, efficient and supportive. They give us water to go when we left for Disneyland. I would visit with them again.

It is evident when you stay here that management has managed to create a culture that oozes positivity in the workplace. It is truly comforting to see, as it is a rarity these days where corporate greed supersedes any type of team first mentality! Every staff member we had the privilege to meet were so happy. Not the fake happy either. It truly made our stay memorable, especially whilst visiting the ‚Äúhappiest place on earth‚Äù! Breakfast and social is a great value. Albeit, not the best food in the world, as the scrambled eggs are of the powdered variety, it serves its purpose, which is to save you from paying the absurd park prices! We found ourselves coming back for the social hour most nights for the rest and complimentary beer. Again, food nothing to rave about, mind you, the

Summary Heading: Nice hotel for family visiting Disneyland
Summary: Family of 5, 3 being teenagers. Clean, good space. Great kitchen for eating in. The included breakfast was ok, however would have been much better if some healthier options eg less sugary cereals, some cooked vegetables other than potatoes.

Best thing about this hotel, most definitely the dinner and breakfast staff! Front desk is also very good, but dinner and breakfast staff go out of their way with friendliness.  We have stayed at this location numerous times, we have always been treated very kindly. This trip in particular, Elsa Lopez, during the evening reception, went above and beyond to make us feel welcome and comfortable.

F&B Crew - Elsa Lopez  Met a very cheery and enthusiastic crew at the hotel. Her name is Elsa Lopez.   She made us feel ‚Äòat home‚Äô and welcomed. Very good attitude indeed. An asset to the hotel.  Thank you for making our stay a memorable experience.

The hotel staff, from the front desk to those in the breakfast/supper area, were very attentive.  I would like to recognize Carmen and Victor for their exceptional service.  They cleared our table quickly each time we dined there and asked several times if we needed anything else.

We highly recommend this hotel. Staff was very helpful. They went out of their way to help our grandkids celebrate their birthdays. Mark and Carmen were extemely helpful. Also highly recommend wheelchair accessibility.

Summary Heading: Great new hotel located close to Disney
Summary: The staff was friendly and made me feel like a valued guest.  The morning breakfasts were wonderful as well as the weekday evening receptions. Next door to the Disney Toy Story bus stop or a 15 minute walk to the main gate.

Very clean and comfortable with staff that go way beyond expectations; probably the most professional and attentive staff my family and I have encountered in a hotel.  A perfect breakfast each morning and a wonderul evening light dinner during the week. Great location for Disney visits and bunk beds for three grand kidlets were a bonus providing fun and comfort. It all starts with the front desk; again, clearly the most welcoming and professional check in we have experienced even for our large party of 7.

This hotel was wonderful. It's value can't be beat for a family - we watched the fireworks each night from our room, the kids loved the bunk beds, the breakfast and evening social were delicious and full of many choices, all the staff were very friendly and attentive to our needs, the location to the free Disneyland shuttle couldn't be beat, the kids loved the pool and the full kitchen in our room allowed for us to prepare and store food.

The food and social hour were wonderful.  The staff was great and very welcoming.  The room was very clean and inviting.    We would definitely stay at Home wood Suites again.  It is a short walk to the pick up area to go to Disneyland.

Recent 10 days stay was wonderful at Homewood Suites. Location is perfect for Disneyland visitors. Room was well equiped, including a small kitchenette and staff were friendly. Social meals Mon-Thurs nights were highly appreciated. We also rented a car and drove to Mt Baldy (1 hr away) played in the snow and chair lift ($25pp) revealed stunning scenery.

Room/beds etc just refurbed, Clean, good breakfast with dinners included M-Th. Walk out front a few hundred feet to the right, right at the light and in a few minutes you are at the Disney Toy Story shuttle!

Good Value, Plenty of Space. Breakfast and evening snack with wine and beer included. You don't have to go out for breakfast or dinner. Can catch the Disney shuttle next door. Never stayed at a Homewoood before. Maybe better than Hampton Inn?

Just have to say that this hotel is awesome and would 10/10 recommend it again. The staff was very friendly, the room was cleaned up well and the location is perfect! The hotel breakfast and complimentary social evenings were great. We met some wonderful staff who accommodated our needs and always asked if we needed anything. Thank you to Carmen and Victor for all of your help, they were truly outstanding!! Will be back here again!!

Hotel accommodations were clean, convenient, friendly and perfect for a family!!  Staff went above and beyond especially Elsa Lopez with the dinner service who was so kind and very helpful every evening, and Feliz Dia who cleaned our room and kept it immaculate daily :) Would absolutely stay here again

The staff is wonderful and so attentive to the guests, especially Elsa. They have happy hour and light dinner every week night and we felt very welcomed. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Great stay. If I could give more than 5 stars, I would.

Summary Heading: My favorite part of Homewood Suites...
Summary: Carmen! Carmen was an absolute sweetheart and provided the best service we have ever received. We will totally be staying at Homewood Suites when we come back to the area just to visit Carmen!!! The hotel and staff here really are exceptional.

The service in the dining area of this hotel was terrific, especially thanks to Carmen! My colleagues and I greatly appreciated her highly attentive, personable, 5-star service. We would certainly recommend this hotel to friends and colleagues  especially thanks to Carmen making us feel so welcome and at home. Thank you so much for making our visit to Anaheim so enjoyable!!

Our group had such a wonderful evening and stay at the Homewood Suites near the Anaheim Convention Center. The rooms were clean and comfortable, but what truly stood out was the dining service by Carmen! She went above and beyond to make sure our needs were met and our bellies were full. Exceptional service overall!

Location: Disneyland parking lot is right next to the hotel. You can walk to it and take the shuttle bus. Saved 20 bucks on parking! There‚Äôs Walgreens & CVS right down the street and restaurants nearby as well. Overall, I thought the location was very convenient and I felt very safe staying at this hotel.  Room: Very clean! The hotel itself is relatively new. Everything from the bed/sofa to the bathroom/kitchenette was top notch.  Food (breakfast/dinner): First of all, I never had any trouble getting a table. I know at some hotels, it gets crowded, especially during the morning ‚Äì but not this one. The staff‚Ä¶wow! Good job! They were polite and really good at servicing the guests.  Amenities: They have a great gym. Pool is fantastic as well. I was really surprised at the

Hotel was convenient and clean.  Room was clean and very comfortable. Staff was very friendly and professional.  Pool and hot tub were clean and in great shape.  Food was very good and well prepared.  It was truly a GREAT experience.

Great hotel for a family stay.  Friendly staff, clean room and close to Disneyland. Bunk beds for kids, kitchen was clean, we only used the full sized refrigerator. Parking was easy and close to the access doors.

I have recommended this hotel all over social media for its ease of use of the Toy Story shuttle, great breakfast and overall quality of accommodations. This time we had a few issues. Upon check in I was asked if we would be parking a car. I said No, no, no... as a matter of fact we just tried Lyft for the first time .., blah blah blah. I was very clear and the young lady and I chatted about the whole rude sharing trend. Upon check out, I was told a receipt would be e-mailed. I asked what the total was, and given a reply that I knew was too high. He went over the room charge and then added ‚Äúand the parking fee of course‚Äù. I said we didn‚Äôt have a car, and he seemed completely unconvinced. It was really upsetting. An honest mistake?? After we made such a huge point of it upon

This was our first experience at the Homewood Suites Anaheim and we were blown away by the convenience of the location to Disneyland (there's a free shuttle service in the next parking lot that takes you right to the main gate and back), the evening reception was a super needed and appreciate, the complimentary breakfast and ambience was great, the rooms great, the pool great, and the staff was excellent in every way. My family just loved it and continue to talk about our stay in connection with Disneyland.

Super clean! I rarely say that about any hotel.  Parking is really easy.  We stayed in a suite with bunk beds that was bigger than my first apartment. This was a date night/Staycation.  We went to down town Disney.  Less than two miles away.  Awesome location.  The free breakfast was delicious, again very clean eating area.  Nobody bothered us at all while we rested. The room was very quiet, two independently climate controlled rooms.The kitchen in the room was better than mine LOL.  Staff was very professional.  A gentleman who I believe was the manager was engaging and pleasant.  If that doesn't convince you to stay here what will?

Summary Heading: Would never stay at any other hotel. They treat you like family.
Summary: You are welcomed with a smile and an at your service attitude. They will try their best to meet any demands. The staff is there for you 100%. Special shout out to Christian and the front desk staff, you guys are the best. Thank you Elsa & Carmen in the dining room for taking good care of my family, you ladies went out of your way and always with a smile, we will never forget you.

This was my family's first vacation to Disneyland. Home wood suites was our home away from home for 8days. The hotel staff was super friendly and helpful to me and my family. They always smiled and said hello to my kids. The suite very spacious and clean all the time. I will recommend this hotel to all of my friends and family. This was recommended to me by my friend and this experience made a lasting memory for me and my family. My kids will always remember Homewood suites.

We had the pleasure of staying here in November, first impression was the overall quality of the building from the moment you arrive, all the way through to the room. We stayed on the 5th floor. Everything was immaculate. Great room facilities and plenty of space, we could not criticise anything. The front of house staff were equally superb and very helpful. Britney helped us with a few local questions and it was such a pleasure to be handled by someone who smiled so much and made us feel very welcome. Theyve won our loyalty, it is the only place we want to stay in the future.

I enjoyed my stay and encounter with all staff. From my reservation ( Antonio) and management (Ben) to my room service (Laura) and the social evening (Carmen). They have the perfect team! I wil continue to book my stay with here. I have referred so many family members and friends. They all enjoy the great welcoming they receive from the minute they arrive.

First time visiting the suites and man did I have a great time! Friendly staff amazing food, perfect place to hold our company meeting. Dinner was amazing! Even got to watch a movie by the fireplace in the evening! Special thank you to Carmen the service was amazing, we can't wait for next year! -Art M

This was our second visit to this hotel.  Still retained most of the positives. There was a room ready for us before official check-in, and we got free bottled water. Room was very clean and still well maintained. Our room was located on the top floor and in the corner, so was quiet throughout our stay. Room had plenty of towels.   So why only 4 stars instead of 5?  Well I have to grade the hotel by the standards of my last visit, and it did come up slightly short in some areas. First, at check-in. We were greeted by... nobody. There was nobody at the front desk when we arrived. There was a family ahead of us, so I did get the sense that the front desk agent was in the back possibly looking for something for them, but still I don't think it was very professional for a hotel to

Was well taken care of by Melissa Ferree in our accommodations. Used it for a company retreat which worked out great because of how large the rooms were! Loved the breakfast and dinner which was included. All in all, a great experience but the real cherry on top was Carmen serving us at dinner. What love and hospitality!

We just stayed at Homewood and would definitely recommend it to any other couple or family travellers. The room was clean, the included breakfast was good and the staff were extremely helpful. The hotel is located about 20 minute walk from Disneyland otherwise there‚Äôs a shuttle pick up point about 5 minutes away. Special shout-out to Victoria and Alejandre? for fantastic service. Thanks again for a wonderful stay.

Always stay at Homewood Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resorts Conversation Center when i‚Äôm Going to Disney. It‚Äôs extremely convenient, they are very accommodating to all my needs.  Thank you for another great vacation!

Summary Heading: Enjoyable, Disneyland-convenient hotel with comfortable rooms and desirable amenities
Summary: Our 5-day, Disneyland-oriented stay was in a standard, 2-queen bed suite. The room was spacious, well appointed, comfortable and quiet. We found everything to be especially desirable, including the complimentary breakfast and evening social food/beverage - seating was comfortable and well arranged. Heated pool had ample seating. All the staff was friendly and helpful. All-in-all, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

My family of 5 lives in the "family suite" for a week. It was very comfortable and clean. The kitchen is perfect size and bunk beds with pull out trundle worked perfect for the 3 kids. The king size bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on at a motel/hotel. There was plenty of room for all of us and the couch in the living room pulls into a bed also. Complimentary breakfast was great. Easy to fill up before heading to Disney for the day. Seating was usually full or near full so that may be hit or miss depending on what time you eat. Also complimentary snacks and drinks in the evening. Appeared to be more like a dinner to me though. Everything was great. This place has a nice swimming pool, large jacuzzi and even a little kids pool. There is an arcade game room next

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel, courteous staff and beautiful rooms!
Summary: From check-in to check-out, the experience was incredible.  We arrived two hours early for check-in and my sister and I were totally prepared to wait for our room since check-in wasn't until 4 pm. To our (pleasant) surprise, we were able to go right up to our room and relax for the rest of the day.  One of the main reasons why we picked this hotel was because they offered free breakfast (hey, who doesn't like free food?!). Breakfast was served promptly at 6:30 am and there was a plethora of food to choose from and it was very delicious.  Another reason why we choose this hotel was the proximity to the Disney parks. Now it's not as short of a walking distance compared to other hotels (Best Western, Hojo Anaheim), but what stands out is that this hotel is literally right next to

Family vacation for four days with two daughters 6 and 4 years. Girls loved bunk beds. Complimentary breakfast and dinner fantastic. Breakfast served early enough to eat at 6:30, leave for short walk to park by 7, beat long lines and be into either side of Disneyland before 8. Then back to hotel for free dinner with excellent service by staff. Finish the evening at the basketball and putting green before bed.

Summary Heading: Spacious rooms, convenient location, and excellent breakfast
Summary: This hotel was really convenient for my family's visit to the Disneyland Resort. On the first day, we walked to Disney. It was about 15 - 20 minutes walk. We used the Disney shuttle to the Disney parking lot after that as the parking lot is adjacent to the hotel.Our room was spacious.We were very inpressed by the breakfast buffet. Lots of selections are in good quality. The only shortcoming was that the buffet was extremely busy between 7 and 7:30 in the morning with all the "Disney families".

We are loving our stay at the Homewood Suites.  Our favorite part is the free breakfast AND dinner! The hotel food is actually good! (Not just airy waffles at breakfast) There were rosemary potatoes, sausage & eggs this morning in addition to all the normal continental breakfast elements. And dinner had tons of options too! (Chicken, two salad choices, 2 soups options, breadsticks, juice/milk/or water, and cookies for dessert). The hotel staff is really on it when it comes to knowing what guests need/want‚Äîespecially the kitchen staff. Julie, Aron, Victor, Carmen, & Elsa really went out of their way for us at mealtime. All of them greeted us with warm smiles every time we passed them, offered to pick up plates right away, and were just all around kind and friendly asking how we

Summary Heading: Amazing hotel for a Disney vacation!  Seriously, stay here.
Summary: This hotel was a highlight of our trip.  Asst manager Mark was gracious and friendly.  Servers Carmen and Elsa were the best!  The shuttle next door was super convenient.  As were the complimentary snacks and free drinks Mon-Thursday.  Breakfast was excellent in quality and service.  We really appreciated how attentive everyone was and this will be our go to hotel when visiting Disneyland/DCA!

Everything was amazing from the staff to the food offerings! We loved everything about the property - we will certainly be back for our next family trip! Thank you to the entire team for such a wonderful vacation celebrating our daughters 3rd birthday!

This hotel is a great home base for a Disneyland/California Adventure vacation. Transportation from the Toy Story parking lot was so convenient! The fireworks were visible overnight from our 4th floor room!

Summary Heading: Great location and services. Terrible beds.
Summary: Suite size and amenities were good. Above average breakfast selections, bottles of water and snacks to take to Disneyland, close to ART and parking lot shuttles. The beds, however, were profoundly uncomfortable. My family had two king suites and after a few nights we were all experiencing serious back pain. If you can sleep on anything and wake feeling refreshed, go for it. Otherwise the hotel was great. But if you ever wake feeling a little creaky I can't recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Hello Excursion25263179080,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us, and for taking the time to provide such valuable feedback. To be completely honest with you, given we opened November 2015, I feel our mattresses are in great condition, however I can understand that everyone has their preferences, and I am not discounting yours at all. I cannot apologize enough for the poor comfort of the mattresses in your suite, and please know that I will discuss with the team on how to improve, or replace them all together for that suite. We take all reviews of our hotel very seriously, and I would love to discuss with you about providing us another opportunity to assist in a much better stay in the future. Please reach out to me via telephone at 714-750-2010, or via e-mail at Benjamin.Ly@hilton.com. I look forward to hearing from you, and thank you again for your time in all of this.  Sincerely,  Benjamin Ly General Manager

Summary: This is our hotel to stay in when we travel to Disneyland. We stayed here last year and the stay was just as wonderful this year. The suites are large and comfortable. The entire facility was clean. They have a free buffet breakfast every day with a wide selection that give everyone choices. Even my three grandchildren found something they liked every day. They also have a dinner buffet M-T, but we were always at the theme park and missed dinner. The property is conveniently located to Disneyland. The next time we visit the Mouse in California, we will be staying here again.

Summary Heading: This was a really great choice!
Summary: We recently visited Disneyland with our two granddaughters, 5 and 2-years old.  This hotel was the perfect choice.  The price was reasonable and the girls loved the suite, the huge breakfast buffet and especially the (very clean) pool.  Getting to the park was very easy-- a short walk to the Disney shuttles.  Like some other reviewers, I  want to mention the Happy Hour that's offered Monday through Thursday nights.  Besides pretty decent wine and beer for the adults, there is a huge buffet that albeit described as a snack, is certainly more than enough food for most families not looking for a gourmet dinner. Definitely a way to save $$.  I want to give a shout out to the General Manager (I think), Mark, who went out of his way to make sure the girls had a great time.  Besides

We were delighted to learn about the complimentary evening social at the hotel on Mondays through Thursdays. The food was delicious and enough to satisfy our hungry group for dinner. Carmen was our hostess one night and she was wonderful. Took great care of us and made us feel like valued guests. With the breakfast and evening social, this hotel offers excellent value. Also located right next to the Disneyland shuttle. Awesome!We would stay here again.

I stayed at the Homewood Suites while in Anaheim for a class. The hotel is very clean. My room was exceptional...!!!  The staff were very friendly and very helpful. They have a complementary breakfast with a variety of food. They also have complementary food from 5 PM to 7 PM Monday thru Thursday. It's intent is for families to be able to socialize. The complementary breakfast and the dinner is an outstanding bargain for families while staying there to visit Disney.   I will definitely stay at the Homewood Suites when I visit Anaheim again.

I stay in hotels at least 3 days every week for work and many of them are Homewood Suites.  This was BY FAR the BEST service I have had at any of them thanks to Carmen in the dining room!  She was incredibly welcoming and friendly.  She truly made me feel at home my entire stay.

Very friendly Staff. Hotel room is clean and beds are pretty comfortable. If you book a suite it has a full size refrigerator,a 2 burner stove, a dishwasher, and a 1 cup coffee machine. They do have free coffee in the lobby. Free breakfast in the morning. Parking fee is 18.00 per day. Walking distance is short to the Convention Center 7-10 minutes. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel!!!  Super Clean and Awesome Rooms
Summary: We've stay twice now at Homewood (by Hilton).  Were not afraid to walk and the 1.0 mile trip into Disneyland can be achieved in 15 minutes.  The Rooms are great!  We love the suite with separate bedrooms.  Staff is great and the property is fantastic.

Excellent customer service from Elsa Lopez in the dining room during the full (FREE!) breakfast and two (FREE) dinners that we had during our stay. She went out of her way to make sure we had everything we needed

Have stayed in many places near the convention center - by far the best place to stay. We stayed for over a week and over a weekend both weekdays and weekends were very enjoyable, never had a problem of any kind.

You can't go wrong with this Homewood Suites location. It was the most Disney non-Disney stay I have ever had at a hotel. From check-in to check-out our stay was a wonderful experience. We arrived early from a long day of travel to a ready room and hot coffee. The evening meal was top-notch, and breakfast each morning had me returning for multiple plates. The room was neat and tidy with lots of space for our 18-month-old to roam. The walk to Disney is easy but you also have access to the Toy Story lot right next door.  I highly recommend this location for any stay - Disney, Conference, or just a visit to the area.  (Party: Two Adults, One Toddler. Stayed during BlizzCon for a family trip to Disneyland)

We came back, an are planning to be back in the future, because everyone we encountered there, are exceptional, at making our family feel welcome & comfortable. Traveling with two special needs daughter's, one using a wheelchair for mobility. Has inherent challenges, that more than a few hotels (including Homewoods) struggle to handle.  Not this one, the suite was roomier than other chains, and allowed the wheelchair access to all parts of the unit. Along with their super  people, that make our girls feel typical and welcome, is priceless! From valets out front, giving you the weather for the day. Along with Christian and other GSA's, who welcomed us , & interacted with us during our stay. Including Elsa, Carmen, and other food service people, who always seem to be there

This hotel was great.  Beautiful clean modern rooms.  One of the best hotel breakfasts, Dinner also since we were there during the week.  Nice pool deck.  You can walk to Disney but we just walked into the parking lot next door and took the shuttle.  Lot's of breakfast seating unlike other hotels. I would stay again and will seek out other Homewood Suites.

Summary Heading: Exceptional Disney base - staff go above and beyond
Summary: We booked this 8 months ahead and had a good choice of Anaheim hotels at the time for our Disney holiday. Chose this one mainly because it offered bunks for our kids as opposed to sharing a bed. So glad we found it - all of the staff are welcoming, happy and incredibly helpful. On our first night we used the fabulous barbecues and sat in the pool area and later, by the fire pit. Our kids loved the pool and basketball court. The included breakfast is of a high standard with good variety and different items on each of our 3 days. Weeknights 5-7pm they offer complimentary supper that is very filling alongside beer and wine - all the staff are delightful - a special shout out to Elsa and Carmen who really looked after us. On one of these evenings we were able to chat to the

We had stayed here a couple of years ago.  I had booked another hotel closer to the park but decided to change it to come back here and happy we did. We had a late arrival and greeted by a friendly staff and a quick check in.   Hotel room was in the front on the street side but had little issues with the noise.  If you are on a lower floor like we were just make sure you close your blinds! Nice to have a suite with 3 adults and able to warm up food in the microwave etc. The best part is that you can walk to the ToyStory parking lot and take the shuttle to the Disney. Free breakfast was good and plentiful and the pool was well maintained. You are also near dining and shopping within walking distance.  Great stay, can't wait to go back!

We really wanted to like this hotel, but unfortunately they do not honor your reservations.   They will glady take your credit card and confirm your "reservation", but when you show up and the family suite that you reserved are all booked well then too bad so sad and good luck with your life.  This type of corporate business tactic is a total scam and disgrace, and they have no respect for their customers.   Avoid this hotel if you believe in supporting honest businesses.
Manager Response: Hello!  Thank you for sharing your experience above. For improvement purposes, I would like to know more details about your reservation. Please feel free to contact me directly at your nearest convenience (714) 705-0531. We take a lot of pride in our service and it appears you have found a need for training. I am about to leave for the day today but will be back tomorrow for the entire day. In case you get my voicemail, please leave me a message and I will make sure it is returned as soon as I am in office.  We look forward to speaking with you soon.  Best regards,  Mark Morihiro Asst. General Manager Homewood Suites Anaheim Resort mark.morihiro@hilton.com

Summary: I really liked my family's stay in this hotel.  It was very close to Disney's parking which was the main purpose of this visit. The quality of the service was excellent.  I will definitely come back next time we visit Disneyland once again.

We really enjoyed staying at this hotel.  Staff was courteous and rooms were clean.  For a larger family the complimentary breakfast and evening reception (weekdays) was a huge benefit.  The family sized room with a bunk bed was perfect.  It is also a very reasonable walk to and from Disney.  Having the Disney parking lot next door is a great perk since you can ride the shuttle if you don't want to walk.

Summary Heading: Trip to Disneyland and Universal Studios
Summary: Great all around resort, staff was very helpful and polite. The Breakfast and Evening social was outstanding, mainly because the staff took great care of us, easy walk to catch a bus to the entrance to Disneyland. Would stay again.

Stayed here 2 nights for a combination work and vacation - and exceeded our expectations! Very friendly and helpful staff! Excellent evening social. Great pool area. Rooms and beds were excellent as always with Homewood suites. Easy walk to Disneyland - about 25 minutes.Perfect location!

We had a great time staying here at the Homewood Suites. The staff is very professional, the location is great, and the property feels very clean and safe. Best place to stay outside of the Disneyland resorts!

Been at Homewood before, I can say this is the best staff I have had the pleasure to meet! Hotel is amazing, amenities are perfect! ELsa Lopes has an amazing energy,and  great customer service provided

We had an amazing experience at this hotel. We arrived around 9am due to an early flight and the assistant manager working at the front desk (mark?) was extremely accommodating in finding us a room right away. As someone who has worked in customer service for many years I was impressed by his service. The rooms themselves are nice and quiet (there‚Äôs really no way around the inevitable hallway noise when staying within miles of Disneyland). Room service was quick and courteous when we needed extra pillows and blankets. Complimentary breakfast before 9:30am. When traveling to Disneyland this is a great place to stay.

Summary Heading: Best Customer Service/ Best Hotel near Disneyland
Summary: I would like to take a moment to share my experience with my stay at HomeWood Suites over a few visits to Disneyland this year. The first time that I stayed at the hotel was in June earlier this year for my daughter's birthday celebration and visit to Disneyland. The most important part of my experience that I remember (and keeps me wanting to come back) is a wonderful young woman named Kat at the front desk. She made our birthday celebration a very special one. She actually went out of her way to help us make our little 5 year old feel extra special by laying out some snacks and balloons in the room so and when my daughter walked in she was mesmerized creating a memorable stay. Kat treats my family so nice and welcomes us back with a warm smile each time. So to say the least

Summary Heading: Perfect Family Hotel Close to Disneyland
Summary: You can see why this place is number 1 - it's location, staff, breakfast and amenities make it a perfect choice in Anaheim.  This was our first stay in a Homewood property but won't be our last. We loved the free breakfast (so many choices) and the week night drinks (beer, wine and soft drink) with super (which we used as dinner each week night).   Rooms are large and clean. Lovely bath products and a large fridge to store drinks and food. A full kitchen which we didn't use but would be great to use for large families. We were on the 5th floor and had a lovely view of the fireworks!  The location is perfect for people with kids as you can get the free shuttle next door to Disneyland gates. The parking is easy and convenient (we were given a discount on the parking as our room

Summary Heading: A must for eating clean dishes was not at breakfast
Summary: Breakfast was great however all the dishes were dirty, I could actually see egg on the plates.  If you touched the dishes there was food residue particles on them.  Told kitchen staff member she did nothing and left the dishes for guest to use. This is how people get sick!
Manager Response: Hello Donna F,  I would like to apologize for the cleanliness issues you experienced with us, specifically with the dishes during our Suite Start Breakfast. Please know that we hold ourselves to a high standard of cleanliness, however we dropped the ball on this occasion. Clearly, we need to focus our attention in this area, because you are completely right, and although we have yet to have a guest let us know they have become ill, this is the last thing we would ever want. Again, thank you for taking the time to provide this feedback, and I would love to welcome you back to our hotel for a much better experience, so please reach out to me via telephone at 714-750-2010, or via e-mail at Benjamin.Ly@hilton.com, so we can arrange your accommodations.  Sincerely,  Benjamin General Manager

Summary: Absolutely the best way to do this trip.  Great friendly folks that go above and beyond to accommodate.  Great management, great facilities, very attentive.  All in all great, very highly recommended.  Enjoy.

Summary Heading: Nearly perfect stay. Would definitely stay here next time.
Summary: For visiting the Disneyland resorts, this was about as good as you can get for an off-resort hotel. The free breakfast was WAY better than what hotels normally offer (as in it was a real hot breakfast with many options). The hotel's location right next door to the Disney parking lot and shuttles made getting back and forth to Disneyland quick, easy and FREE.

We had a party of 6 (3 adults, 3 kids) and reserved 2 double suites, requesting close proximity.  The check-in staff was very courteous and we were assigned suites adjacent to each other!  The suites were spacious, clean, and bright.  There is a kitchenette, living area, and bedroom with a door.  Our suites had a view of Disneyland fireworks!  We got free good, hot breakfast every day and light dinner on weeknights. There is a large wading pool that made our non-swimmers quite content. The hotel is the closest one to the Toy Story parking lot, and it is an easy walk to the free shuttle Disney provides from there to the entrance.  Disney has no problems with the public using this shuttle, and there was never a wait. The only possible complaints I have about the place is I would

We have stayed at both the Disney property hotels and off site neighbor hotels. By far I'd say this is one of the best neighbor hotels. My main concern was how far of a walk we had to Disneyland. This was not a problem. There is a free Disney shuttle service only a few blocks away about a 7 min walk. Directions weren't explained well to me by the reception staff so I will do it here. Coming out of the hotel turn right, walk down the sidewalk and cross the light, then turn right towards the large parking lot. This is The Toystory Land parking lot. You will see some signs and attendants where the pick up/drop off is located.  The Hotel: Very clean and rooms are very spacious since they are all suites. They all have pull out couches, kitchens with a microwave, stove top, full

Summary Heading: Rooms were perfect but front desk needs help
Summary: When we arrived Alejandra was very professional and informative. However the girl in the morning was a bit rude. I think her name was Kat I'm not sure but that's what I believe the other young lady was calling her. I was trying to tell her that we didn't want our room serviced and she just stared at me and said "well why don't you just put the do not disturb sign". I was a bit shocked how she answered I was going to tell her I didn't have a sign which is why I was letting her know to notify the housekeeper . I don't know if she was having a bad day but she needs to work on her customer service.
Manager Response: Hello travelmom265,  Thank you for taking the time to provide such valuable feedback, and I am completely taken back at the service you received by our front desk team. Please accept my sincere apologies on behalf of our entire team, and please know that this is not typical and that extremely courteous and professional guest service is always our main focus. I will be following up accordingly, however I would like to welcome you back to the hotel to provide our team a chance at making it right by you, our loyal guest. When time permits, please reach out to me via telephone 714-750-2010, or via email at Benjamin.Ly@hilton.com, so I can better assist you.  Thank you, and I look forward to hearing from you very soon!  Benjamin General Manager

Summary Heading: Very impressive! Great customer service and very clean.
Summary: I worked as a manager of a housekeeping department for many years so staying at hotels is difficult for me but this hotel really impressed me. I didnt have any complaints about cleanliness the whole 7 days we stayed there...which has NEVER been the case for me. Most of the staff was very professional but 2 employees really stood out. Mark and Elsa have amazing customer service skills. No matter what the situation they approached guests with a very welcoming smil and helpful attitude. We really felt comfortable here and would definitely stay here again. We also saved a lot of money with the free meals provide.  The spacious suite we had with bunkbeds was fantastic and well kept.

This was our second visit to this property.  The suites are spacious and the entire staff was most helpful and welcoming.  A nice gesture was the hotel manager approached the guests to see if their visit was satisfactory.  He was most gracious.  This is our favorite place to stay in Orange County.

Be careful as there is another Homewood about five minutes away with the same name so easy to get confused as we were. Breakfast in this hotel was good. Room was spacious. My kids especially loved the bunk bed. Housekeeping was very good with a sweet lady always full of smiles for us. But she knocked at 8am one of the days which was too early for me. Minus points were that no one helped with bags when we arrived. The shuttle was also always too crowded so would be better to pick a hotel with dedicated shuttle to Disney. Would also have liked to see room service or food at hotel for dinner.

The hotel was clean , small rooms and bathrooms. Close to Disney. I tried to buy an evening ticket and the lady at the desk told me all about it then said except I‚Äôm closed . Come back tomorrow. I asked the concierge if they could pick me up one since I was in meetings all day. Nope. I called ahead to make sure my Honors number was in before I arrived and again when I arrived. They assured me all was good. Except it wasn‚Äôt. 2 weeks later I‚Äôm on the phone with corporate Hilton only to find out it never was taken care of. Hmm. Marriott is looking good to me!
Manager Response: Hello lindeee,  I would like to take this time to personally apologize for the lack of service you received at our hotel! However, I am a bit confused about the Disney ticket purchase, as well as having your Hilton Honors profile placed on your reservation. When time permits, please reach out to me directly via telephone, 714-750-2010 or email at Benjamin.Ly@hilton.com, so I can better assist you, and to ensure that your reservation contains your Hilton Honors information, and to gain clarity on the Disney ticket situation. Again, please accept my sincere apologies, and I look forward to your call/email.  Benjamin Ly General Manager

Summary Heading: Would recommend and stay here again
Summary: This hotel felt like a home away from home. The little kitchen and lounge area meant there was space to spread out and "live" for the 9 days of our stay.  We appreciated many aspects of the hotel: -Our flight from Australia landed early on Friday morning and we arrived in Anaheim by 10 am.  Despite check-in technically being 4pm, because they had a room available, we were able to check-in early.  That shower and nap were very much appreciated. Thank you check-in staff.   (A recommendation for other Australian travellers - our flights home always seem to be very late at night but check-out here and other hotels is 11am. Last time we stayed in Anaheim, we spent hours sitting in the lobby of our hotel until it was time for the airport shuttle at 6pm.  This time, I paid for an extra

This is an excellent property!  Driving up there is plenty of space to park for check-in.  This is important especially after a long drive.  The front staff also were terrific.  While I could not get an upgraded room, they volunteered to pay for my parking and that saved $18...thank you!  The hotel, perhaps like others, offered free of charge a two-day parking pass after check-out so I could leave my vehicle there the following day while we enjoyed California Adventure.  I found our room to be clean and quiet.  It is not a suite in the "strictest" definition, but it still had all the kitchen amenities that Homewood is known for.  The breakfast was good and the location is VERY convenient.

You cannot go wrong choosing this hotel. The food at the breakfast & dinner hour was excellent with an added bonus of beer and wine at dinner. Room was clean and beds were very comfortable. A free shuttle to the parks is about a block away.

I was disappointed with the cleanliness of our suite. This hotel seems to have a lot of wear and tear showing and it has only been there for a short time. The carpet was heavily stained in our room, there was hair on the floor. The tile floor was smudged and did not appear to have been well cleaned. There was a sticky substance dripped across the top of the coffee table. Another thing to note is that the beds were not comfortable. The mattresses seemed thin and the pillows provided absolutely no support. I slept on all three pillows and woke up with terrible pain in my neck and a nasty headache from lack of support. I'm disappointed because I love this hotel brand and have never had a bad experience with Homewood Suites.  That being said, the bathroom was clean and so was the
Manager Response: Hello deedeeg123,  Upon reading your review of your recent stay at our hotel, I cannot apologize enough for all of the issues that arose at our hotel. Your feedback is extremely important, and I cannot express how helpful it is. Please know that we have already put our teams in place to address and further prevent these issues from occurring again. Given the fact that you will provide us a chance to make it right on your next stay, I ask that you please reach out to me when you begin planning your next stay, so that I can directly assist you with that. Again, thank you for taking the time out of your day to provide this feedback so we can improve as a hotel and team, and I look forward to hearing from you.  Thank you again,  Benjamin General Manager

Summary: What a great hotel within a short 5 min drive to Disneyland but half the price of a hotel across the street from the park.  Room was clean and nice.  Great having a Starbucks in the lobby and the restaurant served a great breakfast.  Angel was fantastic at the front desk making sure we had all we needed .

I absolutely love this hotel and had such a great stay. I was more than impressed with their breakfast and their ‚Äúevening social‚Äù food selection. It made it so easy to keep my 2 little ones fed. The breakfast selection is great, the pool is really nice, the hotel is clean, and the staff is so friendly. We spent 4 nights and did Disney 2 of the days. The hotel is right next to the Disney parking lot. I read other reviews where people got on the Disney shuttles, but the walk wasn‚Äôt too bad. It was about a 20 minute (1 mile) walk with pushing a stroller (and 2 rowdy kids). Definitely do-able, and the distance is well worth the great hotel. There seemed to be more than enough parking while we were there. And having a kitchen on our room definitely helped us save on spending extra

Everything about this hotel is wonderful, but the service really stands out.  The proximity to Disneyland and restaurants is very convenient.  The hotel appears to be fairly new, is well taken care of, and has great amenities like an excellent free breakfast, evening social with food and drinks M-Th, and a staff that goes above and beyond all around.  I also enjoyed the small shallow pool (in addition to the regular pool and hot tub, as the small pool is great for young children.  I would gladly stay here again!

Our family stayed here for 5 nights while visiting Disneyland. It was an amazing place to stay with so much to offer.. superb breakfasts, night time meals with a variety of choices,including beer and wine. The pools were lovely, the exercise room, the game room, the basketball courts, etc. provide plenty for the entire family. I cannot sing the praises of this place loud enough because of the AMAZING STAFF that keep this place moving with such hard work and friendly responses. The only challenge we had was getting the towels, toilet paper, coffee, etc. replaced in the room. After the housekeeping staff straightened up we still had to call and ask for these things. To be honest though, I have no idea they keep up with all the people here.  It‚Äôs close to Disney shuttle and so many

Summary Heading: Great place for our family to stay
Summary: Convenient location, next door to shuttle lot for Disneyland.  Kitchen was so helpful to have for our needs.  Room was clean and housekeeping did a great job providing a nice room to come back to after a long day at the parks.  Staff was friendly...really didn't have problems to address during our stay.

Summary Heading: Family trip to Disneyland and surrounding areas
Summary: Stayed a week in this hotel from Melbourne, Australia and extremely impressed. We travelled with our 6 month old and 5 year old. Only issue was at check in when we were told we would be on the 4th floor and then 5 minutes later told the room was given to another family and we would be on the 3rd floor same sort of room. We would have preferred a higher room not overlooking the car park. After this minor incident however we were very happy. Rooms are a good size with a kitchen. Our daughter liked her pull out sofa bed and our son slept well in his crib. Breakfast included everyday delicious and filing. Dinner from Monday to Thursday great salads. Elsa was lovely. Hotel is right near the Toy Story parking lot to get the shuttle to Disneyland. Very convenient. Staff are excellent.

Friendly staff and well priced hotel. Distance from Disneyland is about a 20 minute walk but it's a straight walk up, nice and easy. Quite small rooms. We are a family of 6, and we are finding the room quite squishy. We are in a family room, which comprises of a queen bed, bunk bed with a trundle underneath and a pull out double sofa bed, which is quite questionable. For a small body it's fine, but a teenager, very uncomfortable for a decent duration. Full buffet breakfast is served every morning with tea and coffee available whenever you like, in their foyer. Over all great value hotel.
Manager Response: Hello ceevee6,  Thank you for the detailed review. We are pleased that you had a good experience with the value of our hotel and our friendly staff! Sorry that the rooms are not larger. I see that the stay was a little but cozy and we will take your comments to heart and do whatever we can to improve from this. Overall, we appreciate your nice comments about our value and staff. We will put our heads together and see what can be done about the room size. We look forward to hopefully accommodating you and your family next time you are in town!

Summary: Excellent hotel with great service.  Very convenient as right next to Disney parking lot so could walk right over and take the bus to Disney every day.  Highly recommend and definitely stay on next trip!

Great rooms, facilities & location. Toy story car park next door. Buses all day & night, even in busy times wait is not that long. Great service. Hotel is on the main road, walking distance to food places. We could watch the fireworks from our rooms. Would definitely recommend.

Room was clean and big.  I was alone but could have had a family of 4 in the room.  Great morning enchiladas.  Evening reception food was pretty good.  Made a dinner out of it a couple nights while I was there.  Staff was very thoughtful.  Carmen was fantastic.  She really took it personal to make sure you were happy.

Great Hotel. Great staff. Great pool and jacuzzi. Delicious food. The location was ideal for us to access the shuttles to Disneyland. This hotel was highly recommended and it lived up to the recommendation in every way!

YA'LL.  This was such a wonderful stay, my family and I loved this hotel.  I chose it based on other reviews, and I'm so glad I did - really good hot breakfast in the mornings (included), comfortable beds, family suite with bunk beds was sooooo nice, and my kids loved it too (ages 4 & 7).  You can walk right next door to the Disney Toy Story parking lot and take their shuttle to the parks to save you from all that walking - but there are a ton of good restaurants in the area you can easily walk to.  The pool & hot tub were great too (even have a mini golf pad and basketball court). But my absolute favorite and unexpected perk was the Social Hour Mon-Thurs.  They give you complimentary beer & wine and dinner food!  They had hot dogs, sauerkraut, good salad bar, soup, chips, and

Summary Heading: Second visit better than the first!
Summary: Our first visit here was a little rocky ‚Äî the hotel‚Äôs pack n plays were old and delayed bedtime for our toddler. But otherwise the stay was fine so we gave it a second try when my mother in law came to town to take her grandson to Disney for his second birthday. The second visit was fantastic!  We had connecting rooms, which was great because it felt like a two-bedroom suite and our toddler loved being able to go into grandma‚Äôs room to see her whenever he wanted. The kiddie pool was a hit again. The staff was great, and gave us some milk from the breakfast room when we realized we forgot to get milk for our toddler. The pack n plays were good this time. It was very convenient to the toy story parking lot and shuttle. Breakfast in the morning was great, and staff gave our boy a

Summary Heading: Great Disneyland and Southern California Stay
Summary: Stayed for five nights Sept 8-12. Easy online check-in with Hilton Honors and was able to choose room location ahead of time. Rooms are very spacious with great floorplan. The morning full breakfast has plenty of options. Be aware this hotel is popular with families with small children and getting breakfast is a busy free for all. Manager reception during the week has hearty appetizers and a good selection.   Overall great stay and would highly recommend. I will be staying there again!
