Between May 2017 and September 2018, I have stayed at this location three times, totaling 25 nights.  I highly recommend this hotel.  I will begin with a basic description, followed by my thoughts.  Details:  The most common option seems to be the two-bed, two-room suite.  This option provides a bedroom, a living room, and a kitchenette.  The bedroom contains two queen-size beds, a desk, a dresser, a nightstand, and a chair.  The bathroom is in the bedroom, with the toilet and bathtub/shower in their own room, separated from the sink/mirror, which is openly accessed from the bedroom.  The living room is separated from the bedroom by a door and consists of a foldout couch, a chair, a dresser, a small table, a separable coffee table, and a bench.  The kitchenette consists of an

Summary Heading: Prefect location, Service with the smile
Summary: I am known to be very picky when it comes to accommodation and hotels. I have stayed in many hotels including 5 star resorts. This hotel was awesome.  Location: 15 minutes walk to DL.   Rooms: They matched the picture on the website, you get what you see. The rooms are very clean, beds and bedding appeared to clean and good materials.  Housekeeping: Great team, they work hard and clean hard. I saw them all hours from day to middle of the night cleaning something including shampooing the hallways or dining areas, Rooms were cleaned and organized daily.  Daily Breakfast:  Variety of items, from scrambled eggs to oatmeal. There is something for everyone. They also offer free light dinners in the evenings.  Front Desk staff:  I found the afternoon shift and overnight staff more

Summary Heading: A great place to stay when visiting Disneyland
Summary: This is the second time I have used this hotel and I will definitely use it again! The complementary meals are great, the staff is very attentive, and the room and other common areas are kept very clean. This is a hotel that cares about its customers and has pride in its facilities.

Great economic choice for those travelling with family to Disneyland. Free breakfast and dinner covers so much potential $$ especially when paying so much for Disney. Clean, great staff, walking distance to theme park. Great fun suites for families. Highly recommend.

Summary Heading: Super friendly, awesome service, great value üëçüèªüëçüèª
Summary: Can‚Äôt fault this hotel, the staff have gone out of their way to ensure that nothing was a problem.  Complementary breakfasts every day and dinners (Monday thru Thursday includes beer and wine) have been awesome!  Anyone staying here will not be disappointed.  I‚Äôd also like to call out one staff member in particular, Elsa Lopez, she is amazingüëçüèªüëçüèªüëçüèª

Summary Heading: Excellent family-friendly hotel! Free breakfast, dinners and drinks are the best!
Summary: We stayed here for a week for our Disney vacation. There was a group of 10 of us, including kids, adults, grandparents, and everyone had the best stay. The shuttles from the Toy Story parking lot are free, and so convenient. The complimentary breakfasts (everyday) and dinners (mon-thurs) take the guess work out of where to eat, and complimentary booze - need I say more?! Carmen was our server at the manager's receptions each night and she was so friendly! She took care of us and was very attentive, refilling our glasses and checking in on us often. Thank you Carmen! Housekeeping was great too, the room was always clean and cozy. Overall great stay :)

Summary Heading: Great Hotel, walking distance to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights when visiting Disneyland.  We loved the full kitchen, great pool, and one of the best free breakfasts I've had.  We were able to walk to the Toy Story Lot everyday and take the free shuttle to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Love this hotel! Great place to stay for Disneyland!
Summary: We recently stayed here for 7 nights. This was our first time staying. We loved it so much!! We had 4 rooms - 3 were 1 bedroom queen suites and one was a King Suite. The queen suites each had a full fridge, dishwasher, microwave, kitchen sink, cupboards, etc. The King suite even had a mini fridge, microwave, cupboards and kitchen sink. We all had plenty of room and the beds were very comfortable. The breakfast buffet had different specials each day and had quite a few different options. We also did the evening social that is M-Th. We only did it one day, but it was great and had enough food to fill us up for the evening. It has a lot of other amenities that we didn't have time to use (i.e. pool, hot tub, putting green, bbq area, etc.), but all looked nice!  Everything in the

Summary Heading: Excellent stay and close to Disneyland
Summary: This was our first stay at this location and we had a great experience. The staff went out of their way to make our stay very enjoyable. You can't beat the free breakfast and free dinner/happy hour. The breakfast and evening social staff were friendly, kept the dining area very clean, and worked very hard to accommodate every guest - in fact, the service was better than most restaurants. Elsa Lopez took such great care of us! The rooms are clean, quiet, and very spacious. The hotel is within walking distance to Disneyland and there's even a free shuttle close by (Toy Story Lot). We would definitely stay here again.

Our family stayed in two rooms for five nights. This was our favorite Disney Good Neighbor Hotel we have ever stayed in. The hotel was clean and well appointed, the staff was friendly and helpful, the grocery run for ice cream delivered to our door was very nice, the two pools and hot tub were large and clean, the food was tastey & plentiful, the maids did excellent work and the way they did the kids' beds was very sweet (arranging their little blankets & stuffies and making swans with towels), and the close proximity to Disney's Toy Story parking lot with its free shuttle was a huge bonus!¬† The only (slight) negative was how chaotic breakfast could be, seems like a little bit of re-organizing would help. But the meal workers did keep things well-stocked and clean.   Overall we

Summary Heading: Great value, great service, great stay!
Summary: Everyone was very helpful and the staff were very friendly and nice. We used pretty much every amenity (breakfast, evening social, BBQs, kitchen in the room, parking, pool) and all were nice. They do a great job on keeping the food items (for breakfast and evening social) stocked and fresh, especially with as many people were served. Only noise from the room itself was the stomping of the people upstairs, but I think they were just heavy walkers(;  Would definitely stay again!

This is an awesome place to stay and have stayed here before.  Clean rooms, clean hallways, well maintained.  Pool, spa, kids pool, complementary breakfast, evening social, what more could you ask for?  Only a short (.9 mile) walk to Disneyland or ride the shuttle.  We will go again.

This was the first time staying at this property. After over ten years  of staying at one other Hilton property and having a bad stay last year, we decided to make the change.   Victoria was excellent.  Very accommodating and friendly, as well as Portia and the one lady with the great nails (I didn‚Äôt catch her name).   We had the top floor and a room that had only one other guest room next door.  Perfect location.  No noise! We only took in one dinner and a couple of  breakfasts.  Food was good and lots of places to sit.  The only complaint I have is the air conditioning.   It is set for only going to 68 degrees for the lowest temperature. For us Canadians, in hot weather, it isn‚Äôt t enough.  Also it doesn‚Äôt kick in when you aren‚Äôt in the room so after a full day at Disneyland,

Summary Heading: Excellent Service by Edsa L., Angelina S. & the collective staff
Summary: Edsa provided excellent service during dinner, despite our family arriving as serving hours were ending. She was cheerful and very accommodating in getting us bowls and plates from the kitchen. This saved us time, resources, and emotional bandwidth.  Angelina S. was a fantastic housekeeper and her personal touch (hand-written notes, organization of odds-and-ends, etc...) was greatly appreciated.  Nearly every staff member we walked passed was friendly...I believe a manager (gentleman in blazer) asked on multiple occasions if he could personally assist with anything.  Additionally, they assisted with complimentary items (hygiene products) which saved us having to go out right away and purchase them.  We've been very impressed with all facets of our hotel experience.

We stayed four nights. We loved complimentary meals breakfast and dinner (dinner tues to thurs). The entire hotel staff was kind and courteous. Our room was clean and spacious. Every night Elsa was friendly and kind to us for the dinner. We were able to walk to the pick up for Disneyland each morning at the Toy Story Parking lot next door. We definitely want to stay here again for the next Disney trip.

We just spent an amazing evening at the homewoodsuites in Anaheim. The service from Carmen was not only above and beyond but reflected a standard of excellence that should be modeled by the entire Hilton organization! As a diamond member we have seen many hotels and service workers but Carmen has raised the bar with her friendly approach and tireless working style. We applaud her and hope she is recognized by the management!

This hotel was highly reviewed and lived up to the expectations. The staff was great, the hotel was clean with large, comfortable rooms and the location was fantastic. It is right next to the Disney lots, which means a free trip to/from the parks. Highly recommended!

Summary Heading: What a lovely time we had!
Summary: What a lovely time we had I've traveled extensively over the years and most hotel stays have been as expected with a few notable exceptions - Homewood Suites in Anaheim is one of them!  The family suite was an immaculate livingroom-kitchen-bedroom-bathroom suite with a king bed and two twin bunkbeds behind a half wall in the same room.  Homewood serves a full breakfast buffet each morning - the food is good and plentiful with the usual fare.  The hotel is about 3 blocks from the Disney Toy Story parking lot which provides free transportation to the Disneyland entrance.      What makes this hotel exceptional is the amazing customer service provided by the staff.  Adrian was incredibly helpful on the phone before we arrived helping me arrange a scooter for Disneyland (btw, Disney

Have stayed here before because of its location to Disney buses to Disneyland.  Comfortable, clean, quiet  rooms. They provide a free breakfast and have many choices of food items to choose from.  Will stay here again.

Having sat in traffic travelling from San Diego, we arrived much later in the evening than we had intended to.  The gentlemen on reception were really welcoming, and when they realised it was our daughter's birthday, they surprised her with a free ice cream.  The bottles of water for us were very much appreciated too. We booked a one bedroom family suite with bunk beds, and it worked really well for our family.  It was spotlessly clean, and the separate kitchen and living room was great, giving us a bit more space to relax in.  The curtains in the bedroom and the living room weren't wide enough to actually close at night, which was a bit strange, but didn't affect our sleep. The pool area was lovely and clean, and a good way to have some down time away from the theme parks.

Enjoyed our stay and the pool. The parking is expensive though. But walking distance to Disneyland. Loved the breakfast options! And the pool was fun. Be sure you check your refrigerator temperature though, we found out late in our stay that ours was turned to 'room temperature' and then lots of our food went bad.

The front desk gentlemen was very friendly and welcoming after a 15 hour drive from Oregon. Got us out room quickly and offered us all bottles of water. They offer dinner between 5-7 which was a life saver and it was good. Not far from Disneyland either. I would stay here again

I would say the major draw for this hotel is the close proximity to Disneyland which is within walking distance.  Also there are numerous restaurants and Walgreens/7-11's within walking distance if you don't have a car.  The parking is somewhat an issue because they didn't have enough parking spots for people in the evening and people had to park in the fire lane at night.  The rooms were clean and staff was friendly.  The fitness center was large and up to date.  Overall the hotel seemed well maintained and clean.

It takes a lot for me to write a bad review.  I understand things happen and some situations are out of people‚Äôs control.  With that said...  My family came to stay for our end of summer, week vacation to Disney.  I was going to book at one of the other hotels with a water park feature as we didn‚Äôt want to spend our entire trip at the theme parks and we love swimming.  After being torn between this and the Marriot theme park entrance, I decided to book here at Homewood Suites Anaheim.  The hotel has good reviews and we liked their pool set up with bbqs and fire pit.    After 4 days we had enough walking at the theme parks and wanted to relax by the pool and enjoy the rest of our day. My daughter was so excited to go swimming. After walking th 20 minutes back to the hotel, there
Manager Response: Hello Gracehennings,  I am completely taken back by your feedback, and I can completely empathize with you on every regard. Clearly, we did not exceed your expectations, let alone, meet your expectations. Please know that we took every liberty in attempting to notify all of our guests about the pool closure, nonetheless, I cannot apologize enough for the failure to communicate directly with you when the opportunity provided itself. As we understood that closing our pool area is a daunting task, the condition of the suite you reserved is completely unacceptable by our standards. I have communicated your feedback to the team so we can correct these issues accordingly. When time permits, I would love to speak with you directly via email or by telephone (714)750-2010 so we can discuss further about these issues, and I am hoping that I can help persuade you into visiting our hotel again.  Sincerely,  Benjamin General Manager

Summary: We are a family of 5, having stayed at the Homewood suites, convention centre for 5 nights on our recent summer holiday. Excellent location for Disney, walkable  Close to Walgreens and CVS for provisions. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance. We walked back and forth to Disney, but the Toy story shuttle was right next door if needed and very convenient. Very welcoming hotel. Great lounge area. Complimentary breakfast was good and evening social Monday to Thursday was a nice touch. Staff were very friendly, in particular the restaurant and would always be welcoming.  We stayed in a family suite which was great size for our family. Beds were very comfortable. Lovely kitchen and fridge. Hotel spotless clean despite being busy. We even had a welcome basket on check in.

Stay went out of way to be accommodating.  Rooms well appointed. I loved the lite mirror. It was great to be able  to eat breakfast each morning  and not have to leave the hotel. They even had complimentary wine at dinner for adults. Movies at poolside each night. GREAT stay

Great Hotel and very helpful staff members. The staff goes above and beyond to listen to all the guests and care for their needs. The breakfast was delicious with a huge variety of items. Very clean hotel.

Loved the spacious room with kitchen, living room.  Hotel staff was helpful. Hotel even has activities throughout the week such as movie night. Wifi was good. Great location if you plan to go to disneyland.

You can not go wrong with this hotel if you are looking at going to Disneyland. We stayed here for 4 nights in August and thought it was great. The standard of the room was very good, it was very clean and well serviced. We had a 1 bedroom suite which was a good size with 2 double beds. The pool was clean and the games room and putting green/basketball hoop was great for the kids.  The price includes breakfast which is basic but very good and the evening social is very good as well. The food again is basic but given it is included in the price as well as wine and beer you can not go wrong!!  As other posts have suggested the hotel is next to the Toy Story transportation stop which is like a park and ride. We walked over and easily got on the bus to and from Disneyland and the

Every staff member at Homewood Suites Anaheim Convention Center we met provided excellent service! Victoria at the front desk is the utmost professional who is very knowledgeable, helpful and friendly. This was our second stay here and it was very comforting to see Victoria again. Carmen provided outstanding service during the evening social meal. She worked very hard to make sure the the guests had a great meal and provided this service with a smile. Mark, an Assistant Manager made his way to the customers at evening social to say hello. The hotel appearance is charming with clean rooms and lobby. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Disneyland or the Anaheim Convention Center.

Stayed 4 nights with 3 day Disney tickets. Loved this hotel - friendly helpful staff, large suite, bunk beds a hit with the kids. Pool area was fun and relaxing after the parks. Good breakfast and even better evening food and drinks Mon - Thursday. Made a huge difference to holiday food budget and and this hotel a great value choice. Tried walking and taking Toy Story Parking Lot shuttle to Disneyland - took about the same either way 20mins or so.

We enjoyed a fabulous stay at this hotel which was just a 5 minute walk from a Disneyland shuttle center. The rooms were very clean and comfortable.  The complimentary breakfast and evening meal (Mon.-Thurs.) were very tasty with a great variety. I felt this was a very good value for a hotel in this area.

Our family stayed here 4 days. The breakfast each day was clean, efficient, and very adequate. The small arcade area was perfect to help decompress a little from DL. We used the parking lot shuttles a few times and also just walked to DL during our stay. Rooms were clean and very nice.

The room was clean and spacious.  They offered more food than expected and it was yummy!  The staff was especially helpful and gracious.  Elsa Lopez took good care of us, even when my kid broke a glass at the restaurant.  I will definitely look to stay here again on the next Disneyland trip!

Summary Heading: Best hotel ever!  Very special birthday at Disneyland.
Summary: My twins turned 8 during our Disneyland trip and the staff went above and beyond.  Kids say it's the best hotel ever.  They got special balloons in the morning, goody bags and a song at dinner (thank you Elsa Lopez and Margarita), and we got a special birthday tray and a card signed by Kat, Judee, and Meg in our room.  The free breakfast is really good and loved the chicken enchiladas.   There's a good selection of salad, wine and beer on top of special of the day at dinner.   The room is clean and very spacious.    We love it!   The toy story parking lot is very close.   We are really enjoying our stay.   The only minor things is that the computers don't seem to show if we prepaid or not, so we had to wait and produce our documents.  Overall, this hotel amazing and everyone

Amazing Hotel, Amazing Staff... This hotel will be the only Hotel we will stay at..the breakfast is amazing! dinner and beer and wine Monday- Thursday was Amazing as well..  I promise you will be satisfied 100% with your stay !!

The staff at this Homewood Suites was tremendous.  Mark was the most accommodating, professional and friendly manager that I have ever encountered in years and years of traveling. He could make a fortune teaching others how to manage and how to treat guests. The rest of the staff was great as well.   The property was clean and modern and our room was quiet and very comfortable.  I only wish we could have stayed longer.

I had great hopes for my stay here because of the reviews.  And although it was a very good stay, it wasn't great.  (I reserve "GREAT" for my stay at the Homewood Suites in Southpark/Charlotte.)    You see, I stayed in the Charlotte location recently and it was so amazing that I had high expectations coming into Anaheim.  Some of the things that I'm going to be picky about is the lack of variety during breakfast.  It was literally the same scrambled powdered eggs, hash browns and sausages every day.  And although the front of the house staff was great at this location, the rest seemed to blend in.  I was always the one who initiated a smile and a good morning to the housekeeping staff as I passed them in the morning.  All in all, this felt like a large resort/cruise ship and

This hotel is perfect for visits to Disneyland Location brilliant, easy walking distance (20 mins) to park and close to free Disney transport . Room big, clean and well equipped. Hotel has all you need and the pool area is nice. Staff super helpful indeed and can help you with luggage and storage if you cannot check in early (they let us check in @ 08:15!!!) but want to go straight to the parks. Would recommend  and would stay again, excellent VFM + free breakfast!  Travelled as family of 4, with children <10

The hotel was clean, service was excellent and location to Disneyland was great; about a 15 minute walk. The full breakfast was a great way to start the long day and the evening social was an added bonus.

Summary Heading: Best non-disney hotel to stay at while visiting DisneyLand period.
Summary: We stayed at Homewood Suites during our trip to DisneyLand. We picked it because of the great reviews on Trip Advisor. I am happy to report all the good reviews are true. They offer free breakfast which really helps you get a fast start to your morning. THe rooms are big and offers a great kitchen and full size fridge. There's an evening social from Monday - Thursday from 5-7pm which are great if you have kids as it's kind of a buffet style light meal. Hotel is updated and the staff is the best around. I asked the front desk for a dinner recommendation and he suggested us visit the packing district. It's an upper scale food court and it was a fabulous suggestion. This hotel is doing everything right.

Summary Heading: Another great stay at our favourite Disneyland hotel!
Summary: This is our third time staying at this wonderful hotel near Disneyland, and once again it showed us why it is our favourite!   The rooms are spacious and clean, the location can‚Äôt be beat, the amenities are plentiful, the included food is excellent, and the service is top-notch. The daily breakfast and four-times-a-week evening reception (in reality a light dinner) are an added bonus, and the hard-working food team always made us feel so welcome. In particular, we would like to mention Julie, Carmen, Martha, Elsa, and Victor as going above and beyond to make our stay extra-special. Also, a special thank you to housekeeper Benita V. who put a smile on our young niece‚Äôs face by leaving an ‚Äòelephant‚Äô that she had made out of the towels in our room one day.  We had a large family

Summary Heading: Convenient to Disneyland and Convention Center
Summary: I stayed here for 4 nights (solo) for a combination business/pleasure trip.  The suite was spacious, with a sitting area, microwave, full sized refrigerator, range top, and dishwasher.  The room was clean and comfortable, the grounds were well maintained with the one exception of a half eaten pizza that was in the parking lot for 2 days.  In general, the hotel was fairly quiet other than children occasionally running down the hallway. The Toy Story parking lot is right next door, and you can walk there to take a shuttle to Disneyland.  There are plenty of restaurants nearby, from fast food to higher end restaurants and everything in between.  During certain times of the day I found it a bit time consuming to drive out of the parking lot because of traffic lined up to turn into

Close proximity to Anaheim Convention Center, 15 minute walk. Spacious bathrooms, mini-fridge and microwave. Larger fitness center than most. Great breakfast which is included in room rate. Friendly staff and allowed me to check-in a few hours early.

Summary Heading: Best hotel I have ever stayed in!
Summary: Literally - this place is amazing! If you are going to Disneyland, this is THE place to stay. The Toy Story Lot is right next to the hotel, so it is very easy to get to and from Disney. And the evening reception was beyond generous. I would return to Anaheim just to stay here again - it was that good.

Stayed here for 4 nights whilst visiting Disneyland. Location was great and was next to the Toy Story Parking lot. Room was spacious and clean. We had a view of the parking lot but this also meant we had a view of the Disneyland fireworks.  We made use of the food and drinks in the evening on the wed and thurs of our stay and we thought this was great. The breakfasts were also good with lots of choice.  All the staff were really friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay here again on our next trip.

I stayed here with my wife and child in August for our 2 week holiday, and cannot recommend highly enough. The staff were friendly and attentive, and the facilities were incredible.  The pools are great, for both adults and children. The basketball court also came in handy for running off some of the breakfast laid on by the hotel. The light dinner option was also fantastic, as there was plenty of choice, and the complimentary drink was well received after a day at Disneyland. Overall this holiday was made all the better by the staff at the hotel who went our of their way to ensure we had everything we needed at any time. Thank you to everyone at Homewood suites!

We had a great stay at the Homewood Suites and will be back any time we are in Anaheim. I‚Äôd selected it based on the reviews here, but was pleasantly surprised that I liked it even more than I expected. We are Disney World regulars and always stay on site, so I was a little hesitant to try a non-Disney property. Highlights included:  Location: We walked to Disneyland most mornings. We have a stroller and two kids walking, but it still only took 20 minutes from door to door. We occasionally took the shuttle from the Toy Story Lot which was also convenient.   Employees: They were just as friendly as Disney employees! Every employee made an effort to great us in the hall and ask how we are doing.   Food: Breakfast was great. I had to tear my kids away from their plates to go to the

Summary Heading: Honestly, the BEST option for Disneyland!
Summary: We stayed here for three nights and loved every minute of it - we would definitely stay here again if we came back to the area.  The location is perfect and super easy to get to Disneyland via the shuttles, which were directly adjacent to the hotel.  The staff were wonderful and on top of any need or question we had during our visit.     The free dinner and happy hour during the weekday were awesome.  The free breakfast was very crowded with guests being rude and somewhat gross in touching the food and then not taking it.    Our kids loved the hotel, basketball courts and game room.  We had a room with bunk beds for the kids -- it was quite spacious and quiet.

Summary Heading: Great Room, Great FREE Breakfast, Close to DL.
Summary: This was our hotel for Disney Land for 3 nights. The separate sitting area (with a door) was great to allow our kids to sleep while we had coffee and chatted in the mornings. The full kitchen definitely was a huge plus as well. I didn't hear too much road noise, but it did happen. Nice and clean, zero complaints. I travel for work about 4-5 times per year and 1 long vacation. I know a good hotel when I see one!

Summary Heading: Awesome hotel for families going to Disney!
Summary: Stayed here for three nights and it was perfect for our family of four. Staff was very friendly. Rooms very clean. We had a king bed and bunk beds which also had a trundle and a pull out couch for larger families. Right behind the hotel was the Disney bus stop for bus 20, Woody stop. The walk is 20 minutes to Disney and the lines for the bus from Disney can be as long as the walk.   Free breakfast daily.   Will stay here any and every time we go to Disney.

Summary Heading: Great amenities, Friendly staff, Good deal
Summary: Stayed there for six nights with my wife, daughter, and her family. Clean and spacious room. Coffee in room and downstairs. Free hot breakfast every day and also free dinner reception Monday through Thursday. Block and a half walk to Disney's Toy Story lot where you can ride the busses to Disney and back free.  Amazing way that this hotel handles large crowds - easily and fast. Even with lots of people at meals you don't wait because of the way they have things positioned. Highly recommend for your consideration.

Enjoyed our stay as a family. The complimentary breakfast had lots of options although it did get very busy close to the end of service. Rooms were spacious and clean. Service was great! The kids enjoyed the pool. Hot tub was tucked in the back that I didn‚Äôt even notice until our second time to the pool.

Summary Heading: Ideal for larger groups, especially young ones
Summary: Very impressed clean and new.  Rooms were very large and had huge fridge freezer along with a small kitchen.  Kirtchen, living room, bedroom and a bathroom gives you plenty of space.  Walking distance to the disney parks with bus stopa close by to get the ART bus or the local bus number 43.  We walked to the parks and used the toy story bus  number 20 back which was free.    Breakfast was also very good considering the amount if people it was dealing with at peak times.  Varied buffet of hot dishes, waffles, cereals and bread. Coffee available all through the day. Large pool that appeared to be well used, I can not comment on the evening reception that happened weekday between 530 and 7 as were in the parks.  Will certainly consider again in the future.

This was one of the Good Neighbor Friendly Hotel that we choose when we booked our Disneyland vacation via Costco Travels. Out of the hotels we looked at that was close to Disneyland, this one we decided to take a chance on.  The suite was very clean. The only complaint was that one side of the closet door would not stay open. I literally had to hold it open so that I could put our luggage in. Even though we didn't use it much except for the refrigerator, the suite did have a kitchen. The beds were very comfy, especially after a long day in Disneyland.  Breakfast in the morning was good and there was different options each day. We were able to try their happy hour and I liked the fact that they had different options each day as well. If you paid attention to the schedule on the
Manager Response: Hello swtpinay7,  Thank you for choosing to stay at our hotel, and for providing such wonderful feedback! Also, I am happy to read that you were able to join us for our Suite Start Breakfast, as well as our Evening Manager's Reception. However, I do want to apologize for the closet door not staying open, and the broken net on our basketball court. Please know that your feedback has been communicated to our team and we will get these issues fixed immediately.  Thank you again for taking the time to provide this feedback, and we hope that your future plans will bring you back to the Anaheim area, so we can welcome you and your family again!  Sincerely,  Benjamin  General Manager

Summary: excellent hotel, amazing fully stocked suites, location to disney land is fantastic, top notch customer service from all the staff we encountered. so family friendly, the kids would love it and feel very at home.

Summary Heading: AMAZING! But room was a bit untidy
Summary: This is an amazing place to stay, however, our room was not cleaned as it should have been. The floor had unopened pistachios under the tables which questions if they even vacuum between/during guests (they were still there after 5 nights). Also, the pillows are horrible. Other than that, I highly recommend this place. Great evening social so stay Monday-Thursday if you can (unlimited Stella beer). Breakfast is great! And 2 minute walk to the Toy Story parkade bus shuttles.

We stayed for 4 nights at the beginning of August.  What sold me was the 2 room suites and daily breakfast.  I love having the sleeping area separate from sitting/eating area when staying that many nights and allowing the kids to nap in the room while we watched tv.  The daily breakfast was great with a lot of selection.  The evening reception was nice with beer, wine, and light dinner selections.  The kids loved the kiddie pool.  The disneyland shuttle is about a 5 minute walk and drops you right off at the security gates.  Never had to wait for a shuttle.  They always had a few lined up.  We did walk one night back so we can grab pizza and it was a nice walk.  I left some clothes in the closet (the one place I didn't check).  I called the hotel as soon as I remembered a few

Walking distance to Disneyland. Complimentary breakfast buffet/evening social were nice extras. Clean rooms; helpful staff especially the kitchen staff. Our 3 yr old was looking for cantaloupes like he had the day before but I was told it wasn't on the menu that day. When the person overheard trying to explain the situation to my son, she told me to wait. She came back a few minutes later with freshly sliced cantaloupes for my son; he was so delighted!!  Great customer service.

Summary Heading: Great hotel just got the worst room.
Summary: Nice, modern hotel close to everything. Complimentary wifi, breakfast buffet, mon to thurs complimentary beer, wine and snack happy hour too. Parking is $18 a night. Semi kitchen in rooms that include dishes, toaster, coffee maker and microwave. Love the large spacious showers. Nice gym, game room, pool, kids pool and jacuzzi plus putting course and basketball court. Unfortunately the ground floor back lot room at end only room they had for three nights.

Summary Heading: Great place to base your Disney Trip
Summary: This is a great hotel to base your Disney Land trip.  It is close to the park, and is roomy enough for families.  The complimentary breakfast and evening socials (Monday thru Thursday) really help out the family budget on the meals.  My kids loved the meals, and the pool here.  The only watch out is you have to pay for Parking.  (18 dollars a day), but it is what it is.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay while enjoying Disneyland
Summary: The hotel is in a great spot with SUPERIOR service. Elsa Lopez was a delightful host at our breakfast and happy hour meals. The 'light dinner' was enough for us for two of our nights in Anaheim - it was included in the price of the hotel, included wine and beer, and had a full salad bar with an entree. Then we had more time to enjoy the pool. All of the staff were very friendly and encouraged us to stay with them again. And the location is a 15 minute walk to Disneyland, but we were in extreme heat so we took a $5 Lyft ride to and from Disney. It's still less than parking there, and quicker than the shuttle. WiFi worked well as well, which is a must for our phone-loving family.  I would definitely stay here again.

This is the perfect hotel for a Disneyland trip! Between the large suites that can accommodate up to 6 people (we had a king-size bed, bunk beds with a 3rd bed under and a sofa-bed in the living room), a mini kitchen with a full-size fridge and a dishwasher, the daily breakfast buffet, the evening social 4 days/week, and the fact that you can get to the parks very easily by hopping on the Toy Story parking lot shuttle basically next door, it was a win for us! Of course, it‚Äôs not the cheapest and you also need to pay for parking,  ut it was perfect for us!

Summary Heading: Great location to walk to convention center and Disney
Summary: We were here for work and spent all day at the convention center which was a short easy walk with people out all the time so it felt safe as well.  Great freebies in the morning and evening...nice workout area. All common areas clean and well kept. Perfect for our stay

This is the fourth time we have stayed at this hotel and it never disappoints! We have tried other hotels in Anaheim, but this one is our favorite and we always return here for our annual trips to Disney. The staff is always so welcoming and friendly, and the shuttle to Disney is walking distance which is convenient. We have also walked to Disney from the hotel to stretch our legs after a long flight. They have a complimentary breakfast which includes a different menu every morning so the meals are never repetitive. What we love most is the evening 'happy hour' where beer, wine, and food are provided. This was perfect for us since we spend our entire morning and day at Disney and come back for a little break before we head back to see the night parade and fireworks. We always

Read the whole review!  My kids and I stayed two separate days as bookends to our Disneyland trip. I chose this hotel for the breakfast and the facilities (pool, spa, game room, putting green, basketball court, light dinner M-Th).  First night, Monday 7/30 - Prior to check in, I used the Hilton Honors app and picked a room. Check in went well. Front desk was friendly and informative. She provided us with 2 bottles of water.   Room was nice with a good layout for me Nd the kids. We also were able to watch the fireworks from our room (4th floor facing the Toy Story parking lot).  Light dinner as well as breakfast were both very well done. Nice variety and pretty good quality of food.  My kids really enjoyed the outdoor area. They played Zootopia by the kids' pool on our first
Manager Response: Hello kangatoo,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us, and for taking the time to provide such valuable feedback! I cannot apologize enough for the latter half of your stay at our hotel. Clearly, we dropped the ball during your stay, and it appears that we had some room inventory issues, as well as the location of your suite. Please know that I will be following up accordingly, and when time permits, I would love to speak with you over the phone in regards to all of this. I hope that your future plans will bring you back to the Anaheim area so that we can establish a much better impression of our hotel and team.  Again, thank you for your time, and I look forward to hearing from you.  Benjamin General Manager

Summary: We had a great 2 night stay for our family of 4 (2 teenagers) at Disneyland. We booked a room with a King bed and set of bunks. The room was large & everyone was able to have their own space. Very quiet at night. We enjoyed the free breakfast and the food and drink in the evening. The location to the parks is great. We opted for $5 Lyft rides. Easy to come back in the afternoon and cool off in the pool.

Hands down this hotel is by far the best 3 stars hotel, great location, clean environment but most importantly customer service. From the time we checked in (Victoria is amazing üòâ thank you for all your help, you took care of us and makes us felt at home)to the time we left each and every employee went out of their way to make our stay ‚Äúfive star‚Äù. The breakfasts that were prepared daily (we love the salsa and the chicken enchiladas) and the evening socials were over the top and very family oriented. Again, what sets this hotel above all others is the positive energy and each personnel doing all they can to accommodate our needs. Elsa did a fantastic job! She really exemplifies the true meaning of customer service.  But that‚Äôs just to name a few of your employees. Everyone is

ly AWESOME. Overall a wonderful experience. Room was excellent, clean, and quiet. Can take shuttle or even walk to Disneyland. Full size fridge, and stove was excellent for eating around the Disneyland schedule. Only thing to change might be to add bacon at breakfast some days. Rest of the food was excellent. I have a sensitive stomach, and experienced zero issues for a week, which is very rare when eating out for me - so I must say the food service was above excellent, and definitely fresh. Food staff were courteous and helpful - leave them a tip!!! They go above and beyond. Thank you for helping to make another great Disney trip!

Have stayed in several hotel chains over the years but hands down this hotel ‚Äúhits it out of the park‚Äù when it comes to great location, clean environment but most importantly customer service. From the time we checked in to the time we left each and every employee went out of their way to make our stay ‚Äúfive star‚Äù. The breakfasts that were prepared daily during our stay and the evening socials were over the top and very family oriented. Again, what sets this hotel above all others is the positive energy and each personnel doing all they can to accommodate our needs. One particular employee that really exemplifies the true meaning of customer service was your employee Carmen. Carmen took the time to talk and laugh with us and discussed how she really loved what she does and went

Summary Heading: Great location, spacious suite, very clean, and nice amenities.
Summary: I have been using Hilton brand hotels for quite some time. My family and I have always been satisfied with them. Staying at Homewood Suites for the first time was a treat. A bunkbed for the kids and king for my wife and I worked great.

Summary Heading: Always an Amazing staff, and gorgeous establishment!
Summary: This Homewood has our heart, for me the moment we walk in til checkout we are treated as family. We are honors members and the acknowledge us as such, the rooms are immaculate and the room staff makes coming back each night comfortable as coming home. The complimentary things offer makes this the best place on Harbor!

Summary Heading: Exceptional Stay Very Close to the Parks
Summary: We chose this location based on the larger rooms, complimentary breakfast, and location. The entire stay was perfect. Recommendation...go early for breakfast. There are a lot if families and it can get hectic. But food was warm and stayed stocked throughout on the day we went later.

The layout of the one bedroom with 2 queen beds and full kitchen is perfect for a family!  The free hot breakfast was complete with eggs, sausage, pancakes and waffles.  Also, had hard boiled eggs, yogart, cereal.  Nice variety of choices!

Did lots of research - we were more than satisfied.  The front desk staff saved the day for us.  We had a huge weather related travel snafu.  They were able to us get our family vacation back on track - thank you!! Very easy to use the Toy Story parking lot to get back and forth.  Super amenities for families.  This property is very well run - thank you for a great stay.

Everything at this hotel is wonderful. The staff is amazing. Clean,spacious rooms. The food is awesome and filling. Customer service exceptional. I call it My Homewood Suites!!! Soundproof rooms. Didn‚Äôt hear a peep and slept like a baby.

Awesome home away from home.  With the activities we had throughout the week, it was nice to know we had a comfortable place to chill and relax in the evenings. Very friendly staff and great overall experience for family and business needs.

big shout out to this wonderful hotel.  all good!!!  Especially Alejandra!!!  what an amazing wonderful surprise to find her at the front desk when I checked in.  She deserves a big raise!!!  great dinner...amazing pool and work out area!! awesome

This hotel and staff are top notch.  I've stayed here for business and leisure and the great service is consistent.  It's always a plus when I can stay during the week and take advantage of the evening social.  I had friends with me this stay and they were so impressed with Homewood Suites as a whole.  This property's Trip Advisor rating is VERY well-deserved.

It started off badly when at 4:00, check in time, we had to wait for 15 minutes to be told our room wouldn‚Äôt be ready for another 45 minutes. We didn‚Äôt want to make a big fuss, like many others were doing since others had the same issue, so we said fine and headed to downtown Disney. The hotel is right next to a Disney shuttle/parking lot so that was super convenient. We came back and checked in around 9:00. We went to our room to find that our premium room, which we paid more for, was missing all the snacks and drinks it was supposed to come with. Housekeeping came by with the snacks fairly quickly which was appreciated but when I have to wait extra long to check in the room should be all ready. It was very clean though, and the staff was always courteous and did give us a late
Manager Response: Hello Rachel S,  Thank you for providing such helpful feedback from your recent stay with us. I cannot apologize enough for a less than excellent stay. From your suite not being ready by 4:00pm, to the premium suite amenities not being readily available when you entered, it is clear that we dropped the ball on more than one occasion, and for that, I am very apologetic. Also, I wanted to clarify that we have premium suites on the top floor as well, however all of our premium suites with a king bed are on the 1st floor, nonetheless I can completely empathize with you on every regard. I will follow up with the team accordingly, and I do have your personal information on file, so I will be communicating to you shortly. Again, thank you for taking the time to bring these issues to light, and we hope that your recent experience with us does not hinder your future stays with us. If there is anything else that needs attention, please do not hesitate to contact me directly at the hotel, and I will be more than happy to assist you.  Thank you,  Benjamin General Manager

Summary: The location is great and staff was really accommodating. The included breakfast was good and the happy hour a nice surprise. The carpets could stand cleaning and the pool was over chlorinated but overall the hotel was well kept. We enjoyed our stay and would return.

Good customer service, friendly staff.amazing place to stay. I recommend this place to All Families if you want to go to Disneyland this is the place to stay, the kids will love all the amenities that the hotel has to offer

My family and I traveled to Anaheim as the second part of a 10 day stay in California.  We booked 5 nights at the Homewood Suites and I can‚Äôt say enough great things about our stay!  We arrived several hours ahead of check in but we were able to leave our luggage as we had plans to see the Angels game.  The young man at the front desk was very helpful in telling us where to park for the game!  The suite itself was perfect!  It was large enough for my family of five and impeccably clean.  We had just spent the previous six days in San Diego at a resort that was double the price and not nearly as updated and clean.    The free breakfast was wonderful.  Lots of choices to keep everyone happy.  The light supper offered Monday through Thursday was really nice too!    Location is key

Love how spacious our room was and the full sized kitchen was convenient. Staff was great. Each one of them greeted us good morning or a hello. We loved the pool area and movie that played there. Shuttle service is a 5 minute walk and free! The complimentary breakfast was great!

My two teenage daughters and myself stayed in a 1 bedroom suite for 3 nights. As soon as you walked in the door the kitchen is on the right and has everything you need to cook if you would like. A stove, refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, plates, utensils and glasses. Then a small table to eat and the living room with a couch, chair and TV. Across from the living room is the door into the bedroom and there‚Äôs a king/Queen size bed and in the far corner was bunk beds. My daughter‚Äôs loved the bunk beds and said it was really comfortable same as the king bed. They have a desk across from the bunk bed. Then the other side of room is a sink with a big mirror and a closet with an iron, ironing board and safe in it. What‚Äôs great with two teenage girls was the sink and mirror was

Summary Heading: Perfect for family trip to Disneyland
Summary: Would definitely stay again - in fact, wouldn‚Äôt even bother looking elsewhere. 5 minute walk from the ‚ÄòToy story‚Äô car park with free shuttle bus to Disneyland. Alternatively about a 15 minute walk to the front gate. Standard mid range hotel breakfast. Evening social food were same quality as other Homewood suites we‚Äôve stayed in but presented in a better fashion. Quiet rooms - we had 5 in the bunk bed rooms and had the least amount of jet-lag I‚Äôve ever had - but that may have been due to the hectic 10 hour days in Disneyland! Great pool.  Key tip - keep a very close eye on the price - I booked directly on the Hilton website 8 months in advance and then rebooked several times as the price dropped and saved more than 30% on the original cost. Blaze pizza is great for dinner just

We loved this hotel.  The breakfast was great.  Great location,  near Disney and the convention center.  The evening happy hour was great! Desk staff was very cordial.  Beds were comfortable,  rooms clean and airy.  Pool looked great. will definitely stay here on next visit to Anaheim.

I love staying at this hotel! This was my 5th stay here while visiting friends, Disneyland/Ca adventure park, and sunset/Huntington beaches. The staff is great and very accommodating. I have read some bad reviews regarding service but have never had a problem myself. The manager, Ben, is very friendly and approachable. They have a light breakfast daily and serve dinner on Monday-Thursday, which is great if your trying to save a little money on meals. The toy story parking shuttle to Disney is right next to the hotel and runs half hour before the park opens till about and hour after it closes (last bus ran till 1am when we went on 7/23/18). We drove about 25 minutes to the beach for one day of our trip. It was easy to get to. Overall, I am very pleased with this hotel and highly

I would defenetely stay in this hotel its great dor family trip the breakfast is really complete athe roms are very clean and the employees are very polite  . Its not to far from the dineyland park the shuttle comes every 15 min this hotel is perfect for family trip

Summary Heading: Amazing Hotel that I keep coming back too!
Summary: There is literally no other hotel that I would stay at during my time at Disneyland. This is my 5th visit this year alone. And I have 3 more upcoming reservations. I am always treated with care and respect when I stay here. They have the most amazing pool, mini golf, basketball and food! 10 min walk to Disneyland. The STAFF IS AMAZING. Victoria the front office manager is amazing she is so sweet and made me feel like a valued customer. The whole front desk staff‚Äôs professionalism is mind blowing.  I will be back in September for another amazing visit!!  -Ms.Powell

All staff is amazing! They really welcome you and make you feel at home! Staff is always attentive with your needs. I have made reservation to go back later this year. I have recommended all my family and friends to stay here.

This property is located in the convention area and a short walk to Disneyland.  The check in was flawless.  We were early and the front desk not only checked us in but met my requests.   The room is a decent size with a small galley kitchen and sitting area.  The bedroom is separate with a door to close off the area.  The bathroom has a section with a sink and the toilet/shower area is separated by a door.  We had quiet nights the entire 5 nights.  The pool area is well done with a large pool, small kiddie pool and hot tub.  The staff work hard to make your stay a good one and keep the property clean.  The free breakfast is okay and gets crazy busy.  They should extend the hours until 10:00.  There is a Denny's next door if you want your food cooked to order.  We weren't around

This was my first stay at the Homewood Suites and I was very satisfied.  I will definitely be staying here again on my next trip to Disneyland.  Its only a few blocks from Disneyland but its a good way to get started before standing in long lines there.  The rooms were clean, the staff was pleasant, the complimentary breakfast and dinner was nice to have available if you are on a tight budget.

I stayed here in July for 2 nights with my 2 teens.  The hotel is fantastic!!  I don't understand why it is considered a 3 star hotel.  Very clean, comfortable beds, and great water pressure in the shower - my top 3 measurements.  Had plenty of space in the room.  Ours even faced Disneyland, and we could see the fireworks at night.  Breakfast was very good, and there was plenty of room.  We walked to the Disney parking lot and took the tram to the park, and walked directly to the parks a few times (It's about a mile).  I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone going to Disneyland.

Convenient walk to Disney (25 minutes to the entrance) or free shuttle from the neighbouring car park. Breakfast was rather disappointing for a member of the Hilton family. I was very peturbed to find vegetarian options mixed with meat products in the food warming trays. Room had a great view of Disney parks. Room was clean and an ok size. Staff on reception were very helpful. Parking right outside the hotel and plenty of restaurants nearby.

First time staying at a Homewood suites. Overall we enjoyed our stay. As a family of 2 adults and 2 young kids. The room setup was practical and comfortable. Housekeeping did a good job each day. Front desk was professional. I had some items delivered prior to check in. All but one item was missing which was only a few $. So not too bad, but I would not send anything of value.   Breakfast had enough choices and variations during our stay. It did get busy from 8am onwards. But they coped.   Walk to Disney was about 20 mins. We did use the toy story shuttle as well.   The hotel was busy, mainly families and groups. So the corridors were quite busy. We stayed on 5th floor so not much noise from neighbours but I expect it would be a different story if I stayed on lower floors.

Summary Heading: Great value option for Disneyland Vacation
Summary: Excellent option for a Disneyland vacation. Large rooms available, w/ bunk beds and comfortable pull out couches, kitchen. The hotel offers an arcade, mini golf, basketball court, swimming pool and enough to keep the kids entertained for a few hours. It is about 3min (or less, depending on traffic) to get to Disneyland. Daily breakfast buffet is included in your stay. Waffles, cereal, sausage, eggs and others. Decent quick meal before heading off to Disney. Highly recommended when, great value.

We had a great one night stay at this hotel. We stayed in a room with two bedrooms. The rooms were clean and comfortable. This is within walking distance of the parks so it‚Äôs nice to not have to drive to the parks. The only complaint I have about the hotel is that the parking spaces were rather small. Otherwise, this is a great property!

Our room was extra large and clean.   It was helpful to have dinner and breakfast included with our room.  The bus to Disneyland is within walking distance.  We'd stay here again.  Elsa took good care of us in the dining room.

Clean room, easy walk to Disneyland, lots of restaurants nearby. Great for our family of five! I would highly recommend staying at this hotel. The pullout bed in the room gave everyone a comfortable sleeping space.

Summary Heading: Best Homewood Suites Disneyland Family Visit!
Summary: Wonderful Hotel! Great food, pool & Amazing amenities!! Elsa Lopez was an amazing staff member who was smiling, helpful, courteous and an amazing asset to this facility! Perfect for Families! Stay here!!

Homewood suites was a great hotel for going to Disneyland. It was extremely clean and staff was great. We walked to Disney and was very doable with our 8 year old. Loved watching the Disney fireworks from our hotel room. Overall great experience and hope to go back one day!

We are locals with annual Disney passes and sometimes we stay at a hotel in Anaheim for a little romantic staycation away from the kids. We've stayed at several in the area, but Homewood Suites is our new favorite. The lobby is really nice, the little convenience store area had everything we needed (even vegan ice cream), the price is great, a FULL breakfast is included, the room is spacious, we had a little kitchen in our room, the bathroom is really nice, and the pool area is pretty. It's a really good value!

Summary Heading: Fill Your Belly, Shuttle to Disney, Back to Sleep, Repeat
Summary: During the week if you are going to Disney on a budget, this is probably a good option, especially if you have kids. I didn't have any kids with me, but came here to check out this hotel.  One thing, the elevators were extremely slow, I do not suggest getting a higher floor or you might spend most of your time just trying to make it to the lobby.  I usually get the higher floors. The breakfast and evening meals are good to keep you sufficiently full before you take on the amusement parks in the area.  The room I stayed at had a living area, kitchen, and a separate area with two beds. It was large albeit a little dated.  Perfect for a family with kids. Target is across the street for last minute gifts or forgotten items.  They have a Disney shuttle on the property as well. Staff

Summary Heading: Pretty good overall. We would consider staying again.
Summary: We stayed here 4 nights while visiting Disneyland. Rooms were clean and comfortable. We were in a 1 bedroom suite with 2 queens as well as a sofa sleeper in the living room. Beds and bedding were clean and reasonably comfortable. It was nice to have a kitchen. We had Vons deliver groceries right to our hotel door. First order delivery was free and even a $20 credit with $50 order.   Hot breakfast was good and different every day. The staff did a pretty good job of keeping up with the tremendous breakfast crowd.   Parking was $20 per night. There was no hotel shuttle to Disneyland. You could walk over to the Disneyland parking lot shuttle which was free but it was still a 5-10 minute Walk to the shuttle plus wait time. Ended up being a 20-30 minute trip from hotel to front gate.

We really enjoy staying at the Homewood Suites.  The location is great for a family trip to Disneyland.  It is located next to the Toy Story lot and you can catch a bus at anytime making it less walking then most other hotels.   In addition we have health issues that require a special diet.  The kitchen is large enough to cook in and the BBQ's are great so that we can make a salt free meal with no hassles, they even have the utensils available for you .  The whole family enjoys the pool area, putting green and basketball hoop.   The staff is very friendly and responsive and an issue that came up they were on top of even when the decaf coffee was cold they went and made a fresh pot immediately.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay when visiting Disneyland
Summary: Just returned from a trip to Disneyland and stayed at Homewood Suites by Hilton. The hotel is within walking distance to Disneyland and is one block away from the Toy Story parking lot. The hotel staff are so friendly and made our trip very enjoyable. The complimentary breakfast is great, but gets crowded quickly. The rooms are nice and spacious. We will definitely be back again.

Loved the free breakfast, happy hour was enough food for dinner, great pool, kids pool, splash pad. We didn‚Äôt use the basketball court, mini golf or arcade but liked it was there! Easy walk to Disney shuttle. Parking was $18/day.

Carmen our waitress was very friendly and helpful during our stay in the dining area even after hours. Thank you for such great service. Also, the maid named Angelina did excellent service to my room! Thank you Homewood Suites Anaheim

We have being coming here for 3 years and we love it here.  It is close to the convention center and the Disneyland parking.  It is walking distant to restaurants and stores.  The staff here including Antonio from Reservation and Melissa Sales are awesome.  They have gone beyond to make this stay for our team perfect.

We recently stayed for three nights at the end of June 2018. This hotel did not disappoint. It really is a gem of a property, with close proximity to the Toy Story Disney parking lot shuttle or a 25 minute walk to the front entrance of Disneyland hotel or main gate entrance. The rooms are well appointed and have full kitchens with all the items you need to prepare or at least reheat a meal. The refrigerator is full sized and the bed was extra comfy. The room is tastefully decorated and is modern and clean. This is by far the best three star hotel I have ever stayed at and we are avid travelers. The pool area is lovely and has a a small but fun kiddie splash zone,kiddie pool, larger pool, jacuzzi, barbecue grills, and a game room along with clean outdoor restrooms near the pool

We came for a volleyball tournament. This is our 3rd year staying at this hotel. Love the service, the breakfast, the suite. I get sad everytime we leave but we will be back. Hopefully for a family vacation.

Nice room and free dinner and breakfast. I love this hotel and will definitely come back again. Only problem with this hotel is sometime the carpet smells and there is only two elevators which seem to take forever but other than that the service here is very good. I love Steward. He is the guest manager and took good care of me. Very young and cute too.

Back again!!!!! Came last year 2017, back June 2018! I‚Äôm a repeat offender.   Called asked for Ben (he helped me last year) come to find out he is now the GM! Not surprised at all, and good for him.  Spoke with Alejandra! She is GREAT! They are helpful beyond belief.  Never quote policy, just try and solve problems and assist.   Place is the same. Free breakfast, waffle station, juice, eggs, hash browns, hard boiled, ham, toast, yogurt, fruit, oatmeal, coffee.  The front lobby has a coffee station that's available all day long, creamers, etc.   Facilities, are still clean.  Someone is always mopping or wiping something.    Parking is $10 self park, and Toy Story shuttle to Disney is right next door.   If I could change a thing or two, the pool towels are tiny.  So either know

This was the best hotel we've stayed at for our Disney vacation. Very, very clean. I have asthma and therefore have bad allergies. I usually get really stuffed up and end up with a sinus infection after staying at hotels. This time I did not get sick in any way. 7 nights of comfortable sleep! It was AWESOME!! Friendly and helpful staff. Complimentary breakfast was good. God willing, we will definitely be staying here again. Can't wait!

Summary Heading: Excellent Hospitality, Very Clean, Modern & Family Friendly
Summary: I‚Äôve stayed at this hotel for all of my family‚Äôs Disneyland trips this year. The hotel is within walking distance from the park & has very updated, modern & clean family friendly rooms from a Studio rooms to full on Family Suites, equipped with everything you may need.   If your room is missing something give the front desk a call & they‚Äôre always happy to assist & accommodate you! Moreover the staff overall, from maintenance to the maids & the management, are very nice & try to accommodate & assist you to make your stay more comfortable & enjoyable. The hospitality of the staff is great! I needed a couple specific pots to make dinner one night & the maid & front desk staff took the time to find what I needed. Though some may not consider this a big deal it‚Äôs a small gesture

Summary Heading: Great for families! 5min to Disney and right across from convention center!!
Summary: We came for VidCon and stayed 7 days at this hotel. Admittedly, I debated between this location and the Doubletree then decided to go here. It was wonderful staying at this location. The staff is friendly and very helpful with directing you around the area. They also offer a grocery service which was perfect for my family. We weren't there for disney but did get a chance to watch the fireworks from our room and saw the Toy story lot just behind the hotel for the Disney shuttle. The only small disappointment was the breakfast. The options were minimal and personally I didn't care for the taste. I was relieved for the pancakes and waffles or cereal. All in all i would definitely stay again and just have breakfast else where some times.

A very nice (typical) Hilton Homewood Suites right by Disneyland. Very Clean and within easy walking distance of Disneyland and Downtown Disney. If you are looking for a bargain price because the Disney properties are too expensive his is often a great choice. If there is a convention in town the prices can spike but otherwise they are quite reasonable.

My family and I stayed at the property for VidCon, it's about a 6 minute walk to the Anaheim Convention Center. Parking was expensive ($18.00 a day), the breakfast and evening reception was great. We had some running above us during the night, but security took care of it.  The only other problem that we experienced was the cleaning service entering our room when the do not disturb sign was displayed and we spoke with the front desk, who reassured us that the room would not be entered while we were gone, but do to the language barrier the promise was not kept! We had left all of our belongings out, thank God nothing was stolen. The staff is friendly and the property is nice and clean. Despite the issues we had, we would stay again.

This hotel has beautiful facilities including pool area. Staff is helpful and welcoming. Found us a Los Angeles Tour picking up from the hotel.Convenient shuttle to Disneyland. Great breakfast to start the day.

Stayed for a volleyball tournament and loved it.  Great service and atmosphere.  Employees were very friendly and helpful.  Would recommend to family and friends.  The price was just right.  Walking distance to Dineyland shuttle and convention center. Can't wait to go back!

always awesome have stayed here 4 yrs in a row best value and hotel for the money on the strip pool hottub free breakfast a dinner social and the friendliest staff ever PLUS they clean all the carpets every day and it smells super fresh oh and free coffee tea 24/7 in the lobby

Stayed at the Homewood Suites Anaheim Resort-Convention Center while in the area visiting customers. The hotel is a quick walk across the street from the convention center, and about a 20~25 minute walk to the gates of Disneyland. This is obviously a popular hotel with Disney visitors as the hotel was very busy. The front desk staff could not have been friendlier. The hotel being newer, the entire property is very nice. the room was spotless, the sleep quality excellent. (I had a room in the back of the hotel, only a little noise from the floors above.) The evening reception was the best I have seen at a Homewood in a long time, great selection, plenty of food. Breakfast was the same. Parking is $18.00 per night, however, if you are going to Disney, you can leave the car and

Lots of friendly employees who love there job.  Breakfast and light dinners are wonderful.  This is a must stay.  Elsa Lopez is a great host, very pleasant and constantly clean picking up after people so very clean and yet always has a smile on her face.

We are a family of 5! Our kids are 14, 10 and 3!  I always book suites when we are traveling for extended number of days because I just need the space!  We have stayed at many Homewood Suites over the years, but this location by far exceeded our expectations.  The place is newer and a bit smaller in size for the suite, than other Homewoods we have stayed at, but we loved this one the most.  The breakfast buffet was amazing, the staff always kept everything filled and clean and neat.  All the staff was friendly and nice.  Everything we used was operating fine and no issues.  I say this because it never fails some hotel has something that doesn't work whether it be an elevator, or the bathroom sink or whatever.  My kids loved the outdoor area from the pools, the kiddie pool, the

this is an awesome hotel to stay. Everything was perfect. In our opinion things could have not been better. Everything!!!  The staff done a great job, the hotel was immaculate, the location was perfect, the food both morning and night was awesome,  Wow, what a stay..  Would stay here again for sure.. If you stay here you will feel the same way after...

Check in was easy. There were no bell men, nor was their an available luggage cart. This was the worst thing that happened during our trip.   Our room was clean and we had a partial fireworks view. There was a small kitchenette, dining table, couch, chair, coffee table with a poof under it, and a tv in the front room. The bedroom had 2 Queen beds and a much appreciated ceiling fan. The air conditioning worked well. The bathroom had the tub/shower and toilet. The sink and small counter were outside of the bathroom in part of the bedroom.   I am not a fan of buffets, but theirs was an exception. They had oatmeal, cereal, make yourself waffles, yogurt, fruit, and juices daily. Their other items changed daily. We had biscuits, folded eggs, and sausage patties one day- things for a

Our group of 2 adults, 4 kids fit comfortably in the king/bunkbed/sofabed suite. The room was clean, checking in and out was a breeze, the kids loved the pool area and the morning breakfast was really good with a variety of food that left everyone happy and full for a long morning at Disneyland. I'd like to say a special note of appreciation to Solomon who works with the hotel as a driver. He drove us to and from the airport and the parks every day that we were there. He was prompt, courteous and didn't scare these laid-back Oregonians driving through  southern California traffic. We liked and appreciated him as much as the hotel.

This is a great hotel!! The complimentary breakfast and evening social were great!! Besides the parking rates/fees and limited parking spaces, I have no complaints. I'll definitely stay again, when I'm in the area.

Summary Heading: Would highly recommend the ‚ÄúHomewood Suites by Hilton‚Äù on Harbor Blvd in CA.
Summary: We were here for my daughters graduation present from Marysville Wa. and had booked originally at another hotel that had changed ownerships and was very dirty. We they were able to accommodate us and get us in right away to the Homewood Suites by Hilton. Andres M. and staff were all so friendly and helpful. The hotel was very clean and had a full yummy breakfast. Rooms were very clean. Beds and pillows very comfortable. The location of the hotel was close to Disneyland with a shuttle.  Starbucks and Red Robin in the parking lot. The pool was beautiful and recently renovated. Thank you Andres M. for making our stay wonderful. Definitely will stay here again! T and J

One of my better stays. Great service and great food. If you‚Äôre on a family vacation with children this place is for you. Family environment and is not far from Disneyland. My kids loved it. During dinner hours food was served and the woman serving us was wonderful. Extremely attentive. Great service during my stay. If you don‚Äôt have kids you may want to stay somewhere else. Very family oriented hotel. Great for families.

We were just here for two nights at this wonderful property. Loved the room set up with the bunk beds for kids. Our daughter who is very picky said the mattress was very ‚Äúcomfy‚Äù on all 3 bunk beds.  Loved the dinner reception Monday night with wine and beer. Breakfast here was better than the other Homeood we stayed at in San Diego. Employees were friendly and hardworking. Didn‚Äôt have time to use the pool, but looked inviting. It‚Äôs a good 15-20 minute walk to Disney, but not bad. Parking is reasonably priced at $18 plus tax. Good job to everyone at this property!

I can't say enough about our stay at Homewood Suites. Clean rooms, convenient bus to DL right next door, complimentary breakfast and dinner! The kids loved the pool, basketball, outdoor movie and arcade. Thank you, Homewood!

Had king bed with bunk beds and a trundle bed. Had living room and kitchen with full fridge, stove, etc. Best hotel I‚Äôve ever stayed in. Staff was awesome. Breakfast had huge selection and also received complimentary dinner that was good as well.

Not only free hot breakfast but their Monday-Thursday dinner ‚Äúsocial‚Äù was a full hot meal! Including fresh baked chocolate chip cookies! Great variety of outdoor activities.  Another perk is the property is located right next to Disney parking, so you can walk to that shuttle & ride in for free!!

A quick trip to Disneyland with my daughter and granddaughter. We only stayed for one night this time, but it was just as awesome as previous stays. The front desk staff (Christian and Victoria) were so friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and large with a full kitchen (no oven), two queen beds and a living area. With a baby in tow, and all the extra stuff needed, we used every inch of the room. Location to Disneyland is great. We walked back and forth (about 20 minutes one way), never using the shuttle offered at the Toy Story Parking Lot ( you need to fold up the stroller, hold all your stuff and the baby when accessing the shuttle, so we just decided it was easier to walk).   We enjoyed the breakfast and evening social. Food was tasty and fresh. Always well stocked. Much

We had a fantastic experience here! We booked it as a good neighbor hotel for our Disneyland trip. We chose it for the in room kitchenette, the complementary breakfast and close proximity to Disneyland. The breakfast is a huge spread of all sorts of different items with a different ‚Äúspecial/theme‚Äù each morning. It was more than enough food to get us through the day. We read some comments saying to go early so that the food would not run out but that‚Äôs something I would not even worry about. We were very pleasantly surprised to find out that Monday to Thursday there is a complementary evening social which is a full blown meal and beer and wine to go with it (free, must be of age). If you are able to make it back to the hotel for this you definitely should! It was very tasty,

We loved this hotel. It was Perfect for a family of five! The triple bunk bed was a lifesaver as our kids usually fight about who would be sleeping in the extra bed. The pool was amazing and there was a basketball court and putt putt for my son. It was a Clean and quiet hotel that was family friendly.  The hot breakfast and dinner was also a huge perk in a money saver in the big picture. If we ever make it back to California, we know where to stay!

Loved our suite room, very clean and lots of room. The breakfast was a great value and the  complementary dinner was great too. Liked the fact the you had a lot of items to choose from including beer and wine.

Summary Heading: Great for families traveling to Disneyland
Summary: Our family of 6 was comfortable in our one bedroom suite. Breakfast was very good and the staff works really hard to keep bringing out fresh food and clean the tables during the busy breakfast rush. Front desk staff was friendly and helpful. Shuttle bus from Toy Story lot was convenient and easy for getting to the park. Pool area is very nice, especially fire pit in the evening. Overall a wonderful stay!

We just returned from a family vacation to Disneyland and chose this hotel as our place to stay.  We arrived in the morning before the posted check in time, and the hotel allowed us to park our vehicle and store our bags.  It was a short walk to the Toy Story parking lot next door.  There we were able to quickly hop on a free shuttle that took us right to the Disney Transportation center just outside the main gates.  The hotel is also close enough to Disney to walk, but the shuttles were very convenient.  Our hotel room was spacious and had a fridge, microwave and stove top. We also took advantage of the morning hotel breakfast, which provided a variety of both hot and cold items.  The food was pretty good and allowed us to quickly grab a bite to eat before heading into the

The hotel was very nice, clean, and in a good location for our travel plans. The hotel service was also very good. The breakfast and dinner available was convenient and the food was better than any free breakfast we have experienced at a hotel. We especially enjoyed the service from Elsa in the dinning area. She was always friendly and willing to help. Had a great stay and would recommend.

Large family gathering for five day visit to Disneyland over five days with very young children.  Outstanding service from staff began with efforts by Victoria to get rooms as close as possible with quietest possible location for naps.  Front desk service was highlighted by pleasant interchanges with Christian and others.  We took full advantage of and enjoyed hot breakfasts and a couple of evening receptions.  Numerous visits were made to the pool, hot tub, and game room.  Thanks for a wonderful stay!

Summary Heading: GREAT Location and Stay for families going to Disneyland and California Adventure
Summary: The hotel is right next to the Toy Story lot so a short walk gets you on the free shuttle which drops you off right at the Disney gate. We were traveling with a large group of students which can be hassle for many hotels, but they just smiled through it. They never seemed annoyed or put out and were very patient with the chaperones. The breakfast area was very large and well stocked so the kids moved through quickly. The rooms are HUGE and I'm going to need to find out where those pillows are from because they were SO comfy! Loved this hotel and LOVED the staff.

I have had two wonderful stays at this hotel so far. The location is perfect for Disneyland and for the convention center. The rooms are great, the staff is wonderful, and the overall experience was awesome! My 3 teenage kids had a blast!

Summary Heading: Great family hotel but rooms can be loud.
Summary: My family and I stayed here during a trip to Disneyland. The rooms are clean but a little on the small side and can be very loud. The hotel has five floors and we stayed on the third floor facing the pool and we could hear the people above us walking. At times it sounded like they would come crashing through the ceiling. The hotel offers a good breakfast in the morning and has a nice but simple dinner option Mondays through Fridays. The hotel's location is great if you need to go to the Anaheim Convention Center. It's about a mile away from Disneyland but there is a shuttle next door that guests can use from the Disneyland parking lot.

This was a great experience with plenty of amenities and wonderful service. The Homewood Suites is clean, spacious and everything is up to date. It's location is also fantastic for Disney and other Anaheim events, Knotts, Angels game etc...

We had an okay stay. Hotel is newer and the amenities (kiddie pool, breakfast, bbq, etc.) are great. We slept well, and the suite was good enough for three of us.
