Guest services was polite and always willing to help.   It would have been five stars but there were issues with cleanliness and housekeeping.  We had booked a king suite with bunk beds but we found a bug crawling in our bed when we checked it. It was NOT a bedbug, and they sent someone up from housekeeping to confirm that. Nevertheless, we didn‚Äôt want to stay in that room anymore, so they offered to move us to the other side, two queen premium suite.   The suite hadn‚Äôt been set up, so we had to call down to get the coffee replenished. That‚Äôs when they realized they didn‚Äôt stock the room with snacks (I guess premium
Manager Response: Hello plural39,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us, and I am very sorry to hear that you recent stay with us was just okay. From the mattress pad to the service you received from both our housekeeping and breakfast teams, I cannot apologize enough for any inconvenience we may have caused, and please know that we hold ourselves to an extremely high standard. I will, most definitely, be following up with the team in regards to your feedback so we can prevent these type of issues from happening again. I hope that your future plans will bring you our way again, and I would love to assist in accommodating you at that time so we can provide you with a much better impression. Again, please accept my sincere apologies, and if you would like to discuss anything further, please do not hesitate to contact me directly at the hotel.  Thank you,  Benjamin  Assistant GM

Summary: This was our second trip that we stayed there. The staff is always ready to take care of your needs. We had a couple of minor issues in our room and they had people respond to take care of it within minutes of reporting it to the front desk. In the breakfast/dinner area, Carmen was always there to take care of us. She was always busy doing something, but would stop what she was doing to help us and the other customers. She was awesome. The only downside to the hotel was the beds. They were on the firm side. We like a softer bed. Still a great place to stay and I highly recommend it.

Great family oriented hotel next to Disney Parking/Shuttles. Pool area was clean and complimentary breakfast was worth it $. Right next to the Disney Parking lot to catch the shuttles.  Had a wonderful time and customer service was outstanding.

Location  is excellent  for Disneyland . Free breakfast and dinner  was awesome. Very friendly  Front desk staff.  BRUCE THE SECURITY  officer, was very nice to our family. Great accommodation  for kids. LOVE THE FACT THEY HAD MOVIE NIGHT FOR THE KIDS AROUND THE 3FT KIDS POOL.

We stayed here a few days for our Disney vacation. We found it to be very nice. The hotel is very modern, and the amenities were great. Staff was very friendly. Provided breakfast and social hour is great. Highly recommend.

All I can say is wow! This hotel smelled clean as so as I walked in. The staff was super friendly and accomadating when the room I booked was available. Hotel is close to plenty of shops and restaurants within walking distance. We used the Toy Story parking lot near the hotel to catch a free ride to Disneyland everyday! My family and I truly enjoyed our stay and will visit this establishment again in the near future. My daughter especially enjoyed the kiddie pool and little splash play area!!

Hockey Tournament at the Anaheim Rinks!!! Chose this hotel based on location and accommodations. We are a family of 5 and the room was perfect for us. Pool area is fantastic. They have light dinner and drinks during the week and also a movie for the kids outside during the week. Parking is my only complaint. We had to circle a few times a couple of days for a spot. If I am paying, I should have a spot when I pull in. That is the only negative I have. Breakfast is great!!! They serve different stuff everyday. It does get VERY crowded in the eating area. FYI. Location is excellent! We walked to Downtown Disney. 10 minutes to the rink.  Melissa and Antonio are amazing. If you need to book for a group, make sure you speak to one of them. They will help you with everything along the

We've been doing a once-a-year family trip to Disneyland the last 10 years. We have stayed in the resorts and Disney partner hotels in the past. We found this hotel 3 years ago it is perfect. I am very picky on Hotel's let me tell you this hotel is well kept up and looks new. Complimentary breakfast every morning. Free happy hour Monday through Thursday beer and wine Plus food. The service is awesome. Antonio reservation manager is a great asset to this Hilton! Couple more things the hotel has a awesome pool, arcade basketball court, golfing. To be honest I hate giving up my secret Jewel hotel but this hotel deserves it. Thank you Homewood Suites Hilton see you next year!!

We stayed for six nights in May and found the hotel to be perfect - two grandparents in a separate suite and the two parents and four kids in the family suite with bunks and a rollaway bed brought in. The bunks had a lower trundle that pulled out to sleep a total of three so each kid had their own bed and parents slept in the king size bed. Everyone was in the same room but parents could have slept in the pull-out bed in other room for privacy. Be sure to request this type of family suite if you want it because there is another type that has two queen beds plus a pull-out bed in the living room. We mistakenly booked that and the hotel was amazing at upgrading us to the bunk suite, and not charging for the upgrade! The grandparent's suite had a lovely view of the Disneyland

At the last minute, we changed hotels while in Anaheim.  We did not have a reservation, but the person at the front desk was extremely helpful in finding accommodations for us.  We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Homewood Suites.  There is an exercise room, a nice pool area, wading pool, BBQ area, putting green, and basketball court.  The breakfast buffet was above average.  The walk to the Disneyland parking lot and shuttle is fairly close - maybe 10 minutes.  We would definitely stay again.

Summary Heading: Very convenient location, did pretty well with area power outage. Too much FRAGRANCE
Summary: I spent 3 days in mid May and overall the experience was good.  Rooms were clean, bed was VERY comfortable and breakfast/dinner and beer/wine service was better than average for Homewood brand.  The biggest complaint I have, which might make me stay elsewhere, is that they use far too much fragrances in products used throughout the building.  It is overpowering in the lobby area and rooms.  I had to switch and wait well over an hour for a room that didn't have the heavy spray freshener in the rooms.  Come on guys...that crap is toxic to many of us and for some of us can send us into medical treatment!!!    There was a power outage caused by a transformer explosion in the neighboring hotel that got worse when the 8" main line in the street also blew up and melted.  Power went

This was the first time at this resort. It was so convent that it is close to Disneyland, my children were able to go by everyday. Breakfast and dinner was excellent, and had a great atmosphere. Thank you to the amazing staff who made it feel like home.

Summary Heading: Excellent value, friendly staff, clean hotel!
Summary: We stayed at the Homewood Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center for the first time last week and we had a wonderful stay. The room was very clean, spacious and had a full kitchen which was great for our group of 6. The staff went above and beyond to make sure our stay was great. The complimentary breakfast and evening social were wonderful, delicious food and lots of it. We had about a 15 minute walk to Disney which was nice to wind down from the day but if we were tired we could take the shuttle to the Toy Story parking lot next door. Our kids loved the pool, games room and golf area and we enjoyed a BBQ out by the pool one night, it was a nice break from the hustle and bustle of Disney! All in all we had a wonderful time and look forward to coming back!

Very friendly staff- checkin gal was extremely pleasant. Breakfast staff efficient and nice. No one who works here was grumpy-- they all seemed happy to be there. Complimentary breakfast was one of the best we've had. Food was tasty and not dried out like other places. Rooms were very spacious and clean. Only 2 minor issues: 1. don't know if this was just our room because of the people who were above us but could hear the people walking around at nite 2. a little further to walk to disneyland than some other hotels- you could always take a quick uber or the bus if you didn't want to walk.  These are not "deal breakers" though. Totally recommend this place based on the great staff, cleanliness, and breakfast.

We were very happy with this hotel - easy walking distance to Disneyland Park with free shuttle bus at a parking lot next to the hotel if you didn‚Äôt want to walk. Our room was spacious and clean. The check-in staff were welcoming and efficient. Breakfast was good as was the free coffee/tea which is available at any time. We enjoyed the Tuesday night free salad evening and would like to commend one of the staff, Carmen, who assisted us. She was a pleasure to deal with.

Summary Heading: We'll never stay anywhere else when we go to Disneyland!
Summary: Everything about this place was great. We walked to/from Disneyland every day without a problem (about a 20 minute walk). The service was exceptional. The room was well-equipped with a full-size fridge, two burner stovetop, microwave, coffee maker, toaster, plates, cups, flatware, etc. We drove down with a big cooler of food and drinks, BBQed steaks by the pool one night, made pasta the other night, and barely spent any money on food within the park. The breakfast buffet was way above average and the evening social looked good, though we didn't take advantage of it.

We had a wonderful stay here the staff were very friendly and helpful. It is convenient to everything including public transport. Shopping is great. Shuttle to Disney runs on time including pick up. The room was a little smaller than pictured but fully functional for 3 adults and 1 child. The cleaning staff were very attentive and to a high standard. Great toiletries they supplies neutrogena. THANK YOU so much to the wonderful lady in the kitchen who made pancakes for our grandson for breakfast when they were not on the menu, you made his day. Over all great place to stay. Thanks all staff. Go to Target on arrival they have a grocery store at the back and lots of Disney merchandise

We were at Homewood in the middle of the week for one night as the next day we had a school group visit to Disneyland Park. We had a late check-in but when we got there they had a power outage on entire block. We went out to dinner hopping when we get back power will be back. We came back and still had the same problem. Long story short the whole thing took until 5:00 am next day to be resolved and we gave up to sleep in the dark, so we can make it early next day. Hotel was nice enough not to charge us anything and let up park the car there for over night and for the next day which we came by from Disneyland almost 9:00pm.  We had a bad experience because of the power outage but everyone in the hotel was nice and took care of use anyway they could. I think everyone handle

Summary Heading: Simply the Bad and Good List
Summary: I think it‚Äôs best to just list the Bad and Good  about this hotel because I experienced both:  The Good -Two room suite with 2 queen bedroom was clean (floor, furniture, bathroom, counters) and spacious  -Fully equipped kitchen with top range, refrigerator, dishwasher and dishes -Flat screen TV‚Äôs in bedroom and living room with many channels including movies -Bathroom with toilet and shower in separate room from sink/ mirror  - Other extras- Full length mirror, iron/board, own air conditioner in each room, ceiling fan, plenty of electrical plugs in room, nightlight in bathroom, security safe -Walking distance to shuttle bus stops, some restaurants, convenient stores and  Enterprise car rental.  If 10-15 minute is considered close to you then there is Disneyland.  - Free

Summary Heading: Homewood Suites - We will DEFINITELY be back!
Summary: We have stayed in Anaheim numerous times. I have personally stayed at approximately ten different properties around Disneyland. I have finally found my true love! Homewood Suites is everything you need and want in a hotel. The highlights of our stay include the wonderful buffet breakfast every morning (there is something for everyone), the large pool which my kids (ages 13 and 9) loved, and the evening dinner social which is a HUGE bonus (I have never experienced this anywhere else). The rooms were large and provided everything you need during your stay. The staff throughout the hotel was always helpful and accommodating. I have been telling numerous friends and family since coming home how wonderful our stay was. I would highly recommend this hotel. You won't be disappointed.

I love this place. Usually stay here when coming to Disneyland.  This time it was Britney that was helpful, nice, patient and accommodating!  Awesome.  Breakfast and dinner also makes this a nice place to stay with the family.

The hotel staff at the front desk, the evening reception (especially Elsa Lopez), and the hoisekeeping were fantastic.  The rooms, pool, basketball, and golf were equally as fantastic.  Highly recommend staying here.

Summary Heading: You should stay here! Best service and rooms are great!
Summary: You should definitely stay with them. The staff is very friendly, knowledgeable and efficient. They do it all with a smile on their face. The breakfast is wonderful and the dinner social is delicious. Pool area makes you feel like you are on vacation!

Summary Heading: Wonderful stay within walking distance of everything I needed
Summary: I was attending a convention at the Anaheim Marriott, and the Homewood Suites was a 5 minute walk from there. It was also next door to the Toy Story parking lot, so I was able to walk there and catch the free shuttle to Disneyland. Also, the Lux Bus has a pick-up stop for Universal Studios in front of the Anaheim Marriott, so that was a short walk also. My stay was 9 nights, and all the staff were wonderful. I emailed my grocery list prior to my stay, and my groceries were in the kitchen/fridge when I checked in. The daily breakfast was really good, as was the evening social. The free wine and beer at the evening social was a nice accompaniment. The room was very clean, and the housekeeping staff were accomodating with my varied schedule.

Summary Heading: Families visiting Disneyland or Convention Center, this place is a must.
Summary: We have stayed here 8 times and they are still is as good as our first visit.  Our last visit was in April and will be back Mother's Day Weekend.  We like them because they are family oriented, feel safe, clean, selection of food for breakfast and social hour, pools and activities, and great customer service.  When you can remember peoples names after a great trip, it leaves an impression on you.  Victoria checked us in, there was an issue the room.  She personally came up to our room and moved us to a new one. Instead of having us go down and get a new key for a new room.  The service staff are very hard working especially during the busy breakfast and social hour.  Elsa L. took care of our family.  Checking out my 4 year old daughter made a thank you card to the staff and

Good hotel with the advantage of free breakfast and happy hour at night. A lot of families were taking advantage of this perk. Lot of selection for breakfast including eggs, bacon, sausage, hashbrowns, rice and beans, etc.. Did not do nightly happy hour but looked like a good assortment of food and beverages. Easy walk to Disneyland or take Toy Story Shuttle from parking lot next door.

We had a brief, but enjoyable stay. Parking was very convenient, and a little cheaper than the Disney lot. It's a seven minute walk from the hotel to the Toy Story Parking Shuttle stop. Nice, clean suite that includes a small living area and kitchenette. There was a very good selection of breakfast items, including a variety of juices and healthy selections (oatmeal, fruit) along with the usual bacon and eggs. We lucked out, because despite it being a long trek to our room, being at the end of the hall away from the main elevators meant a minimum of noise. Only real con to the hotel is that there are no affordable restaurants or grocery stores nearby.

This hotel was wonderful for our family trip to Disneyland. Free hot breakfast saved us a ton of money. Staff was great to deal with. Hotel was clean and modern. Room was comfortable. View of fireworks every night was a huge bonus. Less than 5min walk to the free Toy Story shuttles to Disney. 100% exceeded our expectations. We were thrilled.  Please note, MAKE SURE THAT YOU BOOKED THIS LOCATION AND NOT THE  12005 Harbor Blvd LOCATION! Our travel agent made that mistake and we had to spend a night at the other one before we could be moved to the correct one (Convention Centre). The other location is old, dirty, and had horrible service.

Pros: Social Hour & Breakfast is amazing for families staying in Anaheim.  Great food selection too.  Staff are friendly & helpful.  Cons: not really sound proof enough, can hear people above us walking around super early (5:30am) and late at night.  Thin duvets, so make sure to ask for an extra blanket.  Rooms could use a more thorough cleaning; & we tip every day.  Internet really sucks, after paying premium.  The noise & internet is the only thing we're really dissatisfied with, the others are minor nuisances as we can remedy by asking the staff who are really accommodating.  Would stay here again next trip, would just request the top floor if possible.
Manager Response: Hello Dianne B,  Thank you for such detailed feedback, and for choosing to stay with us! Noise is a tough issue to tackle, but we are most definitely monitoring it and taking your feedback into consideration as to what we can do to improve on this area. For the Internet, I am happy to let you know that we have just upgraded the speed, and I apologize that you were not able to enjoy this as planned during your recent stay, but I am hoping you will return so we can create a much better impression. Thank you again for your time in providing this feedback, and if you have any further questions or concerns, please do not hesitate in contacting the hotel directly so we can better assist you.  Sincerely,  Benjamin  Assistant GM

Summary: Travelling from Sydney Australia and following lots of research on Anaheim accomodation, my son and I choose Homewood Suites Convention Center for our April stay. This is one of the newest properties in the area, with a breakfast room, large suites, kitchenette, easy walk to Toy Story Shuttles to Disneyland and most important, excellent staff in both breakfast room and front desk area.   We stayed for 9 nights and will stay again on our next visit. Thank you for making our stay so fantastic.

Stayed in a 1 bed suite with 2 beds.Rooms were a great size,clean comfortable and catered well for us (2 adults and 2 children).Hotel is in a great location with about a 15 minute flat walk to Disney.Toy Story carpark is close for free shuttle,but lines can be long so we found it quicker to walk there.Shuttle is good option for return as walking around all day can be tiring.Staff at hotel were great with reception letting us check in 2 hours early after a very early arrival from Australia.They have a light evening meal (monday-thursday) which a lot of people took advantage of.As well as the food they have also beer and wine.This is great touch by the hotel as I think it saves a lot people a lot of money.My biggest gripe with the hotel is the breakfast.Yes there is plenty of

Great place, great location, EXCELLENT staff! They were accommodating and very friendly. We stayed 5 nights, we had a large group of people (20). All of us, oldest to youngest, was treated with the same professionalism and kindness. Top notch place.

Summary Heading: Might be best Hilton stay ever
Summary: I don‚Äôt write many reviews but this hotel deserves a review.  Clearly five stars.  Breakfast was awesome.  Good variety.  They keep the area very clean.  Lite dinner Monday thru Thursday.  Lite?!  It‚Äôs a buffet with beer and wine.  Pool looked nice but it was too cool to enjoy that.  And the toy story parking lot is right next door.  A very easy walk to save $20 in Disney parking.  Overall.  Excellent!!!

Breakfast buffet was busy every morning but constantly cleaned and restocked by 3 staff. Room was spacious, clean and quiet. We were in town to visit Disneyland. We took a Lyft to the park each day and then road the Disney Toy Story parking lot shuttle home each night. We had a bedroom and sitting room suite with a small kitchen. Hotel had everything we needed and more, I would definitely recommend!

The kids and the chaperones loved it! Very friendly staff. We were taken well care of. I lost my wallet at the hotel & then got it shipped the same day. Nothing was missing and the staff was very formal about it :)

We stayed here for a volleyball tournament at the Anaheim Convention Center. After years of hotel stays for my three kids travel sports, this hotel was literally the best yet. The complimentary breakfast is ample and varied, with a ‚Äúspecial‚Äù each day. Each room has a full kitchen which we used for lunch and late night snacking. The full size frig was awesome. The rooms also have two separate areas - one for sleeping and one for living. Our room also had a King size bed with bunk beds and a trundle - genius move on their part. My family of five loved it! No one on the floor or the pull out couch. The pool area has a hot tub and three grills. We had our season end team dinner (grilled and used the microwave) for 30 in the lobby area. Everyone was so nice and accommodating.

Here for Girls National Volleyball Championship. Hotel was in a great location for the Convention Center.  Breakfast was wonderful and the evening reception was extremely enjoyable.  Carmen was our attendant and she was courteous, efficient and helpful.  We would definitely stay there again.

This hotel was great for our FFA chapter during the convention. It had close proximity to the convention center, disneyland, and other stores/restaurants. They have a complimentary breakfast and dinner social that really helped save costs. The rooms were big and the staff was great. We will be booking again for next year.

We stayed here for one week for a combination family and business trip. We will absolutely stay again. The location is very convenient to the convention center and the park.  The rooms are designed for extended stay and have a kitchenette (no oven) and sitting room. I would love a balcony and a stronger hair dryer but no other complaints about the room. Every morning there is a generous breakfast with small variations each day - waffles, sausage, cereals, yogurt, plenty of juice and rotating items such as biscuits and gravy and Mexican style breakfast items. It is always busy but they usually had 3 staff members helping keep it stocked and cleaning tables. Great way to start your day. The evening reception included wine and a light meal Mon - Thurs and we attended every evening.

We had a great experience at the hotel and it was within easy access to Disneyland (walking); a short drive to both John Wayne Airport and the Angels Stadium.  We would stay here again as this was a great experience.

We stayed at the Homewood Suites beside the Disney parking lot. It was a great hotel. We stayed on the 5th floor and faced Disneyland so that we had a view of the fireworks ( which was fantastic) when we weren‚Äôt at the park. It was extremely quiet, the beds were comfortable. We stayed in a suite that had a king sized bed and a bunk bed with a pull out trundle bed, so it would sleep 3!  The morning breakfast and Monday to Thursday evening reception saved us a lot of money. Lots of food choices. The staff were all extremely friendly and hard working to keep everything in order. The hotel is right beside the toy story parking lot so you can easily catch a free bus to the park. Great hotel. We would stay here again and recommend it to friends.

Summary Heading: Absolutely perfect for families going to Disneyland!
Summary: Only a half block walk to the Toy Story parking lot where you can ride a free bus to Disneyland.  If the line is too long, it's a reasonable 15 minute walk.  Free breakfast and dinner Monday through Thursday! Free alcohol at dinner and free cookies at the evening social.  Layout of the bunk bed suite room was awesome--so spacious with lots of sleeping options.

Summary Heading: Excellent place for a Disneyland Trip
Summary: I have stayed at many Homewood Suites, this by far was the best.   Great choices for food in am and evening.  Excellent service by all interacted with.  Room cleaned very well with added persona; touches never seen before. Shout out to Maribel at front desk.  Very friendly and helpful

Summary Heading: Great property but be careful to check your bill upon check-out
Summary: Homewood is great for families.  The suites with bunk beads are wonderful for the kiddos, and also feature a pull out sofa and full kitchen.  However, be careful of this place. I checked in after using reward points to reserve a suite.  We were given a very small room with just a king bed and a kitchenette.  there was no place for our kiddo to sleep.  They changed the room immediately (but with a tired kiddo, late at night etc. it still took time to go back downstairs, get new keys etc.)  Upon check-out, we asked them just to email our bill as we were anxious to get to Disneyland.  When I checked my credit card statement, they had charged me for the full room amount plus taxes. I had to spend 15 minutes on the phone while they checked that this was in fact a reward reservation
Manager Response: Hello MaddieG,  Thank you for taking the time to provide such valuable feedback! I cannot apologize enough for the inaccuracy of your reservation. I do want to highlight, at the property level, we are unable to make reward redemption reservations, so we assume that our central reservations team are able to confirm every detail, especially the room type reserved and billing. I can tell you that we rarely have this type of billing issue, but please know that I will follow up accordingly to ensure this does not happen again. Thank you again for your time, and for choosing to stay with us, and if your plans bring you back to the Anaheim area, I would love to welcome you back to our hotel!  Thank you,  Benjamin  Assistant GM

Summary: 1. $18 per night for parking 2. 15-20 min walk to Disney, not 5 mins like some other reviews state. Take Uber for $5-6. 3. Quietest floor is 5th floor otherwise you WILL hear noise from above.  4. Pool is small, dirty, no pool towels 5. Hallway carpets are dirty, dirty dishes left for days, same dirty q-tip and debris on carpets the 3 days we stayed, we had housekeeping one time while we were here. They didn‚Äôt clean the other days and we aren‚Äôt sure why they didn‚Äôt.  6. Breakfast is free and average. 7. Room is decent size, seemed clean. Had a heavy orange chemical smell in it and unfortunately the windows don‚Äôt open so no way to air it out.   If they had better housekeeping our experience would have been more positive. We won‚Äôt be returning.
Manager Response: Hello sdes1280,  Thank you for taking the time to provide such valuable feedback! It is evident that your recent stay with us was short of excellent, and for that, I cannot apologize enough. From the parking charges and the noise to the cleanliness of our hotel, we clearly fell short of expectations. Please know that the cleanliness items you have brought to light are not the norm for our team and hotel, as we like to hold ourselves to very high cleanliness standards. Your feedback has been communicated across the board, and we will ensure that these areas do not go overlooked. When time permits, I would love to speak with you further in regards to returning to our hotel to provide us with a second chance at making it right by you and your family. Please contact the hotel directly and ask for myself so I can better assist you.  Again, please accept my sincere apologies, and I look forward to hearing from you,  Benjamin  Assistant GM

Summary: This place is awesome! My family and I stayed for 2 days and what a great hotel and staff. The buffet breakfast was good and the evening complimentary happy hour provided by the hotel was nothing short of actual DINNER. One night we had options of beef and/or pork sliders, a FULL salad bar, Mac n cheese, soft drinks, 2 different types of soup,  rice, wine and beer....all you can eat AND complimentary!! AND it was really good. From check-in to check out, this hotel is an absolute MUST if you're staying anywhere in the vicinity, for whatever your reason.  As far options for dining, there are a few options within 5-10 min walking distance. Ruth Chris, Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles, Morton's Steakhouse, Carl's Jr, etc....a little for everyone's palate and budget. From now on, when we

We went to Anaheim for a short visit and really enjoyed our stay here at Homewood Suites.  It is close enough to Disneyland to walk or take a shuttle if you prefer.  Very clean facilities.  The staff was also helpful with directions and even holding our luggage on the last day.  The complimentary breakfast and dinner are just extra plusses for us.  We don't expect them and this place had good choices for both.  I think we have found our "go to" for the next Anaheim visit.

Summary Heading: Excellent Room at a Great Price!
Summary: We had 4 adults in our party (one our daughter's friend)  and so got two rooms.  One room had a king bed the other 2 doubles.  The king room was spacious with a desk,room fridge, closet, safe, and kitchenette.  The room with 2 doubles was larger, had a small kitchen, 3/4 size fridge, table to eat at and a sofa - it was more of a suite.  I would definitely recommend this if you have kids staying with you in your room.  It is across the street from the park at 1/2 or less of the price.  Breakfast was good with hot food choices but a bit crazy with all the families trying to get to the park in the morning.  If you go later it is much more relaxing time.  Everything was clean, towels were soft and absorbent, shower had good pressure.  Room took a few extra minutes to cool down but

Summary Heading: New/Modern Hotel - five minute walk to Disney parking!
Summary: We had a fabulous stay for 4 nights for our Disneyland trip, I would certainly pick this place again for the future.    Pro's: 1.   Breakfast was great (make your own waffle, hot food, etc...)!!!  It's a buffet and very crowded, sometimes a bit hard to find a table (8am-9am busy!).  However, the hotel is completely prepared for the traffic and there to help clean tables or get you whatever is needed.  I was very impressed with how well this was managed by the hotel.   2.  Very clean and modern!   Note this is not a big Resort like you find near Disneyworld Orlando.   3.  Pool, outdoor fireplace, basketball, and putting green area were really nice.  The pool water was a bit cold (was 55'F outside).  They have a few outdoor grilles. 4.  Our suite room was perfect and generally

Nicely located next to the convention center and near Disneyland (next door to Disneyland parking lot with free shuttle bus to Disneyland).     New, clean and friendly environment. Nice out door area with pool, hot tub, and basket ball court. Great complimentary breakfast selection. The light dinner (Monday to Thursday) option saves us paying for dinner each night. The 2 queen suite fits nicely for 5 people. We will come back to this hotel again.

Summary Heading: Best hotel for a family Disney trip
Summary: Basketball court, adult and kid swimming pools, hot tub, gym, breakfast , dinner, next door to toy story parking so you can ride the shuttle for free to Disney. 2 rooms in 1, Full kitchens 2 full beds 1 pull out couch all of this for the price included in room. Only place I‚Äôll stay from now on.

We had a fantastic stay at the Homewood Suites Anaheim Convention Center.  Any Disney trip with 4 kids over spring break will not be very relaxing, but the Homewood Suites definitely helped our stress level, and made the week enjoyable. The suites were spacious, and we were grateful that our family of 6 could stay in one room in the family suite. The hotel was clean and well kept. The hotel offers a grocery item pick up service, and although we didn‚Äôt use this during our stay, it definitely is a nice service to have. They also have a low-cost local shuttle service that we used to get to the park early for our Magic Morning.  The pool and BBQ area was clean, and my boys liked shooting hoops in the rec area.  There is a large breakfast buffet every morning, as well as a nice

This place is tip top. Evening reception is not to be missed, it‚Äôs much more than the Embassy Suites evening reception. A lot of food is provided as well as beer(s) and wine(s). Their breakfast was quite decent too. The maintenance and housekeeping staff are always in motion here, tidying up, keeping everything clean and comfortable. As busy as they are reminds me a bit of the workers on Carnival cruises. Overall experience rated a four only because I had a non functioning coffee pot, not a kuerig by the way; went to front desk twice asking for a replacement, they brought a brand new one at 3:30 pm. Parking is a bit tight, but doable.

Great, clean hotel close to Disneyland. We were able to easily walk with children ages 4,6,8 and also access the shuttle 5 minutes away at toy story lot.  Room was very clean, housekeeping was excellent. Breakfast was busy, well stocked, and tasty. Staff was top notch, friendly, polite, and efficient.  Pool area was well maintained. Great place and great location, you will not be disappointed!

Summary Heading: Perfect for Disneyland and small kids- wonderful service
Summary: This was the perfect hotel for our family trip to Disneyland.  The room was great- bunk beds for the kids and a wall divider for the king sized bed.  The separate living room, kitchenette allowed my husband and I to have some time while the kids were asleep.  The location to Disney is great- you can get on the Toy Story bus in a 5 min walk.  This hotel has a wonderful complimentary breakfast as well as a evening happy hour.  The evening happy hour was enough of a meal for our kids as we had a big lunch at Disney.  The staff is very nice and helpful.  We will certainly stay here the next time we go to Disney.

Took a trip to Disney decided to stay the night. Arrived to a clean room, comfy bed, quiet hotel. Very family friendly. Great breakfast, coffee was nice and strong enough. Nice pool area didn't get to use it but it was well taken care of. My boys loved the basketball court. Only dislikes had to pay for parking and the later you arrive the less available spots. Breakfast was very good, good variety. Crowded but that's expected especially close to Disney . Other then that I loved it and will be visiting again.

We had such an amazing experience at this hotel.  The staff was very friendly and professional.  Our room was unique with a bunk bed for our kids and a king size bed for my husband and I.  It was spacious enough that during our 5 day stay everyone was comfortable at all times.  We were also pleasantly surprised with the added benefit of a nightly movie at the pool for the kids and a complimentary evening social hour with great food, beer and wine.

Summary Heading: Best choice for a Disney stay
Summary: You absolutely cannot go wrong with choosing this hotel.  Convenient access to Disneyland; via the Toy Story shuttles, which are free. Clean, quiet hotel with comfortable rooms, friendly staff.  Plus you get free breakfast and they have the evening social 4 nights a week.   Plus there is a pool, spa, gaming room, basketball court, putting green AND they offer movies on the big screen outside.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disneyland
Summary: What a great hotel.  Staff was super-nice and helpful, room was very clean, new and modern.  Pool and spa were great.  Tons of other families there so breakfast, happy hour, and the pool were mobbed, but it was a ton of fun.  Walking distance to the free shuttle was also nice.  Would definitely stay again.

We found the Homewood Suites to be very comfortable and accommodating.  The staff members were very friendly and helpful.  Breakfast buffet was excellent and most everyoone's personal preferences were probably met.  In the evenings they had complimentary beer and wine with heavy hour dourves--sufficient to not needing to go out to eat.  We will stay there again.

Summary Heading: Nice place. Clean, Friendly and efficient staff
Summary: I stayed here when I attended wondercon. It was close to the convention center. Had a great complimentary breakfast. Decent fitness center. Comfortable beds and nice kitchen and living area. I would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Solid family option for Disney trip
Summary: We booked this hotel for our spring break trip to Disney.  We have two adults and three kids.   Pros:   -This hotel is less than a mile from the parks and we walked it to and from everyday (some days more easily than others). The to go coffee station will help fuel you for the trek. The streets were well lit and there was security/patrol out all five nights we back in the dark.   -The housekeeping was great and we appreciated the attentiveness our room stuffed with five people for each day.   -The suites have a full functioning kitchen with appliances and cookware, including a full fridge and freezer. This was big for us because we could make/prepare snacks each night for the next day, including freezing water bottles to fill up.   -The hotel offers a breakfast buffet in the

First night: check in, front desk gave us the longest rout me to find out room. After about a day and a half we saw other family going a different way only to find a quick way to the elevator. I had asked for a room away from the ice machine and elevator due to the noise but we were three rooms away but it worked out since we couldn‚Äôt hear much traffic in the halls. Next: hair chunk on the hand towel. Dark hair on wash cloth. Threw them on the ground and checked other towels and The seemed ok but a little yellowish. Noticed after midnight  when we returned from Disneyland to also find no shampoo, conditioner, hand soap but we did have two body soaps. To tired to deal with that at 1 A.M.  other issues occurred since we have been here but the kicker is that I‚Äôm sitting here
Manager Response: Aileen H,  Please accept my sincere apologies for such an inconvenient stay. Clearly, we dropped the ball on more than one occasion and I cannot thank you enough for your patience and time taken the other day to discuss with me about your concerns. Your feedback is extremely valuable to our team, and please know that I have already taken the liberty of following up with the appropriate personnel in regards to each of your concerns. Our priority is our guests, and to ensure that all of our guests have an enjoyable stay from pre-arrival, to departure. I know that our wonderful team will be able to establish a new and lasting impression on you and your family on your future reservations with us! If you have any further concerns or questions, please do not hesitate in contacting myself directly so I can better assist you.  Thank you again for your feedback,  Benjamin  Assistant GM

Summary: For a fam of 4 the king/ bunk beds lay out was great.  Nice that there is a door that closes off the sitting area completely.  Kitchen was adequate for a 3-6 night stay.  B fast is what you expect.  Size of pool worked w traffic at this time of year.  Hotel staff patient and helpful.  We used a car to get to the park rather than walk.  After a long day it was worth the expense.

Summary Heading: Conveniently located, easy walk to Anaheim Convention Center
Summary: I was attending a conference at the Anaheim Convention Center, so I was looking for a clean, quiet place to make my home base that wouldn't require a taxi ride or a long walk to the ACC every day. This Homewood Suites is just pleasant 2 block walk away, and offers quiet, large and comfortable rooms. The free breakfast was very nice too, with make-your-own waffles. But as this hotel is near Disneyland, be aware that you'll likely be sharing your stay with a lot of families with young children. But heck, you could say that about almost all hotels within walking distance of Disneyland...

Homewood Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center (Disneyland)  Value ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ Cleanliness ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ Location ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ Room Comfort ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ  Extras ‚Äì Vons Groceries, City Stroller Rentals are all delivered there. Free WiFi Parking $18 usd  1 KING/BUNK BEDS 1 BEDROOM FAMILY SUITE Our room could easily sleep 7 ‚Äì Beds very comfortable, ground floor, private courtyard with pool view. * 1x King Bed * 3x King Single (bunk this was huge and could easily sleep adults) * 1x double sofa bed that offered good padding.  * Full kitchen  This is value for money! As you know we love to test drive accommodation for our page. This place is amazing, staff are super nice and helpful (a huge shout out to Daniel for exceptional service!). The main foyer always smelt clean and fresh every. We seen the

5 stars all the way. We booked the family bunk suite and it was roomy enough for our party of 3 adults and 3 kids. I used the online check in and chose room 132 because I wanted to have a patio next to the pool. I thought that we could walk out to the pool from our room but that wasn't the case. It had bars that enclosed it which actually turned out to be nice because I could leave the door open and my toddler could walk out there if he wanted and I didn't have to worry about him wandering off. Loved the room and the location. The only negative was that you could hear loud footsteps from the guests above us. The comp breakfast and the evening social made this hotel a great value. Also gave us a late 2pm check out when requested. Every staff member was friendly and helpful and

Summary Heading: Good location, great breakfast, hard beds
Summary: There are some great things about the Homewood Suites, but also the beds and furniture were uncomfortable so it's hard to know just how to rate it. It was a 5 minute walk to the Toy Story park to catch a shuttle bus. The staff was friendly and the rooms were clean, but the family suite was not as spacious as I expected based on the pictures. And there wasn't a lot a lot of seating for a family suite---a couch and a chair. As expected with a sofa bed, the couch was hard. Our group had 9 people in two rooms, and every one of us thought the beds were uncomfortably hard. The breakfasts were great but the dinners not so much. We were there from Mon-Thurs. Mon was, as I was told, "the lightest night" for meals: cheese & crackers, salad and two soups. Tues. was soup & salad night (the

Summary Heading: Wonderful stay for the family! Comfortable, clean and affordable!
Summary: This is a wonderful hotel if you are coming to town for Disneyland! The complimentary breakfast is fantastic-eggs, sausage/bacon, pancakes/waffles/French toast, pastries, yogurt bar, cereal bar, oatmeal, juice. And the complimentary afternoon social is a full meal! These two things saved our family so much money. The suites look brand new-they are very clean and roomy. We had the family suite with bunk bed/trundle. You could easily fit 7-8 people in this suite. And having a full kitchen is fantastic! The staff is friendly and helpful. There is a free shuttle to Disney just down the block, very easy to use. The pool and game area are great-there is a hot tub and a small children's pool, along with an arcade, basketball court and small putting green. Our kids loved it! We will be

My wife and I stayed with our 3 yr old daughter for 3 nights at Homewood Suites Anaheim on our Disney Holiday. The room was very spacious and kitchenette ideal to cook up a hot meal for our daughter. The location was perfect a 5 min walk to the free shuttle to Disneyland. The housekeeping always did a great job of maintaining the room and the rest of the staff especially the front desk was very helpful with any questions or planning needed. The breakfast spread was also very decent.

This is our 3rd stay in 2 years and again we were greeted with a friendly and joyful welcome from Christian and Victoria at the front desk. Our 6 night stay in a two QB and pullout (sleeps 5 easily) with full size fridge, cookware and BBQ to cook my steaks (plus free shopping for food) thanks Ben!  Our room was cleaned by Gvadalupe with care and detail to provide a cute towel elephant to make us laugh. Full Breakfast and fulfilling evening ‚Äúsnack‚Äù (I mean supper) was provided by helpful staff of Carmen, Elsa and Efren and all the other awesome staff! This awesome property is close to the LA REC conference by a 5 min walk and again 5 min walk to free toy story shuttle to Disneyland. A++ well done crew!

Summary Heading: Extremely clean, safe and good location
Summary: A friend recommended this hotel. I found it to be extremely clean and a safe place to stay with my two teenage granddaughters.  It was a great location to the Disney area and to some of the beaches. We came home very late two evenings and felt extremely safe in the parking lot.  I found the price to be very reasonable considering how clean the suite was  and with two free meals each day‚Ä¶breakfast and evening.

We took our grandkids to Disneyland and Homewood Suites was perfect!! Great location and great staff. We really enjoyed Elsa Lopez, the waitress in the dining room. She was very friendly and helpful. We will definitely come back!!

We had a great time at this hotel. People were friendly and helpful, the entire facility was spotless and the location was great. We would certainly stay here again! We were aware of the breakfast (it was much more that we thought it would be) but the social hour was more like dinner and it was a pleasant surprise.

Summary Heading: Great family hotel close to Disneyland
Summary: Very convenient hotel to stay for a Disneyland visit.  5 min walk to the free Disneyland Toy Story parking lot shuttle.  Plus free hot breakfast and Mon-Thurs free, decent dinner/beer/ wine helps saves $

My family stayed here for 4 nights, Sunday to Thursday for a disneyland trip, and had an excellent stay. Our party consisted of 2 adults, 3 year old, and an 8 month old infant in a double queen bedroom suite and had plenty of room. The room was very accommodating and stocked with everything needed in the kitchen for feeding kids and heating milk. The food was well stocked during breakfast and a nice buffet spread. The complimentary dinner during the week was way above my expectations. It was said to be a light dinner and alcohol beverages, but was buffet style also and actually free refills of beer and wine! Our server during the dinner hour was very attentive with keeping our cups filled and making sure we had everything needed with our girls. The server's name was elsa lopez,

My family and I stayed here during our recent vacation to Disneyland, and this hotel exceeded all expectations!  Disneyland was an easy walk from the hotel.  The rooms are spacious and the property was very well maintained.  The warm pool, basketball court, and fire pit area made for fun evenings after a day in the Park.  We really enjoyed the complementary breakfast and dinners.  Complimentary beer and wine in the evenings was a great touch!  All of the hotel staff was very accommodating.  In particular, Carmen and Elsa who worked in the evening dining area, provided absolutely over the top wonderful customer service.  They made my family feel very welcomed and took great care of us.  I would highly recommend this hotel!!!

My family stayed here for four nights (two adults and two kids aged 12 and 16) because it was close to Disneyland.  I reviewed many hotels in the Anaheim/Disney area before I picked this one based on ratings and reviews.  The hotel did not disappoint and deserved the high ratings.  Breakfast each morning was good with quite a few options.  It was convenient to have breakfast over and done before heading out to Disney and based on Disney's prices it also saved us quite a bit of money.  Due to the weather and the fact we spent a lot of time at Disneyland, we only used the hot tub once and didn't get to use the pool at all.  The hot tub was welcome after a long day of walking and the pool and kiddie pool looked nice.  There was also a fire pit and several BBQs for guest use.

Summary Heading: Suite accommodations with great service and meals
Summary: I highly recommend this location. It's a short walk to the convention center. There is a nice outdoor recreation area with pool, spa, basketball and golf putting area. Terrific service, clean rooms and great food.

On a grandkids vacation trip to Disneyland we stayed at the best hotel ever. Besides the great suite which accommodated 4 adults and three boys, the other amenities of a huge heated pool and extra large spa, good breakfast and happy hour light meal, the staff was so very nice. On the evening of my grandson‚Äôs eighth birthday, two very special ladies, Carmen and Elsa, surprised him with a birthday cupcake, balloons, candy and rubber duckies all with the staff singing Happy Birthday to him. What a wonderful thing to do!  I‚Äôm sure it will be a special memory forever. Thank you to them both. It may be a few years before we return but it will definitely be to stay at this hotel. We would give them a 10 star rating!!

Summary Heading: Great stay and value for visiting Disneyland
Summary: We spent 1 night here.  We were able to check in very early prior to the park opening.  The rooms were very clean and spacious.  Breakfast was decent but more importantly was kept well stocked and the staff were very attentive.

Summary Heading: Best place to stay for a Disney family vacation!
Summary: We just had our third stay at this hotel and it was amazing as usual. The customer service on every stay has been top notch. The rooms are clean and comfortable with a kitchen. They even got our groceries for us. The manager Benjamin went above and beyond to make sure that our stay was perfect! The rooms are spacious with room to spread out especially with teenagers.The breakfast was good with lots to choose from. The hotel is just a short walk from the Toy Story parking lot where you can catch the bus to the park. Although, the walk to the park is only 15 minutes.

Summary Heading: Great room, Wonderful staff = Awesome stay.
Summary: We spent 2 nights here for our wedding anniversary/Disney trip. Our room was very clean and comfortable with a fridge, microwave and coffee maker. Nice and convenient amenities. My husband and I enjoyed the evening social which included wine and beer. The daily breakfast had a wide variety of delicious selections, which hit the spot. We especially appreciated the friendly and attentive staff. Front desk, dining area, and all service staff were helpful and accommodating. A gracious thank you to Elsa L., Christian, and Alejandra J., as they went out of their way to make our special occasion  extra special. You made our stay Awesome! We will be back again for sure.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, but way too hot!
Summary: Love the hotel, but the temperature controls in the room are locked to not go below 68 degrees!  For the 3 nights that we stayed we were very hot all night!  Everything else about our stay was outstanding, but not sure we'd stay again.  A good night's sleep is important and not being about to lower the temperature was not good!

My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights during a 3-day conference.  We absolutely loved it! Staff is extremely nice and accommodating- every person from front desk to breakfast staff to maid service.   The rooms are great - all of the amenities are more than one would expect - snack tray, full fridge/freezer, stovetop, dishwasher, coffee, etc.    in the room, they have a ‚ÄòGrocery List‚Äô that you can indicate what you would like purchased and the staff will purchase your items!  We did not use this feature, but in retrospect, we should have! Hotel offers A delicious free breakfast with hot and cold items. On specific days, they do offer free dinner that includes beer and wine :-) We noticed it is a great place for kids‚Ä¶ There are basketball courts, swimming pool/ jacuzzi,

Just spent a week at this hotel while we vacationed at Disney, Universal, and other locations in the LA Area. This hotel has spacious suites and the staff are very accommodating. Excellent service all around. Special mention to Elsa L. down in the dining area - thanks for looking after us Elsa! The hotel is within walking distance to Disney and Garden Walk Mall shopping. It is also right next door to Disney parking so catching the shuttle to the park is handy. I would definitely come back to this hotel next time in Anaheim!

Summary Heading: Excellent stay for all the family
Summary: Loved our stay here, we had a queen sized bed and bunk beds so all were happy! Excellent breakfast, adored the waffles and eggs the complimentary evening meal was great. Staff are friendly and relaxed. Elsa was a great host at dinner and looked after us and service etc was excellent Really glad we booked and would recommend.

This hotel is next to Disneyland parking lot/structure, so the shuttle can be taken to Disneyland. We walked, as it is only 15 minute trek to the Disney park entrance, which is the same time as the shuttle takes. We paid for parking at the hotel, so saved Disney parking charges. The staff is friendly and helpful, and Disneyland tickets can be purchased at the front desk, which we did at check in. Hilton Honors guests get a bag with waters and a snack. The rooms are clean and spacious suites, and have a full kitchen with frig, microwave, dishwasher, toaster, Keurig coffee. We found the rooms quiet and slept well. Nice pool and workout room. The FREE breakfast was exceptional, with coffee, juices, several waffle makers, pancakes, French toast, fruits, oatmeal, eggs, potatoes,

This place has everything any traveller wants and needs, we stayed 7 nights (1 adult 1 child). 2 pools, a spa, small games room for the kids (get your quarters ready), half basketball court, 5 hole putt putt golf, gym, laundry ($2 a load), atm, computer access with printer, free wifi, great sitting area in the lobby, hot & cold buffet breakfast everyday, light supper monday to thursday nights with drinks oh and movies by the pool those nights also, fantastic staff.  Our room:  It was great we had the 2 queen bed suite overlooking the basketball court, the room was spacious with everything you need in the kitchen you just have to supply the food. The food: We both found something to eat at meal times and it was lovely to save some $$, special mention Elsa in the dining room was

Summary Heading: My Stay at Homewood suites in Anaheim
Summary: I consider Hilton treats me as I am one of their family member and they always take care of me and if there is any problem they resolve it or give me free stay. It never happened because they pr5ovide superior service all the time.

Excellent place to stay for our family vacation. Would definitely stay here again. Clean, personable staff, and the meals were excellent. The beds were extremely comfortable. The proximity to Disneyland and the free shuttle was perfect.

Summary Heading: Absolutely the best family stay at Disney
Summary: For our first Disney trip, I shopped around and we ended up at the Best Western Park Place. Overall, it was fine, and the location literally can't be beat, but it was old, run-down, not clean and just kind of icky.  For our second trip, using what I had learned from our first Anaheim experience, I shopped around for MONTHS looking for the best value for our family of 6. Our requirements: adequate room for 6; a good free breakfast included; clean accommodations; not more than 1 mile from the park entrance. Our preferences: a decent pool; a great breakfast; a kitchen/kitchenette; a separate sink area in the bathroom; very clean room.  I booked and cancelled several rooms at highly-rated mid-range hotels on Harbor Blvd. such as: Hyatt House, Hyatt Place, Residence Inn, Springhill

The hotel is centrally located.  We did not walk but took the shuttle to Disney.  The morning breakfast had fruit that we could grab and go.  The coffee quality was average.  At the end of the day the proximity to everything was a big plus.

My family and I stayed here in a two queen 1 bedroom suite. We brought our inflatable toddler mattress for our 2 year old who slept soundly in the living room area. As other reviewers have mentioned, one of the best features of this property is it‚Äôs proximity to the free Toy Story Disneyland parking lot that features the free shuttle too and from the theme parks. On one day where we had booked an early morning character breakfast, it only took us 15 mins to walk to the park with a stroller since the buses didn‚Äôt run that early. Another great plus for this hotel is its complimentary wine and beer with light dinner provided Monday - Thursday. We were able to make use of this on many days as it helped us unwind after a tiring day at the parks. The room was kept tidy and was always

The Homewood Suites has a great breakfast and evening meal.  The staff were all very pleasant and dressed nicely, and made a significant effort to please the guests.  In particular, I would like to recognize Elsa Victor Margarita Jorge for what I consider superior service.

Summary Heading: Best hotel of all our Disneyland trips!
Summary: Breakfast with every food you can think of. Plus Monday to Thursday‚Äôs was full suppers inclusive of wine and beer.  Staff so friendly, especially Elsa, Margarita, Victor and Jorge of the names I can remember. Supper wasn‚Äôt a high end meal but always had veggies, salad and main plus homemade warm chocolate chip cookies to end. So clean, full kitchen and our king room had bunk beds plus single pull out under bunk and pull out couch. Free Disney shuttle within 3 minutes walk. Great staff, always helpful and smiling. Amazing deal! Saved us so much money!

Summary Heading: Nice stay - convenient for Disney visit!
Summary: We stayed at this Homewood Suites for 3 nights starting 1/10/18.  We were impressed with the friendliness and courtesy of the staff from the moment we checked in to the time we checked out!  We checked in about 6:15 pm and were pleased to find the Managers Reception still going on so we didn't have to spend more time in the car to go get supper!  The breakfasts were great (different items every day) and the Mon - Thur evening reception was a nice touch.  The only thing missing that would have improved it would have been to have a soda machine.  If you don't drink beer or wine, your only choice is orange or apple juice, which isn't exactly what I want to drink with pizza.  The facility was neat and clean and our room was very nice.  Parking was easy and the shuttle bus that stops

Summary Heading: Excellent place to stay to visit Disneyland
Summary: The Homewood Suites is PERFECT for families visiting Disneyland Anaheim.  The suites are perfect if you want to cook a dinner and save some money. We stayed in a room with 2 queen beds (each parent got their own bed :) and a sofa bed for our daughter.  Excellent staff.  The breakfast was DELICIOUS and choices changed every day. The staff gave out balloons to every child attached to bath duckies, too cute! The dining room plays Disney Junior shows to entertain the kids. Monday to Thursday there is a free evening beer/wine and snack from 5-7pm. The rooms are clean, the cleaning staff left a cute towel animal on the bed. The hotel is located right next to the Disneyland parking lot so you can walk and use their shuttles. We will definitely stay there again when we go to Disneyland.

Homewood Suites Convention center is the place to stay when doing your family vacation at Disneyland.The accommodations are unbeatable to any of the other Hotels in the area.The Hotel is right next to the Toy Story Parking lot for Disney.It is a few blocks down the road from Disney but the wonderful thing is you can walk over and load the Toy Story busses for a ride to Disneyland for free.The other great part of riding the Toy Story buses is they have their own security check points when getting to the park which are much quicker then the A.r.t ones as well as at night you have your own line for Toy Story Buses which is much quicker.  Ok back to the Hotel.The cleanliness of the Hotel is 5 stars.I have added pics taken of our suite.Most rooms are 2 room suite which is great for a

We rented two rooms and had family there with us.  We enjoyed the rooms and pool and how close it was to Disneyland and Knotts Berry Farm.  We bought a skillet but most items were complete in kitchen.  We had food allergy concerns and many meals were cooked at hotel prior to departing....contamination would be an issue.   Staff friendly and always helpful.

Summary Heading: Good experience at the Homewood Suites
Summary: Enjoyed our stay at this hotel while attending a meeting at the Convention Center.  Good location, breakfast, and social hour.  Worked out very well for our 4 night stay.  Staff was helpful and parking was easy at the hotel.

Perfect hotel for family of 5!  One room. Immaculate. Staff on target at all times. Highly recommend and will stay here again. Breakfast was variety of good items for all type of eaters. Always left satisfied. Could not attend the dinner but great option to have.

Great location, clean. A little dated as we stayed at the modern Homewood Suites in San Diego so we were spoilt. Breakfast staff were great. Room living area small. Paying for parking when staying there is a little rich if you ask me but overall great stay!

I would recommend this hotel to any family. We had a large family trip and all stayed here. The amenities were great. Nice hot tub/pool and basket ball court for active kids and a break for us parents. Beds fantastic. Good breakfast.

For the price, this was one of the best stays I have had.  Staff was ALWAYS welcoming, kind and helpful.  Carman at the Dinner buffet was super each night she was there.  When I'm Anahiem again I'll start here. Thanks, Robert C.

My family of 2 adults, 2 teenagers, booked a 1br queen room for 9 nights.  The staff were absolutely faultless - always pleasant, willing to help, and nothing was ever too much trouble.  We were fortunate to be able to book into our suite earlier than the regular time which was greatly appreciated after 19 hours of travelling.  2 queen beds (doubles if you are Australian) in the bedroom, and a double sofa bed in the living area.  I would suggest the sofa bed should only be used for the lightest/smallest person/s in your group, as the mattress is thin and the springs easily felt.  Having said that, our lightweight 16yo daughter had no problem with it whatsoever and was very comfortable.  The location is ideal, close to the Disney Parks, many restaurants, convenience stores,

This was our base for a family visit to Disneyland and wasn't disappointed. We checked in early but couldn't get a room due to high occupancy.  Rooms are spacious and come with a kitchenette that is helpful. Bathrooms are clean and adequate. Light dinner is served to guests on the house from Mondays to Thursdays. A sumptuous breakfast spread  helps you get prepared for a hectic day at Disney.  A family pool, putting green and arcade room are available for guests. Disney tickets can be purchased at the hotel.

The best features of this hotel were the suites.  We had 3 kids and they thoroughly enjoyed having bunk beds to sleep in.  We also enjoyed the morning breakfast as well as the location close to Disneyland.  Our only complaint was that the beds were not very comfortable.

Summary Heading: great place for a family going to Disneyland
Summary: This is my first time staying here and I would stay again ! I had a few questions and needed help narrowing down a hotel I wanted to stay at so I called the hotel and got Christian he was so knowledgeable , Friendly and super helpful and went above and beyond  !! We had a Double queen suite and a standard adjoining king on floor 5 beds were comfy and rooms were clean. They were also nice enough to let me check in early my only complaint is the pools and all recreational stuff closes at 10 which is too early. But other than that everything was great

Vincent was soo helpful, this hotel is so beautiful and fun. I love the smiles and vibe here, come stay at this nice friendly hotel in this district, such a convenient place to stay! Close to some great bars, made me enjoy walking everywhere I loved it

Summary Heading: Walk to Disney - Spacious for Families
Summary: We booked this hotel on points hoping to be close enough to walk to Disneyland.  We were not disappointed!  You don't feel like you are driving into crowded theme park hotel.  The driveway is friendly and parking is easy, spacious and well lit for the walk to the hotel.  Parking is $18 per day, but we checked out in the morning and left the car there for the day, and there was no issue with leaving at 8:30 p.m.  To get to Disneyland, we decided to save our feet and take an Uber.  The ride was $6 because it's a straight shot and you get dropped of, right near the entrance.  Return trip was just as easy.  Our boys were delighted when they saw the room.  Because it's a suite, there was lots of room.  Even with the two queens, there was lots of room for a pull out couch, a chair and

My family loved this hotel. They had so many extra amenities for the kids to do. The staff was so friendly. They have dinner and drinks Monday-Thursday which we loved. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Clean rooms, lots of room - breakfast was great, and so was the dinner/evening social. Option to take a shuttle to Disney, but we just walked, it's not too far. We loved Carmen and Elsa, the food/wait staff, they made our time so fun!

We stayed here from Boxing Day and over New Years. We loved this hotel, we stayed in a double queen room, which had a pull out bed in the living area.  We are a family of 6 and we didn't feel cramped. The kitchen was well equipped and the fridge had a menu and upcoming events on it. Every area was spotless, the housekeeping staff were very friendly and accomadating. In fact any staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful. The free breakfast buffet was plentiful and varied something for everyone. My only criticism would be of other guests who didn't take the time to read how to work the waffle machines and leaving the waffle cups sitting around the area instead putting in the bin right beside the waffle station. The waffle station is brilliant though and making your own

I enjoyed my stay here. Friendly front desk, clean room, nice amenities. The standard that I've come to expect staying at a Hilton. I don't remember the front desk person who checked us in but he was very friendly and helpful.

This hotel had friendly staff who were very helpful. The hotel itself is modern, very clean and pleasant. The room we stayed in was great for a family with children. It‚Äôs location is right next to a Disney shuttle. The breakfast was great, so good that it was over packed in the am. The only complaint I can think of this hotel is that breakfast is so over crowded( even in s large area) that it‚Äôs hard to enjoy it. I can‚Äôt say enough good things about this hotel. We will definitely being staying here again! The only thing that could add to this hotel is to add room service.

This is our third stay at The Homewood Suites in Anaheim, and we will continue to go back.  The hotel is right near DIsneyland, breakfast is awesome, the staff are always amazing, and the suites are clean!

Friendly reception staff gave us a great welcome. Family suite great for our 3 kids aged 14,13 and 8. The eldest slept on the sofa bed in the lounge which worked well. Breakfast buffet was great with lots of choice and daily specials.  We experienced the free light dinner  and poolside outdoor movie on our last night - a special end to a fantastic stay.  Would definitely recommend this hotel for families.

Really happy with this hotel. Large rooms (booked a suite) that are modern and comfortable. Hot breakfast was good with a lot of options. Pool was cold but the hot tub fire pit area was really neat. Also host hospitality nights with more feee food etc. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Only complaint was the walk to Disney was a little long for smaller kids but the free Disney shuttle is only about 5-10 minutes away so it worked out great. We will come back here next time I‚Äôm sure.

Summary Heading: Good hotel and convenient location to Disneyland parking lot
Summary: Reserved this hotel based on review on Tripadvisor and Yelp and it definitely did not disappoint.  Nice clean room, good selection for breakfast and happy hours (which was a first outside Embassy Suites).  Staff was very friendly and eager to help.  I like that they greet us every time they see us and always seem to want to help fix any issue I am encountering (even non hotel related).  Would definitely stay here again next time in Anaheim and will look at other Homewood Suites as option for future vacation

Nice and clean hotel. Close to the park. Breakfast isn‚Äôt the best. We always stay at a Hilton Hotel, (Hampton, Embassy Suites, etc.) but every other one we stayed at has had a really good breakfast. The eggs here tasted like rubber, potatoes weren‚Äôt too great and no bacon...the self made waffles were the best thing. The room was nice and clean, but we weren‚Äôt able to get a suite, so our bed was a little cramped with a 4 year old sleeping between the wife and I. But the room was clean and the staff was friendly.

We stayed at homewood  sites for one night prior to check in at a Disney property.   This hotel is clean and comfort.  The morning complimentary breakfast is good but a zoo in terms of finding a table.  The hotel was very busy and parking was difficult.     This hotel is not close to Disneyland main gate at least a thirty minute walk.   Out experience was ok but nothing special

This was our annual visit to Disneyland. Our great experience with the Homewood team started last November when we booked the room, it was a warm and informative experience with no pressure.   We booked an SUV with the Homewood front desk to pick us up from LAX, our flight was nearly an hour late and our driver was pleasantly waiting for us and cheerful.   Our room was exactly as we expected for a new building, clean and well maintained. The bunk beds for the kids were a treat and the suite had everything a family would need for a week.   The service from staff simply got better. The complimentary breakfast was fine for a family on the go to Disney Land.  The morning staff went over the top being helpful and kept a hectic buffet area clean. There loads of cheerful smiles and

There is a reason this hotel is listed as #1 on trip advisor. The hotel is a 15-20 minute walk to the main entrance to the parks or you can walk 5 minutes from the front door to the bus at the Toy Story parking lot.    The hotel was clean and well kept and the staff was friendly and accommodating.  We had a one bedroom queen suite which was was spacious and met our needs.  I wish there was a double vanity in the bathroom area, if you had more than three adults trying to get ready in the morning it would be a tight fit.   The breakfast was great and the food was always fresh.  The hotel was busy when we were there so seating was at a premium so arrive early if you want a quiet relaxed atmosphere.   You may as why only four stars sold everything was great?  Well I have two

Took me a year to save for our trip! We stayed from Dec 23-Jan 1st.  9 night stay was perfect.  Always came back to a clean room.  Saved hundreds by eating breakfast in the morning.  Ate out for lunch and dinner.   Walked to and from the park.  Occasionally we would use the shuttle from the toy story parking lot.  Pool and Jacuzzi was utilized after walking all day.  Laundry room was clean and convenient.  Room we stayed in was a connecting room but didn't have any problems with noise. Really zero complaints   Will recommend to friends and family.  My last trip was in December '14.  Will consider staying again.  Book early for a decent rate.

This place is really a great value for what you get.  As for the room, it was nice size for a family as our one bedroom suite did have nice amenities with a dining table, refrigerator, microwave, etc.  The faucet in the room was a bit leaky and the furniture was a bit boring and basic, but it worked okay.  Free breakfast was nice but probably just okay as well.  Overall this hotel was probably good for the value and the location is great.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for visiting Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here with our three kids while we visited Disneyland. The Hotel has many great features, the rooms in particular are very spacious and had bunk beds for the kids, probably the beat hotel room I have stayed in for family‚Äôs! Free breakfast is included which was an average standard. They do put on a light dinner and drink‚Äôs, Mon - Thur night which was a good bonus. You can and we did walk to Disneyland, it‚Äôs not the closest of all the hotels, but it‚Äôs still an easy 10-15min walk. Parking is an extra cost on top. I would highly recommend for families!

Just returned from a 5 night trip to Anaheim and couldn't have asked for a better hotel. I've stayed at 5 star resorts and while this is not an all inclusive resort, it is the next best thing.   The room itself was maintained spotless, with tons of space and a nice kitchenette. We got the most basic room for 4 people (2 double beds), and it was still more than we needed. The beds were very comfortable, and the AC worked very efficiently without making noise to wake you up in the night.   When we checked in at 10 am, they didn't have a room ready, but they stored our luggage for us. They also sent someone to the kitchen to grab us some food from breakfast, since breakfast was already over. A nice touch!! The tea and coffee station, available all day, was very convenient as well.

We stayed here while we went to Disneyland and had a great time. The hotel is right next to the toy story disney parking lot where we were able to walk over and take the bus to the parks for free. The breakfasts were different each morning and the evening social was a nice touch that I hadn't ever experienced before.

We had double queen sized beds along with sofa bed in the living room area. Breakfast was good with some variety. The short hop to the bus terminal and the resort was a great icing to the cake. Our overall best choice

We arrived for our first California vacation. The staff were pleasant and helpful when we had additional requests. The breakfast and evening social were an amazing perk. While it did not take away from our experience, it would best to keep in mind that the hotel is a family setting for Disney vacations. Many children around in various states of excitement. However the social area was designed well and provides comfortable areas for meals. Our suite was what we would want from a hotel. The location was great for access to freeways, Disneyland and local attractions (Honda Centre). We have recommended this hotel to our friends who have stayed and would give the same type of glowing review.

This hotel was new, clean, actually very nice. The staff were young but very competent and very pleasant and helpful.  Room was a suite with two queen beds. The beds were comfortable, but not the most comfortable. I didn‚Äôt sleep that well here.   There was a separate living area with a sofa, chair, and kitchenette. Space was fairly tight, this is not the size of a condo you might rent on VRBO. Yet we were happy it was set up as a suite.  Location is good but not spectacular . It will take you 15 minutes to walk to Disney. The ‚Äúfree‚Äù shuttle from the Toy Story parking like a block away is not that helpful. We experienced long lines to get on and we ended up just walking because we didn‚Äôt want to wait (many people did this too). The walk is not terrible, it‚Äôs just no where near as

We stayed here for a week long family vacation.  We had a king family suite which was perfect for our family of five. The in-suite kitchen with full size fridge was a great way to hep us save money on meals.  The location was ideal for Disneyland. We also took day trips to Universal and Huntington Beach. The staff were very friendly and were constantly keeping the place clean. The breakfasts were substantial and the evening social was a nice touch. We also enjoyed watching a free movie by the pool one evening.

Good location and friendly staff. Family friendly place. Very flexible staff.we stayed in two rooms. Thanks we enjoyed our stay . I really don‚Äôt have much to add to this. Happy new year happy new year

I absoloutley loved, loved, loved this hotel. It has a nice warm feel to it, and I enjoyed my room and the food. I think dinner and breakfast was free, but it was delicious. Not a far walk from Disneyland and a few great eating spots and a great place to relax with family. I have Hilton honors, and this was a reasonable, cheap, and enjoyable experience for me and my family.

Summary Heading: Awesome hotel and especially the staff and very convenient they have almost everything the Guests want.
Summary: Awesome hotel and staff very friendly helpful and clean hotel and very convenient for the Guests like me and my family especially if you have lil kids. We love the shuttle service even though you need to pay but I tell you is worth it and beautiful shuttle service feels like you are the mayor or governor üòÇ

Summary Heading: Homewood Suites Anaheim Convention Center is convenient for Disneyland
Summary: Homewood is 5 - 10 minute walk to Disney's Toy Story parking lot where you can take the shuttle directly to the front gate in about 8 minutes, so about 25 minute total trip, which would have taken that long if walking the 1+ miles.  The hotel provides hot breakfast and light dinner meals Monday-Thursday, so very convenient for families.  Rooms are spacious and clean.

This hotel offers you everything you need for a trip to Disney. Location awesome. Two meals great. Price beats staying on Disney property and it's super close. Comfort of rooms awesome. Staff is on top of any and all needs.

We really enjoyed our 3-day stay at this hotel. The highlights were: having a suite with a separate living room and kitchen, included breakfast and dinner, easy walk to Disneyland shuttle and very good customer service. I had originally booked a premium suite but that seems to just be a suite with included snacks and was not worth the added cost so I requested a regular suite on an upper floor and was accommodated after the first night.
