The breakfast buffet is very good--lots of choices to fuel you for a day at Disneyland. We made sure to go back to the hotel in the afternoon for a break from the park crowds and the included dinner. It's described as light but was enough for us. It tends to be on the salty side (e.g., chicken nuggets, mac and cheese) but there was always

We visited Disney and this hotel has everything. It's walking distance to Disney parking lot. Lots of restaurants nearby.  Breakfast/Evening social is good Parking was adequate   Digital access was nice.

Summary Heading: Disney fireworks view + easy breakfast + walk to Disney shuttle  = efficient!
Summary: Checkin was quick. Using app would have made it faster.   Property is clean and airy. They had honored request for room with view of fireworks.   Bed was comfortable. Bathroom was updated. Kitchenette was good but we did not use it.   Breakfast was crowded but efficient.  Walking to Disney shuttle lot is super useful.   Plenty of restaurants around to eat out in, if not within Disney itself.  Checkout was on the phone.

Stayed at this property recently for our party of two adults, one teenager and two younger kids. Extremely convenient location. Free Disney shuttle is only about 10 minutes walk from the property. They provide daily breakfast which is convenient especially with kids. On weekdays, from 5-7pm, there is complementary drinks and some simple finger food. There are also restaurants (e.g. Blaze Pizza) , Wallgreens pharmacy which sells drinking water and other groceries, all within 10-15 minutes walk. There is a kitchenette with microwave oven, fridge, cooking utensils, cutlery, dish washer - which is excellent. And there is also a common laundry on the ground floor.  Would definitely recommend this property if you are visiting Disneyland!!

Excellent customer service! Beyond amazing!  I have been staying at the Hilton brand for over 10 years and this is the best damn hotel near Disneyland! If you look at my records we stay quite a bit at your Hilton brand around the Disney area in this hotel is five star plus with its customer service, the way they can multitask, to the room service, to the security guard at night, to the kitchen people in morning buffet, to housekeeping to just everyone!!! I can‚Äôt stress enough how amazing, outstanding, excellent, and just overall superb everything is abou

I was happy with overall experience was disappointed that they weren‚Äôt able to accommodate our stay longer when requested!!! The kids were extremely disappointed that they could stay to enjoy the pool and their arcade
Manager Response: Hello Freddyg1,  I am happy to read that your recent stay with us was a pleasant one, however I cannot apologize enough for the disappointment in us for not being able to extend your stay. Due to the demand and our booking windows, our occupancy changes daily and we have, on numerous occasions, completely sold out nights. Again, I apologize for this inconvenience, and if there is anything I can do for you, or for a future stay, please do not hesitate in contacting the hotel directly and asking for myself, Benjamin, and I will be more than happy to assist you.  Thank you again,  Benjamin Assistant GM

Summary Heading: Rating of Homewood Suites by Hilton
Summary: Excellent Hotel, I recommend it to any family looking for a vacation.Disneyland and other shopping centers are close by, fancy restaurants like Cheese Cake Factory,PF Changs and others are walking distance from hotel.

Rooms were clean. Staff was friendly. Dining area and hot breakfast are very good. Disneyland is only one mile away and is pedestrian walk friendly. Only downside was the Internet connection. Very poor.

We stayed at this place during our trip to DisneyLand. We loved the breakfast at this place. Lot of options and nice quality. Otherwise, we mostly spent time outside the hotel so have much information to add.

My family loved this hotel! During our vacation to Disneyland, we stayed at this location. I really enjoy Homewood Suites and this resort is certainly one of the best around. The staff was extremely nice and very helpful. Like many Homewood suites, this hotel provides a great complimentary breakfast. Monday through Thursday, social hour is served in the evening to provide staff-served beer and wine. The food differs from soup, salad, and occasionally pasta meals or beef sliders. Certainly a money saver from having to eat out. The hotel has a large swimming pool with a kiddie pool and hot tub. Next to the swimming area is a decent size game-room. Some nights, they have a movie displayed on the wall of the game room building near the kiddie pool. It was a nice added touch for the

Exceed our expectation. Excellence at every level. We feel valued. Our family alawys enjoyed our stay. We will NEVER stay at another hotel again when we visit Anahaeim. This is THE designated family hotel. We shared our positive experience with our extended family and friends and invite them to stay here as well. You too will enjoy your stay as we have as well.   A few perks we liked:   Friendly staff and management team Breakfast with varieties  Cleanliness of the room and hotel Big room with great amenities  Accommodate up to 6 ppl Fast room service Happy Hour  Close to shuttle  Warm reception upon arrival Benjamin always take care of me Digital key One day prior check-in  Great price Plenty of parking  Well-lit parking lot Well maintained property Can take food to eat in

Summary Heading: Great hotel with an amazing staff
Summary: Rooms are great.  Beds are comfortable.  The complimentary breakfast is a feast; the evening social can easily substitute for a dinner.  And there are USB and AC chargers all over the dining area.  Most importantly, the staff is wonderful.  They are professional and extremely helpful.  Highly recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: Again, one of the best hotels in Anaheim!!!
Summary: I travel to Anaheim several times a year. I always try and stay at this Homewood suites. Their hospitality cannot be beat!! They make you feel right at home!! And their dining staff is the most helpful and friendly I have ever encountered!!! Love this place!!

Summary Heading: Family loves this hotel, home away from home. We have never had a bad stay and we come here every month.
Summary: Family loves this hotel, home away from home. We have never had a bad stay and we come here every month.  The staff knows us by name and will even bring out an ice cream with a candle and sing happy birthday to my kids on their birthdays!

Summary Heading: Great Property and perfect for Disney visitors
Summary: This particular property was very clean and the layout of the rooms was great for our family of four.  We stayed in the King size one bedroom with bunkbeds.  The bedroom was very large and had plenty of room for our adult girls to move about.  The separate living room and kitchen area was very nice.  The location in relationship to Disneyland was very good with guests walking less than 2 blocks to catch the shuttle bus.  With the hot breakfast and evening social this hotel is a great value.  Would definitely recommend!!

We stayed Dec. 2-12. We had a King Suite and it was wonderful for the 2 of us. Lots of room to spread out. We were early for check in but they tagged our bags to hold them for us so we could head for the parks. We also made a small shopping list and our stuff was there when we got back to go to our room. The breakfast in the morning was excellent. It could get crowded but Julie and the rest of the Kitchen Team kept everything replenished and tables cleaned up. I especially loved the coffee and it was available 24/7. We only attended one evening reception. There was soups, crackers, cheese and salads. Plenty for a light dinner! The different beers and wines were excellent also. The only small drawback to this hotel and the only thing that would make me consider staying elsewhere

We stayed her while visiting Disneyland to celebrate our daughters birthday.  The hotel has great amenties including complimentary breakfast and evening social which is really like dinner.  The pool is clean and nicely heated and there are grills to BBQ if you wish(and we did)  It is about a 20 walk to the parks but you can take a free shuttle from the adjacent Disney parking lot as well.  If all that is not enough the staff are friendly and extemely accomodating.  I would recommend this hotel to everyone!

The complimentary breakfast and dinner were excellent and plentiful. The room was spacious and clean. The staff was friendly and accommodating. Best of all, it was a very short walk to the parking lot of Disneyland, and then a complimentary shuttle took you right to the front gate.

We spent 5 nights here and we loved it. Very modern, clean and great facilities (pool, games room, laundry). Loved the bed -so comfy!!Breakfast was free each morning which was fantastic especially with two teenagers in tow and coffee was always available in reception. Could just walk next door for Disneyland shuttle which was so handy. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend.

A three night stay here, chosen for its price and proximity to Disneyland. We arrived by bus from the airport so no car to park. Check in was quick and easy. Our room was a king suite. A bit on the small side but equipped with a fridge, microwave, coffee machine and wet bar. Also was a reasonably large safe (for a change). Everything was fine apart from the noise from the adjacent room. Sound seemed to travel through the [closed] connecting door far to easily and when that noise is a whining child all the worse. When we asked staff about how far to walk to Disney, they told us that there was a Disney parking lot next door with shuttle buses to the park, which we used and experienced no problem. We did also walk to/from the parks as well which felt safe. Evening reception and

Homewood Suites have been a beacon of welcoming hospitality ever since the first time that I stayed at one of their hotels. I will ALWAYS look to book here first. Anywhere else is just a compromise. Don‚Äôt cheat yourselves. Stay at Homewood Suites!

Had a great stay!! Everyone was courtesy and helpful. Rooms very clean and fit a family perfectly. Great hot breakfast every morning. I would of like to gone to evening drinks and snacks but no time.  We would stay again!

The last 3 or 4 reviews (NOT Jo from Sydney) have described the place excellently. We loved everything about it, except for the 3kg we all put on during our stay. We are not fussy eaters, but we also understand the logistics of feeding a lot of people, in limited space and time. I think the quality and quantities of food were sensational. The hardest thing was finding a table, which obviously indicates that we weren't the only ones who loved the food.  We stayed here for access to Disneyland. We usually stay at Desert Inn and Suites which is right across the road from Disney entrance. To save money and based on previous reviews of the Toy Story shuttle, we chose Homewood Suites and were not disappointed in any way. It took roughly 15mins door to gate using the shuttles that, off

Great location, perfect set up for a family going to Disney. You can catch the shuttle from the disney parking lot not even a half a block away.We arrived late the first night with two young children, they made the check in happen quickly and even help find milk for the kids for us. The rooms had bunk beds and a king, with a living room. Nothing fancy, but clean, great lay out, nice pool and hit tub with a mini put area too. We would highly recommend this to any family planning a disney trip.

Room quite clean and spacious with separate living room. Clean and well appointed. Laundry facilities clean. Pool and games room well looked after. Ideal location to Disney right near toy story car park shuttle to Disney. Breakfasts were very manufactured and quite frankly couldn‚Äôt eat much. That was disappointing somewhat that they were missing key items and what was served was very sweet and even my kids couldn‚Äôt eat. Apart from eating at the hotel all else was ideal.
Manager Response: Hello,  Thank you for your recent stay at our hotel, and for providing such valuable feedback! I would like to take this time to apologize for the quality of our Suite Start Breakfast, and for the feeling of it being manufactured. It is our goal to exceed your expectations and clearly we did not. Your feedback has been communicated to our team so we can address these issues appropriately. If there is anything that I can do for you, please do not hesitate in contacting the hotel directly and asking for myself.  Sincerely,  Benjamin Assistant GM

Summary Heading: Expected more from a Hilton hotel
Summary: Don't get me wrong. The place is nice . We experienced problems at breakfast people pushing and shoving like they had never seen food before. I know this is hard to control but was crazy. Room was nice but we had at least one thing wrong every day of our 10 day stay. Not enough towels for number of guests in room ,Bins not emptied . Sheets taken off bed and left on top of our suitcases for two days. Room not serviced one day . Hallways not vacuumed for two days leaving night staff who bought towels in disgust and vacuuming at 9pm.  While I found this hotel had a lot of  good qualities and facilities. Their housekeeping staff leaves a lot to be desired . As a travel agency owner I expect more for my valued clients ...

After reading other reviews about how wonderful this hotel was, I was confident in my selection and was not disappointed. The rooms are a little smaller than other Homewood suites I stayed in and I wasn‚Äôt crazy about the vanity/sink being separate from the bathroom and in the bedroom (hard to not wake up the other ) this was only a minor thing. Also, it seems Hilton is getting away from letting guests precisely control their thermostats and limiting the range available. This was my third Hilton property in 6 weeks where this was apparent. Since I was expecting it, I brought sleep clothes for either extreme, so be aware.

This is our fifth time in the Anaheim area and this hotel is hands down the best we have ever stayed at. Perfect distance from the park, takes about 20 mins to walk to the gates. And is located right next to the Toy Story parking lot, which you can walk and take a shuttle bus from there for free! Especially nice to take after a long day at the park. Rooms: We stayed in the 2 Queens suite. Separate bedroom with 2 queen beds, TV, Bathroom with tub, and safety deposit box. The other room had a sofa bed, TV, kitchenette, Fridge, stove and a table with chairs. Our maid service was excellent. We always came back to a clean room. There was free WIFI with your room #. Hotel amenities: Hot tub, adult pool and kids pool. An arcade, basketball hoop and putting green. They even have outdoor

Excellent place to stay if visiting the Disneyland parks.  Very close to the free shuttle, large pool and hot tub, friendly and attentive staff.  Our extended family of 20 loved this hotel!  Also, visit Universal Studios, Sea World and Lego Land - WAY shorter line up times gives you better bang for your buck compared to Disney.

Summary Heading: You can always trust a Hilton Property
Summary: Hilton is about integrity, you can be sure you are going to get what is promised ~ A great stay with pleasant surroundings, respectful staff, comfort & cleanliness. Hilton is always my "go too" hotel whenever ~ wherever I travel. I'm always 100% satisfied with Hilton.

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel Near Disneyland and Anaheim Convention Center
Summary: I stayed here 3 nights and would do so again. The location is perfect, whether you're going to the Anaheim Convention Center or Disneyland. The rooms are well furnished and quiet. The staff is friendly and professional. The complimentary breakfast and evening wine with appetizers is all fine and saves on restaurant trips.

We go to Disneyland about every 5 years. The first time we stayed at a Disney hotel (Paradise Pier) all though it was nice, we did not think worth the money. The next two times we stayed at Embassy Suites which we chose from the Trip Advisor reviews. This time as we were booking and looking over the latest reviews we noticed Embassy had alot of negative reviews regarding the breakfast. Im not going to lie a good breakfast always is part of where we choose to stay. We came across the Homewood Suites which had great reviews so we decided to give it a chance. We even went as far as to make contact with people who left reviews for both locations to make sure we were making right choice. We were not dissapointed. We considered the breakfast above average for your typical hotel

Summary Heading: Stay with Family for daughters birthday
Summary: Don't waste your money the hotel is mediocre not worth the money you waste. Food is average and amenities are not great. I would not think that this type of stay would just be blah and room wrecked of rodent poison. For the same price you can stay at double tree or fancy hotel. Chose it for reviews and locations but greatly disappointed
Manager Response: I would like to apologize for your disappointment with your recent stay with us. We always strive for nothing less than outstanding, so a review with a reflection of mediocre is something that we take very seriously. In regards to the claim that the room had smelled of rodent poison, I have to admit that it is the first time I have heard of something like this, but I do not discount in any way that you smelled something unpleasant. Please be assured that we have not treated the rooms with a chemical of this nature and have had zero issues with any kind of rodents. We are constantly working on our food options and changing out specials and adding and subtracting based on the voice of our guests and also have attempted to put in place all of the amenities to make a stay comfortable, enjoyable, and again outstanding for our guests. I would like to gather a bit more detail from you to make it better than it was and prove our commitment to your satisfaction.

Summary: We recently visited California and we were sure impressed with this hotel! First of all the room was meticulously clean.  The breakfast and evening reception was very nice, and the staff was very attentive and welcoming!  I defiantly will stay here again.

Our family took a trip to Disneyland and stayed overnight at Homewood Suites in Anaheim.  The location was very convenient to Disneyland and nearby restaurants. Our rooms we‚Äôre great. We used the pool and the gym at the hotel.  The breakfast was great and really added to the value of our stay

The hotel is clean, nice service. They have a mini golf and b-ball court,  arcade and a cold pool:( if they would heat it little more? I don‚Äôt understand why have a beautiful pool and keep it cold?  A little girl cried when her Dad put her in it. The hot tub is big so all the kids swim in it. The food is good. It is kinda a long walk from distance but not bad. I would stay here again other than a cold pool!

We enjoyed our time at Homewood Suites, and will gladly stay again if the opportunity presents itself.  We loved the complimentary breakfast - it had plenty of good food and was well presented.  Our suite was clean and comfortable, and we were very pleased with our entire experience.

Summary Heading: Hands down our best hotel stay in the USA
Summary: What makes a hotel stay a win?  There are prerequisites of course: amenities, cleanliness and courteousness.  Whilst these are necessary for a hotel to impress, it takes something more for a memorable stay, and that is what you will find here.    First, the basics.  We love having the space of a suite, and with 2 adults & 2 children, we never felt cramped.  Having a full sized fridge was wonderful, as was everything in our suite.  We enjoyed being able to have breakfast and the evening socials at the hotel: a glass of wine at the end of the day was fantastic.  The proximity to Disneyland is awesome: we walked it some days, and some days took the shuttle bus.  Both were convenient for us.    But the thing that sets this place apart for us was the staff.  From my first email

We stayed here for 3 nights while on a family vacation at disneyland. The hotel was nice and the staff was awesome. The beds need to be updated as they were very uncomfortable. The walk to Disney was good, felt a little far by the end of the night but not too bad.

It‚Äôs very close to Disney resort. Great pool and great complimentary breakfast and supper ( which is included )Very convenient and close to Disney shuttle and parking lots . Will definitely stay again

Great location!  Easy Walt to Disneyland, Downtown Disney and California Adventure.  Great price and very friendly and helpful staff. Easy access in and out, and digital key was really convenient.  Coffee and hot tea available in the lobby all the time for guests. I will definitely stay here again.

Everything about this hotel exceeded expectations. Breakfast and social hour food was perfect for everyone from 5 year old to mature adults. They have a wide range of beverages including Stella beer for social hours 5-7 Mon-Thurs.   The rooms were comfortable with all the desired amenities. Kids loved the pool!    Ordered groceries that were delivered from Von‚Äôs primarily snacks, fruits, drinks which was perfect to take with us to Disneyland.   Walked most mornings to Disneyland and took free shuttle from Toy Story parking lot. Highly recommend this hotel!!!

I stayed at the Homewood Suites for a meeting held at the convention center. The hotel is the perfect place for this purpose. The convention center is a 10 minute walk away. The hotel staff  is very friendly and helpful. Rooms are spacious, clean and accommodated with a small kitchen. Breakfast is good (some more fruit would be nice) - and you can enjoy it at the pool side.  Be aware that there are 2 Homewood Suites on Harbor Blvd - check the address before you get in!

We have stayed at Homewood Suites several times over the past 2 years. They have never disappointed us! The facilities, amenities, food, and staff are top notch! They offer movie nights, hot and cold daily breakfasts with a daily breakfast special. During the week they offer nightly meals. If you prefer to cook your own food, the rooms ate equipped with a stove top, dishwasher and full size refrigerator.  If you like to bbq or grill, they offer 3 beautiful outdoor grills on the patio! Front desk staff were knowledgeable, informed and helpfull. You can also check with some of the close returants for nightly happy hour specials! Rooms seem very noiseproof! We will deffinately there again!!

We stayed for 9 days at Homewood Suites Anaheim Convention Center.  It was so nice to have a separate room so that the kids could be in bed and we weren't disturbing them.  We liked the breakfasts and it was so nice that some suppers were included.  It was a bit of a far walk to Disney, but with the Disney parking lot and free shuttle next door, it didn't matter.  We will definitely be back

Summary Heading: Stay here, you won't be sorry!
Summary: You will find clean, well appointed spacious rooms with comfortable beds and excellent pillows. Great amenities include a putting green, 3 pools, a fire pit You will find clean, well appointed, spacious rooms with a full kitchen, and comfortable beds.  Amenities include 3 pools, outdoor movies, putting green a fire pit and an exercise room.  The staff in all areas are friendly and accomodating.  Breakfast is outstanding with loads of choices and different offerings daily.  The evening social was more than enough to call "dinner".   friendly, out-going staff.  You will save from purchasing 2 full delicious meals per day.

We stayed at this Homewood because I am a Hilton Honors member, and could use points and dollars for the stay.  It is only a mile walk up Harbor to get to the main gate of both Disneyland and California adventure.   The hotel was packed with young families.  But our room was quiet and comfortable, and our breakfast experience was excellent. The serving staff was on the ball, and replenished the food very quickly when any chaffing dish was emptied. They even clean the tables, much like a restaurant. I would highly recommend this hotel to any family that is staying over for the Disney Resort Parks.

Very clean and recently renovated. An excellent option for traveling families. No onsite restaurant, but the in-suite kitchen provides a good family option for meal planning. Would definitely stay again.

This is our favorite place to stay. It is so convenient to Disneyland shuttle, the food is delicious. The rooms are always clean, and the staff is helpful. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. It is so worth it.

New and cozy. Far better than its counterpart main gate which I have mistakenly booked n graciously I could switch to here eventually.  The front desk is superb helpful and responsive. The room is very clean n spacious that is very suit family needs. yet the air conditioner in the living room is a bit noisy. Breakfast is excellent with great variety food and is still serving food even the breakfast time is up.  So close to the main gate that we choose to walk. we can go back to the hotel for a rest and start the Disney journey again. Our thumbs up to this hotel and will definitely come back!

This was our 2nd stay at this hotel-it has a wonderful "family suite" with room for the kids and a kitchen. They have a kids pool with movies at night, and a lovely BBQ area, as well as a nice adult pool and spa.  The staff are very friendly and helpful.  Breakfast and "happy hour" included-happy hour is very substantial and if you take advantage of these offerings it makes the price very attractive.  They also have an on-site laundry and a video room for older kids.  The only areas of improvement are the bathtub-it is VERY slippery-we asked for a bath mat for inside the tub but they said they didn't have one-if we go again we'll bring one because my husband, myself, and my kids almost fell every time in the shower-we had to hang on to the silver grab bar!! The hotel is close to

Great place, near Disney walking distance to park.  We had a suite and  it was clean, spacious and the kitchen was fair size for cooking for kids.  Pool was nice, breakfast was great, hit and copious.  Staff were friendly and very attentive.  Parking is for a few but well worth it.  You need a car to get around.  I recommend A higher floor near the elevators and at the front side of the hotel facing the street and the convention center.

Loved this hotel. Was upgraded to a 2-queen SUITE without even asking. These folks will even buy your groceries for you at no extra charge (like no delivery charge... you still need to pay for the extra food lol).  Definitely coming back here again next year.

Hotel smelled like chemicals.  Actually, like a urinal.  Especially the elevators.  Way overpriced for type of accommodations.  Breakfast and evening social were fine, but very crowded.  Room was average.  Bathroom sink in an open area with no privacy.
Manager Response: I would like to personally apologize for the challenges you had during your recent stay with us. We take great pride in our service and accommodation's so anytime anyone expresses displeasure we definitely listen! We have replaced all carpet in the four elevator cabs and deep cleaned the walls. . As for the crowds in breakfast and our evening social, it is true that they can definitely get busy with the crowds going to Disneyland. We always suggest that guests try to attend before 8:30am if possible as the last hour is generally the busiest. I would love to have the opportunity to discuss further issues with you and to regain your loyalty as part of the Homewood Service Promise. Please feel free to contact by emailing keith.moses@Hilton.com or by calling me at 714-750-2010.

Summary Heading: Great stay on our Disney vacation!
Summary: This hotel was wonderful for so many reasons! The staff was always so nice & accommodating for anything that we needed, including at the breakfast & evening dinners. It is a newer hotel so everything feels pretty clean & well kept. We had the family suite with bunk beads which was perfect, especially at night when the kids go to bed early. The breakfast each morning was great, many selections. We caught the evening social a couple nights & the food selection was ok, but better than nothing and you really can‚Äôt beat free beer & wine! The pool area is nice, the kids enjoyed the kiddie pool & the spacious hot tub. One of the greatest things about this hotel is the proximity to the toy story shuttle lot. It is maybe a 5 minute walk & there are always shuttles ready to take you to

Terrific Hotel üëçüèº Great location. Stayed with a family of five, loved every minute. Basketball court and games room are a great bonus. Breakfast also very good. Would definitely stay here again. Thanks.

Our second trip as a family to Disneyland.  This time we decided to stay in one of the non-Disney hotels as the convenience of the Disney hotels is outweighed by the additional cost in my view, particularly as we were now a larger group.  Homewood Suites had two adjoining rooms (both with kitchens and sitting rooms) for about half the cost of one room in Grand Californian.  Overall, it was perfect.  A warm welcome at reception, comfortable and clean rooms, friendly staff and a short walk (or very short Uber) to Disney.  Complimentary breakfast each morning, and a light evening meal Monday - Thursday:  not quite to our tastes, but fine and there are other restaurants nearby, basic cooking facilities in the room and a gas BBQ by the pool which residents can use so you have

I've stayed at this hotel 3 times in the past 2 years and it's the best overall value in my opinion.  It's a newer hotel and everything is updated and clean.    Breakfast is very good for a hotel.  The traditional food itself is just OK but the options are great.  You can make your own fresh waffles which is my personal favorite.  The hotel is about a 5 min walk from the toy story parking lot shuttles straight to Disneyland.  This is a big plus because you don't have to pay for transportation to Disneyland.  My family will be staying here again on our next trip.

The stay was very comfortable. The staff was very friendly and responsive. The rooms were spacious and clean. The complementary internet speed was decent enough. Overall experience was very good and would love to stay here again.

We stayed here for 8 nights recently. Again we were very pleased with our stay. It was lovely to see the hotel decorated for Halloween, that was a lovely touch. We were give a very spacious room with a shower rather than bath which we were delighted with!  I was really pleased to see that the comments I had made last time about the tea and coffee station had been followed up on...this time there was always hot water,  milk,  coffee etc, and nothing was ever run out. Meals were very nice and the staff so lovely.  One minor niggle - I had been told by a general manager in a reply to my last review that tea kettles were available and all we needed to do was ask for one to be put in our room... so I did, and was told they had never had tea kettles.  Odd! On the other hand, our

We stayed at the Homewood Suites Anaheim Convention Center on a recent trip to California. This hotel has a fantastic location for visiting the Disneyland parks! The hotel is right next to the Disneyland Toy Story parking lot so catching the FREE shuttle to the Disneyland front gates was super easy. The hotel also sells theme park tickets at the front desk and has a little shop where you can buy waters or snacks before heading out to the parks each day.  We stayed in a studio suite with 2 queen beds. This was the perfect size for our family of 4. The room was spacious and the beds comfortable. Be aware, however, that the vanity/sink area for the bathroom is small in this type of room.  The room had a kitchenette, but we did not use it during our stay.  The morning breakfast was

I had high hopes for this hotel given the high marks but it was just ok. The comp breakfast was indeed very convienent and the facilities seemed fairly new. But during our stay the elevators both had stains and bad smells for several days and the advertised Disney tickets were sold out for the weekend.  But the location near the Disneyland shuttle was good and close to Walgreens/cvs and restaurants.
Manager Response: We take great pride in the service and accommodations, and of course our online reputation means the world to us and feel it is well deserved. The last thing we want is for someone to leave feeling that we are just ok in anyway as we always strive for excellence. Please note that we are replacing all carpet in the four elevators this week and that generally we always have Disney tickets available as a Good Neighbor Hotel. This particular weekend we had a small issue with the ticket order, which delayed the delivery of the tickets. We do apologize for the inconvenience. Please feel to reach out to me directly at keith.moses@Hilton.com or by calling me a 714-750-2010 so I am able am able to regain your loyalty and have you back as your guest in the future.

Summary: On the plus side: friendly personal, spacious rooms well maintained, nice small kitchen. On the minus side: Hotel windows can't be opened - typical of big hotel chains - breakfast lacking healthy options.

Summary Heading: Disneyland Location Perfect for Family Shuttle Service
Summary: This location was right next to free shuttle to Disney Parks, clean and very nice nice staff.  A great free big breakfast daily, and clean outdoor pool.  Also vehicles are protected with gated Room patron only accessability.

We spent 5 nights here in a 1 bedroom queen/queen premium suite, in a fireworks facing room on the 5th floor (room 535). We traveled with Grandma, myself and my two boys, ages 2 1/2 and 8 1/2. I probably would have given the hotel 4 stars, but gave them a well-deserved extra star based on their excellent customer service. Below are my thoughts on our experience, with a few tips on transportation, room choice etc. at the end.  Given the TA reviews, I went in with high expectations. The room itself was functional and comfortable. The separate living area was definitely tight quarters, but thoughtfully designed and functional. Having a separate bedroom with a door was essential to my mother's and my sanity.  At night, the kids slept on the pull out couch, and my Mom and I could

Summary Heading: I can't wait to go back
Summary: We originally had a different hotel booked, but when we got there, it was not what we expected (lots of ongoing renovations).  We called this place up and they gave a great room for my 2 adult 2 kid family.  Amazing rate.  The location to the shuttles is the best, and the breakfast in the mornings was unreal.  We couldn't belive our luck in finding such a great place last minute.  We have recommended this hotel to all our friends that are traveling to Disneyland.  I wish I could come back sooner.  Just awesome.

Summary Heading: Best Disneyland Stay (Off Property) for a Family
Summary: We have been to Anaheim Convention Center and Disneyland more than 10 times in the last 10 years. We have stayed at multiple properties on and off property. This hotel is an EXCELLENT choice for families.  Complimentary breakfast daily was varied and plentiful and served in the standard cafeteria style. Something for all ages. Cold cereal, fruit, waffles, pancakes, sausage, etc. Free evening "reception" could easily pass as a light dinner - but not available every day.  Free Wi-fi.   We stayed in the King 1-bedroom suite and had plenty of room for 2 adults and 3 children (6-12 years old). We could have fit more. Room had a King bed, a set of bunk beds, a trundle bed under bottom bunkbed, plus a sofa sleeper. Two TVs. One bathroom. Kitchen with large fridge, dishwasher, 2-burner

Summary Heading: Still good and a new find!
Summary: This was our second time at the hotel. We stayed for 7 nights and had a great time at the Magic Kingdom. The Homewood was still very comfortable. We stayed in a King Family Suite, which comfortably slept 3 adults and 2 kids.   The breakfast was great each day and saved us a lot when compared to breakfast out. The dinner / happy hour was good as well. We took advantage of that only twice during our stay since it is only offered Mon - Thurs. even our vegan nanny was able to find something in the offering to eat.   The one suggestion (caution) we have is that at least in the room that we were in the shower/tub was very slippery. Our daughter fell and the adults were grabbing on to the bar to make sure we did not slip. Maybe some grip strips or something on the bottom of the tub? I

This hotel was extremely convenient to Disneyland. We were able to see the fireworks from our room on the 5th floor which was awesome.  The breakfast was great! The staff were all friendly and they even gave my son an awesome poster. Best part was the mini golf course, basketball court and heated pools.

We had a great stay here.  Very close to Disneyland.  We walked the first day and took the free Toy Story shuttle on the others.  Everything is very new and clean.  Service was very professional.  Loved having a full kitchen and space to relax. Breakfast buffet was very generous (and a bit busy at times) with lots of choices.    Perfect place for a family visiting Disneyland.  No need to spend more to stay at a Disney hotel.

Highly recommended.  The staff were amazing.  The facilities were clean and very modern. The free breakfast and dinner was perfect, delicious and fresh.  They always had mire than enough and never ran out. This hotel is fantastic for families.  The pool are and ither facilities made our stay perfect.

Fantastic layout for families. Breakfast could be chaotic but plenty of choice. Evening drinks and meal included was a bonus. Walked next door to get Disneyland shuttle which was free. Other cheap family restaurants within one block for easy  walking. We used the courtesy taxis several times and they were awesome and reasonably priced.

We have been a family visiting Disneyland over the last 15 years.  This is our favorite hotel to stay while in Anaheim.  It is more of a home away from home with great customer service and amenities.  Looking for a hotel: we look for safety, value, cleanliness, pool, customer service, and location. The hotel has high marks on all  those factors and more.  This was the 4th time visiting them.  Christian at the front desk gave excellent service, we checked in and was able to check us in early with a top floor room and surprised my wife with some ice cream for her birthday.  Brittany at the front desk has always went above and beyond.  She would make a good manager with her great customer service.  Last year she gave my daughter a balloon for her birthday.  We had a issue with

Summary Heading: This is the place to stay!
Summary: The room was spotless and roomy, had full kitchen with large fridge. Clean, fluffy white towels. Breakfast was actually quite good (sausage, ham, 2 types eggs, waffles and tons of breads and cereals. The dinner reception was fabulous (well, for a free meal), we were there for Italian night. They put out tons of food (Italian subs, creamy Mac and cheese, 2 types of salads) with alcohol and several juices. They served for a solid 2 hours and people were taking huge platefuls. Most receptions are so skimpy it‚Äôs not worth bothering with. Was a nice treat after a long day at Disneyland. Very family oriented with game room, putt-putt, large pool with hot tub and kiddie pool....all of which were located within the fenced area of the pool so kids were able to roam while easily  keeping

I visited this hotel for a conference at the Anaheim Convention Center. The room was exceptionally clean and spacious. The staff at the front desk, housekeeping and wait staff were all very helpful and far surpassed my expectations.

Summary Heading: Great stay for Disneyland on my wifes birthday!
Summary: The room was comfortable, and is what you would  expect from a Hilton, but what really stood out was the staff.  They were extra kind throughout our stay.  When my wife and I came back from Disneyland, the bartender for that evenings happy hour, Elisa Lopez saw that my wife had a birthday button from Disney, and  she was kind enough to go back and pack a little gift with candy, balloons, and some wine.  The staff then came out and sang here happy birthday!  The staff really does go the extra mile at this hotel.  Thanks for making our stay a memorable one.  We will be back soon!

Summary Heading: Great stay,convenient to amusement parks and  restaurants and Starbucks
Summary: Overall we had an excellent stay sometimes the noise in the hallways and the people next to us and above us was disruptive the staff was great the convenience to the amusement parks Starbucks and in and out burger was great the breakfast buffet have a lot of different items every morning be aware it gets super crowded around eight to 8:30 AM

Our kids went crazy when they saw our room. They loved the suite and the bunk beds. We felt very comfortable and enjoyed the wide variety of breakfast and the dinner/evening social was an added bonus.

The Hilton did a great job in providing service to myself while on business travel.  The place was clean adn centrally located...  I enjoyed the fitness center and the pool area.  They even had a basketball court.  Great location to relax and good access to convention center and Disney land.

This was my first time staying at a Homewood Suites hotel and I enjoyed it a lot.  The hotel room was spacious, clean, and comfortable.  Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful.  Best of all, it was great location and very easy to get to Disneyland from the hotel.

We just checked out yesterday after our 7 night stay at this location and we absolutely loved it!  We stayed in a premium suite on the 5th floor with a view of the Disneyland fireworks. The room had a kitchen with fridge/freezer, dishwasher and sink, microwave, cooktop (no oven), and small dining table. The living area was a pull out sofa, chair, tables and dresser. Bedroom had two queen beds and a desk and dresser and nightstand.  Bathroom was separate from sink area. Closet had a safe for valuables.  Best of all it was quiet. We rarely heard other guests from our room.   The cleaning staff did a great job everyday and we even got a few towel animals to brighten our day.  My son really got a kick out of that.   Hotel amenities were great - pool, kiddie pool, hot tub, grills

Great experience on trip. Arrived for business and extended the stay for pleasure.  Hotel staff are excellent and very helpful. Hotel is clean and well kept. Food was excellent.  Will be back next time travel takes us to this area.

We stayed at the Homewood suites in Anaheim for 2 1/2 weeks.  We had a wonderful holiday coming over from NZ.  If you are going to stay in Anaheim for your disney holiday I highly recommend staying here.  I dont  really have any negatives.  The hotel was very clean, and our suite was cleaned everyday.  We found all the staff very friendly and nothing was a problem.  I was in the fitness centre everyday and the equipment I used was new and always clean.  My two boys loved the pools and spa (and there is a movie on most nights in the pool area).  The breakfast had a great range to choose from and such hard working friendly staff.  It was great to be so close to the Toy story parking where we caught the bus to and from Disneyland for free.   Thanks again Homewood Suites for your

Summary Heading: Our greatest find! This place does 'HOME' really well
Summary: So we are a family of four (2A, 2K - 11 and 14). We arrived in LA after a long flight from Aus. We were exhausted. From the minute we got to Homewood Suites we felt at home. We arrived early - not sure exactly what time but our flight landed about 8 so we reached the hotel before lunch time. We were checked in straight away by friendly and welcoming front of counter staff. Our room was wonderfully quiet (we were in the back corner of the hotel on the second floor).   These rooms are so well equipped for families with a great kitchen including a full size fridge. (With a note on the fridge saying that if you need any groceries fill in the card and we will deliver it to your room!!)  Breakfast was great. Everyone has breakfast included so there is no having your name marked off or

Summary Heading: Homewood Suites by Hilton Anaheim California USA
Summary: My wife and I, and part of our extended family, stayed in the Homewood Suites for our Disneyland Holiday experience. The Hotel is ideally located about a 15 minute walk to the Disneyland entrance although we understand a shuttle is available if you prefer. The unit was modern,spacious and well appointed with a microwave,cooktop,dishwasher, fridge, in- room safe, ceiling fan, air-conditioning and very comfortable bedding. The room was serviced daily.Each floor had coin operated washing and drying facilities available for guests. The Hotel includes within the room price a light dinner ( night time meal) Monday to Thursday. Breakfast is also included and is quite extensive in terms of hot and cold choices. The Hotel has an excellent pool,spa pool, games room and mini putt putt golf

Summary Heading: "Happiest Place on Earth" extends to this Hotel!
Summary: This hotel is within walking distance to Disneyland and the Anaheim Convention Center - located right on Harbor Blvd.  If you need a Starbucks fix, there's one on the ground floor of the Hyatt House hotel that sits on the corner of Harbor and Katella - a few blocks from this hotel.  Large driveway so if you're getting dropped off, you do not have to feel the pressure of the traffic on the main road as you unload your luggage under a covered porch.  If you're driving, there's ample parking on both sides of the hotel.  There are multi entrances to the hotel from the parking lot.  Self-parking is at $18 per night.  If you have guests visiting, or if you do not intend to park overnight, you can ask the front desk for a complimentary parking pass.  Lobby is spacious and modernly

Summary Heading: Such a great place for a family!
Summary: We were 7 adults, 7 children fitting comfortably into 3 suites. A short walk got us on the Disney bus and it was a 15-20 minute walk to the Disney gates. The suites were clean and comfortable. The hot breakfast (open at 6:30am) got us all off to a great start for the day. We only managed to make it to 1 social hour but it was all we needed for dinner that night. I highly recommend this hotel for a visit to Disney or anything else in the area. The only suggestion I would make is that the hotel try harder to reserve rooms for families closer together. 2 rooms were on the same floor but the 3rd was on a different floor entirely, making it more difficult for the families to visit each other.

Summary Heading: Taking Family to Disney? STOP SEARCHING AND BOOK HERE!
Summary: Boy oh boy, where do I even begin?!  Our flight arrived late in LAX, and we finally got to this Homewood Suites to check in after 11:00 p.m.! The lovely lady at the front desk (can't remember her name, but she had short hair and glasses and was sooo sweet!) got us checked in promptly so that we could get in and get some rest!  We booked the King family suite with bunk beds for the older kids, and the fold out sofa bed in the other room for my 21 year old stepdaughter. The hotel provided us with a pop-up crib for our 19 month old to sleep in. The room was spacious with plenty of room for all 6 of us to feel comfortable and not cramped. The beds were super comfortable, and even the sofa bed was comfy to snuggle up in. The boys didn't want to leave their warm soft bunk beds!

By far one of the best hotel experiences I have had in many years! Starting with Christian at the front desk who accommodated my requests for early-check-in...and greeted me by name (remembering I was the pesky phone caller requesting it!) at check-in...to all the polite, courteous staff  all throughout the hotel. But folks, lets talk comfort, spaciousness, activites and AMENITIES!!! First rate breakfast food availaable..and good tasting waffles from the make-your-own machine! Juices, coffee/tea/fruits/hardboiled eggs/oatmeal (very popular..they were always having to bring freshly made out)/yogurt/bagels/muffins/english muffin....entrees seem to trade off from one day to nest: eggs/sausage/gravey/hashbrowns/mexian fare to make your own breakfast burriot    etc etc...filling and

Summary Heading: Great hotel for location and friendness.
Summary: This is a great hotel for group travel. Along with family travel the staff is very friendly and will to assist in any way needed.  They are great with families and children.   They don't make you feel like your questions are unanswered.

We loved our stay!  The rooms were very clean. Great amenities. Great swimming pool area. Great bbq grills available.  The staff was friendly and helpful. Great location to the Disneyland parks!  We had a great time.

Hotel was easy to find off the interstate 5. lovely lobby, room and staff. I would def stay again. hotel was near disnelyland, though we were not there for fun but for business, this hotel was vey nice. met our expectations. I liked how the parking lot was secure by a gate, and needed a ticket to come in and out.

This is a perfect place if you are planning a Disneyland trip with family. Suites are very spacious with full Kitchen and living room area. 2 queen beds in bedroom w desk and chair in addition to a living room w full kitchen. Staff is friendly, place is very clean, full breakfast is pretty good. It's about 20-25 min walk to Disneyland entrance or $6 Uber. You can also request hotel driver with charge vehicle for $10. I think shuttle is also available. Couple food options w in walking distance. Gym overlooks pool area, sitting are in lobby and you can even buy park tickets and front desk. We do a yearly Disneyland trip stay a couple nights and this will be my go to hotel from now on. Loved our stay. Best place for your $$.

Lovely hotel clean great location safe $20 for parking at Disney good walking distance.  Great breakfast buffet and a social hour which they serve a light meal with a Complementary adult  beverage which was nice and relaxing after a long day.  Clean rooms friendly staff. Was nice to come to a clean room every night got spoiledüòä

We recently stayed at HOMEWOOD SUITES for 27 days. Some construction issues with our home brought us to checking into a hotel and we chose HOMEWOOD SUITES. We cannot explain in this one REVIEW how wonderful this hotel is. So many amenities. Breakfast in the morning is plentiful. Dinner M-Thursday in the evening is a 'lite menu' but wonderful just the same. We were on the TOP floor and loved all the views to the POOL area. The hotel is very quiet. We slept wonderfully in their comfy beds. The room is a very good size and a STOCKED kitchenette with dishes and silverware and a dishwasher and refrigerator. The STAFF are all AWESOME! From the Front Desk to the Kitchen Staff to Housekeeping! All very attentive to your needs! This Hotel is a "DISNEYLAND GOOD NEIGHBOR". It is located so

I will preface this by saying I researched hotels like crazy trying to find the best option for our 6 night stay.  We are also Hilton Gold and try to look to the Hilton brand when we travel - finding it generally a good value for a family.  Having said all of that, we would probably pick somewhere else on a return trip.  Observations:  We walked back and forth to the park and found the walk to not be bad at all (2 adults and 2 boys-ages 9 &10).  I averaged about 24k steps daily on my Fitbit.  We did take the Toy Story shuttle once on the way back to the hotel just to see how it compared to walking.  We  calculated we saved about 2 minutes over walking and the hassle of using the shuttle was not worth it to us.  The employees working in the breakfast area where wonderful.  It

I love the helpfulness of the staff, the quality of cleaning and food service, and the extras this hotel offers. I needed extra items and each time they were helpful to get those to me. This is our 2nd stay at this location and we Would go back.

Summary Heading: Very close to shuttle service to Disneyland.  Breakfast and light dinner, too!
Summary: This hotel was nice enough and close to convenience stores and a few restaurants.  It had room for all 3 of my kids, though one chose to sleep on the couch instead of the top bunk (quite high up) We did have a kitchen, though we only used the fridge.  The breakfast and light dinner was nice and we tried to take advangage of that.  Nice pool, etc.  though we only say by it while eating.  Loud peole above us - Mostly clean, a few hairs here and there and had to ask for towels once.  Shuttle to the parks right next door so we did not rent a car.  I would stay here again.

This hotel had more to offer than any other hotel that I have ever stayed in. I wish there were more hotels like this one.  1) The staff were unbelievable, always pleasant and greeting you with a smile and a "hello". Our sink stopper was stuck and after talking to the front desk in the evening, a maintenance person fixed it the next day. 2) The public areas and rooms were very clean. 3) The food at breakfast and in the evening was amazing. One night there was potato salad, two kinds of soup, garlic bread, vegetables, pineapple, crackers, salty snacks and pita chips. They offer complimentary beer or wine. And white or red. And when I wanted the red, there were three kinds of red! Another night was rice with chicken stir fry but again a bunch of other foods to go with it. On a

After a 14hr flight, the staff allowed us to check in Early. Great customer service and we also received two bottles of water at reception. The room was clean and large a very comfortable. Breakfast was ok. They should make diner time longer

Had the pleasure of 9 nights at this hotel after staying here last year.  Does not disappoint.  Breakfast is brilliant.  Very organised.  Monday-Thursday reception is far from light dinner, how could anyone go and have dinner after these sittings?  Wi-Fi, washing and dryer machines all worked well and the kids loved the basketball and pool.  All staff from reception, housekeeping (loved the towel animals!) and kitchen staff go above and beyond to make you feel welcome.  A big thankyou to Melissa, Christian, Antonio and the snack lady for making our stay here so perfect!  Cannot praise this hotel enough.

I had high expectations for this hotel after reading all the positive reviews.  I'll start with the positives, which is by far the location.  As other reviews mentioned the location is nice.  You can walk to Disneyland in about 20 minutes or catch the Disney parking buses in the adjacent Disneyland parking lot.  That was very useful, especially after a long day at the park.  The rooms were relatively well maintained as well.  The breakfast that they serve is nice and convenient along with the evening social/snack/dinner that they have on the weekdays.  Now for the negatives.  The walls are extremely thin.  I could literally hear the person in the room next door snoring.  I've never experienced anything like that before!  Also if you're not on the top floor, you will obviously
Manager Response: Dear semifrequentflier,  We take great pride in the service and amenities we provide to our guests and I cannot apologize enough for falling short on that during your stay. I assure you that the issues that occurred are by no means the norm and it sounds as if we most definitely have a training opportunity for our team communication. I would love to have the opportunity to speak to you to find out the location of your suite to see if we are able to determine more about the issues with sound and also try to make it right for the issues that occurred. Please feel free to call me at 714-750-2010 or email me at keith.moses@hilton.com.

Summary Heading: ANOTHER ENJOYABLE STAY AT HOMEWOOD SUITES
Summary: Enjoyed another 9 night stay at the HOmewood Suites.  Staff were friendly, efficient and knowledgeable.  The rooms were quite spacious , comfortable and clean.  The complimentary breakfast was great.  I don't generally have any complaints about this hotel - other than the breakfast area does get quite noisey and chaotic (which really isn't the hotel's fault).  I think some children need  a little supervision with their breakfast items as there were lots of overfills, spills and wastage - which is a shame.  Other than that, loved my whole experience and would definitely recommend this hotel - especially to families staying longer than a couple of days as having the complimentary breakfast and the kitchens in rooms is great.

Summary Heading: TOP NOTCH... BEST Hotel in the Disneyland Area!
Summary: LOVED this hotel.  We've stayed in several in the area mostly the hotels at the crosswalk and close to Disneyland.  This time we were staying in the area for 9 nights so Tripadvisor reviewers suggested this hotel and it was PERFECT for our needs.  Yes it's a little more of a walk but if you can't be bothered with the walk, just stroll next door to the Toy Story Parking Lot and catch the free shuttle right to the main gate of Disneyland.    We loved the additional space provided in each of the family suites and the kitchenette was helpful when feeding the grandchildren.  I had booked two of the family suites,  one of the King Suites and a Two Queen Suite and each of them was well appointed and ideal for the needs.  The evening social 'meals' were perfect after a Disney day with

Summary Heading: Very clean and comfortable, perfect for families
Summary: The rooms were very spacious and clean, perfect for families, they offer free breakfast as well. Great quality, for the price. Walking distance to Disneyland. Very convenient. Staff was helpful and friendly

Summary Heading: Clean, good location, excellent food, very helpful!
Summary: We stayed 3 nights here. Our room was clean, spacious, and had every amenity we needed and more. Breakfast was delicious and the staff was very helpful. Parking was a little pricy, but it was safe we were able to enjoy our stay.

My wife and I just stayed here for 3 nights and it was great! The rooms are very nice, spacious and quiet! They also have a nice kitchenette and a good free hot breakfast, a full breakfast. They also have a happy hour Tuesday thru Thursday with enough food to make it dinner 5 to 7 pm. The location for Disney is great too! Just walk 3 minutes out the door to the toy story parking lot and take the parking shuttle bus right to the park! The hotel is very nice, new and modern and has a great pool too! We would stay here again for sure!

Summary Heading: Great hotel for family and kids.
Summary: We stayed here for our Disney Vacation. What a great place to stay. Staff were very accommodating. Our suite was awesome and were lucky enough to get a view of the fireworks at night from our room. Nice to have hot breakfast s before a long day at the parks. Happy hour was good as well. Highly recommend this hotel.

I cannot fault anything about this hotel. After a long international flight and transfer from LAX we were given access to our room hours before official check in time. The staff were all friendly and welcoming. The room was amazing - large, clean and very comfortable. The evening drinks were a nice touch and our kids loved the pool. We walked to Disneyland every day and then caught the free Toy Story shuttle back to the car park next door. I would definitely stay here again.

Clean, comfortable rooms with plenty of space for families. We have stayed at many hotels in the area but this is our favorite and now we won't stay anywhere else. There is always coffee and tea in the lobby. The staff is professional and friendly.

Great hotel close to Disney free shuttle bus service. Local hotels within walking distance.  Free breakfast and evening social including drinks and dinner a definite bonus. Overall a very nice experience - will definitely stay here again.

Everything about this hotel was a great experience for my family. We were here for 7 days and didn't have a single complaint. The cleaning staff is amazing and the place smells so freaking clean all the time. The front desk staff was very accommodating when we arrived hours early - they held our bags for us and checked us in 2 hours early with a view of the fireworks. Breakfast is very good but a bit packed, as expected, so maybe arrive when it begins. Evening social was very good too - we often enjoyed our stuff poolside after a long day at Disneyland. We played mini golf and tried the arcade out. The arcade could use a little updating but it was a nice feature. We will definitely be back!

Stayed here recently for a couple angels games.  First time we've stayed at this Hilton property.  Good stay, and nice breakfast.  Close to most Anaheim locations.  Would stay here again.  Not far from Disneyland and Angel Stadium.  Close to the freeway.  Had a great time

This is an excellent family venue but because of this don't  expect to be able to get any sleep ins.  rooms are good with good facilities breakfast is a little bit crazy because the hotel is so busy.  evening social nights are great . nice pool,  mini-golf , basketball court and fire pit.

Summary Heading: Book it!! Best decision you will ever make!!
Summary: Let me tell you about it... We have stayed in this hotel 3 times and its an amazing hotel rooms are very clean! Best of the best complimentary FULL breakfast you will ever received from any hotel believe me!! ALL staff is amazing from front desk to housekeeping everyone always with a smile on their face greeting you at all times! This hotel has a lot of amenities s big pool, kids pool, jacuzzi, basketball court, golf, fireplace & one the amaze me was 3 very super clean grills!! Everything from this hotels makes feel be at home! For a reason its called Homewood Suites!! Our houses keeping Maria did an amazing job!! If you go to Disneyland you walk to the parking lot in the corner from hotel and shuttle bus to Disney in minutes!! Book it Book it!! It will be the best decision you

Summary Heading: Excellent Room, Excellent Service, Excellent Location
Summary: Stayed at the Homewood Suites for the first time for one week and my family and I were extremely satisfied with our experience. The place was super clean, nice pool, large hot tub, friendly staff, laundry facilities, you name it. The only thing lacking was a restaurant/bar. But it wasn't missed much, since we spent so much time at Disney. I would stay here again 1,000 times over. Great price, great choice!

Very comfortable - great facility - excellent breakfast and evening buffet - staff very helpful -  excellent value. Kitchen was very well equipped - good size refrigerator - our family of five were very comfortable and very happy with our stay

What a nice hotel.  Looks new and in great shape.  The breakfast was good, the service at the front desk was great.  The property had movies at night, nice pool and even a putting green and bball hoop.  Easy walk to Disneyland.  Awesome.

This hotel is the best! Second time staying here for 8-9 nights. Hotel is maintained well, always clean, and the stff is so welcoming and helpful. The breakfast was delicious, and the lite evening meal. Great money saver! Wonderful pool/spa too!

My daughter was verbally assaulted by someone sneaking into the side doors of the hotel and using their restrooms to straighten their hair and do their makeup.  She began verbally berating my daughter who wanted to wash her hands. Awful start of our first morning to Disney with a crying daughter and nearly a fight in the bathroom. Busy breakfasts, but staff is efficient. Rooms were sufficient. Security needs to be better to keep transients out. My 11 year old daughter was traumatized and did not feel safe for the rest of our 6 night stay. It took her until Day 3 to feel ok enough to get her own food in the public area and she no longer wants to go into ANY public restroom without me accompanying her. Management offered her a water bottle, but no other effort was made to make her
Manager Response: I am so sorry that your child was traumatized by the incident at the hotel. As a parent myself I certainly understand that seeing your child frightened in any way is painful, not only for the child, but for the parents as well.   Please know that we take security extremely seriously. All entrances require keycard access at all times with the exception of the front entry, which is only locked overnight, but is constantly monitored during the day by the front desk personnel. We do also keep private security for added protection overnight as well. Please know that the incident that occurred was by no means ignored by the hotel. We found out that the person in question had come in through the side door which is located next to the public restrooms when another guest was on their way out. They immediately went into the public restroom at which time the unfortunate incident occurred. As soon as we found out about the incident we immediately sent multiple managers, supervisor, and additional staff to attempt to locate the person in question and secure the hotel. The person had already left the premises. I believe our Assistant General Manager and Sales Manager dealt directly with your family attempting to reassure your daughter at the time that she was now safe.  Again, I know none of this changes the fact that this incident negatively impacted your family vacation. Please feel free to contact me at 714-750-2010 or email me at keith.moses@hilton.com so I am able to prove our commitment to your satisfaction.

Summary: The staff and accomodations were amazing.  Definitely going to stay here again and will refer others.  The convenience and cost were outstanding for what they offer. Thank you for the great family trip!

This hotel is in a great location lots of choices for great food restaurants there is a Target right across from the hotel. When I arrived to the hotel I was greeted by a male front desk agent who was really nice and mentioned the breakfast and stated all the amenities at the hotel I really liked that. He told us where our room was and where we can park which was great as well and the easiest way to enter our room so far so good . Once I entered the room it was so beautiful but the one thing I asked the hotel is  not to be on street view or near exits or anything that could be  noisy and they put me near a exit and I had street noise. Ugh that sucked. When I walked near the room I noticed stains on the bed and pillows I went down stairs to the front desk and there was Rochelle I

We recently stayed at Homewood Suites, with our two young sons.  We were very happy with the accommodation.  It was modern, and had lots of activities for the kids (pool, basketball hoop, games room, movie nights, mini golf).  For the adults there was also a jacuzzi.  The staff were very helpful and well mannered and we were lucky to get an early check in at 8am after a long flight when normal check in was much later in the day. The hotel had a buffet breakfast and a 2 hour 'social' at 5pm most weeknights, where you could have a drink and light snack (salad, cheese and crackers, fruit, or chicken noodle soup etc).   A lot of people seemed to use this as an early dinner although it didn't suit our fussy eaters and we had to walk 5 minutes to nearby restaurants. Disneyland was a

Had a great a stay in this modern facility and for a family visiting the area (close to Disneyland) value for money. The staff were helpful, there was plenty of food for adults and children.  The pool area (there are 3 pools) catered for young and old.  We felt very safe while were staying there as our party included seniors to babies.

Summary Heading: A Magical Stay at Homewood Suites
Summary: Everything from the helpful front desk staff, the superb breakfast, the beautiful, clean and functional suites, and all the extras that they throw in, made our trip to Disneyland just perfect. The front desk staff is efficient and knowledgeable and eager to help. Every time we would walk by they would give my son a balloon and it just made his day (and mine since we didn't have to buy the $25 dollar ones at disneyland) The complimentary breakfast has so many choices and it is different every day. There are waffle griddles, cereal, muffins, pastries, a yogurt bar, an oatmeal bar, toast, bagels, and hot breakfast options as well. Their biscuits are AMAZING! The room we stayed in was a one bedroom suite with a king bed and it was perfect for our family. Our son is two so we blew up

Summary Heading: 30th NPN  , very relaxing hotel with great staff. Avery was very friendly and helpful. Manager she were very very nice.
Summary: Staff were very friendly made me feel welcome . Family oriented   Home away from home atmosphere . Great food and service.  If you looking for  a nice hotel check out this one. You get your money worth l, guarantee you will enjoy your visit . Right down d street from Roscoe chicken and waffle.

After rebooking short notice because of hurricane of irma this hotel was a little in three pricey students for my budget but, the room was amazing.   Clean with plenty of room and would be fantastic for a family with children.  The included breakfast was nice but would have liked to have seen more fruit options ( the waffles were a big hit with my husband). The whirl pool on the property was clean and a good temperature. This hotel is perfect for visiting disney as it is an easy walk to the toy story parking lot where you can catch the free shuttle. Staff were friendly and helpful.  Would stay here again if i could afford it.

Thank you for another great experience.  5 star thank you. The service of the hotel is great, the cleanliness is perfect and it is really a truly perfect family hotel. Free breakfast is the best. its so close to disneyland thats the best.

The location is convenient to the Toy Story lot shuttles and the Convention Center.  The hotel is clean and new, but the rooms feel bland.  Complementary breakfast is very good.  Excellent staff who are very friendly and helpful.  This hotel pretty much offers everything you would need for a great stay in Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Hotel Very Good but Watch out for the Shower
Summary: We enjoyed the hotel food, closeness to Disneyland and the housekeeping staff.  Be sure to check your shower because 3 of us slipped in ours.  Check in online before you check in at the desk to be able to use your phone for in and out privileges.

Just returned home from 10 days at this hotel (2 families of 4). I have never written a review before but felt I had to share how fantastic it was. The hotel is clean, convenient (15 min walk to Disneyland or 2 min walk to free shuttle), great hot breakfast with lots of choices, happy hour (beer and wine) & pretty much dinner every Mon-Thur. Free wifi.  Movies at night on the wall by the pool, bbq area if you want to bbq your own dinner (we did!). You might pay a bit more for the hotel, but these cost savings (ie: breakfast and happy hour) make it worth the while. The front desk staff are very helpful. The kitchen staff incl. Karla, Victor, Jorge, Margarita and Elsa were great to us.  They even wrapped us up a happy hour dinner when we were running late. Service like that

The staff and accommodations were excellent! The coordination of 11 rooms was made easy. The food (breakfast and dinner) was great! The digital key worked every time and made the access to hotel, parking, room, etc. so easy!

Excellent and informed staff able to answer local navigation questions.  Great large room and full kitchen.  Only improvement to request: Please add a privacy curtain between the sink area and the beds.  Otherwise great great great!

Nothing to complain about, everything to compliment. Front desk staff was friendly, rooms were clean and quiet, and breakfast was delicious. Definitely would recommend staying here especially if you're going to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: So Cal City Pass Family Vacation
Summary: Choose this hotel due to their free breakfast offered daily and is right next to the Toy Story Woody parking lot which is a 5-10 minute walk from the hotel. There are shuttles buses that run all day everyday that you take from the woody parking lot to Disneyland.   PROS:   1. Free Breakfast and Free dinner Mon-Thursday 5-7pm. Free Beer and wine also. 2. Short Walking Distance to the Toy Story parking lot which provides shuttle service to Disneyland. 3. Huge Swimming Pool, separate baby pool and huge hot tub. Children's Movies played at night at the pool.  4. Basketball Court 5. Mini Golf "one hole"  6. Arcade Room 7. Comfortable Beds 8. Awesome Rooms with kitchenette and basic essentials. Full size refrigerator and full size Microwave. Small kitchen Table.  9. Great Location

Just returned from a fabulous 12 night stay here with 3 kids aged 5, 8 & 12.  Room with king size bed, bunk beds and pull out bed under bottom bunk meant no need to use sofa bed in lounge area.  Room was spotlessly clean and had everything we needed.  Free wifi was good, pool nice and warm, plenty of towels and sun beds and pool area was kept clean.  Breakfast had something for everyone, though was a little manic at times with people letting their kids get mountains of food which was then generally dropped all over the floor or just wasted. Restaurant staff worked tirelessly in a morning, anything that ran out was replenished immediately and despite the chaos they always had a smile for everyone.  Mon-Thurs evening snack with wine or beer was a really nice touch (though don't

Due to the lack of response, staff attitude and time it took to receive items we will not return to this hotel.  We requested several times for the same items. At one point the front desk person did have an attitude in their tone. Waiting for a crib for 5 hours is unacceptable for a facility this size.
Manager Response: Hello leilan815,  Thank you for your feedback. We sincerely apologize for the lack of service you received. We will follow-up with our team and find out what happened for improvement purposes. We ill also follow-up with the person at the front desk that assisted you. We never want anyone to ever think that our front desk personnel have an attitude and I will make sure this is clear to everyone on our team. Please feel free to contact me directly when booking your next Disneyland vacation. I would love to help out and see how we can make up for any short-falls.

Summary Heading: Great location for Disney but mixed reviews...
Summary: We were super excited about our trip to Disneyland and this newer hotel on the strip nearby.  Some things were really great and some were not.    Here's our mixed reviews, and I'll start with the CONS: 1. Shuttle buses are next door but there is no direct path from hotel to the bus line, so you have to walk around.  We rode on these free shuttle buses every day - it's great for adults but the little ones may not want to walk back especially after a long day at Disney.  If you have young kids who are toddler to early elementary, you will want to bring a stroller or two, or take the public bus which drops you off across the street. 2. Morning staff at the front desk were not so friendly, and not helpful with general questions about the hotel's amenities.  Ask to speak to the

This was an excellent hotel. Their hot breakfasts were great with lots of variety and then 4 days a week they had dinner included. It was very clean and staff were very friendly. They had movies by the pool, a putting green and basketball hoop. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who are heading to Disney and surrounding areas

This hotel is close enough to Disneyland to walk, however, the Disneyland Toy story parking lot is adjacent to the hotel, so it is a quick walk to grab the Disneyland shuttle busses from their parking area. The staff at this hotel are very accommodating and helpful. Everyone was friendly, and the rooms were cleaned on a timely basis. Hon from housekeeping was excellent.  The hotel can arrange a private car service, which we utilized to go to the beach for the day. Reasonably priced, and dependable. Highly recommend!  The only slightly negative thing is the room noise from the room above. Had hoped that since the hotel is a newer construction there wouldn't be a noise issue between rooms. And the breakfast is your standard complimentary fare. Would have loved to have had access

Visited for family holiday for 9 nights! This hotel is new and it shows; the rooms are spotless and comfy, housekeeping are outstanding and preserve your privacy whilst servicing your room. The pool area is amazing with lots of beds towels and in the evening there is a kid film and fire put when there's a nip in the air! The BBQ is good but we didn't use it.   The breakfast is a real bonus....the staff work so so hard to keep food replenished and well stocked. However we found the weekend really busy and hard to get a table; there are also lots of greedy people taking far more food than they need or to make lunch to take to parks which means there is less for others. There was a huge range of hot and cold food and decent quality. It's a real shame that people abuse this; but a

Excellent location. Nice clean hotel. Suite was comfy for the family. Pool and hot tub were just fine and clean. Staff was friendly even though they were not good for directions to anywhere outside of Anaheim. They must all live close by and not drive a lot-use computer Mapquest.  Parking should be free for Hilton Honors members and it was not. Washer and Dryer are coin operated ($2.00 each). Beware-dryer set for 1 hour timeframe (cannot be adjusted to less time) and my medium load still wasn't dry. Has to pay $2.00 again to reset dryer ($4.00/2 hours to dry 1 medium load-ridiculous). Several breakfast choices, hot and cold. Some days the hot choices weren't all that great so the family just took fruit or muffin. Only ate at evening social once--pasta and bread but no meat or
Manager Response: Dear Karena390,  Thank you for putting together such a comprehensive email about the hotel and surrounding area. It sounds like the majority of your stay was good, but we strive for outstanding! My maintenance has already looked into the settings to ensure drying time is shorter for future guests and we will be following up with the front desk in regard to area attractions. We have actually spent quite a bit of time training them on this in the past, but refreshers are obviously required! I have also taken note of your comments regarding our complimentary food and beverages. We are always striving to make things better than they were. We hope to see you on your next vacation to the Anaheim Resort area.

Summary Heading: Home sweet home at the Homewood suites
Summary: Well where do I start! Me and my husband looked for ages at a hotel to stay in for our Anaheim Vacay. We eventually settled on Homewood suites and trust me its not a disappointment!  We checked in fairly late at night but the lady on reception was lovely and very chatty. After going through the key points and completing check in we made our way to the room.
