Our room was 459 and although the view wasn‚Äôt the best (the car park!) it was a lovely room.  As you enter the room you have a decent size hallway, off of there is the bathroom. Very spacious and a great shower although you do have to wait 5 mins for the water to get to the hot temp. Normal amenities shampoo, conditioner, body lotion etc neutrogena brand.   The main part of the room is lovely and spacious, a huge bed, decent

What a great time our family of 12 had at this Homewood Suites! The staff was amazing! Helpful, nice & very accommodating!!! The rooms were super clean with extra towels every day! The food staff worked equally as hard! Many to feed & they really kept the food coming ! Fresh fruit , baked goods , waffle machines ! Every night and every morning they clean the facility meticulously!!! Very impressive and would definitely return and recommend to friends !!

We stayed for 8 days with a 5-day park hopper pass!  It couldn't have any more pleasant and affordable - we even used Hilton points for a big price reduction!  Perfect with two little ones and a teen-ager!

Summary Heading: Super comfortable suite hotel within walking distance of Disneyland
Summary: Loved this hotel - lovely swimming pool area (big pool, plenty of space, blue sky and palm trees!!), room was clean, spacious and so comfortable. Fabulous having a kitchenette and being able to drive a couple of blocks to the grocery store to feed ourselves. Walking distance to Disneyland (but you can take the shuttle from the Disney parking lot next door if you want to).  Staff were lovely.  Breakfast crowded at peak times and finishes fairly early (9.30am)

Summary Heading: One of the best Hotels we have stayed in!
Summary: We normally stay at Hilton properties but we're doing a last minute trip and ended up at a competitor. We had major issues so began looking and found this gem. Staff was excellent, front desk, cleaners and those preparing in the food area. The breakfast was very good and had different options each day. We were there a week. Breakfast was great as well as evening meal and drinks. Huge pool plus kiddy pool plus big jacuzzi and always had fresh towels. There were many people at this hotel but never had to wait on elevator or to find a chair. The location is a short walk from convention center and next door to shuttle lot for Disney. There are many restaurants within walking distance. We would definitely stay here again.

We are Disney annual pass holders so we came in town for a quick overnight trip. Overall a pretty good stay, just a few issues. I booked the room through TripAdvisor (redirected to Expedia) a few hours before arrival so when we arrived the front desk did not have record of my booking. Since it was through a 3rd party, I had to call Expedia and get them to explain to the front desk that I did indeed have a reservation. This took a good 30 minutes. When we finally got that settled they said they did not have the room type (2 Queen Suite) that was booked online but they would give me a king with bunk beds. My children are 23 and 17 so I explained how they would not be as comfortable in bunk beds. They did make some adjustments so that we were able to get the room we booked. And

Great staff. Friendly and helpful. Room was clean and great breakfast. Kids love the pool, basketball court. Close walking distance to Disneyland.  We could see the fireworks from our room. Bonus!  Would stay there again.

Summary Heading: family vacation with the mouse down the street
Summary: I'm a planner and researcher when it comes to travel with my family. We were planning a big trip to see the "big park" in the Anaheim area, and this hotel came up with just about everything on our wish list.   I was traveling with the spouse, and 3 pre-teen/teenaged children.  Separate sleeping area for the teen boy? Check Breakfast buffet for the hungry kids (and to save $$)? Check Separate vanity area from the bathroom so we can move multiple family members around easily? Check Pool? Check Fridge? Check  The putting green, small arcade area, and movies shown in the pool area were a bonus. As was the happy hour food options - a light meal after a hot day in the parks makes for happy kids, and beer or wine for happy parents. Tasty options of drinks too - local wine and beer

My family had an outstanding stay at the Homewood Suites. We had a room on the 5th floor in the front corner of the hotel -- from the living room there was an excellent view of the Disneyland fireworks each night. It is an easy 15 minute walk to the Harbor Blvd. entrance of the Disneyland-California Adventure Esplanade. But, it's also less than a 10 minute walk into the Toy Story parking lot to take the shuttle to the Esplanade. The shuttle is free and buses run continuously. Rarely a wait.  The hotel is newer and in very good condition. We did a little bit of cooking in the kitchen. The room was very clean and everything in good working order.   The free buffet breakfast was very nice. Slight menu changes each morning were fun and tasty. We also enjoyed the free weeknight light

Our stay at the homewood suites was great! Our flight was delayed and we didn't arrive at the hotel until 3am and what a relief it was to hop into a comfy bed!   The room it's self was great, we were in a king bed studio suite and it was big enough for the two of us, might be a bit cramped with anymore people. The kitchen and bathroom were great and clean.   Of course if you are staying here you are probably going to Disneyland and this was a perfect hotel for that. We walked to and from the parks and it took around 15min each way.   The complimentary buffet breakfast was delicious and had a great range of foods, my favourite was the fresh waffles!   We only went to the evening social one night during our stay as we had been at the parks for the other nights and we were

Great newer hotel with excellent service! All the amenities you need and steps from the Disney shuttle. Most importantly the team here will go to no ends to make it a great stay! Breakfast and evening snack/super are a very generous.

This was our first stay in this hotel. We had previously stayed at another hotel just up the road, but decided to try something new - and were so pleased with our choice! The staff are all so helpful & extremely friendly. This hotel has everything a family needs. Beautifully clean rooms, which are well stocked with fresh towels every day and full of fantastic amenities. The well equipped kitchen area meant we were able to prepare a packed lunch for our fussy eating 5 year old before we went out each day & the separate living & sleeping areas are perfect as you don't get the same cabin fever as a normal hotel room gives you when everyone is trying to get ready! The breakfast choices were excellent, as were the evening socials. Loved the complimentary tea & coffee in the foyer &

What a great hotel overall. The staff were very friendly and helpful throughout our staff. First night after long day of flying, we got to room and couldn't unlock safe so we called down and were hoping it wouldn't take too long so our child could go to bed and maintenance was up in about a minute to unlock it for us. The room was super roomy and was great to have the kitchen even if we didn't use it completely. Nice to have a fridge to keep fruit and beverages cold and microwave to heat things up or make popcorn for a snack. The complimentary breakfast was great with lots of choices and variety from waffles to biscuits to make your egg mcmuffin or burrito, oatmeal, fresh fruit, muffins, toast, bagels, etc. It got busy after 8am though but food was replenished quick.  The

This a wonderful hotel for all families. We stayed in a family suite and it contained all the creature comforts of home. The Hotel is exceptionally run and the staff is superb. Cleaning staff was off the charts great and accommodating. The pool area is fantastic. We made excellent use of the clean and tidy barbeque area. The dinner and breakfast options offered were fantastic and the round the clock free fresh coffee was a great touch. To many great staff to name here so I will just say that I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a family friendly hotel close to Disney

We only stayed here for 2 nights as a base for our Disneyland visit. Usually we stay at a hotel across the road but I'm so glad that I decided to try Homewood Suites this time. Large rooms by any standard. Loved the free coffee in the foyer which was just what I needed. Yes breakfast was very busy, but if you take a few minutes people are always coming and going. Breakfast choices were ample. What I loved was the evening meals. One night they had sliders and the next nachos. We just walked back from Disneyland to have a bite to eat and refresh before going back for the night. You can save yourself some money by eating here. Was great to use the laundry and they had free self parking. Value for money = 100%. My new go to hotel for visiting Disneyland.

The staff was very friendly and helpful, from the check-in desk, to housekeeping and the staff that managed the breakfast and socials each day.   There were a lot of guests at this facility and the staff was very efficient at moving people through quickly and attending to individual needs to make it a very stress-free environment. Hotel was extremely clean and so very close to Disneyland!  Would definitely return to this hotel when in the Anaheim area.

We had an amazing experience here. The staff from top to bottom was incredible. Everyone is happy and helpful. They take care of everything. They even have dinner on Monday to Thursday as part of your package. Hotel is situated in the perfect location to everything you need.   We had an amazing maid who took care of our room. Her name is Maria Antunez. A huge shout out to her. She made our room special every time we came back.   All the best.

Loved this place!  Whatever your reason for staying in Anaheim, coming home after a busy day to Homewood Suites is the best. With all the activities in Anaheim, it's great to stay home a day or two to recharge.  At Homewood there are plenty of on site activities to keep adults and children happy.  Very nice laundry room too.  The accessible guest room we stayed in was top notch with well appointed, spacious kitchen and bathroom.  Courteous and helpful staff.

The hotel staff were amazing! So helpful to our many requests, since we brought a large group! Breakfast buffet was great! Loved the outdoor barbecue area! I highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Very well-run hotel; great base for Convention Center or Disney
Summary: We stayed on the fifth (top) floor. Great layout for our family of 5: bunk beds plus a trundle = a perfect fit for our 3 kids. My husband and I could stay up later in the living room area without disturbing the kids. The kitchenette was very handy, too, although this hotel had one of the biggest free/included breakfasts I've ever seen. Excellent housekeeping service; front desk staff had lots of helpful tips for Disney park visits, etc. No complaints!

The suite reserved was perfect for our family. There were four adults that stayed in the one room that had two queen-size beds and the two younger children slept on the sofa sleeper. Having the refrigerator dishwasher and stove was a big plus. We were very pleased with our stay.

5 star here does not mean it's a 5 star hotel , but it's clean , pool is clean , service is polite and good . Most importantly you walk around the corner to the back of hotel you catch the free shuttle to Disney . Otherwise you need to pay for a resort bus that stops in different places . The free shuttle serves the Toy Store parking lot with direct service to theme parks . First eve the front desk person recommended me to get the paid bus, probably new and didn't know about the free shuttle which is 3 minutes walk behind the hotel . Breakfast is very good for this price hotel , again not ritz Carlton , but absolutely done the job clean and comfortable.

Summary Heading: We'd stay here again in a heartbeat!
Summary: Loved the food, evening light dinner was a great added benefit for our family of 5, and the staff were all great! Housekeepers and meal staff were such sweet people and served so well!‚ù§Ô∏è Thank u for everything!

Summary Heading: A Great Fourth of July Weekend
Summary: We booked the Homewood Suites for our 4th of July holiday.  We did online check-in and chose room 459, which faces the Toy Story Parking Lot of the Disneyland Resort.  This room is also a studio, which means it has a kitchenette, rather than a full-size kitchen.  Physical check-in was easy.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  I did have a problem with the room - though clean, I kept finding stray hairs all about, including on the bedspread.  I brought this to the front desk's attention, and they did a deep cleaning of the room, which I really appreciated; still found stray hairs about that were not mine - I think the hotel may want to invest in stronger vacuum cleaners.  That was my only complaint.  Otherwise, the bed was soft, the water pressure was strong, and they supplied us

Summary Heading: Great deal for families, within walking distance to Disney shuttle lot and the Disney parks!
Summary: Spacious rooms include separate bedroom, livingroom and kitchen/dining areas. Daily breakfast included; themed appetizers/dinner Monday through Thursday; $18 daily parking with in/out privileges; hotel also includes gameroom, putting course and pool with movies on the big screen!  Great, friendly staff answered all our questions! Was also able to purchase twilight Disney passes when plans changed at the last minute.

A very nice place, near Disney and the Congress Center. Very clean rooms and friendly staff. If you had to say anything, the cleaning of the room is very late and also the check in is late. We booked the room with breakfast but also got dinner for free in the evening.

If you are looking for above and beyond the average hotel accommodations, we recommend the Homewood Suites, Anaheim, CA.  Walking distance to Disney shuttle and Disneyland Parks.  Great outdoor pool.  Families welcome.

Summary Heading: A Sweet Stay At Homewood Suites
Summary: Our party of three were greeted with warmth sand courtesy.  Our rooms were ready and we were offered free water (a nice touch).  The rooms were very clean and comfortable.  The bed was very comfortable!!  All amenities were provided and having two TV's was a plus.

We had a terrific family holiday in Anaheim, thanks in large part to this wonderful hotel! The rooms are spacious and nicely decorated, the common areas are well-maintained, and the staff is all very helpful! In particular, the staff working in the breakfast/evening reception area works very hard and deserves special recognition. Despite busyness at both breakfast and evening times because of a large conference, the complimentary food and drink was always plentiful and delicious. Martha, Carmen, and Letty were gracious hosts and always went above and beyond to make our stay extra-special. Thank you to them and all the staff at this excellent hotel for making our stay so memorable. We will definitely be back!

Summary Heading: What a great hotel for a family trip to Disney
Summary: Great hotel to be  able  to  use for free, parking shuttle to Disneyland next door. Complimentary breakfasts were fantastic  with lots of choices as were the evening socials. We were a party of 13 so it was a great savings for a family. The children enjoyed the pool and outside facilities. This was my 17th trip to a Disney Park and this was the best accommodation for a family by far.

Summary Heading: Great place for family & business - plus free food!
Summary: I stayed here with my family in a 6 person suite for a business trip, and leisure trip for the family.  The location is super convenient for the Anaheim Convention Center, and even more so for Disney - you can walk to the parking lot shuttle next door.  The amenities are excellent - free robust breakfast, evening social is really a full meal.  Fitness center super clean.  Friendly staff.   I highly recommend this hotel.

Everything about the hotel is lovely!  Hallways, rooms and bathrooms are very clean, modern, and the service is great!  Area was nice.  Walking distance to Disneyland.  I highly recommend the hotel! First rate! *****

Great staff -- appreciated their friendliness and wiliness to serve.  Libby was the best hostess in the breakfast area.  The food was well supplied and crowds managed very well.  The rooms are quiet, very clean, very comfortable beds, great shower (tall!) and many towels supplied.

We stay at a lot of hotels, this was one of our favorites! I loved everything about our stay. This was our very first time in CA. We were attending a conference at the convention center. This hotel was the perfect place to stay. It was in walking distance so we didn't have traffic. Every morning they served a full breakfast. It was delicious! Every day was a little different. The staff went over and above to please the guests. They kept the food full, if something got spilled they quickly cleaned it up. The housekeeping cleaned our room daily, it smelled so fresh when we would return. The pool water was the perfect temperature. During the week they provide a light dinner which for us was perfect! When you are in meetings all day the last thing you need is heavy food. Every night

Summary Heading: Don't expect to get the room you reserve!
Summary: I reserved the family suite with bunk beds, but was told at arrival that I had been "downgraded" because the people in the room decided to stay an extra night. What is the purpose of a reservation then? Other then that It was a good stay. Just disappointed as my son was really excited to sleep on the bunk bed for his birthday.
Manager Response: Ron621,  I cannot apologize enough for the fact that you did not stay in the suite you reserved ahead of time. You are completely correct, when a reservation is made for a specific type of suite, you should get that suite upon arrival. We have an occupancy strategy where we oversell our hotel due to late and same-day cancellations, this is to ensure the hotel maximizes its occupancy efficiency. Unfortunately, you were inconvenienced with this, and I can understand your frustration, and take full responsibility for this. When time permits, please contact myself at Benjamin.Ly@Hilton.com, or directly at the hotel (714)750-2010, so we can discuss what I can do for you.  Thank you, and I look forward to hearing from you,  Benjamin Ly Assistant GM

Summary: This hotel is fairly new. Located close by to Disneyland. The shuttle is a nice walk next door about 10 minutes at the most. The area has many restaurants, if you like to walk and a couple drug stores. The hotel served a buffet breakfast every morning, very busy between 8:30 and 9:30, might have a hard timefindibg a table to sit at, but you could go outside around the pool area. Our room was on the first floor, only complaint was someone above us was heavy footed, but we only heard this in the morning when we were up. Spacious room and bathroom. Only negative there is a door for the shower and toilet but not for sink area where you might use a hair dryer. The sink area is right by bedroom but all in all we were fine with everything. If I had to complain it's not with the hotel

Location, value (breakfast and dinner/drinks), friendly  staff and cleanliness has  been the reason why this is our go to hotel when in town. Grab the free Disney shuttle next door at the "Toy story" parking which takes you to and from. No driving needed if you've had lunch and drinks at the Cove bar at California Adventure. As local residents and Disney pass holders, we don't have to cram all Disney rides in one trip. We do a few rides a day and then return to our hotel to the pool, wash-up and dinner. .  Real convenient for us.  Never disappoints.

The location is perfect to get to Disney as its not too far and not too close. We could of walked but took an uber down to the Disney gates.  The rooms had a small kitchen which allowed us to stock snacks and small meals for the kids.   Separate living space from the bedroom allowed for quiet time.

We stayed at this hotel with the kids shortly after it opened in April of 2016.  We had such an amazing time that we had to come back just us adults.  The front desk is so nice!  Upon arrival, they happily gave us free parking just for returning!!!  Our stay was great, but that made it even better!  The hotel is perfect for Disney as it backs up to the Toy Story parking lot which is a five minute walk.  At this lot, free shuttles to the entrance to Disney come every five minutes!  And, they stop running an hour after the park closes which is awesome.  The hotel is clean and we'll staffed.  Breakfast is ok with a pretty good variety.  The rooms are wonderful with a kitchen, full sized fridge and all the amenities.  The only downside is the beds are really hard.  But, if you are

We were fortunate enough to stay at this hotel for an entire week while vacationing with our kids.  We were within walking distance of Disney (0.9 mi.) and even used the shuttle on occasion.  The staff was excellent, being so polite, and helpful in any way.  The breakfast was fresh and staff was always cleaning up the buffet and tables in order to sit quickly.  The hotel is so clean as the staff works all day to clean everywhere.  The staff here are super polite and friendly.  The rooms are very comfortable, beds excellent.  So nice to have a kitchen and living area when vacationing with family.  I would highly recommend this hotel when traveling to Disney and So.Cal!  We also drove out to see parts of California and the hotel is a quick drive to Route 5 which will get you

Our family was very happy with our stay at Homewood Suites! Every facility at this hotel was very clean and well maintained. The complimentary breakfasts were very good and had something for everyone in our family to enjoy (2 adults, 10-year-old and 7-year-old). The evening socials Monday through Thursday were very enjoyable and the food was surprisingly satisfying. The BBQ area was easy to use and very clean. The beds and pillows were very comfortable. The complimentary toiletries were nice quality. The staff was friendly, accommodating and helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again, and actually look for it in other locations.

Great complimentary breakfast and dinner.  Cheaper than other hotels in the area and only one mile from the Disneyland gates.  The shuttle picks up just outside the hotel doors, but we walked back and forth every day for a three day trip to Disneyland.  The breakfast and evening social were great.  We fed our family fully at each meal every day.  Early breakfast at the hotel followed by 5-6 hours at Disneyland; then a break and dinner at the hotel; and then 3-4 more hours at Disneyland; I don't think our family of seven could have had a better hotel experience.  We will absolutely stay again and highly recommend this hotel.

Stayed here late July/early August for 5 nights. We truly enjoyed our stay and would stay again if in the area. Room was nice, spacious and clean. Bed was comfortable, nice water pressure in the shower, good room temperature control and quiet. All staff encountered were friendly. Had complementary breakfast every morning. A bit chaotic but once you know where to find what you are looking for, it's all good. The ladies who work in the breakfast area are great and deserve recognition! We easily walked to Disney as well as local restaurants such as Red Robin, PF Changs, The Cheesecake Factory, and Starbucks. All were within a mile walk. We did not use the pool so I cannot comment. Internet was good.

This place is very clean with a friendly hard working staff. Nice complimentary breakfast and Complimentary dinner (M-Th). Pool area was super nice, and the kids enjoyed it. Thumbs up to the housekeeping staff and the dining area staff. Everyone was so courteous and very helpful. Overall, the place was very comfortable.

Our suite was very spacious with a very nice layout. Loved having a nice big fridge and freezer for all our food and beverages. Breakfast was AMAZING!! The evening social Mon-Thurs was also amazing with complimentary beer and wine which was definitely a nice surprise!

Neat, modern and clean. We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite with 2 queen beds. The room was spacious and tidy. The suite included a full kitchen (full size refrigerator, stove, etc) which was perfect to prepare meals of our own. The hotel offers a complimentary hot breakfast if you're happy to get up before 9 am. The facilities were handy particularly the guest laundry and the games room was a favourite with the kids. If you're heading to Disneyland, the offsite parking lot is right next door and you can jump on the free car park shuttle bus that takes you to the entry of Disneyland. Overall, I highly recommend Homewood Suites and would stay there again.

Summary Heading: Thought was nice  and comfy til I killed a roach!
Summary: We arrived in the end of June, after a family incident which left us tired and arriving late to the area, we asked for a high floor, but were told there was only one room in our category left, and it was being Super-cleaned because the prior guests made a huge mess.  My kids really wanted the bunk beds, so hesitantly I took the 1st floor room, which I never do, inspected it, and thought, well, its only for one night, so what could be wrong.  Had a great nights sleep, but awoke to a roach crawling on the table next to the beds.  I was blown away, this is a newer property which looked nice, but was not so great.  The hotel was very goof though in helping with our room cost, and apologized, so, that was good, but would I book it again, not likely unless there was no where else
Manager Response: I want to thank you for choosing to stay with us. We are happy to hear that our front desk team was able to provide great service in what was a most disturbing situation. I assure you that what occurred was by no means the norm and definitely not something indicative of our cleanliness standards. After you reported this issue the hotel not only followed up with our pest control company, but also with the city of Anaheim to ensure that they properly abated the sewage lines for pests, which they sprayed for the following week. We have had zero similar issues, prior or since. We would love to have you back to the hotel to regain your trust and prove to you that this was a complete anomaly.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disneyland vacation
Summary: we walked to the park each day after having a big breakfast which is provided complimentary.  Came back to the hotel for the evening social, rest and freshen up and head back to the park. Great location and amenities.

Summary Heading: Great hotel - super close to Disney
Summary: This is a great newer Homewood. Probably my favorite so far. Great for families heading to the Magical Kingdom. We chose the king suite with the added bunk beds which worked out great for our two daughters. You can walk to the Disney parking lot right next door and take the Disney shuttle to the park.  Very large buffet breakfast is served complimentary and it's the biggest I've seen at a Homewood. Great variety to choose from. You can buy your discounted park tickets directly at the front desk.   Here are my 5 by 5 rating notes. Five stars (*) is best:   1) Room Quality: ****   2) Updated Status: *****   3) Front Desk Service: ****   4) Housekeeping Quality: ****   5) Price & Value: ***** Overall Rating = 4.4  Will I return? Absolutely   Internet / WiFi fees?  Breakfast

This place was awesome. We really enjoyed the pool and thought it was cool that they had a game room for kids. Our room was nice and I liked that we only had to hold the key up to the door to unlock it(I didn't even have to take it out of my wallet). Antonio at the front desk had great recommendations on where to eat and go for fun. We'd definitely stay here again.

We used this hotel as our base for a SoCal vacation that included DisneyLand and Beaches. Convenience to DL was amazing, a short walk to the Disney shuttle and a 7 minute ride to the gate. Workers were so friendly. Breakfast was great each day. The night time food on weeknights was such a bonus. Room was very clean. Pool area was very nice.

The facility was conveniently located with quality facilities. The staff and management were customer centric. The breakfast was presented with a diverse array of choices and replenishment with fresh food was appropriate.

Summary Heading: Excellent location and overall a great stay!
Summary: Our 2 week stay at this Homewood was enjoyable, that said there were a few things missing in the comfort and service we would receive years past at the one further along Harbor (Garden Grove). The desk was truly great like they always are, but housekeeping at this one was hit and miss. Some days excellent, others really poor and we had to keep requesting missing towels or soap. The living room area is missing the "comfort factor" the other Homewoods have. Noisy guests can be a problem, and were now and again for us as the walls may be thin. That said, overall, its a fab hotel with great front of desk staff and I'd stay again.

Front desk was very helpful and accommodating and allowed us to use the hotel wheelchair throughout our entire stay after a family member injured her knee the first night of arrival. Overall, the staff was excellent

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel and a great value!
Summary: We stayed here on a whim extending our trip to Disneyland and the D23 Expo.  If I knew then what I know now, I would never have left for another hotel!  The service was great and the hotel was clean.  Our king suite was the perfect size and had everything we needed.  They serve breakfast every morning and also have a happy hour Monday - Thursday included as well (there is food, beer, and wine!).  Excellent hotel and excellent value.  It's within walking distance of the parks and the convention center.

Summary Heading: Amazing choice of over all home wood suites hotels that I've seen so far
Summary: What can i say .. Definitely deserves the 1st choice in Anaheim and probably the best disney neighbor  Great choice for families visiting disney  I've definitely enjoyed my stay and it wouldn't be my last

Summary Heading: One of my favorite places to stay, but the front desk service wasn't as great this time.
Summary: Our family arrived on a Monday just prior to the Fourth of July.  We took an early flight and arrived at the hotel at about 9am, to enjoy the amenities of the hotel.  During our previous stays,  this hotel has always been able to check us in early.  But on this day we were told our room would not be ready until 2pm. I was not greeted as a Hilton Honors member and we were not offered an opportunity to check our baggage.  The staff also failed to tell us about the free breakfast, nor did they advise us to enjoy the pool and other amenities while we waited for the room to be ready.  We finally decided to ask the front desk to check our bags and took off until 2pm.    When a hotel staff member tells me a room will be ready by 2pm, my expectations have been set to receive that room
Manager Response: I want to thank you for your loyalty to both Hilton and the hotel itself. It sounds like we fell short of the service expectations that we live by. Although it is very challenging sometimes to allow early arrivals in the midst of an extremely busy day, the hotel most definitely should have tried to accommodate you in the best way possible by making all of our hotel services available to you and your family. Please feel free to contact me at keith.moses@Hilton.com or by calling 714.750.2010 so we are able to discuss the rate discrepancy and any other issues further. Please know I will be touching bases with the entire team regarding your stay.

Summary: Great place for a family stay and awesome location! There was plenty to do at and near the hotel! Very comfy, clean, enjoyable stay! I only wish the breakfast was 6:30-10:30am. I will definitely return and recommend to family and friends!

Summary Heading: Great Stay for a Disneyland Visit
Summary: This is a great location for a stay during your visit to Disneyland. The walk from the front door to the entrance to the park is less than a mile. (Ubers and taxis are readily available if you have an aversion to walking.) We relocated here from the nearby Hyatt and liked it much better.

I loved that the bedrooms were separate from the family rooms. The kitchens were ample as well. My complaint is that for those of us with food sensitivities and allergies, when food is served open and there are not packaged options other than fruit, one feels like they are paying for a lot of meals that they can not partake of. We were at the hotel over a week but could not eat there.

We stayed at Homewood Suites due to it's room size and proximity to Disneyland.  Our 1 bd. Suite w/ Trundle Bunk Bed was able to accommodate a family of five easily.  Hotel is right next to Disneyland's Woody parking lot (5-7 min walk) so we were able to walk over and take Disneyland's shuttle to Disneyland front entrance without having to pay extra for parking.   Hotel has complimentary hot breakfast with a variety of food for everyone.  Also complimentary is snack/light dinner with wine/beer from 5-7 daily.  The staff were always very helpful and courteous and were present thru-out the hotel to assist.  Overall, this hotel is great for anyone looking for convenience and comfort when traveling with kids.  It's location and complimentary services is a plus for busy Disneyland

Our family stayed at Homeward Suites last week and loved it! It was clean, great room and helpful staff. We enjoyed the breakfast & the evening meal, which helped with the budget. It is a big hotel, so the breakfast area was very busy in the morning, but there is lots of seating. Our kids loved the pool, basketball & putt putt area.....kept them well entertained! Also, our room had a kitchen area, which was wonderful! It's in a great location, so you can walk to shopping, restaurants & Disney transportation. We loved it & hope to be back soon!

Service: Excellent and polite.  Room was ready when we arrived.  View:  Had room on hotel side facing Disneyland.  We were able to see the fireworks on the 3rd floor.  Breakfast: Was ready at 6:30 AM.  Room: Very clean and well maintained.

We stayed for a week and enjoyed it very much.  We moved to the Disneyland hotel our last two days and my 6 year old was saying she missed homewood suites.  Checking in was easy.  The breakfast was great. Very family friendly.

This hotel being close to Disneyland means that it literally gets to be a Disneyland zoo, it's soo busy it ain't a nice thing anymore. Particularly during breakfast you notice how full the hotel is and you really get a zoo feeling (at least we did). People crawling over each other to score food, and as a result food is often empty and you need to wait for it to be refilled.  On the positive side: 1) staff is very attentive 2) property offers family suites that can comfortably sleep 4 people, 1 king bed and 2 bunk beds  So, if you can accept the busy nature of the hotel and want to be close to Disney, it's OK. If you have other things on your mind, I would not stay here.
Manager Response: Hello ThomasEMM,  Thank you so much for the detailed feedback. We are apologetic that you didn't get to have your best experience with us, especially during the breakfast time. We will make sure to take your comments to heart and do everything we can to improve. Thank you for your positive comments about our staff, and accommodating rooms. We feel terrible that you don't want to stay with us again, but we would love to connect with you directly and try to change that. Please feel free to contact me, I would love to assist. - Mark Morihiro (714)705-0531.

Summary: Can't say enough about this hotel. The entire hotel was very clean, the staff is friendly and helpful, good location to Disney.  The free buffet was plentiful with lots of choices.  We had a 2 queen suite it was very spacious and loved having a full size refrigerator and separate room was sound proof enough the TV in the "living room" didn't disturb those sleeping in the bedroom. You won't be disappointed.

Great location and great service.  Breakfast if good for a hotel "free" breakfast.  Have dinner Monday to Thursday as well which is nice if you need something fast.  Food was good.  We will absolutely be back next time in the area.

Hotel was clean and staff was friendly, its very close to the convention center and short walk to the Disney parks. The Pool and hot tub were clean and well maintained the rooms are spacious and clean. I would stay here again, the staff was super helpful with local restaurants and questions on the area.

Summary Heading: Pleasant place to stay for business of family vacation
Summary: Nice clean room with all the amenities to be comfortable. Very easy walk to Disneyland. Complimentary meals make it economical for families. Very comfy bed. Meals are decent but nothing to brag about. Free alcohol during evening meal but only non-alcohol beverages served were juices and coffee.

Summary Heading: Top Notch Management, wonderful property. We're looking forward to our return
Summary: I had my return trip to Anaheim booked for a month, long story short: some issues arose with my reservation.  I took to the phone and after a lengthy call with Hilton Honors they suggested I contact the Homewood Suites property manager directly, so I did.  Melissa F., the manager of the Homewood Suites Anaheim Resort - Convention Center, went above and beyond.  She not only assured me that we would find a solution, but she connected me with the folks at Hilton Honors to make that happen. Together, with Melissa leading the conversations, we spoke to about three different Hilton Honors employees ultimately resolving my issue.  Throughout the conversations, Melissa exhibited the highest levels of professionalism and courteousness to all of her colleagues as well as to me.  In an

Manager changed our room from one bed to two for our stay when I asked. Excellent Breakfast options. Utilized free grocery pick up service. Participated in evening dining social which was nice. Food options for evening social were limited but still nice option for saving $. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Loved having coffee available for our extremely early mornings. Rooms were clean and property was well maintained. If we return to D23 in 2019 we will be staying here again.

We were staying at the Hilton nearby but the conference room here at the Homewood Suites saved us $1K so we walked over.  The room was large but the table was too small so I had to knock off a point.  There were 10 of us and we felt crowded with that table for our laptops and things.  Other than that it would have been 5 stars.  We didn't order in food but they provided us some muffins which was nice. They were able to lock the room for us when we went out for lunch.  They brought in a huge extension cord bar so everyone could plug in.

We just returned from a trip to California and stayed at this suites hotel based on the ratings online. Although I'd like to give it 5 stars, there were a couple of points that knocked it down a little.  The hotel lobby and check-in were great! Christian was friendly and very helpful with the process. My issue however is that we'd requested a room on the 5th floor overlooking the fireworks but even though we'd been promised these, we did not get the room (had requested months before).  The room itself was very big and well layed out. Very comfortable and clean (with one exception... opened up the sofa bed and found some dirt (which was dealt with quickly)). Kitchen was great and overall, everything is almost brand new.  The breakfast in the morning... eggsellent! Tons of food

Summary Heading: Super place to stay for Disney
Summary: Less than 10 minutes walk to Disneyland with free breakfast and evening reception/light dinner! What else can you ask for? Well, free parking might be nice... We got a room facing Disneyland, and we enjoyed the firework on the couch. It was a nice stay.

Summary Heading: Kids first time to disneyland...Best hotel in Anaheim
Summary: Honestly, this hotel made the trip to Disneyland with the kids the best part.  Firstly, its very close to Disneyland.  You can walk next door to the Disneyland parking and take their shuttle.....FREE FREE...  The morning breakfast was perfect, best way to start your day, kids loved it and we even took a bit of stuff with us for snacks during the day.  Evening social was perfect, free beer and wine.....perfect for the audults, and the kids got snacks.  it was a perfect way to end the day.    The pool was nice and warm, and the movies they play in the evening outside was a nice touch.  The manager, Melissa Ferree, CTA Reservations Supervisor, was the best.  I had a couple of requests prior to our arrival and she was able to accommodate them all. She is very good and most all gave

All of the staff were friendly.  The complimentary breakfast and evening social saved us alot of money. The entire hotel was clean.  I loved that they had grills another great way for their guests to save a few bucks.

Great hotel and location. This hotel is in a perfect spot for walking to Disney. Lots of restaurants to choose from. Room is large and clean.  Easily sleeps 5.   Breakfast is excellent with lot's of choices.  Will definitely be back to this hotel. Great value

Summary Heading: First time stay here, great hotel but noisy guests
Summary: Check in was fast and friendly and there was plenty of parking. We had a bunk bed room and I was very pleased with it, ac units were very efficient at keeping the room cool and not too noisy. The beds were not horrible which is about as much as I can hope for, I slept pretty decently every night with the exception of the jerks above us, but more on that later. We had a completely unobstructed Disney view and on a few nights we watched the fireworks from our room. We only used the breakfast area once but there were lots of great choices and the staff there were very attentive and friendly. We did laundry one night and the dryers took forever to thoroughly dry our clothes so if you plan to do laundry do as small of a load as possible or split one wash load into two dryers if they

Homewood Suites by Hilton took great care of our family during our visit to Disneyland! They provide a very good breakfast and 4 d nights a week host a delicious evening manager's reception. The beds are comfortable and the front desk responded quickly to our requests for assistance.

Perfect size suite for my family of 5.  Friendly staff and always clean.  Breakfast was excellent each day.  Sitting by the fire pit was a great way to end the night!  Disney shuttle was a short walk from the facility and many restaurants and stores within walking distance.

This hotel is the best. The room was great and clean. The hotel staff members were the greatest people you could ask for. They were always there and willing to help you. They were wonderful. Hilton needs to be proud of their staff. The complementary breakfast and dinners were very good. We were right next door to the shuttles to Disneyland and all we had to do was walk over there.

Summary Heading: Do Not Stay Here for Business!
Summary: Giving four stars for the property itself since it's clean and the employees are great. They can't control who stays there. I always give props to a property with electric vehicle charging, too. I wasn't driving my EV this time, but I was glad to see all of the dedicated spaces.   I checked in after a day of meetings and a long drive from Los Angeles. I'm a Hilton Honors member and was recognized as such with free overnight parking. Very appreciative for that gesture.   I noticed that I was the only solo traveler in the lobby and on the elevators. Big families with small children and teenagers there for Disneyland visits were everywhere. My first room was in the middle of a long corridor on the 5th floor. Lots of noise in the hallways prompted me to ask for a room change. The

The entire staff was amazing!! They went above and beyond to make sure my family of nine was accommodated with parking of our 31' RV and the breakfast buffet was outstanding. It was great being able to feed such a large family breakfast before we headed out to Disneyland.

The hotel is extremely clean. The hotel staff members are very helpful. The complementary breakfast and dinner saves you a ton of money. The movies by the pool are cool for the kids. The putting area is cool too. Excellent stay and coming back to this hotel very soon!

We recently stayed for 9 nights from Queensland Australia and wish we could have stayed longer. All the staff and Management were very friendly and professional and we could not fault anything.  Homewood Suites Anaheim Resort made us and our young family feel very safe. Cleanliness of the rooms and hotel was excellent and the extra amenities like the mini golf course and the basketball course was just amazing to have. It was a short walk to Disneyland or on those big days the free Disney shuttle is just next door.

We stayed here for 8 nights for my 60th birthday. I just wanted to go to Disneyland with my two adult children for my birthday and this hotel's location is perfect. My daughter and I arrived flew in from Australia and arrived at the hotel around 8am. We were quite tired from the trip and the reception staff, particularly Christian, were amazing. We were so warmly welcomed, given a room straight away and invited to enjoy the complimentary breakfast (even though regular check in time is after 2pm).  Do request a room overlooking the toy story car park and watch the Disneyland fireworks every night! Also - request a room on the top floor. We were on the fourth floor and could hear kids jumping around in the room upstairs until about 11-11.30pm. Hotel staff followed up immediately

excellent, awesome, Great. Would stay here again, highly recommend this hotel to all my family & friends. Very convenient to surrounding restaurants & to Anaheim Convention center, also the shuttle buses to Disneyland.

What an excellent hotel!  In our hectic summer, my family happened to have a rare weekend free of any scheduled event or youth sports game to attend.  We were fortunate enough to get a room at Homewood Suites.  Not only is the location great(Disneyland/Downtown Disney shuttle), but the staff is excellent as well-friendly, informative and helpful. We stayed in the family suite that would comfortably sleep 7!  To quote my 10 year old daughter, "this bunk bed is like a dream come true!"  She likes sleeping in the top bunk.  Practically a full kitchen(minus an oven). We had a great time in the large pool and even ran around the splash pad while my wife got some relaxing jacuzzi time.  Free breakfast brunch had a lot of variety and was very good.  We are local, but look forward to

My family's stay here was absolutely amazing. I have not one negative comment. The room was very spacious and very clean. Nice, fully equipped mini-kitchen with complementary snacks and beverages for the kids. The pool was great, lots of seating/lounge chairs, a kiddie pool and large jacuzzi. The free dinner and breakfast was delicious, they also offer free beer and wine during the week nights. Keyless entry was really convenient. They offer a shopping service if you need anything from the store. A short walk to Disneyland and right across the street from the Disney shuttle. This hotel truly relieves the stress of a fast-paced Disney trip by accommodating all your needs and makes you feel very welcomed.

Summary Heading: Highly recommend for Disney trip with free breakfast, evening social (dinner), amenities and across to free shuttle!
Summary: We highly recommend this hotel! It was better than I had expected! It is a short walk to free Disney shuttle in the toy story parking lot. You can buy your tickets at the hotel to save tons of time. They have a basketball court and put-put that I didn't expect the hotel to have! The workout room was always so clean and well maintained. No wait at all and I was usually the only person in there! The best thing I think was the complementary hot breakfast  and evening social (dinner). The breakfast had brunch items like chicken enchiladas, rice and beans! One day even chicken tenders! Make your own waffles was a big hit. The evening social is pretty much a dinner. It isn't gourmet or anything but perfect for kids - like hotdogs, sliders, Mac and cheese, hamburgers and I loved the

this hotel is a short way from Disneyland but the still walkable.  The room was spacious and clean and the staff is helpful and considerate.  If you want restaurants they are all around and the facility is family oriented.  The complimentary breakfast is as good as you can get for included in the room price.  I will stay again.

I recommend staying at Homewood Suites by Hilton Anaheim. My family especially enjoyed the complementary breakfasts and evening meals. The swimming pool and arcade was also a big hit with the kids. Great way to recoup from a day at Disneyland.

Stayed here with my 8 and 9 year old grandchildren and the stay was awesome. There is a Disney Parking lot behind the hotel that is very convenient. You can take the free shuttle to the park. Breakfast was excellent also. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Nothing but good things to say abut this hotel. Would highly recommend.

Excellent location right next to Dland parking. Take the shuttle free of charge! Less than 15 minutes to get there. Fold out bed not so comfortable. Great place for a family on a budget. Breakfast in the am and buffet style dinner during the week, plus adult beverages.

Wonderful facility with a top notch staff.  They were all friendly and outgoing folks.  The rooms were very clean with lots of space.  I didnt hear any noise from other rooms or the hall.  The pool was nice and the area but not the cleanest and thats my only gripe with the hotel, too dang many people.  The free breakfast is good but you will tire of the same stuff after a few days.  Happy hour is awesome if you are there mon-thurs.  You wont want to walk to disney from here, its too far, but the toy story bus is right next door.

This hotel was super clean. The staff was amazing and willing to help in any way. Great selection for both complimentary breakfast and evening social. We would only stay here anytime we visit this area again.

We recommend this hotel. Fact is, don't waste your time looking anywhere else; especially if you have a larger family. It's close enough to walk to Disneyland, but there is an available shuttle right next to the hotel. The staff is great and the rooms are clean: a very pleasant experience! With the free breakfast and the evening social, it's really an incredible value.

We absolutely love this place. Been back again and again. Told family members and friends about. They shared the same positive experience while they were here...Great customer service, very friendly staff from front desk to Managers, clean, fully loaded room, clean towels, rooms, bathroom, kitchen, pool, bb court, etc. fast house keeping service. Short wait time for elevator. Variety of food warm and fresh food to choose from the food court. Variety of drinks and juices. Plenty of seats at breakfast and dinner. If seats were filled, you can take food to your hotel room.   Room rates is fairly reasonable if you book a couple of weeks in advance and when there is no convention. 5 min walk from hotel to the free Shuttle which takes you to Disneyland. We have an option to walk to

The Homewood Suites Anaheim Resort Convention Center is an excellent hotel with impressive rooms and an outstanding staff. The front desk staff and breakfast staff are very friendly, professional and helpful.  The rooms are spacious, clean and elegant. I will definitely stay there again!

We stayed to go to Disneyland. The hotel was very clean and our room was spacious with the kitchenette. The full breakfast was great! The pool looked fantastic but we were too busy at Disneyland. It is within walking distance. We paid to park in the lot but it's better to leave your car there and walk to Disneyland. Our room was quiet and looked over the pool. We would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: A pleasant stay, would highly recommend!
Summary: The Room The room was large and could easily sleep four or more adults. The suite came equipped with two very comfy queen sized beds, a sofa, two TVs, a safe big enough to fit a 15-inch Macbook, a kitchenette with all the amenities, a kitchen table, a desk and more. Housekeeping came from 11 am to 4 pm every day and always did a great job.   Free Breakfast The complimentary breakfast was better than at any other resort I‚Äôve ever stayed in. There was a great variation offered (sometimes even strange things like chicken enchiladas) but mostly eggs, bacon, waffles and cereal. Everything was always fresh and there were plenty of places to sit and eat.   Other There was a pool, a BBQ, fire pit, mini golf and basketball on property. All was free but I can‚Äôt vouch for how good it was

We stayed here for seven nights in June. It is an excellent location and a great room. It was basically a one bedroom apartment. We had two queen beds, a living area and kitchen. The hotel came with breakfast every morning and four nights a week there was a dinner buffet. We really enjoyed the breakfast, the dinner not as much we only ate it once. You could walk right next-door to the toy store parking lot for the shuttle bus to Disney. The Anaheim convention center was less than a 10 minute walk. There was a strange vibration noise in the room but we figured out it was the overhead fan and just shut it off. Overall it was an excellent hotel and we would stay there again.

Summary Heading: Awesome place will always come back here
Summary: Awesome place this is the second time we visited here for a week and it is the best homewood suites ive ever been to.  the hotel is new and offers a large back courtyard with beautiful pool hottub, putting green, basketball court firepit and grills to cook on. the staff is super friendly and accommodating and the rooms are spacious and nice.  the breakfast offers a ton of selections and it's FREE they also offer a night social dinner M-THRS which is also free and includes wine. beer and a selection of "bar foods" like burger sliders, burgers, potato salad etc... this place is right next door to the disneyland parking lot and a block away from the convention center and u can walk anywhere without a car.

Summary Heading: Still the best near Disney and the ACC
Summary: This was my second stay, and I will be back. The hotel is very clean, the staff is very friendly, the food is just what you'd expect and the location is within walking distance of everything. No complaints, other than that I couldn't stay longer!

I would stay here again and again! The morning breakfast is amazing! Freshly prepared and a build your own course. The staff was so helpful when it come to refilling any missing items. The dinner was just as good. The rooms were nice and clean to perfection! The walk to the Disney shuttle was in perfect distance.

Summary Heading: Business and Traveling as a Family.
Summary: We stayed 5 days total for business but traveled as a family.  We LOVED it here. Great rooms and amenities. They do an excellent job of keeping things clean and inviting. Convenient to the park.  Served Happy Hour and Dinner M- Thurs.  We enjoyed this the whole trip.  Our room had everything we needed to be comfortable and to enjoy home cooked meals, including access to grills at the pool that we used.  We met the GM and complemented him on doing a great job.  The only improvement that is needed is the business center should be closed in/with a door. It is REALLY loud for that location to get work done on the phone professionally which I needed to do as I still have to work prior to check in and just after check out.

The breakfast choices are great.  There is a shuttle to Disneyland about a block away. The evening social hour was an added perk, they didn't have the best selection but free dining is always great. Overall we hav a great family vacation.

Summary Heading: Great hotel for family Disneyland trip!
Summary: Stayed beginning of June with my family of 5, including a 1 year old. We got the family suite which included a full kitchenette with dining room table, living room, and separate bedroom with a bunk bed, pull out bed, and king bed. Services were as to be expected with a home wood suite.... amazing! Breakfast included daily was various hot breakfast items. Pool was average, but their was a large spa and a 1" wading pool for toddlers. There was also a basketball court, miniature golf putting green, and arcade. The best part was this hotels proximity to FREE shuttles to Disneyland. The shuttle ran from 0730-0100 daily and was literally in the Toy Story parking lot right next to this hotel, so no need to pay for Anaheim local transit which is $20/day. I only stay at homewood suites

Our family had a great time at this hotel during our 6 night stay. The room we stayed in was more accommodating for the 5 of us because of 3 things: 1) the bathroom area separated the sink/counter from the shower/toilet, allowing more than 1 person to get ready in the mornings; 2) a separate bedroom allowed others to change clothes while others were still getting ready for the day; and 3) the 2 queen beds in the bedroom and pull out couch bed in the living room.  For the families wanting to save money on their trip to Disneyland parks - the dinner social from 5pm - 7pm on Mondays thru Thursdays made it nice. Each of those nights they have a different menu with a buffet style setup. Coupled with the free buffet style breakfasts (every morning) it makes budgeting for food while in

Family friendly and the Disneyland shuttle is picks you up a block away from the hotel and its free. Staff was very friendly and there is a pool, miniature golf area and arcade. Perfect if you have little ones

We've been coming to Disneyland for nearly a decade, and we are thrilled with this latest Hilton brand hotel. Embassy Suites used to be our go-to, but this hotel feels like a mini-resort, with putt putt, basket ball court, game room, and COFFEE 24 hours a day! We often eat dinner poolside, grilling our steaks and enjoying the fire pit. You really can't beat this place at this price. And all the staff are excellent!

We're on our last day here at Homewood suites convention center. A wonderful family hotel on South Harbor Boulevard. It is a 2 min walk to Toy story parking & a 5 min shuttle away from Disney.  The property is well maintained, simple & practical. Staff are lovely, very helpful & happy to assist anytime with a smile. Breakfast has a good choice of cold & hot food. Loved the onsite laundry - they have a small shop that sells detergents amongst others. Through the week they have evening snacks that I heard is almost as good as dinner. We never got to try though.   What we loved most about this property was its simplicity with a no fuss attitude. Would love to stay here again.

Amazing hotel! Our room was huge, (we stayed in a bunk bed family suite) It was quiet, clean and comfortable! The pool and hot tub were perfect for a midday break from Disneyland. The breakfast and dinners were an added bonus, not to mention the beer and wine! The staff is friendly and they go above and beyond to make sure your stay is perfect! I was impressed watching staff members meticulously cleaning the pool area, dining area and bathrooms. My 11 year old enjoyed the game room, and we all enjoyed the movies and fire by the pool in the evening. Definitely would stay here again!

Summary Heading: Family friendliest hotel I've ever stayed at
Summary: I took my son down to Vidcon 2017 for his birthday. Turns out this hotel was the best decision I made. A short five minute walk from the Convention center made it perfect for attending Vidcon. Also close to Disney parking lot so you can catch the shuttle.   They serve breakfast and dinner Mon-Thurs. Good variety of food and drinks. When we arrived in our room the had balloons and a box if goodies for my son. Nice touch.   The staff has bern very friendly and helpful. Clean rooms. The pool was great, they also had a putting green and basketball hoop.  Overall I'm very happy with my stay here.  You wont go wrong.

We couldn't have asked for a nicer place to stay at during our visit to California!  Staff were very friendly and kind to our family. Throughout our stay!    The breakfast was a wonderful added bennifit and important one for us.

My family and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights on our Disneyland vacation. It is a perfect hotel for Disneyland. They have a great breakfast before you head out for the day and they have food on weeknights from 5pm til 7pm. I thought the afternoon would just have snacks but they had enough to where we didn't have to go out for dinner. Such a help with money and time!  The toy story parking lot is just a block from the hotel and there is a shuttle there that takes you to Disneyland. The hotel was clean and neat. The pool area was so nice. My daughter loved playing putt putt by the pool. Thank you Homewood Suites for making our magical vacation even better.

Great time was had here!!!!!!   We not only enjoyed our stay we ended booking extra nights! They were wonderful!   Front Desk:  ALL THE STAFF .... Always ready to help in anyway they can, like renting strollers delivered to lobby, or recommending restaurants.   POOL:  Clean and Nice.  The baby pool was awesome, 1.5 ft deep and a great size for the kiddos to play while I sat next to them enjoying.  They even had toys from hotel out.    ROOMS:  Big, clean and comfortable.  The bunkbed is a trundle so it actually sleeps 3, which is awesome.  Kitchen has it all to take care of family.  Yes, move the knives up so your kid doesn't grab them.  ALL KIDS TV channels included.    Guadeloupe was our cleaning lady, she was outstanding.  She left our room wonderful and the towel animals were

If you read my reviews, you'll find I rarely give out five-stars.  When I do it's because it is well deserved.  I'm happy to say this is such the case.    Frankly, this is one of the best hotels stays I've had.  No, it's may not be the Ritz or some other snooty place where celebrities stay; but this IS where families stay.  And that's MUCH more important.  The level of service we received was geared as though we were part of their family.    The place is clean and well maintained, and the staff is incredibly friendly.  The amenities are plentiful; from the spacious rooms (flat-screen TV's, couches, cable, comfortable beds, bunk-beds for the kids, fridge, stove, microwave, etc.) to the breakfast bar (slightly different each day as to avoid repetition, and includes fruits, meats,

This has been the best place I have stayed near Disneyland. It was very clean and accommodating. My family had a great stay. We will definitely be back soon. We stayed for a week with 4 adults and 5 children.

Very nice property and friendly staff! Thank u to Martha! Very friendly and excellent customer service. Hotel and room was very clean. Dinner area was clean and check-in was simple. Look forward to staying here again.

This property is an excellent hotel if you're going to the Anaheim Convention Center or Disneyland which are both within a short walking distance. They serve a complimentary hot breakfast buffet in the mornings and a light dinner in the evenings during the week. Service was friendly and professional. Rooms are spacious including a refrigerator, microwave, and dishes. Also Directv service including all of the HBO channels. Very good value for families visiting Disney that want to save $$$ on meals.

Homewood suites  is a great family friendly place to stay. Breakfast and there lite dinners were perfect. The pool and movie at night were wonderful. The kids loved playing basketball and putting. Stores are very close and many restaurants if you wanted to eat out. They do have a kitchen with microwave.

I took a mini vacation for three days and stayed at this hotel again!!! My daughter and I had a blast! We did the family movie night at the hotel this time and had a blast! The breakfast was amazing and the staff was super awesome!! I honestly wouldn't even try another hotel because I have had nothing but positive experiences here. It is close to Disneyland, Angels Stadium and the Honda center. On this trip we went to Disneyland 2 days. There is a tram location very close to the hotel so you don't have to walk. The staff provides all this info which is great for a lot of visitors. I will be coming back again!!! Thanks Homewood for making our mini vacation special!!

Summary Heading: Great hotel in a great location
Summary: Fantastic breakfast and walking distance to Disneyland.  Very good fitness room.  The beds are extremely comfortable.  Very convenient to all of the Anaheim attractions.  Definitely upholds the Hilton image. Many children at the breakfast bar.  Overall very good hotel.

I would highly recommend this hotel, the rooms where great for any family,the insuite kitchen we great, we loved the pool area and there was a barbaque area we did not uses this but lots of others did, the breakfast was really good lots of choice, and the happy hour was great evey day was different, from soup to burgers to nachos. We had a great stay at this hotel, the access to disney transport was only a 5 min walk and it was free.We will stay at this hotel next time we are in the area..shopping was close by so if you want to make food you can walk to Target  in 20 mins and get a cab back for $8.00 this can save a lot on eating out cost.

Located with all of the other hotels that are within walking distance to Disneyland gates. Prices are very reasonable and include not only breakfast but also a light buffet dinner with beer and wine. Hotel is relatively new and in great shape.

Ok so the room was great and clean with everything we needed and more. Nice sized fridge stove top and microwave.   But really, how long do ya spend in your room while on a Disneyland vacation?  But get this. Of course there is a free breakfast that is fantastic and changes every day, and here is the kicker. You also get free dinner!!!  Not just munchies either. It is fantastic. And just like breakfast they change it every day. It is only Monday thru Thursday however. Two big thumbs up from this guy.

I book this hotel because I was staying with my family to go to the Disney parks. My first encounter with them was when I called several months prior to arrival to ask a few questions since I have never been to the area before.  I got a lovely gentleman by the name of Christian, he answered all of my questions and then followed up with me a week prior to arrival to see if I needed anything.   He got all the information for my family and even booked our tour. But we couldn't attend. Christian made my entire family feel welcome when we arrived and continue to follow up on any of our needs.  He always had a welcoming smile on his face when we came back to the hotel, which I really appreciated after a long day. Now in my opinion, that‚Äôs top notch service. This hotel is very clean

Summary Heading: Homewood suites resort is the perfect stay for an extended Disney stay.
Summary: We arrived just about the time evening social started. Just in time for some snacks and adult beverages it was awesome!! That evening we left for Disney and did not need to take a bus or shuttle. With four kids ranging from 4-10. They all made the walk to the park with energy to spare.  15 min max. The next day we had their Breakfast and it was good. We repeated the cycle for 5 days and didn't have one complaint.  Had a great time!!!

Summary Heading: YOU SHOULD STAY AT THIS HOTEL
Summary: FANTASTIC service. We had our do not disturb sign up while housekeepers were coming around and when we came back from the beach our room was COMPLETELY organized and cleaned. It was an incredible surprise!! Also, the breakfasts were so so so good, and we were happy to find out dinner was served (mon-thurs). We usually choose our hotels based on amenities, and lucky for us this hotel had a TON of them. The pool, putting green, movie night, basketball hoop.... The beds were also INCREDIBLY soft. Usually when someone is done a trip they can't wait to get back into their bed, but i miss the hotels bed. haha. The breakfast staff was so so helpful and i cannot say enough good about this hotel! We were incredible happy we spent the extra money to have a suite with a kitchen for us and

Summary Heading: Fantastic Hotel with Great Amenities & Amazing Staff
Summary: I cannot speak highly enough of this hotel and am so glad that we chose to spend the final 7 nights of our 16 night trip here.  The staff are really helpful and friendly and the amenities are second to none.  The hot tub was fantastic and we made the most of the BBQ grills by the pool.  My only recommendation/gripe (niot enough to reduce my rating) was that our of 7 mornings only on one day was bacon served at breakfast, and secondly the pool area shut at 10pm, even on some days when the movie was still playing so we didn't get to see the end.  Like I said, not enough to reduce our rating or stay here again if we were to visit but I think having the pool area open later 11pm or midnight even, would give people a chance to have a dip or relax in the hot tub after a day at the

We stayed here for 3 nights for disneyland trip. Perfect location only 15 mins easy walk to parks, also plenty of restaurants and shops. Parking was easy as was check in, our suite was huge for the 2 of us and had everything you needed and was immaculate. Lovely free breakfast with lots of choice and every evening there was a  reception with free wine/beer and light bites which included soup, salads and fresh fruit which was most welcome. Thoroughly recommend staying here.

Summary Heading: Excellent value and perfect room for families with more than two kids.
Summary: We stayed here over Memorial Day weekend and it couldn't have been better. Close to Disney and restaurants/shopping. Easy parking was available and the pool was nice. Breakfast was very good each morning although it seemed there were many people eating the Homewood free breakfast that clearly were not guests of the hotel. A voucher system for guests may improve this. We have four kids and the bunk bed suite worked perfect. Traditional bunk plus a pull out trundle bed was in the room plus a sofa that could be pulled out into another bed and a king bed for us. Clean, quiet at night and an overall great experience.

My arrived may 28 for 5 days. I was allowed to check in the day before with the app. When we arrived checkin was a breeze. All I had to to was receive our parking pass and keys. We went for a family trip to Disneyland. As we checked in the representative told us we could take advantage of the toy story shuttle around the corner for free. That came in handy because we didn't have to pay for Disney parking just the hotel parking if 18.00 nightly. We stayed in the king family suite with a king bed and bunk bed. There was also a trundle  bed so our family of 5 slept well with their own bed space. The free breakfast was wonderful and different each morning. Eggs, sausage, fruit, make your own waffles, make your own burritos, you  name it. And dinner was no different. They say a light

My family visited in May for a 5 night stay.  I can't say enough wonderful things about the duration of our visit.  The staff was friendly, the hotel was very clean, and the location is in such a close proximity to Disney.   The view from our room was one of the Disney parking lots (mountains in the distance).  We were able to walk to the parking lot and take a shuttle directly to Disney.  It was extremely convenient.  If we were to walk, it would have taken 10-15 minutes to arrive which is still nice.   A hot breakfast was free every morning and my kids enjoyed a daily waffle.  Each evening M-Th the hotel offered a themed dinner/social hour.  Between the breakfast and dinner, a family is able to save in added expenses which is a bonus considering how expensive a Disney vacation

We usually stay at Marriott properties.  Based on our experience here, we will look at Homewood Suites for all future travel plans.  The staff was friendly and accommodating.  The rooms were clean and well organized.  We stayed in wheelchair accessible suite #225.

Great location, clean rooms, great service, great breakfast, and friendly staff.  It was a great experience and I would recommend this hotel to everyone.  I have stayed in several hotels in the area and this one gave me the best experience.

This was my first stay with any Hilton hotel. Had a bad experience upon arrival with the front counter member "Stephanie". She did not make me feel "welcome" to the hotel. It took me 2 days to get over the bad experience, to not let it affect the rest of my stay there. She is the only person on the property that doesn't fit the Hilton Brand. Everyone else (housekeeping, kitchen staff, maintenance, managers, security, other team members) treated my family and myself as valued guests.  I also could not check in using the "Hilton Honors" App, was not able to use my phone as a digital key. Contacted android support (KMM25222592V24422L0KM) to no avail.
Manager Response: Hello IMHOjust4U,  Thank you for your detailed feedback. We sincerely apologize for the customer service that you received. We have already taken your comments at full face value, and followed through with the correct actions to resolve any concerns with the team member mentioned. We hope you will give us another opportunity to accommodate you in the future!

Summary: Overall my family enjoyed our 7 night stay. We arrived early and our room was not ready but they stored our luggage and offered us complimentary breakfast! Our room was ready for us at lunch time which was a huge bonus! The room itself was spacious, two queen beds, separate lounge, large fully equipped kitchen, 2 televisions and a view towards Disneyland. Bonuses offered by this hotel were fantastic, breakfast was great, with lots to choose from, evening supper is offered a few nights during the week but we didn't try this. I used the guest laundry a number of times,again a bonus when traveling. We met so many fantastic people from all over the country enjoying the pool, hot tub, mini golf and basketball areas....very relaxing after a hectic time at Disneyland. Housekeeping did

Two thumbs up! The value, service, amenities, location and overall satisfaction exceeded my expectations!  Works for our family who have food allergies and sensitivities.  We prepared our own meals using their fully equipped kitchen which made our vacation ideal and worry free.  Only thing I could wish for is to have allergy free food options.  Again that's a wish because everything else is great!

The hotel is very well maintained, with good service, clean and spacious rooms, and good location (next to toy story lot, where you can ride the Disney buses). The breakfast and supper both leave a lot to be desired. Please include vegetarian items in both meals.   Overall - other than my veggie observation, there is really nothing to complain here. Perfect for families.

Excellent experience. Great value for space and amenities and location near Disneyland. The best breakfast my family has ever had that was included in the nightly accommodations. Right next to the Disney Woody parking lot for a free, easy ride to Disneyland and California Adventure parks. Very clean room and hotel.

Great hotel! Clean, great breakfast, wonderful staff! Would recommend to anyone! Wonderful suite with lots of room. Everything is new and fresh. Close to Disneyland parking lot where you can ride the shuttle to the park.

Stayed at hotel for 9 nights. Can not speak more highly of the facilities.   They have thought of everything.   We are a family of 5 and still had so much rooom in our room.   The breakfast was great with an amazing selection and even better was the evening service.  Everyone was so friendly from the front desk to the housekeeping staff

Summary Heading: BEST Disneyland Hotel for Family for VALUE and CONVENIENCE
Summary: Today (5/30/17) is the last day of my DELUXE Disneyland pass that I purchased for my family. Currently, my wife and mother-in-law are enjoying the last two hours that they have available at Disneyland before we let our passes expire. My son is watching MLB.tv on the hotel's wifi while my daughter (who turned 3 today!) is sleeping after her Bippity Boppidy Boutique Snow White Day. It was somewhat of a last-minute reservation at Homewood Suites, but I'm definitely glad that we did.  I think it's a good idea to book a hotel for annual passholders even if you live in Southern California, and Homewood Suites is definitely the way to go. Why?  1) The location is prime. You are right next door to the Toy Story Parking Lot, so it's a quick bus ride to Disneyland or DCA. Or, if you're up

This was an awesome hotel! we will be back again! the best breakfast buffet to the awesome staff!! pool area was nice. Location was prime. my only suggestion would be to get a couple more washers and dryers for the guests to use.

Hotel is quite new so room are clean. It is well located, just next to the Disney parking lot. Being able to use the phone to enter room/fitness ...etc is really great. The only problem is the breakfast closing at 09:30 which I find a bit too early. 10:00 would have been great.

Perfect location for Disneyland stay 7 min walk to toystory shuttle location and not too far from several restaurants. Breakfast is great with food selections daily. Nice place for the family even a kids swimming pool, arcade, basketball, mini golf. We'll stay here again. Only complaint is the mattress was a little too soft for my liking but thats a matter of opinion.

Stayed here for the second half of our Disneyland trip, b/c I couldn't stomach their hotel prices. Good size room, we got a 1 bedroom suite so it was two roons with a door. Kitchenette with full size fridgerator was nice and they offered grocery delivery but we had already done that. It was nice to have a table to sit at. Breakfast was good, good variety and hot foods too with waffle makers. Pool with spa and kids area and a recreation area with basketbsll and putting green. The art ( anaheim resort transportation ) was available for a charge. We just walked next door to the woody and friends parking lot to take the bus to Disneyland for no charge and dropped you off next to the park. gates. Very friendly staff parking was another $18 but from my research that was the norm.

We chose this hotel because we were traveling with my wife's brother and wanted extra space and privacy. The hotel would be a great choice for families traveling to Disney.
