The hotel is conveniently located next to the Toy Story parking lot so you can walk in the lot and take Disney transportation to the parks. This transportation is MUCH better than ART. Walking to Disney from the hotel takes about 15 to 20 minutes depending on stop lights to cross streets and with a quick walking pace.  My statement about the hotel not being good for couples stems to how loud it is in the breakfast area and the number of times we heard kids running through the hallways. If those two things are not bothersome to you, this may be a great choice. If those are bothersome to you, I would recommend

Excellent hotel and location (15 mins walk to Disney). We stayed here for a week and were very pleased at the room and amenities. We had a family suite and was perfect for our 2 young kids.   The daily breakfast and dinner are great and a nice addition.   Overall couldn't recommend highly enough if you are using this to base yourself for Disneyland.

My husband, daughter and I stayed here from 8 - 18 May in a queen suite.  The lounge and kitchen were separate to the sleeping area.  The room was spacious, modern and very clean.  It have everything we needed.  We stayed on the 4th floor near the lifts so it was close to the front of the hotel so not much of a walk to get out.  There was an ice machine outside our room which we could hear in the hallway but could not hear at all in our room.  Our room was very quiet. The buffet breakfast was excellent, with a fantastic variety of hot and cold food.  Note to Australians - they do have vegemite, just ask one of the lovely ladies keeping the buffet area stocked and clean and they'll get you some little packets from the kitchen. There is free coffee any time in the reception area.

We picked this on advice from other people and I can say we won't stay anywhere else. Queen room with the bunk bed is a good size and has plenty of room.  Staff were awesome and couldn't do enough for us. Close to the parks and all the restaurants.

We stayed at Homewood Suites by Hilton at Anaheim for 2 nights this May while taking our son to the Disney parks. It's an excellent hotel with large beautifully done up rooms. We had a suite with a small kitchenette and a small drawing room with sofa, TV etc and the bedroom inside. A small sit out outside with deck chairs. The Disney parking is a few minutes away from where one can take the Disney buses which ply every 5 to 10 mins. The hotel had an excellent breakfast and dinner buffets. Overall an amazing experience. Will recommend to anyone taking their kids to the Anaheim parks.

Our room was very clean, and well stocked with kitchen supplies.Staff were very helpful and kind. Having breakfast done and dinner's during the week were great for me to enjoy my holiday without cooking. Kids loved pool and fitness center. The shuttle to the park was great and so close.We met great people and look forward to staying here in the future.

Summary Heading: This Hotel Is The Real Deal!
Summary: Twenty years plus in the hospitality business, I know what I'm looking for, and this hotel truly lives up to it's lofty rating. Gwyn at check in was superb! A genuine sincerity in desiring to provide excellent customer service. What a welcome sight after a long day of travel. All transactions were handled flawlessly and quickly, including an excellent check out experience with Stephanie as well. Had two rooms for a five day stay. Beds were super comfy and the rooms were surprisingly quiet for the area. Housekeeping left the rooms immaculate every single day. Professional, prompt and going the extra mile. Breakfast was a generous array of hot and cold dishes. You can imagine the chaos with a family friendly hotel near Disneyland, with most guests converging on the area at the

My wife and I were traveling with our 6 year old and 5 month old. The experience could not have been better. It was a nice walk to the park with the option of walking a block away to catch the shuttle. We had a bunk bed room which my daughter loved. The room was great, the staff was amazing, the breakfast was good, and we were able to treat the manager reception as dinner. We would definitely stay here again!

Great hotel , great service! Very kid friendly hotel. Be prepared for footsteps on higher floors, other than that , this was the first time using this hotel and will highly recommend. Family suite is smaller than pictures , but we managed.

Best experience we've had with Homewood ever. New facility which was nice, room was large with everything needed for family in kitchen etc. Comfy beds and most comfortable pillows we've ever experienced. Staff was friendly, accommodating and efficient. Great location. Close proximity to Disneyland with shuttle next door.

Although not the biggest place ever, it's not bad and comfortable enough.  The biggest bonus is that the car park for Disney is right next door to the hotel.  Although you could walk to the parks you can get the shuttle bus easily from the car park which was great.  Staff are friendly, the only downside is that we didn't realise that breakfast was included until the end of our stay which is a shame.

Summary Heading: Fit for a Family of Seven
Summary: This hotel was very clean, had a kitchen, King Bed (that was actually the sixe of a king), 3-bed bunk bed and a sofa bed. We all slept very comfortable. The kitchen had everything we needed and the staff was very respectful. The breakfast was amazing. On one day they serve rice, beans and chicken enchiladas along with the regular breakfast items. It was the best!

Summary Heading: Great family friendly hotel close to everything!
Summary: Looking for a Disney vacation but don't want to spend the high prices of a Disney resort hotel, this is prefect!  Rooms are standard but the best part of this hotel is the proximity to the Toy Story Parking lot.  Save money riding the ART (public transit).  The hotel is adjacent to the parking lot and they encourage you to walk into the parking lot to pick up the shuttle into Disney.  On top of that, free hot breakfast every morning.

This hotel is conveniently located to the main gate at Disneyland.  I found the staff to be very helpful and friendly throughout the state, the breakfast was OK but when you stay at a location for a week you would hope they would change it up a little bit. Is very convenient to have the kitchens in the room makes it helpful for small children. And it's easy enough to walk to Disneyland or ride the parking lot bus.

The only word that expresses how we felt about our stay at this property is PERFECT! From the staff, to the location, to the cleanliness of the rooms, to the breakfast and social hour.  It was PERFECT!!

Clean and specious room. No cosmetics in the suit. Ok service. Breakfast is included but quality of food and variety could be better. Parking available. I personally need more from the hotel so i will look for someplace else next time.

Melissa and the staff is excellent!!  I moved here from Best Western Park Place, because that hotel wasn't for me. When I'm on vacation I like nice clean hotels !  And trust me this hotel is almost new! They have free breakfast and dinner and the pool is so much fun. They have movies at night and a kiddie pool. Trust me if you're in Disneyland book this hotel you will be happy !!!! And one more thing my kids were twice as happier at this hotel !!!

I've stayed at many hotels around Disney and I have always thought to myself, "what a dump these hotels are".  Why wife stayed here with the kids on a Disney trip and came back happy to tell me about this gem. I was not disappointed in any way! The staff are very courteous and friendly in every way you would hope for bit almost never happens. The food was good and beds were comfortable. They had a movie night out by the pool and we were able to sit and relax after a long day of walking. Very happy with this hotel and they can expect our return business 4 to 5 times a year!

Great environment, comfortable and all the convenience of home, including laundry facilities. Staff was very accommodating. Love the evening reception and breakfast. Easy access to Disney transportation, a great stay in a great location.

We travel with a 5-yr old and an 18-month old and whenever we do, we look for suites with a separate room too allow for our baby to go to sleep before the rest of us.  Homewood Suites has these types of rooms and they are extremely comfortable, clean, and well stocked.  The kitchenette is an added plus and the staff is absolutely courteous and helpful.  The front staff were always offering helpful tips and providing just about anything we needed during our stay.   The breakfast staff are incredible too!  Letty in particular remembers our daughters' names and was always playful with them.  We often got downstairs too late for breakfast but they would take pity on us and offer a few muffins and bananas to keep us afloat.   The pool and arcade were lots of fun when not at

Spacious, clean rooms with easy access to Disneyland. We chose to walk but shuttle buses available. Eating establishments close. Staff very friendly and nothing too much trouble. Breakfast options excellent and dinner very good after a day of delight.

The suites are very clean they have everything you need in them. The employees are super nice and they have a great breakfast. I thought that since this is a family place it would be loud at night, I was totally wrong it was nice and quite all 3 nights we stayed. We will return.

Great hotel next to the Disneyland Toy Story parking lot. It near good restaurants and shuttles. Also besides breakfast every day, they offer free appetizers during the week on Monday through Thursday from 5-7PM.

Summary Heading: Better than what we expected.... much better.
Summary: This hotel is very well run.   Staff are extremely friendly and helpful, rooms are comfortable and clean, and it's only a 15 minute walk from Disneyland.  They provide free breakfasts with good food and a fair assortment of items to choose from, both hot and cold. We have had the breakfast  every day and have always managed get enough to eat. Usually free hotel breakfasts are the kind where you take a look and either settle for a stale muffin or decide to go somewhere else which is why I am not a fan of such things. Not so with this one. It's actually quite good.  The room cleaning staff do a top-notch job too. Yesterday when we came back to the room expecting to start the dishwasher that was full when we left and which we had forgotten to turn on, we discovered that not only

There are zero upscale hotels in Anaheim, so we decided to stay at the Homewood Suites based on TripAdvisor reviews, and we were not disappointed! For this hotel class, this property deserves 5 stars. I didn't have a reservation, so I was more than pleased when the front desk followed through on my request to put us in the quietest room available (we were exhausted).  It was very peaceful and comfortable and I slept like a baby. My son enjoyed the full breakfast each morning.  One evening we returned early to find a complimentary nacho bar and wine happy hour. The shuttle to Disney parks from the parking lot next to the hotel was easy and convenient.  We also went to an Angels game, which was a very easy 10-minute drive from the property.  My son was thrilled that they had a

Summary Heading: Excellent Hotel Within Walking Distance to Disneyland
Summary: My wife and I used Tripadvisor to select this hotel, and we were very happy with our choice.  It is within walking distance to Disneyland resort.  The rooms are very clean, spacious, quiet and comfortable.  The staff is very friendly and accommodating.    The daily included breakfast is a very nice and tasty bonus!

Great hotel with super friendly staff.  The food was very good and the facility was clean.  The staff went out of their way to ensure that we had a wonderful stay at their facility. We will definitely be staying there again.

Best hotel that we've ever stayed in our 14 trips to Disneyland.  Staff is very friendly and efficient. Breakfast and dinner was added bonus.  Food was excellent throughout.  Rooms were very clean.  Used the Toy Story transportation to/from Disney parks from next door. Overall highly recommend this hotel.

Stayed here for a week. Enjoyed the hotel. The staff was very friendly. We stayed in a standard room pretty good size. The breakfast in the morning is great definitely one of the better breakfast hotels we've stayed at. The hotel Is kept very clean and nice. Bathrooms are a good size as well. We also enjoyed the ceiling fan in the room a nice touch for a hotel room.   My only complaint about this hotel is for being new it is not very sound proof. Stayed next to someone with a kid and you can hear it screaming like it's inside you room. Also can hear the people above you walking around on the floor above so I would suggest asking for the top floor.   Overall enjoyed the stay here and would stay again.

We stayed at Homewood Suites for four nights during our visit to Disneyland.  I have to say, we really couldn't have ask for more.  This hotel was perfect for what we needed.    The staff was super helpful and friendly, which is always appreciated.  Everyone was smiling and truly seemed happy to help you out.    The hotel itself is very nice.  The suites are great and very clean.  We had a family suite which had a set of bunk beds, a king size bed and included a small kitchen and living area.  It was perfect for an extended stay.    The location was great.  The property sits right next to a Disney parking lot.  It is an easy walk to the parking lot.  From there you can catch a shuttle to the park.  It worked great for us and we really didn't have any issues with it.    The hotel

Absolutely loved this hotel!  It was clean, comfortable and an excellent choice for our family.  We stayed in a king/bunk bed suite which had more than enough room for us!  The evening dinner was definitely a delicious added bonus!  The staff were friendly and beyond helpful.  The Disney parking lot right be side the hotel made getting to the park easy!  I look forward to our next stay!!

My wife and I stayed at this hotel to celebrate our 2 year wedding anniversary.  As soon as we walked in the door we were greeted by the front desk staff congratulating us on our anniversary and were told we could pick a bottle of wine out of their fridge free of charge.  Nice and courteous touch!! We were also given a bag with 2 bottled waters.  Our room was very nice. The hotel was right next door to the Toy Story parking lot and shuttle to Disneyland.  Shuttle was a 5 minute drive right to the entrance of Disneyland.  Pool area was nice, it had a large pool, a baby pool for young children, a hot tub, basketball court, putting green, and an arcade.  Breakfast buffet was good and had a lot of choices.  Try and make it down for breakfast around 7am,  after that it is

The staff is amazing and friendly, imagine how many kids they deal with daily and they always had a smile on their face.  Value- outstanding, free breakfast, dinner and drinks were good quality.  Pool area nice and spacious.  Huge and clean rooms.  Conveniently located to the park, catch free  toy story shuttle or walk 15 minutes.

This is our go to hotel whenever we visit the Anaheim area!!!! The hospitality is second to none in this hotel!!! From the minute you walk thru the doors, you feel welcomed!! The front office personnel I have had the most interaction with are the wonderful Victoria and Christian!!!! They make you feel like you are VIP'S!! Surely puts a smile on your face!!! Another thing we love so very much about how this hotel is the free daily breakfast!! Not only that, but on the week nights they give you free dinner!! Here again, the personnel in the dining room are extremely efficient and extremely nice! They try very hard to give you a great dining experience. A special thank you to Karla who went above and beyond for our family in one of our visits!! She is great!!! The accommodations

Great "extras" at this hotel for the entire family, the fireplace and basketball nets were neat additions that we took advantage of in downtime. Food was great and the evening social was a great idea and enjoyed it!

Extremely clean hotel with super friendly staff. Excellent free breakfast and exceptionally good coffee. Dinner was okay but the selection was lacking a bit so we usually ate out. Suite was large with full kitchen. If you stay on the back side of the hotel you get a view of the fireworks at night.  It took us about 15 minutes to walk to Disneyland with a 5 year old in tow or about a $5 Uber ride. Will definitely be staying here again on our next trip to Disneyland.

This is a lovely new hotel within walking distance to Disneyland and the Disneyland park & ride.  Very nice people, free breakfast with good variety.  Very kid friendly with multiple room suites.  Some rooms have bunkbeds and pull out beds.

Right as I walked in the hotel the front desk personnel were very welcoming. I had an additional vehicle with me and they gave me an extra parking pass. The room were extremely clean. I also used the laundry facility it was very clean as well. The social hour was my favorite they had wine, beer and food.

I enjoyed staying at Homewood Suites and I will definitely recommend it to others. Complimentary breakfast, pool, hot tub, poolside movie, mini golf, basketball court, game room, and grill! Can't go wrong with that!

I enjoyed the Homewood Suites.  The rooms were great and there was friendly staff.  Also, the hotel parking was great and flexible to attend Disneyland.  Finally, the hotel had a good breakfast selection.

I liked this hotel. It was very convenient to the buses that took you to Disneyland. The pool area was nice. The room was spacious. My only complaint is that it seems like a feeding frenzy at breakfast and the night social. But regardless, I would stay here again.

Our handicap room was on the second floor and required 2 long halls to walk. I couldn't use my walker and had to be pushed in a wheelchair. Of all the hotels we have stayed in, we have never had a handicap room that far from the dining area or the door to the parking lot.

Summary Heading: Best hotel our whole trip in California! Great for a big family!!!
Summary: If you are planning on spending time at Disney, this is your hotel. If you have a larger family, you will enjoy the suites that give you some room to spread out. We had six in our room and had enough room for all of us. I posted lots of pictures from here.    Hotel:  Easy to find. Super friendly front desk staff. Clean and beautifully decorated. Fairly easy to navigate for being so big.  Suite: The suite is very pretty and modern looking. There is a small kitchenette that includes a full-size fridge, stove top, microwave, dishwasher, etc. The living room was kind of small but had a coach that folded out to a bed, which my mom slept in with no complaints. There is also a chair, ottoman, a couple of small tables, and a TV. There is another smaller table separating the kitchen and

We just recently helped our daughter move to Anaheim, as her work and law school are both located in Orange County.  While helping her, we checked in at Homewood Suites by Hilton. It's a nice temporary stay suite hotel with a living room and full kitchen - very convenient. Also, it was close to a lot of restaurants, including our favorite Morton's and PF Chang's ...didn't use the kitchen because if this...lol! They also provided a complimentary breakfast buffet, which is nice. Overall, will stay here again in the future when we go visit our daughter.
Manager Response: Hello MMC66,  Thanks for choosing to stay with us on such a special trip. We are thrilled that we made such a great impression. We look forward to having you stay with us again on your next trip out to visit your daughter.

Summary: Traveled to Disney with wife and 4 kids.  It's a short 15-20 minute walk to the park so that was nice.  Stayed in the room with bunk beds (and a 3rd pull-out on the bottom).  Along with the sleeper sofa we had plenty of bed space.  But the sink/bathroom space is very tiny and the closet and dressers offer very little space to store clothing.  The breakfast was average at best by Hilton standards, and because of all the families there it's very crowded in the morning.

Everything was great but the extremely late check in and the room still not being ready by 4pm. Didn't get into our room till 5pm and it wasn't even the one we selected. Had to chose another. Breakfast was great and so was the social evening. Hot tub was perfect not too hot for kids to be in but warm enough to feel good. Cute game room basketball and putting green. Carpet and furniture in the rooms were very clean. Right behind toy story parking lot. Would stay again.

Deserves it's #1 rating.  Taking this review chronologically.  There is a little turnabout area in front of the lobby doors you can leave your car while checking in.  Check in was fast and smooth.  The gentleman accommodated our request for a quieter room by giving us a room in the back of the hotel (more on that later).  As Hilton Honors members, got 2 free bottles of water.  Drove our car to the back side of the hotel, plentiful outdoors parking (no garage).  According to the guy at the front desk, parking is not an issue even when the hotel is sold out.  Seemed true, as the lot is quite big.  There are secured doors leading into the hotel in the back.    Our room was on the 4th floor, right on the edge of the building, so we shared only 1 wall with another room.    So details

Whenever we travel, we always check for a Homewood Suite.  This location does not disappoint!  The staff is wonderful.  The rooms are clean and quiet.  The location is great!  It is easy walking distance to Disney, Convention Center, and restaurants.  The food options are plentiful and even though it is very busy the staff keeps the area clean and there is always a seat available.  This is a must stay when visiting Anaheim, CA!

We are family of 4 Had 2 double bed room with separate sofa area and kitchen.  It was very spacious for all of us.  Very clean   Breakfast could have more healthy options and it was loads of cereal full of sugar, had waffles, hot buffet.  But something to look for more healthier options please for your breakfast.  Dinner 5.30 till 7pm Monday till Thursday complimentary which I was very surprised! We didn't pay for it at all none of the days! So a Big Thank you from all of us.  Pool was great and hotel front desk was very accommodating for us.  Toy story Woody bus you catch from the car parking next door for free every day to Disneyland.  If we ever come back to Anaheim we will definitely stay at this hotel!

I stayed here with my boyfriend so that we could be close to Disneyland. This is definitely a family hotel. When you go down to breakfast there are a ton of family and kids, but it makes it lively. The rooms were clean and modestly updated. It was a nice place to come back to after a long day of having fun.  The breakfast offer is very decent and for the price of the hotel and location it was totally worth the stay. Kitchenettes are a plus too so we brought snacks and didn't have to worry about keeping them cold.

We were visiting because of DECA International event in the area.  This hotel is very clean and the staff very friendly.  The breakfast is superior to the usual free breakfasts and their evening appetizers served Mon - Thurs could in fact be considered a light meal.  We didn't have the opportunity to sit at pool, but we did enjoy the fact that Disney parking is right behind the resort, and we even walked to the park one day as well (the lineups get long on weekends for parking at Woody Parking Lot).  We had a Queen 1 bedroom unit and it was just perfect for us.  Everyone we spoke to felt the same about the resort.  If we are back in the area, we will definitely book our next stay here!  Thank you Melissa!!

Summary Heading: Good hotel but no bath tub
Summary: We were surprised to find that our king studio suite had no bathtub. This is a hotel that caters to young families going to Disneyland so it was odd. With two young kids this was very inconvenient.   Breakfast was good with many options.  Disney parking lot shuttle bus was a 5-10 min walk.
Manager Response: Hello Amaran19,  We apologize that your King studio suite did not have a bath tub. As it turns out, only our two-queen bed suites and king bunk bed suites have tubs. I‚Äôm glad you were able to enjoy the breakfast and continue to shuttle though. Please feel free to contact me directly at the property and I will try to get you the bath tub you need for your next trip to the Anaheim area.  Best regards,  Mark Morihiro

Summary Heading: Great hotel but sadly we left a kindle behind and it has 'disappeared'
Summary: We stayed one night at the Homewood Suites in order to visit Disneyland and was very impressed with the facilities - the suite with one king and a bunk bed was spacious and clean and comfortable.  The pool, mini golf, games room were added extras.  A complimentary breakfast and weekday dinner was a bonus. Its right next to the Toy Story carpark so very easy to travel to Disneyland. Front desk staff were extremely pleasant and helpful. The only disappointment was after our stay when my daughter realised she left her kindle in the bedroom. We rang to see if it was in Lost & Found but sadly had not been handed in by housekeeping.  She is adamant (and I agree) that it was left behind there so it is sad that the honesty of some of the staff is lacking.

Great location across of the Anaheim Convention Center and walking distance to Disneyland and DCA. We even walked next door to the Disney Parking Lot and caught the free Disney shuttle that took us to the parks.   This was a very nice and clean hotel. They had an awesome complimentary hot breakfast buffet. They also had a great evening social with hot meals, beer and wine. We had a studio suite with a full kitchen, full size refrigerator, microwave, stove top, pots and pans, dishes and utensils.  We even had a pull out couch.  All in all we had a wonderful and comfortable experience. The hotel staff were excellent. I would definately stay here again.

We stayed at the Anaheim Convention Center Homewood Suites taking advantage of the discount rates for a week long stay.  We could not be more pleased and have already made reservations for next year at this same facility.  Not only is this hotel in close proximity to Disneyland and the convention center, many great restaurants are within just a few blocks as well.  To help with your budget, this hotel also hosts both a delicious breakfast, but a great nightly dinner as well!  We also found this hotel to have family movie nights.  For those that like to bar-b-que, Homewood Suites offers an outdoor kitchen for guests to use. Local transportation (buses) are located very close to the front of the hotel and Sightseeing buses to LA will pick you up right at the hotel's front door.

This hotel was very clean.  The staff was helpful with all requests.  We had a couple hundred high school students with us and there was always enough food at breakfast and it was always picked up immediately

Can't speak highly enough of this hotel. Very happy we chose this, and would actually pay more to stay there in the future, although probably shouldn't include that. After a crazy day in Disneyland, it was wonderful to come back to a hotel that was so accommodating and amenity rich.

One of the best hotel in Anaheim. We didn't want to leave because it was home. From the welcome staff with small welcome gift to the gorgeous large rooms and beautiful hallway and lobby.  I am always the planner on the trip and my days was easier because if them. Breakfast was great and evening reception was really dinner along with wine. So much food and nice choices. I can't say enough about my stay but it is rated number one for a great reason. Love love love our stay!

We're just wrapping up our 5 night stay and couldn't be more pleased. The staff is friendly, fun and provides 5 star service! We had several shipments sent directly to the hotel for our conference. Everything was waiting as soon as we arrived. They allowed us to charge our phone behind the desk when we had a charger mishap and when we lost the backing to a magnetic name time, they let us use one of theirs on a moments notice. This is on top of the professional upbeat and fun dispositions.   The accommodations are impressively clean and comfortable. I was expecting a mediocre stay but am thrilled to have stay here!

Stayed here from 1st-8th April with my husband and 11 year old daughter. Used it as a base to visit Disneyland, universal studios and Hollywood.  Would highly recommend this hotel if in the area. Clean, modern, friendly efficient staff with breakfast and evening meal included. What is not to like?  Our room was located on the ground floor near the Laundry and door to the pool/garden. Room was spacious with kitchen area and a full size fridge and freezer. King size bed and sofa bed. Powerful shower and good wifi reception all around the hotel. Used pool area on more than one occasion. No issues trying to get a bed and towels are provided.  Free breakfast in a morning was ample and we would come out of the parks to utilise the free evening snack before jumping back on the free bus

As a family of 5 we often struggle to find places to stay that can accommodate us.  The family bunk room was perfect.  The staff were very friendly and location next to the toy story parking lot made it very easy to get to Disneyland.  Breakfast was surprisingly good with great variety.  The kids pool was very handy for parents that don't want to get wet.  On the down side the rooms are a bit dated and the walls are very thin to the point where we could hear the conversations in the room rooms on either side of us which made for some sleepless nights.
Manager Response: Dear raytemoa,  We are glad that you enjoyed our Family Suite, the customer service, location, and that the little ones were able to take a dip in the kiddie pool. I want to apologize for any noise issues that occurred during your stay. We take great pride in our accommodations and generally have had very limited noise complaints, our goal is definitely a restful stay. Being just over a year old, I am sorry that you felt the rooms were dated. I would really appreciate additional feedback to understand this and to make it up to for any inconveniences you had during your stay. Please feel free to call me a 714.750.2010 or email me at keith.moses@hilton.com.

Summary: My adult son, daughter and granddaughter and myself stayed here for a week. I can't say enough about this hotel! Everything was perfect....clean room, comfortable beds, helpful pleasant staff, etc. Breakfast was crowded but the kitchen staff were very quick to refill and tend to our needs. We enjoyed the close proximity to Disneyland, either by toy story shuttle bus or a pleasant 20 minute walk. The pool area was very clean and well maintained. I would definitely stay here again and highly recommend this property. Thank you!

Summary Heading: Great family friendly hotel close to Disneyland
Summary: This hotel is in a perfect spot if you are visiting Disneyland with kids. The Disney Toy Story parking lot is located around the back of the hotel so a short 5 minute walk is all that's required to get to Disneyland as you can hop aboard the free Disney car park shuttles (and nobody seems to mind that you haven't actually parked in the lot as heaps of people do it). The shuttle busses are very convenient as they take you right to the gates and come every few minutes right up until after closing time. It would probably be about a 15 min walk to Disneyland directly from the hotel but we didn't need to do it once. The hotel provides a decent breakfast and on Mon-Thurs even offers a free dinner with beer and wine from 5pm-7pm which varies each time and offers a good money saving

Great hotel. Super clean with a very good staff. Enjoyed the breakfast and the dinner was good too. Close to Disney, and many restaurants. Our room had two comfortable  Queen size beds and a pull out sofa. Also had a small kitchen if needed. Highly recommend.

Homewood is located right next to the Toy Story parking lot, so it's a great location if you are there for Disneyland. Self-parking is $18/day, but they do provide complimentary breakfast & wifi. Depending on where your room is, you can see DL fireworks from the room. There were a lot of families with kids there but it was so quiet at night, so I really loved it. I think this might be our choice of hotel for Anaheim from now on!

We stayed at this Homewood Suites to celebrate our daughter's 3rd birthday in Disneyland. After an 8 hour drive, it was refreshing to be greeted by a warm friendly smile the second we walked in the doors! Checkin was a breeze and was catered toward me (I'm very familiar with this brand and its amenities). When we got to our room, we were very impressed by the cleanliness and attention to detail. It was one of the cleanest hotels we have ever stayed in. In the mornings, breakfast was incredibly busy but the team there didn't miss a beat and kept items fully stocked, tables bussed and even made time to ask us how our stay was going. This hotel is right next to the "woody" parking lot and is a 5 minute walk to the Disneyland shuttles. For all of these reasons, I highly recommend

Date of visit: 4/23 - 4/24, 2017. This was our first stay here, and now I would not stay anywhere else if visiting Disneyland again. It was close to perfect.We were fortunate to be able to check in early which helped us start our vacation a little early. The supervisor at the front desk was very friendly and helpful and nade us feel welcome. There is shuttle service to Disneyland, which is only about 7 minutes away. Our room was beautiful and clean, comfortable. The bathroom was gorgeous. The room had a super nice kitchenette but we did not have a chance to use it --only two of us and only at Disneyland one day. The bed was so comfortable that I slept well--I usually don't in hotels. And it was quiet, we didnt hear a thing. The hotel offered several complimentary meals: hot

We decided to stay here for our family trip to Disneyland. Not only was the included breakfast great, so was the room and the staff was awesome! We were even surprised by a little towel animal that the cleaning team left for us. My kids loved that! It's nice for a company to put out that little extra to make their customers happy. What a great team Homewood Suites has!

We had a great time/experience here. They were very helpful with helping us with an early check in. The suite is beautiful and clean. The kitchen was fully equipped. Saturday morning we did not want our room cleaned but the housekeeping staff were great, gave us extra towels and were very friendly. The pool is nice, jacuzzi might need a little more pressure from the jets but overall pool area was family friendly! Target and the food establishments are very convenient being across the street. Shuttle bus was very convenient to get back and forth to Disneyland. The breakfast they cook is not so great but the coffee and bagels and fruit were perfect! I love having the complimentary coffee bar and cucumber water out 24/7. On our last morning my son left his wallet at the eating area

My extended family and I stayed here last week in order to visit Disneyland. I chose Homewood Suites from looking at online reviews, and I am so glad I did. It was an excellent experience all the way around. My whole family loved it! The rooms were spacious and immaculate. The whole vibe of the hotel was clean and airy. We enjoyed their complimentary breakfast each morning and walked by as many guests were taking advantage of the cool evening socials they host as well. All staff we encountered were courteous, professional and helpful.  The pools were awesome too. Very pleased with our stay and I think it was such a great value for our budget! Well done, Hilton!!!

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel for the price, especially if you have a family.
Summary: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. I appreciated that breakfast and light dinner was provided. There were plenty of activities for families to do. It was close to the shuttles that went to Disneyland. I liked having a kitchenette in the room, especially a full size refrigerator.

We spent 2 days at the Homewood Suites near Disneyland and during our stay the staff was very friendly and helpful.  The rooms were cleaned except for one of the bed's blankets that had a blue gooey under it.  Besides that, everything went smoothly.  Parking was easy, the internet access and speed were adequate and the amenities (pool, hot tub, etc) were in good condition.

Just as good if not better than a Hilton Resort Timeshare. When you arrive at check-in the staff is almost to courteous and ready to answer any questions. The front desk staff made it home and very clean dining room.

Wonderful location Friendly staff A bit noisy at night-not great sound proofing  Fitness center doesn't have a lot of weights but it does have cardio.  The staff really set the tone for my stay-SO pleasant and ready to help for any issues.

We stayed three nights here and the hotel and staff were superb. The hotel was clean, the pool refreshing and the staff friendly and welcoming. Complimentary breakfasts, dinners and beer and wine was nice. It is walking distance to Disneyland and California Sdventure, even for 5 year olds. Both the Manager and General Manager spoke with us about our stay, our plans and if they could help make our trip better. I wouldn't stay anywhere else coming to DIsneyland.

We were very impressed by the friendliness of staff, cleanliness of the hotel common areas as well as the room, the breakfast, and M-Th light dinner.   Our flight was an early one but we went to the hotel thinking to use their luggage storage room and were greeted with the unexcpected, great news that our room was ready for us to check in. We walked to the Toy Story parking lot, only about 3 blocks away and the caught the free shuttle to Disneyland. We always felt safe walking back to the hotel even at midnight. The whole Homewood Suites experience was outstanding.  We definitely recommend this hotel.

We stayed here on our trip to Disneyland.  Location was great! The hotel is literally next door to the Disney Toy Story Parking lot where you can catch the shuttle to Disneyland.  The hotel is very nice, modern, and clean.  Rooms are well appointed. We did the family suite with King bed for the parents and bunk bed for the kids which  was a great space for my family of 5. They also have pull out sofa which we could have used.    Kitchen had a large fridge to store plenty of water, wine, left-overs, etc. My kids loved the pool!  They also have a FREE breakfast and Social (wine, beer, soup, snacks!)  Great value for the money! We will definitely be back!

This is the perfect hotel for family trip to Disneyland. Great family suites, delicious breakfast, great pools and even weekday happy hour. A short walk to the free Disneyland shuttle- easy to come back to the hotel midday- then back for the evening. A great hotel for multi generation family trips as well!

This hotel wasn't the best Homewood Suites I have stayed at. The kickbacks were small and had very limited food options. The suites were pretty small and the wifi was slow. Some good things about this hotel was that they had an arcade, mini golf course, and movie screenings every night. Also it was close to Disneyland and was walking distance from the shuttle bus that took you there. Ok hotel but good if you are going to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear TheTravelKing29,  Please know that we strive to be extraordinary, so the fact that things could have been better and that the hotel was not among your favorite Homewood Suites is definitely not how we want our guests to remember us. We definitely try to provide our guests with a robust breakfast, with eight chafing dishes of various hot items, fresh fruit, cereals, bagels, waffles, etc. as well as providing our complimentary Evening Reception Monday through Thursday, which includes a light dinner, beer, wine, and non-alcoholic selections. At 585 square feet on average, we did make attempts in construction to make our suites spacious and comfortable for our guests, I am sorry that you felt it was small. We are constantly upgrading our WiFi speed to keep up with the demand of the current needs of society. We are glad that you enjoyed our central location and all of the fun extras the hotel provides. If I am able to be of any assistance please do not hesitate to call me a 714.750.2010 or email keith.moses@hilton.com.

Summary: We stayed here when visiting Disneyland. Most of the hotels are on one main street near Disney, including this one. The car parkinging is great. Lots of restaurants within 5/10 minute drive and some also in walking distance. Rooms had most tho he you would need. We stayed in a room facing Disney and at night could see the fireworks. Breakfast is a bit chaotic, nothi g special but adequate. Good location for Disney.

Hotels rooms are nice and big. Complimentary evening dinner with beer and wine is great and a money saver. Breakfast is good and has plenty of options. About a 20 min walk to Disneyland, but this is a must for us since we love to eat.

Summary Heading: Best hotel stay in years! Clean, location, awesome staff!
Summary: Location just perfect, Great parking.   Happy staff all day long.... this is hard to find nowadays.    Bunk bed rooms are perfect for families 4-5!     Excellent breakfast option and great 5-7pm light dinner, even have draft beers included.     Super clean.  We loved the brand concept.

My daughter and I stayed at the hotel for 10 days. It was great. The front desk staff was friendly and very helpful. Especially Victoria, Antonio, and Kristi. Victoria has a wonderful personality. Antonio always gave you a great smile and asked if we needed anything. And Kristi helped us with transportation and our groceries when our train had a delay. Hon also was very nice and asked if I was enjoying my stay and if I needed more towels when I was at the pool. The rooms were very clean and quiet.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel that's close to Disneyland
Summary: Great hotel with nice amenities that is close to Disneyland! New hotel with a nice home feeling. Our suite was great for my wife, baby, and myself! Would definitely stat here again. Budget friendly!Would recommend to friends and family!

We recently stayed at this hotel for spring break.  The hotel was busy but still quiet and well organized.  The complimentary breakfast is the best - lots of choices for all appetites.  The family suite with bunk beds worked great for a family of four.  I definitely recommend this hotel for a Disneyland visit!

Great place to stay for visiting Disneyland. Free shuttle from the neighboring Disney parking lot to the park. Hotel has very good breakfast buffet and also a nice evening buffet. Pool area is great, too. Get room away from the basketball court.

First and foremost the customer service is outstanding, the entire staff at the Homewood Suites in Anaheim is everything in the word "remarkable". The rooms are spacious and very clean. You have a full size refrigerator with a microwave and dishes if you feel you need to have your own food or you can have a breakfast each morning and light dinner snack Monday through Thursday evenings down stairs in the main lobby. I would like to give a big thanks to a few staff members especially as they seem to always go out of their way to make sure you feel as if you were at home, Melissa F the registration manager is just plain outstanding, she makes sure to spend time with you to see how things are going and to make sure that the room you are in is top notch, Karla R in the kitchen area

Summary Heading: Started off rocky but ended up great
Summary: We had a heck of a time getting the reservation correct for our stay.  Lots of phone calls, etc.  Once the reservation was correct, the stay was awesome.  The hotel is very nice.  We were able to walk to Disneyland or take the shuttle across the street.  Breakfast was great.

This Hotel is a great hotel! The rooms are spacey and modern, and complementary breakfast is better than many hotels with full breakfast! (Not just cereal and toast! They also have dinner, also complementary, during weekdays. Our family fit nicely in the rooms!  There was also parking at a fee. I used my Hilton Card and received points for my stay as well. (Not too far from the Park) little hint- you can walk a little over a block and take the Disneyland Bus Shuttles at no cost!

So happy to give this hotel another chance.  Looks like all the kinks have been worked out and the stay was perfect. The staff is so friendly and makes sure you are 100% satisfied. Rooms are spacious and comfortable.

Good, comfortable hotel. Would be good if the breakfast could be extended to 10.30, which would help due to many families staying at this hotel. Proximity to Disneyland is  a big plus. Disney parking is right next door from where one can grab a shuttle to theme parks, which is v. convenient. Easy access to freeway as well (I-5).

Having just stayed at this hotel for a spring break with my family, we had a great time.  The hotel is perfectly located, it is right next door to a Disney carpark so the ability to take the Disney transportation to the park is very easy if you do not want to drive or take the normal bus. This is also a cost saver for the person staying at the hotel as the disney bus is free.  Finally with regard the room and hotel, breakfast is good with plenty of options but busy. They have good facilities for the pool and gym plus laundry facilities if needed though I have not used those.  They also offer an evening social midweek and provide free food and drink as an evening meal.  Overall very impressed

This hotel offers all the comforts of your home. Full kitchen, living room and bunk beds for the kids. Extras include evening social and breakfast every morning. The pool area was perfect for unwinding after walking all morning at Disneyland.

I was quite happy with my stay here. The room was clean. Everything was in working order. The staff was friendly.  The breakfast exceeded my expectations.  I went solo, but will return here when I'm in the area with my family.  Everything in the fitness center was in working order.  Can't say enough good things about this place.

This Hotel was perfect location for walking distance to the Toy Story parking lot shuttle. The complimentary full hot breakfast and evening social are a great value! The walls are thin and at times you can hear your neighbors foot stomps; which for yaxwas unbearable. However, the hotel did its best to quiet the noisy neighbors!

The front desk was friendly, our large suites were well appointed and clean, the free breakfast had an excellent selection... this hotel is #1 for a reason.  It's unfortunate that it's not closer to Disneyland if that's why you are staying there (which we were), but the quality of the lodging made it worthwhile.  The pool is also amazing!

Homewood Suites provided me with an excellent experience during my recent stay. Breakfast was all I was expecting but I got so much more. I received excellent customer service, hot dinner from Monday through Thursday, movie nights and I even got to see the fireworks from my window!

This was a Disneyland trip for us with our two granddaughters. We flew into LAX and took Disneyland Resort Express (paid for 2 adults and the 2 kids were free), which dropped us off almost in front of our hotel. Check-in was quick and informative. We received the daily park schedules, daily meal schedules and menus, and even instructions on how to take the free Toy Story Parking lot shuttle bus to Disneyland.  ROOM: We stayed in the Family Suite with the king bed and bunk beds (which also had a trundle bed we didn't use). The bunk beds were GREAT! Our girls thought they were better than their beds at home! We opted for them so they would not have to share a bed or have someone sleep in the living room area. We loved the suite. It allowed the kids to have a different sleep

Staff were prompt and professional in resolving issues. Hotel needs to upgrade to better washing facilities to ensure hotel guests receive clean towels and sheets. Breakfast consisted of powered eggs and frozen pancakes. These items were horrible. However, guests also have the option of making their own waffles and the waffles were good. The potatoes were also good. One meat choice was available daily.
Manager Response: Dear 524candacea,  Thank you for taking the time to let others know about your recent stay. We are glad that our team did a great job of resolving any issues that you had, but our goal is to ensure there are no issues in the first place. I have shared your comments with the appropriate department heads and team. We are constantly monitoring our industrial washers and dryers, but have reached out to the appropriate vendor to ensure they are properly dispensing. I am glad that you enjoyed portions of the breakfast, I would be remiss if I didn't point out that the scrambled eggs are not powdered, but are made in large quantities. We are always striving these to make them as tasty as possible, so we will discuss. Thank you again for staying with us and we hope to see you again the future!

Summary: Very Close to the Anaheim Convention Center as well as the front gate to Disneyland. Very clean with an amazing staff. Walking distance to many places to eat and shop for gifts. Great place for business and for your family.

I stayed at Homesuits and was greeted by their pleasant staff. I really enjoyed the room and the mini kitchen. I enjoyed their spacious living room and bedroom. The complementary breakfast and dinner was very delicious.

You can't go wrong here. Everything was so very nice and the staff was exceptionally pleasant.  The evening social was really surprising. We had no idea it would be that nice. Short walk to Disneyland in a safe area.  Would definitely stay here again!

Every person who helped us was kind, friendly, and helpful. Karla,Victor, Carmen, Jorge, Margarita, and Brittany were amazing! Breakfast was generous, waffles,eggs, meat, a variety of breads and fruits, and cereal. It was quiet. We loved it.

Summary Heading: A Memorable Stay in an Excellent Property with a Great Location
Summary: Why is this property the number 1 hotel in Anaheim...boy there are many reasons we could give: * A newer property; well maintained * A well-trained caring staff * Great food and DINNER during the week

Summary Heading: Good family hotel when visiting Disneyland
Summary: Enjoyed the Homewood Suites.  Good variety of breakfast foods.  Evening snacks were tasty.  Took the shuttle bus from Disney's Toy Story parking lot, located one block from hotel (about a 10 minute walk to shuttle buses) to go to Disneyland/California Adventure.  Room was clean and quiet.  Hotel staff was helpful.  Pleasant stay.

Awesome hotel with superb customer service!  Complimentary hot buffet breakfast was excellent.   Food never ran out and great breakfast selection.  About 2 blocks from Disneyland.  Family suites with bunk bends were perfect for our family of 6.  Will definitely be staying there again.   Highly recommended.

Had the best stay at Homewood Suites! We were a family of 5( 2 x adults and 3  x kids) staying in a family suit that consisted of one bunk bed with bottom roll out trolley bed and a king size bed. Heaps of room. Loved the buffet breakfast, esp making your own waffles. We also enjoyed coming back from a busy day and having the light supper and complimentary beers and wines between 5-7pm Mon-Thurs. Awesome when your tired and have to feed the kids. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Loved the fact that the free bus shuttle to Disneyland was just around the corner.  They have an awesome taxi service with Solomon. We traveled with another family so we were a group of 9 altogether. Felt safe every time we traveled with him. It was a little pricey but we were comfortable (always

This hotel deserves 5 stars! We have stayed here twice for our week long vacation. Great hotel for families, as they have 2 room suites, a great full breakfast, not cooked to order omelettes, but still very good, evening reception with drinks and coffee available most of the day. Walking distance to Disney and a lot of dining options. Kids have a fun time with their pool area, which includes a water feature, the game room, a putting green, but they especially enjoy the basketball court.  The staff is always helpful and greets you. Rooms are well cleaned and the staff during breakfast and evening reception are always spot on. It helps that this is a pretty new property, maybe 2 years old. I don't even mind paying for parking as it is atleast a secure lot with gated entry. Ok, so

Location Location!! Breakfast was good social evening reception was good, hotel was excellent and clean.Service was great at each level will recommend to others  and definitely  will come back to it again:)

Recently stayed at this hotel for a family vacation to Disneyland.  We stayed in a two room suite, which had a fully stocked kitchen, separate bedroom with two queen beds, and a pull out bed in the living room.  Room was spotless upon arrival and stayed that way throughout our visit.  We walked next door to the Toy Story parking lot and used the Disney shuttles to go back and forth to the parks, but it would be an easy walk as well.  Breakfast each morning was good enough to get started for the day, pretty crowded but they have a lot of seating.  Monday-Thursday they had a light dinner with beer and wine available, which was a nice touch.  Parking is an extra fee which seems to be normal in that area.  Each employee we encountered were so nice, friendly and helpful.  We will for

Not only was the hotel great in every way. The staff was very compassionate toward our child when he was sick for a day. They would consistently ask my wife throughout our stay if our son was feeling better.

I stayed here in September for a conference at the convention center.  After the conference, my husband and 2 sons joined me for 2 nights for Disneyland/California Adventure.    The room:  The suite was very spacious.  Way more than I needed for myself, but great when my husband and kids came.  Having a full kitchen is always a plus.  Beds were comfortable.  We could see fireworks from Disney and Angel's Stadium.  The floor in the kitchen had some stains, as my younger one was only crawling I inquired at the front desk for cleaning.  I was told it was residue from workmen's boots that had stained the floor....  Our shower leaked causing a flood each time we used it, which did not get fixed during our stay.  Breakfast:  CRAZY BUSY.  And this was during a weekday in September, low
Manager Response: Hello EnigmaKS!  Thank you for the kind feedback. We appreciate your mention about our pleasant staff and apologize that you were not able to enjoy our breakfast to it‚Äôs fullest extent. We also appreciate the positive mention about our location. Hopefully you can come back and stay again soon! We look forward to having you.

Summary: This was me second time staying at this hotel and it was a much better experience this time around. Staff is always friendly and helpful and is walking distance to a few store's and the park. On the day we arrived we went on a walk and came back to a nice gift from the sales Manager. (Thank you again for that) We go to Anaheim every year and will definitely be back. Being a manager myself the Homewood suites has a great team with great teamwork and that makes all the difference on where you stay. :)

We had a fantastic stay at this hotel.  Friendly staff, complimentary breakfast and light dinner with drinks.  Basketball court and movies for the kids.  List goes on.  I would not even look up another hotel on our next trip to Disneyland.

We would highly recommend this hotel to others in the future and will definitely stay here again either in Disneyland or in other locations. We especially loved the Mon-Thrusday evening reception. Our family returned from Disneyland and relaxed by the pool sipping our favourite beverages while nibbling on some appies. We loved the room and were able to make a few dinners for the family while the kids swam in the pool and then relaxed in the room. The fitness centre was awesome and the BBQ's were top notch!

Perfect location and wonderful family hotel!  Very safe and clean property and surroundings.  Will stay here again!  Loved the room with the bunk beds for the kids and big walk out patio space by the pool!

We had a great experience at this hotel. The room was spacious, modern, and clean. If we come back for a lengthier stay, we'll definitely take advantage of the kitchen! There is a free shuttle in the nearby Disney parking lot for an easy trip to the park.   The breakfast is decent. Nothing to write home about, but it fit the bill. I think it'd be great for kids and large groups since there is good variety. I personally loved the waffle makers... yum!  Each staff member we encountered was very friendly and helpful.  My only complaint is that the parking lot lacks security or cameras in certain areas. I was disappointed to find my car with a decent dent in the side when we were about to leave. The staff was very sympathetic and took a report, but without cameras there was nothing

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel, breakfast and close to Disneyland
Summary: We have stayed here two years in a row. The staff is very friendly. The complimentary breakfast was very good. There were tons of choices for what to eat... it will please everyone in your family. The social hour was great! You get a free meal and free beer and wine. Very clean rooms!

Me and my family stayed for 6 days at Hilton Homewood Suites Anaheim ‚Äì Convention Center and I would like to thank you all for the amazing time during this period.  I want to thank all the staff who were very kind and  helpful during this period.  The hotel is amazing, very clean and has everything we need during our stay !

Beautiful and clean, great complimentary breakfast , brand new , great comfy bed and the best ADA bathroom but having mobility issues it was a bit of a walk for me to the Toy Story parking lot but ART bus very close to this horel

Enjoyed our stay at this hotel. All staff were helpful and respectful. We loved the full breakfast and evening social each day. Great suites, roomy, comfortable and clean. Easy access to Disneyland. Family friendly hotel.

Our whole family agreed that we will stay here again on our next Disney trip (even our conscientious spender!) I wish there weren't a parking fee, but the complimentary meals (breakfast and weeknight dinners) and other amenities more than made up for it! We would walk the couple blocks to the Disney shuttle in the morning, go back to the hotel in the late afternoon to rest and have dinner @ 5, then head back to Disney for the night. The hotel was very clean and the staff was so friendly!

Excellent hotel for vacation with family.  I enjoy the nearby eating places and location to the Disneyland property.  I must stay for future visits.  I highly recommend this hotel for families with children and guest with large parties.

This was a fantastic hotel. It was clean, staff were helpful and breakfast was terrific!  We loved the option of the evening social, especially after a busy day! It was right beside the Toy Story parking lot so it was easy to catch a bus to Disneyland every day!

great value and excellent breakfast provided.  room with bunk beds and king sized bed slept our family of 5, extremely comfortably.  20 minute walk to disney's main gate, or jump on the toy story shuttle with is next door to the hotel.

Very nice hotel with easy access to Disneyland resort. Nice room to accommodate family of 5.  Nice size room, clean, newer property, good location, easy access to Disneyland via nearby shuttles.  Good breakfast included.

Travel from Texas with family to Disneyland.  Couldn't ask for a better property Close to park and the staff was incredibly accommodating.  The facilities are amazing.   Outdoor fun on the grounds.   Kids had as much fun here as they did at Disney - without the lines

Everything was too notch, from the minute we checked in to the day we checked out was a fantastic experience, rooms were clean and staff was will to go the extra mile to accommodate, looking forward to booking another trip and bringing the family to Disney and this hotel will be my first choice

Fantastic hotel.  The walk to the toy story parking lot next door to catch the shuttle is super easy and was always fast.  Staff were awesome and very friendly.  The breakfast is the mornings is very adequate and the staff keep everything clean and in stock as is does get busy.  Rooms were very nice.  Wifi was fast.  Parking was easy as can be.  The arcade was a nice touch to have just to change up the pace and give the kids something to do at night for a little bit.  Beds were comfy.  Stayed here 4 nights and never had an issue.

Summary Heading: Staff was great - hotel is very family friendly!
Summary: Staff was great and very friendly - hotel family friendly! Breakfast and evening reception were decent and they had good options - about a mile from Disney. Nice lobby area - Would definitely return :)!

Perfect position, opposite the conference centre, modern, clean, free breakfast with a good choice. Each room was a suite so took food up from their breakfast and had it by myself with a book. Negatives, it was about a quarter of a mile walk from he lobby to my room. You could hear the toilet flush from a nearby room (not nice at all). The staff made you feel like they were doing you a favour, never really making an effort and when i called for someone to bring down my luggage, no one came! Would I return? Yes without thinking twice!

Stayed 2 nights for a show in the Anaheim convention center, great value for large, pretty new, clean rooms, great kitchenette and great service. Short walk to Anaheim convention center and next door to Disney parking lot. Booked it based on Tripadviser reveiws, was not disappointed.

This nice hotel for family if you have kids & beer from Disney land &  downtown of Disney  Next time if I need to travel with my family I will reserve again on this hotel  Thanks for team of the hotel  Again thank you

Loved the hotel and right next to the parking shuttles to Disneyland.  Had a great 3 day stay with the family and a clean and comfortable room.  Breakfast was good and they handled the crowd very well.  I would stay here again for sure.

We found a gem of a room and a great price. It was a 1 bedroom king suite with a bunk bed, trundle bed and sofa bed. All the kids got to sleep where they wanted! Staff helpful, personable & professional!

We loved Homewood Suites Anaheim Convention Center! The hotel made it convenient by selling tickets to Disneyland at the front desk without any markup. The complimentary breakfast was delicious and had some variety each day. Having a full kitchen in the suite was awesome, and the rooms were quiet, clean, and comfortable. The bed was GREAT. The staff bent over backward to help. We'll definitely return!

Our stay was wonderful with the exception of the complimentary breakfast. The room was spotless and lovely. The staff were helpful and polite. The parking was tricky because we have a large vehicle but we made it work. We felt very welcome. The complimentary breakfast wasn't good. Some of the items were bland and over cooked. The waffle makers were clogged and the eggs ran out within in hour of it starting so we never got to try them. Hopefully the breakfast can be fixed because we would love to stay here again. Best part was that the hotel is VERY close to Disneyland! We could see parts of the park from our room!

Great, free breakfast! Suites were great to tuck the kids in and we could stay up to plan the next day. Kitchen was an added bonus, we packed lunches to save a few bucks. Convenient to Disney and shuttles if you don't want to walk (less than a mile). Pool, basketball court and arcade room. Highly recommend this hotel!

For the price, it is hard to imagine a better place to stay if you are visiting Disneyland.  The rooms are big and comfortable with kitchen/living area and a separate bedroom, good for families of four or five.  The included breakfast has all the regular offerings including eggs, waffles, bacon/sausage, fruit, yogurt, cereal etc. and they vary the menu somewhat from day to day to increase the variety.  From Monday through Thursday, they also have a light supper offering which includes beer and wine.  Wifi reception was excellent. The hotel is within easy walking distance to the Disneyland shuttle.

Christian at the front desk was amazing, very pleasant, kind and courteous. We needed to extend our stay an additional night, and he found a way to accommodate us. He also set us up with a quiet room which was important to me. He gave us restaurant suggestions in the area, and even set me up with a driver to the Amtrak train station.   Room and furnishings were new or refurbished, it all looked new to me.   The rooms were always kept clean.  Beds were comfortable. The swimming pool and jacuzzi were a nice treat, always kept clean and heated. The coffee and hot teas were good.

I went to this hotel with my family (4 people). We arrived super early at LAX and we were allowed to check in early. Breakfast was really good, a lot of options and lots of space (9AM could be kind of cramped). The attention is very good, they are very attentive. The room was immense, and I mean immense (the hotel photos make it look smaller than it is). This was great, because we stayed there for almost a week and never felt like it was cramped. The employees really make your experience better, and are very helpful. The hotel was a laundry service, and a car service to the LAX airport (100 or 120), which is very convenient in LA traffic :) Definitely going back if I'm ever in town again.

What a great experience we had at this hotel.  Being a newer hotel I expected it to be in good condition but it was also very well maintained.  Our room and the public areas were kept very clean during our stay.    We stayed in a non-suite room which was large enough for our needs.  The bathroom is large and it was convenient to have access to a microwave and mini-fridge in our room.  I also liked that the room had a ceiling fan which helped keep the room comfortable.  I liked the bed however I would have liked some firmer pillows.  All 4 pillows on our bed were very soft and didn't provide the kind of support I like.  The breakfast was fantastic and was a much better quality than you expect from most hotels.  There was rotating menu items each day as well as waffles, muffins,

We love this place ... friendly, fun. clean ... a class hotel for families ... great location ... Disney bus is right next door Disney and we had no issues using it go to Disney and back even though we were not parking there ... complimentary breakfast is great ... complimentary dinner Mon to Thur is so so but the beer is Stella and the wines are great ... can't be beat

We really enjoyed our stay at the Homewood inn and suits. We after in the queen suits. The separate rooms were perfect for our family of 4 with two small children. The full kitchen was a plus for us as well. Having the option to cook and store snacks before we headed to disneyland was really nice. The rooms were very clean and well kept. The pack and play we requested for our 1 1/2 year old was like new which was a wonderful surprise. We've had not so good experiences with other hotels and the free pack and play provided. The service was exceptional. We enjoyed the free breakfast. It was your standard continental. Nothing exceptional. My husband would go down each morning and grab us something because the crowd was large and it was easier with our small children for him to bring

Loved this hotel, I will never stay anywhere else when going to Disneyland!! The hotel staff was amazing and very accommodating, our suite was very clean, has plenty of room to sleep 7, and the breakfast is wonderful! It is within walking distance to the "toy story" lot for Disneyland so it made getting to and from the park super easy!!

Summary Heading: wonderful stay - we will be back!
Summary: Had a wonderful 4-night stay at this hotel.  We were able to choose our room before arriving which was great because we picked one with a view of the Disneyland fireworks (room 535).  We were able to check in early which was an added bonus.  The morning breakfast and evening social (with free wine and beer!) are a nice touch as this saves you a ton of time and money.  Cookies are served at the end of the social hour. Very clean, very nice staff, nice pool and hot tub with other things for kids to do on the property - we will be back!

Summary Heading: Excellent stay for an excellent price!
Summary: I was a little apprehensive booking a room on the internet for my family. You never know what you'll get until you get there. I was so pleased when we opened the door to a delightful and spacious suite!  I was staying there with my daughter, son-in-law and my two grandkiddos, ages four and almost two.  The room was clean, modern and well designed.  Having a full-sized refrigerator was a plus. The beds were comfortable and clean. The bonus breakfast and delicious meal at the manager's hour was huge!  It saved us  from having to purchase a dinner meal at Disneyland! Extra friendly staff and beautiful surroundings convinced us to make this our go-to hotel when in the Disneyland area!

Nice newer hotel. Stayed in the bunk bed suite, which was perfect for our family of four. Easy transport to Disney parks via the free Toy Story bus service. Enjoyed the complimentary breakfast and dinner, as well as the hot tub. Would definitely stay here again!

Summary Heading: perfect for families. love the grocery delivery. order directly from Vons.com  before your arrival. breakfast and dinner
Summary: Perfect for families going to disney. Roomy suites. Kitchen.  Grocery delivery. Freshly renovated and clean. They sell park tickets, rent strollers, free dinner during week with wine and beer. Nice pool and hottub....disney parking shuttle leaves right across the street for free. What else could you ask for

Summary Heading: New Hotel in Great Location near Disney / Convention Center
Summary: New Hotel - opened in ~ Nov 2015.  The hotel is centrally located in Anaheim and near Convention Center and Disney.  We enjoyed a 4 night stay for a family Disneyland trip.  The breakfast area was large and had a lot of breakfast options.

I rate this place five stars for the price and all the amenities that you get its an excellent stay. Very family oriented and vey close to restaurants and Disney shuttle. Perfect place to stay whether you are staying only a day or a week. Very much enjoyed my stay there.

We had an absolutely fabulous stay at Homewood Suites this past week.  The hotel was clean and the service was top-notch.  We appreciated the restaurant recommendations, and the staff even went out grocery shopping for ice cream for our kids.  The breakfast and happy hour was fabulous and the staff was friendly as can be.  Would absolutely stay here again for any Disneyland trip!

Enjoyed all amenities the hotel had to offer. Definitely designed around family and convenience. The hotel staff were fabulous. The location to Disney was also perfect as good neighbor hotel. Lots of dining choices nearby.

Summary Heading: Perfect base for a Disneyland family vacation
Summary: We booked 3 nights for our mid-winter break vacation.  The room was very spacious with a separate bedroom with 2 queens and a living room/kitchen.  It was immaculately clean. The staff was uniformly friendly and helpful. Christan at the front desk when we checked in is a good representative of the property.  He was very helpful and efficient.  We checked in late enough to enjoy the end of the evening reception.  It turned out that they serve a complimentary meal rather than snacks.  It wasn't haute cuisine but it was good and saved us a trip out at the end of a long day.  Breakfast was tasty and not too crowded but there are a lot of kids running back and forth.  Disney was an easy 15 minute walk with restaurants within walking distance for apre-park dining.    It was a very

Nice hotel location-- right next to Toy Story parking lot for Disney--you literally walk next door and hop on a shuttle to Disney.  The walk would have beena little longer then we would have wanted to do--so glad they had the shuttle next door  Breakfast here is great, nice food options and one night they even had a salad bar around 5-6+/- which was a nice perk as well.  They have a small putting green and basketball court for the kids which is nice.  We would have utilized the hot tub but unfortunately another hotel guest chose to let their infant swim in the hot tub in their diaper which was a turnoff for us--not sure why hotels don't ever enforce the no kids in the hot-tub rule??  Especially ones in diapers!!!

I have always like the Hilton chain of hotels but this Homewood Suites quickly became my favorite. It was clean, modern, well stocked and a great staff. Honestly the staff is what made this our new go to when we are in Anaheim. The front desk workers were so friendly and helpful. The food area workers went above and beyond to help us and make our experience great. We had Victor, Jorge, Margarita, Karla and Carmen during out stay and I can't say enough about them. They are a true asset to this hotel. They all were so happy which to me is a true reflection of good management. They all seemed to express such positive opinions of their managers and pointed out the general manager was serving the beer/wine. Where do you ever go where the general manager is out working with their

When we go to Disneyland and need a place to stay either one or two nights,  we always choose Homewood Suites in Anaheim! From the moment you check in you are greeted with friendly faces! The hotel rooms are specious and very clean! They also offer a huge buffet breakfast style in the morning! If I can give 10 stars I would in a heartbeat! I truly and highly recommend this hotel to everyone! You will not be disappointed!!

Great stay st a great hotel. Everything was perfect, from the check in and check out, to the breakfast and evening socials. Was about a 15 minute casual walk to Disneyland and California Adventure. There a few places to stop and eat along the way, plus a CVS and Walgreens. Would definitely come back again

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay with Kids
Summary: Our stay at the Homewood Suites was perfect. The room was comfortable and spacious. The full size fridge was great because we were able to buy snacks and water for Disneyland, and keep everything cold. The breakfast each morning was also excellent. There was something for everyone, and it was super convenient. Every employee we interacted with was friendly and helpful. The only criticism is that the rooms don't have a DVD player or On Demand. It would have been nice to be able to unwind with a movie at the end of a long day at Disney. All in all, though, it was a minor thing. We will definitely stay here again.

Stayed here for a little get away to Disneyland with my 2 sons and husband.  Checked in on-line and I love the choose your room option with Hilton, such a great concept and convenience.    We had a corner 2 Queen bed suite which really worked out nicely with 2 boys who need space from each other and it was just like a 1 bedroom apartment.  The room was facing S. Harbor and was perfect and clean upon arrival.  The front desk and valet staff were very nice, and I really would rate this hotel as excellent; however, when we came back to our room after a long day at Disneyland, I was looking forward to coming to a nice tidy suite, but unfortunately, it was not.  The beds were made and the toiletries replenished, but right when we opened the door, we see the sheets and blankets on the

We really enjoyed our stay here from the friendly customer service, the breakfast on offer, the location, the cleanliness and even the dinners put on.  Having the free bus right next door was so handy to get to Disneyland and even just to go to Downtown Disney.  We felt we had everything we needed and nothing was missing. Should we return to Anaheim we will be coming back!!

Spent a two day stay here and it was great. Took advantage of the breakfast in the morning to fuel up for our day at the park. Front desk was helpful in selecting options to get to the park. The dinner was a salad and other finger foods. Overall great stay

It's new and clean. $18 dollars/day for parking- it was in the fine print. Almost $25 for a "transient" tax, whatever that means. Ends up a lot more than you think. The light dinner of salad was okay. The breakfast is terrible though the fruit was okay. A nice 15 minute walk to the park.
Manager Response: Dear Charlie Q,  I want to thank you for choosing to stay with us and appreciate the feedback. It appears that your stay did not live up to the expectations that we strive for and I would appreciate the opportunity to discuss in more details the issues that occurred directly so we are able to make it right. I do want to attempt to explain a couple of your issues. Due to our proximity to the Disneyland Resort and Convention Center the Anaheim Resort hotels do generally charge for parking. The last thing we want to do is give people the impression that we are somehow hiding the fee, which is why we have it clearly detailed on our website and is part of the confirmation email you receive from Hilton as well as third party sites. The transient occupancy taxes are taxes imposed on all hotels by the city of Anaheim and are paid directly back to the city. This fee is common throughout the industry, but percentages do vary from city to city. I hope that help a bit in clarifying.

Summary: We stayed three nights at the Homewood, very clean rooms with plenty of space for the whole family. We had a suite that gave the kids bunk beds and a pullout couch, parents a king size bed. Comfortable beds, room was cleaned every time we returned from the Parks. Complimentary breakfast was the best we've encountered, with little extras and different every day. Outdoor pool, arcade, putting green, and basketball net were enjoyed by the family. A few miles from Disneyland, just walked to the parking lot next door to the hotel and took the shuttle to entrance and back every day. Perfect stay for our family!

The staff went above and beyond to service our needs. The family suite is a good option (with bunk beds) for families with young kids. There is a free shuttle to Disneyland next to the property. There is also putting green and basketball court for the kids

Summary Heading: Gem of the Anaheim Resort Area
Summary: This site is truly the gem of the Anaheim resort area!  No wonder it is ranked #1 of 118!  It is centrally located and within walking distance of most areas.
