General Manager Keith is very friendly and accessible.  He truly has hired a wonderful staff that enjoy working at the fine establishment.  Most notable is Food & Beverage Supervisor Irene and her amazing staff (Letty, Anney, Jasmin, Marisol, Santi, Efren, Mario, and Martha).  ALL take pride in their service.  You are truly made to feel at HOME.  I highly suggest this location!

We stayed here for 6 nights as our home base for a Disneyland trip. Overall, the hotel was really good. The 1 bedroom suite was large and had everything needed for a family including a kitchen. The hotel has lots of paid parking which although expensive, was helpful. We also thought the included breakfast and dinner (Monday-Thursday) were really good. The pool area was also quite good with a full size pool, kids pool and hot tub. The location is also good - 15 or so minute walk from Disneyland or you can take the free shuttles next door at the Disneyland Toy Story parking lot if you don't feel like walking.   Our only slight issue was that the room cleanliness wasn't an "A+" when we arrived. It wasn't terrible, but there was something sticky on the bathroom floor and lipstick on

Summary Heading: Perfect for parents with small children
Summary: Pool is great, location is great, hotel is very clean. The staff, including one of the managers Mr. Ben Ly, make you feel right at home. I recommend the breakfast before you begin your day about town. I went with my Wife, my 3 month old baby, and our 3 year old, and we felt very comfortable with our stay. The room we stayed was "extended stay", with a living room and kitchen. I would recommend this hotel to people who want a smooth hotel that is close to Disneyland.  Disneyland is about an easy 20 minute walk.

The hotel is conveniently located near Disneyland. We had spent the day in the park on one of the rainy days we've ever seen. It was short of a tropical storm.  Christian greeted us with a friendly smile and do noticed it was my wife's  birthday and offered up hot chocolate and a candy bar.  It was. A nice little touch.  The hotel is a little loud in the morning from kids excited to hit Disneyland,  so if you want to sleep in ask for the top floor.

Close enough to Disneyland with a suite to use while the kids slept.  Beds were comfortable.  Breakfast had lots of choices with food constantly replaced.   Hotel is only 2 years old and does not have a bar area.  If you enjoy wine after a long day at Disneyland, be sure to bring your own.   No real store for wine or large selection of munchies.

We stayed two nights at Homewood Suites and two nights at Disney Hotel (grand California). I would say I love my stay at Homewood Suites far far far better.  Super spacious and clean suites, comfortable bed. The hotel doesn't offer a lot of services like no one will help you with luggages and directions. Nonetheless there are luggage carts every where. Parking can get a little busy at night and need to valet park, the valet park gentlemen are super friendly and helpful.   Very very good value, especially when you are travelling as a family!

Just returned from a trip to Disneyland with a large school group of performing arts students and their parents - we were so happy with the Homewood Suites.  Check in with our big group was seamless, staff was happy and helpful, the lounge was spacious, breakfast was very good and pool area was a great hang out spot.  It was nice having a full kitchen in each room and beds were comfy.  Overall very pleased with our experience.

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel in a Nice Location
Summary: I was in Anaheim on business ( MD&M ) trade show. The Homewood was right across from the venue, so didn't have to worry about additional parking fees. The rooms were clean, the staff friendly and the location excellent. What else can I say.

Summary Heading: Great value for our family of five
Summary: After a night flight from Honolulu we landed early at LAX (6am). Our shuttle took ages to arrive and by the time we made it to Anaheim, we were exhausted.  What a relief it was to approach reception and be greeted warmly, and to be told our room was ready.  We had requested early check in but really weren't expecting we could have this so early (9am).  There was tea, coffee and hot chocolate available in reception and a large, comfortable seating area with a fireplace - our children had already made themselves at home expecting a wait!  We had also requested a room with a view of the Disneyland fireworks, and this was met.  We saw them twice during our five night stay, and they were awesome! Our room was on the top floor so there was no noise from people above,  We had a one

We stayed at this hotel the first week of June 2016.  5 of us were comfortable in the suite.  Had 2 beds in the bedroom and a fold out couch, so plenty of room.  Kitchenette worked nicely and we were able to save by preparing food each day in the room.  Best part?  The hotel is next to the Disney parking lot, so we walked to the  lot each day and hopped on the free shuttle to the park.  Didn't ever have to wait more than 2 minutes.

Summary Heading: Great apartment hotel close to Anaheim Convention Centre and Disneyland carpark shuttle
Summary: We chose to stay here as our trip involved a conference at the Convention Centre plus Disneyland for the kids. The staff are friendly, and rooms are quite spacious and clean with good amenities. The kids loved the bunk beds. The buffet breakfasts were convenient and we made it for one of the complementary evening meals which included wine. Laundry services were handy. We only hired a car on our last day and the staff kindly let us park for about 15 mins to check out and load up without charging us for parking.  No need to get the street buses to Disneyland - this hotel is just next to the Disneyland carpark from which there are complimentary shuttles from an hour before Disney opening time to about an hour after closing time.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay in anaheim
Summary: This was a lovely hotel. Big rooms, great shower, clean and with a really comfy bed. It is close to all attractions and the staff were friendly and extremely helpful. The hotel was really quiet which I love and made it a really pleasant escape from the hustle and bustle of Disneyland.

This hotel is only 1 yr old so everything is clean and new ! Every staff member was friendly and aimed to please.Loved that the pool is a bit larger than most and it was heated so grandson had a good time in the pool and watched a movie shown on the wall. The ART (which goes all over Anaheim - Knott's, shopping etc.) stopped right next door and tickets can be purchased at the front desk. BUT,  for DL catch the FREE bus in the middle of the Toy Story parking lot - it is a continuous flow, no waiting - awesome when you are so tired after walking all day.  This hotel has complimentary breakfast every day and a nice light supper from Mon - Thurs - not only does it save a ton of money, its fast and convenient. Loved the nice size rooms as we stayed a week so didnt feel closed in.

Summary Heading: Good but expected a little more
Summary: We stayed here from jan 28-feb 4. We had four rooms as we were four families traveling together. Rooms 329.325.321 and 322. We had wanted our rooms adjoining but it was unable to have any of them do that.  Pros: about 1 mile walk to Disneyland, free breakfast and evening meal (Monday through Thursday), spacious rooms, clean and newer. Can do laundry on site yourself or send out, friendly staff, plenty of paid parking. Cons: the breakfast was ok, two mornings the choices were pretty good but the rest of the time it was ok. Fresh cut fruit couldn't get it was constantly empty. Go to breakfast before 8-830 as it tends to get very busy around then. No bar or restaurant in house and no room service. The store they have is very limited on food and snacks.  We used the laundry mat and
Manager Response: Dear m_17kisses,  I want to thank you for taking the time to let others know about your recent stay with us. I am glad that there were some positive areas during your stay, including the friendly staff and spacious accommodations, but unhappy that you left without the intention to return. Please know that the safety of our guests is a huge priority and I am sorry that there was anytime during your stay that you felt unsafe, whether it was in or out of the hotels control. Please know that I am following up with department heads to investigate the areas of concern from your review and will address appropriately. We would love to have the opportunity to regain your loyalty, please feel free to call me at 714.750.2010 so I am able to further discuss with you.

Summary: We had a very pleasant stay at this hotel when we brought our children to Disneyland. The hotel is next to the Disneyland parking lot which has a free shuttle service, although we walked to and from the park (about a mile) most days. Victoria had housekeeping have our room ready at 9am when we switched from a very unpleasant stay at a hotel down the street. We were impressed with the cleanliness of the room and surprised to find a trundle bed under the bunk bed so all 4 of my kids had a bed to themselves.  The breakfast was fresh and delicious.  We will definitely stay here again!

Great hotel with clean spacious rooms and excellent service. We stopped at the desk before check-in and were given our parking pass. Asked about best way to get to park. Told walking...about a mile to Disneyland entrance. No shuttles. Public transportation. We walked but noticed that about a half block towards the park, there is a Disney parking lot. The next morning we asked again about best way to get to the park and were told about taking the free Disney shuttle from the parking lot. Desk staff may need training regarding that question. The free breakfast offers good variety but frankly is not very good. Scrambled eggs were strange. Would be nice to have a non-sugar yogurt, an adult granola type cereal, and filtered water but not a deal breaker. Would certainly stay again.

Great experiences on the road always start with a wonderful staff and a well kept property. The hotel has both. Great Location as well. I highly recommend this hotel for business or a Disney stay. Both groups were given the proper attention.

Summary Heading: HOMEWOOD SUITES STAY AT ANAHEIM CA
Summary: We had great stay for our Disney trip and this hotel was super convenient go get to the park with Disney bus service a half a block away at no charge. The hotel staff was supper helpful and accommodating our requests. We bought our park tickets there as well. Breakfast was decent and could find enough food to satisfy our needs to get our day started. Rooms were great and very well kept.  I would recommend this hotel would stay there again without hesitation.

Great amenities. Breakfast could use more variety. The eggs were a little too wet and the bacon was a little thin. The kitchenette is perfect for longer stays. You can purchase food and save a few bucks by eating in. All in all it's a great place to stay!

Summary Heading: Best hotel near Disneyland! Ben was awesome!
Summary: This hotel was recommended by a friend and I am so happy we stayed here! It has everything you need to make your stay comfortable and the whole facility is clean and well-kept. There is a fridge, sink, microwave, coffee maker, plates and utensils, and even a DISHWASHER! There is laundry facilities in the building as well so you dont have to pack very much. There breakfast is AMAZING!!! The whole kitchen area is large and the food is delicious. The manager, Ben, was so helpful and his staff was great. I am definitely going to stay here again!

Summary Heading: Nice & new hotel next to Disneyland
Summary: New, contemporary hotel.  Very nice hotel and lots of room.  Liked the breakfast and the complementary snacks at night.  Very close to Disneyland - 15-20 minutes walk.  They also had a convenient shuttle right next to the hotel - complementary.

Good value, particularly for a family. Good location. Had everything we needed. Enjoyed the complimentary breakfast & evening social. Clean rooms, nice layout. Nice place to relax after a long day at Disneyland.

Went with wife and 5 year old.  Rooms were tidy and well equipped with extra room suite, and kitchen.  Great breakfast and dinner time happy hour provided complimentary, which was perfect after day at parks.  Disney is 10 minute walk or 2 minute walk to Toy Story parking lot shuttle bus.  Loved pool / hot tub area which had BBQ's and projection movies playing for kids.  Great stay and would stay again.

The hotel was in a good location, close to restaurants, stores and Disneyland. The staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast and social evenings were good quality and had lots of options. The outdoor area which includes a pool, kiddie pool, hot tub, arcade, basketball court, putting green, grilling area was fantastic! The whole family enjoyed spending time in the outdoor area. The evening pool side movies were a nice extra! The room was spacious and clean. We would totally recommend this hotel to others and stay there again.

I took my son and grandson to Disneyland for my grandson's fifth birthday.    I booked the family suite so that the four/five year old could experience the bunk bed.   The room was very clean and well appointed.  Actually the two rooms and kitchenette.    The hallways were in constant need of vacuuming and the service carts were always blocking the hallways.  However, like I wrote, the rooms were clean.    There was some confusion when we checked in as to my reservation, which was odd as I had called the hotel several times prior to arrival.  It turns out my reservations had been canceled.  The reservations were reinstated and we stayed four nights.    The breakfast was plentiful and good.  The staff was constantly making sure the serving dishes were full and the area cleaned

Our family had a great stay! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Hotel was clean and looked to be recently remodeled. Our room was spacious and perfect for a family of four. We will definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Ok stay; some good some bad; nothing to write home about
Summary: Stayed here based on reviews from trip advisor and convenient location to Disneyland.  Start of stay got off on rocky foot; even though checked in online; room was not ready and  we were "upgraded" to a suite with bunk beds on the ground floor (it was just husband and me).  The front desk seemed more interested in selling us park passes and tours than checking us in.  Didn't confirm rate; stay; tell us how to get to our room; amentities of the hotel; breakfast etc.  Room was clean and seemed fine on day 1.  This changed that night as we heard banging from above; running while we tried to sleep.  We left it that night since we were exhausted; but this happened every night and morning that we were there.  I want to point out that our Hilton profile clearly says we like high
Manager Response: Dear DinaF2011,  We take great pride in the service and accommodations we provide to each and every guest, so anything short of a fantastic does not live up to the standards that we believe in. I do apologize for the issues with noise and although many find our Family Suites to be an upgrade, I do see how in your case it would not be the case. Please feel free to contact be at 714.750.2010 or email me at keith.moses@hilton.com, so I am able to further discuss and make it up for any inconveniences during your stay.

Summary: Although we visit Anaheim yearly, this was our first stay at this hotel. It did not disappoint! We had a suite- small living room with sofa bed, kitchen, and separate bedroom with 2 beds. Room was spacious and it was nice to have the kitchen option to make the occasional lunch in. The breakfast, which is included in your room rate, offered an excellent selection of both hot and cold food items. The staff there were diligent about replacing items as soon as they were emptied. My only suggestion is that they should implement some type of check that you are indeed staying there. The breakfast can get very busy but I'm almost certain on one morning that a trio walked in off the street and took advantage of the breakfast despite not being hotel guests. Monday through Thursday there

Great family vacation.   Breakfast and dinners were fun.  Wine was a bonus and all walking distance to the parks.   The rooms were comfy.  Wish the kids bunk roomwas partioned off so we had better access to the bathroom. Nice kitchen with eating area. We would highly recommend.  Did I mention the friendly staff!!!!

Summary Heading: Perfect family hotel for Disneyland trip
Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights while visiting Disneyland and CA Adventure.  We drove our car, and parked it onsite.  The parking is listed as $18 per day--but upon check-out there are taxes and fees that actually bring the total to about $21 per day to park.  The hotel is right next door to the Disney Toy Story Parking Lot that has free shuttle buses to Disneyland/CA Adventure throughout the day.  We were told to use a wheelchair accessible ramp to enter the lot, but there was a gate locked at the ramp.  So we just walked in on the sidewalk next to the street entrance to the lot.  You do not have to park in the Toy Story lot to use the buses--nobody ever questioned us if we really parked our car there.  The buses do not start running until 1 hour before the parks open--so you will

Summary Heading: First big family vacation - hotel was the best part!
Summary: This place was absolutely amazing! Our whole trip could have been just to this hotel and it would have been an excellent vacation! Christian and Britney were especially awesome! I was a beyond stressed out single mom with two tween boys and the hotel really helped take the pressure off. They hooked us up with transportation and a car rental reservation, they went shopping at the store for me when my son had an allergic reaction to the pool (he has a clorine sensitivity that I did not prepare for properly), they have a great daily breakfast and an awesome reception in the eves with free beer! The facility was super clean, cannot say enough good about this place! I chose budget because for the rate and what we got it was a fantastic deal!

I would most definitely recommend Homewood Suites. What a great stay. Rooms a large (super comfy beds) travelled with my 3  kids 18, 15, and 12 and we never felt crowded. Free full breakfast was fantastic, complementary dinner (mon-thurs) was an great added bonus. Kids loved the pool. The front desk staff were all wonderful always had an answer for all our questions, even helped us chooses a place to order dinner in one night because  it was raining so hard we didn't want to leave the hotel. About a 15 min walk to the Disneyland entrance or you can take the free shuttle from right next door at the Toy Story parking lot. Will definitely stay again if we are ever lucky enough to go back.

My husband and I took a quick trip to disney for three night and chose this hotel because of the excellent price. I believe we paid $129 a night which is an excellent deal near disney. Our room was large, clean, decorated nicely, and quiet for the most part. The complimentary breakfast looked great, however we didn't really eat there because there were a lot of un attended children basically tasting everything and then putting it back....not the hotels fault at all....parents watch your kids at buffets!...so we grabbed coffee and ate at the park. The walk to the free disney shuttle wasn't bad at all, in-fact I think it is closer walk than the paradise pier hotel we stay in on our last trip. All in all we enjoyed this hotel and will most likely stay here again. :)

Stayed for 7 nights in this newly opened hotel as a base for Disney and Universal parks. Room (1 bedroom, 5th floor north side of tower) was modern, comfortable, quiet and offered view of Disney fireworks. No issues. Price overall was very reasonable. Staff were always friendly and accommodating. Included breakfast buffet, which was always very busy but quality and selection was very good. Best part was we walked over to the Disney Parking Lot and got on the free shuttles, running every 5 minutes! Rented a car at Budget for a couple of days, conveniently just down the street. Would definitely stay again when visiting Disney Parks.

Wonderful staff!!!  Outstanding facility.  Great place to hang your hat for a few days or a few weeks!!!!   The location is ideal.  Great free breakfast, game room, pool, workout room, Jacuzzi,and much more.

Pros: one bedroom so kids can go to sleep and we can stay up. Free breakfast, coffee, dinner and evening drinks! Pool was great for kids, mini golf. Laundry room was big and clean. New clean hotel. Very close to Disneyland (walkable). Close to target and restaurants. Kitchen was great. Business room to print boarding passes.   Cons: sofa super uncomfortable to sit on. Beds were not the most comfortable, and staff is not the most friendly at times. Don't ask staff anything in little restaurant place they will forget right away or just wont bother helping if you asked for something.

Summary Heading: THE BEST hotel I've stayed at in awhile!
Summary: I stayed for 5 nights. This Homewood Suites was absolutely fantastic....in so many ways. The added value for this one.- the breakfast !!! complimentary, complete - hot and cold items made fresh daily as well as the standard staples of any complimentary breakfast.   Shout outs to Letty and Efren !  Thank you!  Complimentary coffee and hot water any time of day. Weekday complimentary dinners. In addition, the staff that keeps this gigantic area clean and comfortable are warm, inviting, patient, and happy people. So pleasant to see in the morning. Beautiful large pool area with 3 grills (which we used) a fun although small arcade room and other amenities to keep everyone from "being bored" The rooms are top of the line comfortable. Nothing overly extravagant, but clean, spacious,

My husband, sister, our two toddlers and I, Just stayed at this hotel. Our room was spacious for the 5 of us and allowed us to have our own privacy as well. The kids loved their bunk beds. And the king size bed was very comfortable. My sister which stayed on the pull out couch said it was comfortable as well. The morning breakfast was remarkable as no one would leave hungry by the variety of food each morning. Just a short walk to catch a free shuttle to Disneyland too. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. We will definitely use this hotel in the future.

Summary Heading: Great hotel for business and Disney.
Summary: Very good hotel close to the park amazing rooms for families and great staff. Movies at the pool!!  As always great breakfast and evening snacks!! Kids look forward to the hotel stay!!  The bunk beds are great and the kitchen makes it perfect.

We a family of 5 stayed for 4 nights and this was our first stay in this hotel. Hotel is located within walking distance to Disneyland which we chose to do but if you'd rather you can catch the shuttle in the Disney parking lot next to the hotel. There is a PF Changs, Cheesecake Factory, Bubba Gump, and several other restaurants within walking distance (5-10 min) or you can drive if your are lazy or out of shape :-).  Our room was a studio room with two queen beds and a pullout couch. Fit our family of 5 nicely. There is a full size fridge, dishes, cutting board, toaster, and basic kitchen stuff which was great and came in handy. The room had a ceiling fan which was a nice feature. The room felt really large and spacious.  We went to breakfast each morning and it was the best

Love this place. It felt like home away from home. Staff was so friendly and helpful. My second time I have been here. Definitely would go back and also recommend this place to family & friends. Just love this place.

This was my first time staying at this location. My family and I come about once a year. We usually stay in a larger hotel in the area, but decided to try the Homewood Suites this year.   We arrived and the valet was super friendly and pleasant. Our room was nice a clean and spacious. I love having the suiteand being able to have 2 rooms when needed!  We definitely took advantage of the free breakfast and the nice thing was they changed the theme daily and the food was fresh and delicious. Our first day was breakfast burritos with beans and rice with the usual breakfast items. Another day it was breakfast croissant and you could make your own sandwich. All the food was so hearty and delicious (this is not true of all hotels) So we were so happy!  We missed the evening reception

We are Hilton Honors members but this is the first time we have stayed at this particular property.  It was outstanding from start to finish. We were there on business so the evening glass of wine/beer offered to us was a real plus.  The hotel is exceptionally clean and well maintained.

This hotel provided us with everything that we required and more: short walk to convention center, comfortable bed, great wifi connection, full-sized refrigerator and cooktop with all needed utensils, space to spread out, laundry facilities, a large hot tub, huge shower, friendly employees, ample parking (important during conventions), free daily breakfasts and happy hour and evening meal during weekdays. This is the second Homewood Suites that we've stayed in and we are absolutely sold on this Hilton chain.

Once again our experience of the Homewood Suites chain was a positive one.  This particular hotel is located about 1.5km from the main walking entrance to Disneyland, just a couple of hundred meters down from the Disneyland Parking Lot (in fact the back of the hotel overlooks the car park).  Rooms were clean and well appointed and the swimming pool area provided much entertainment for the children.  Helpfully towels were laid out on all pool chairs, as well as in containers, making accessing them easy for children who insist on getting in and out of the pool.  Breakfast was generally very crowded with all tables occupied, but one usually came free reasonably quickly.  The food was plentiful with lots of options for fussy eaters.  We also ate at one of the complementary snacks

The hotel rooms and facilities were exceptionally clean with attention to detail. The front desk staff was very friendly, helpful, and accommodating as was the staff at the buffet. The sitting area in the lobby was warm and relaxing. We also enjoyed the outdoor facilities (e.g., grill, fire pit) which was perfect for a cookout we had with friends. The beds were comfortable which made for a restful, refreshing experience. We will be back next year!

We had planned to run in the half marathon, enjoy Disney with friends, and not spend a fortune in accommodations. This was the place. It was walking distance to Disney, several restaurants , Disney parking lot if you didn't want to walk. The hotel was immaculate and food was terrific and included.

Being a passholder to Disney, we travel to the area a lot. We have stayed at many properties in area, this hotel by far is a primo stay. The kitchen allowed for flexibility in eating in & snacks at anytime for the grandkids. Loved our stay, will be returning!!

When we arrived early morning we were greeted by friendly staff. We were allowed early check in, which was great. The overall appearance of hotel was excellent and breakfast and evening social were both great. The room was spacious and inviting. The kitchenette was fully equipped with everything you would need to cook. We returned to clean room. Housekeeping was great. This will be our go to hotel when ever we visit the Anaheim area. I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone.

A wonderful staff was very helpful. The breakfast everyday had more than enough to satisfy everyone in our family. There was food M-Thurs evening with free beer, wine, coffee, etc. Sample menu: Game night had salad bar, hot dogs, bratwurst, vegetable soup, cold cuts, potato salad, dessert, and more. An easy one block walk brings you to the Disney Parking lot where you can take a shuttle bus to the park.  Negative: You had to pay for parking. Extra: You can watch the Disney fireworks from the windows at the end of the hall.

We were there for a Friday convention, and a Thursday Disneyland. We arrived Th morning and were invited to their buffet breakfast, (fantastic), then held our bags so we could spend 11 hours at Disney. A Disney parking lot is just next door, and has a free shuttle to the park. Late that night, our room was clean and ready, and comfortable. Next morning we had another great breakfast, (different, & just as great), they graciously held our bags again so we could walk across the street to the Convention Center. After the convention, they were very accommodating to let us hang out in the lobby by the fireplace until our Uber arrived for the short trip back to the airport.  Christian was especially courteous and helpful throughout our stay.

Well managed with friendly and helpful staff, this hotel far exceeded our expectations. Extremely well located near Disney with great premium options for families.  Kids loved the arcade!  A great value!

The service at this hotel was the best we had during this visit to the USA. The staff at this hotel are so friendly, and the rooms are clean and well kept. The added bonus of breakfast and also light refreshments, including wine between 5-7pm was a lovely surprise. Everything is catered for at this hotel, and nothing is too much trouble for the staff. Would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Nice play to stay with the family!
Summary: Stayed here for a long weekend outing with the family at Disneyland.   Pros: - less than a mile from Disneyland so it is walkable - pretty good gym - treadmills, elliptical, bikes, free weights - good breakfast buffet - clean, new rooms  - pool, basketball court, putting green  Cons: - crowded at breakfast buffet - service was slow at times, called down to the front desk a couple of times and was put on hold for a while.  Also took a while to check out due to busy front desk.  Overall, good hotel for the value.  Good alternative to a Disney hotel because of the costs.

Recently stayed for 7 nights here. Great spacious room, comfortable beds. The hot breakfast every morning was great. The people who worked the front desk were so helpful in finding us shuttles and for any information we wanted. There was always coffee downstairs in the lobby. A 2 minute walk  to toy story parking lot to get the shuttle to Disneyland or a 15 minute walk to Disney gates. We had a kitchenette in our room which we didn't get a chance to use. There is a pool and hot tub and a fire pit. Thank you for making our trip great.

Summary Heading: Very good choice for families going to Disney.
Summary: This is a very good hotel for families going to Disney.  The rooms are spacious and comfortable.  The complimentary breakfast is perfect for a wide range of tastes.  The staff was mostly very accommodating.  The shuttle to the Disney resort is a 5 minute walk.  However, we did have some issues with housekeeping.  On our second day, the room was refreshed but we were left with one bath towel....  for 2 adults and a toddler.  We called the front desk and requested a set of towels.  They said they would send some towels up but they never arrived.  Calling Housekeeping directly finally did the trick.

Summary Heading: Awesome hotel for families going to Disney
Summary: I stay in a couple of dozen hotels per year and found this one to be the best I've stayed at in a long time, particularly when considering the value for the money.  This hotel is ideal for visitors at Disneyland, since there are local buses AND free Disney shuttles that stop across the street.  It's also really nice for families on a budget that they have good-quality free breakfasts, and free dinners on weekdays.  The kids particularly enjoyed the pool, hot tub, and water jet fountain.  I was a big fan of the room layout (family suite), which allowed for plenty of space and even some privacy for a family of 6.  We didn't take advantage of the room kitchen, but that could be a huge plus to those who want to prepare their own meals.

This is my third time staying at this property.  Each time has been better. The family loved it and the room was excellent.  The triple bunk beds really helped and the room size was good for a large family.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay if working in the Amherst area
Summary: stayed at this hotel recently and it was very nice, condition was like new, rooms are all suites and spacious, great breakfast and complimentary dinner on Monday, coffee and tea are always available in the lobby and you have the ability to make food in your room as well.  Close proximity to the Convention center where I had meetings, blocks from Disney (15 minute walk). really nice pool and hot tub, with fire pits if you just feel like chillin at night.

We recently stayed for 5 very enjoyable nights at Homewood Suites. Extremely happy from beginning to end. We arrived early after a long flight and were greated warmly plus granted an early check in (phew)! Rooms are great - big, clean and spacious. We are a family of four and were very comfortable. Given the amount of choice in the area around Disneyland, we were keen to make the right choice to kick off our Californian hoiliday and this hotel did not diisappoint, A short walk to the Toy Story parking lot to catch the free shuttle bus to the front gates of Disneyland (5-10 mins ride). The breakfast was staisfying, the coffee was plentiful and the evening social was very appreciated after long days of theme park fun. Thank you for strating off our trip so wonderfully - we would

Excellent stay. Victoria and Christian at the front desk were super helpful!! Very clean and well kept rooms. Breakfast and dinners were well done with lots of options. We'd definitely stay here again!

Homewood Suites is the only place to stay. There is no other option as far as we are concerned. This hotel delivers everything and more. The price point is great and the quality of the service it top notch. Check it out before you stay anywhere else!

Summary Heading: Homewood Suites Great Place to Stay
Summary: We stayed at this hotel one night before checking in to the Disney's Grand Californian. In comparing rooms, the rooms at this hotel were nicer than the room at Disney's Grand. At 1/4 of the cost. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The complimentary evening social and morning breakfast are a real plus.

There is a reason this hotel is ranked #1 in Anaheim and we had the pleasure of experiencing this for ourselves.  From the moment we checked in the reception area with the Christmas tree and the staff who couldn't do enough for us we felt that we made the right choice, before we had even seen the room.  We stayed 11 nights and wish that we had spent the rest of our holiday here.  The kids LOVED the elf on the shelf game and we collected a fair few rubber ducks and it was one of the highlights of the evening when we came back to the hotel from Disneyland. The story time after dinner was also a very lovely touch. The meals were good and whilst busy we never felt rushed for our table.  The evening meals were an added bonus as we didn't have to think about what to do for dinner.  We

The hotel was very nice and a great location. The front desk staff were all amazing especially when we checked in on Jan 1st. They went out of their way to accommodate us and get a room with two beds. Thank you so much for that

Best hotel to stay at if going to Disneyland and don't want to pay the high prices of the Disneyland resorts!  The hotel is right next door to the disneyland parking lot so all you have to do is walk to the parking lot and catch a tram to Disneyland.  So convenient and in fact faster than staying at the Disneyland hotel and taking the monorail.  The hotel lobby is great and the staff are so friendly and helpful.  I was very impressed with their free breakfast since most hotel only offer limited items but Homewood Suites offered full hot and cold breakfast.  Great perk!  They have a laundry room and a fitness room too.  My only gripe is that they forgot to clean our room one day.  I highly recommend this hotel!

Enjoyed this hotel it was perfect for our needs. A short walk to Disneyland. New and clean. Good buffet breakfast and dinner. One of the best hotels near Disneyland. Good choice for families. No complaints or suggestions.

Stayed here for 7 nights when we visited Los Angeles.  It is fairly new and was a fantastic hotel for the week we were there.  Room was fantastic and clean with no issues with any insects.  Nice to have the kitchen too.  Close to many restaurants, shopping and best of all, only 15 minutes walk from Disneyland.  Front desk staff was very friendly and very flexible.  We were originally booked in for 8 nights, but our flight was changed to a really early time at LAX.  We were able to cancel our final night with no issues or penalty which I appreciated.  Complimentary breakfast was good but very busy, especially after 8:30am.  We didn't check out the complimentary dinner but it looked good.  Pool area and sports court was great.  Movies and arcade provided for the kids.  Definitely

We have had the pleasure of staying at this Homewood Suites several times and every time we return the service is exemplary.  Our most recent stay was just my children and I as my husband is currently deployed. Unsure about spending the holidays at a Hotel, I was worried before our visit. The staff at Homewood suites greeted us with such hospitality and made every effort to make our stay very enjoyable. The housekeeping team was superior and very kind meeting each and every need we had.  Stephanie, Antonio, Christian, Victoria, Bruce and  many more went above and beyond for our family and made our stay memorable.  We will definitely be back and appreciate the team at Homewood Suite Anaheim - Convention Center.  I would recommend anyone visiting Disneyland or in the Anaheim area

Summary Heading: Great Location for Family Disney Trip
Summary: Took the family to Disneyland for New Year's week end.  Chose this hotel as recommended from a friend.  It was a great experience.   Not exactly walking distance (although did walk the mile once), but it is right next door to the Disney shuttle bus and parking lot.  Suite environment available and we were able to sleep 5 comfortablely.  Hotel staff was wonderful and so helpful.

This hotel had it all! A full breakfast, coffee and tea all the time, and dinner served Mon-Thu. Pool and hot tub were great for taking a break from Disneyland. They also had put put golf and a movie playing outside in the evening. The rooms were suites with full kitchen, sitting room and bedroom. We never really had to use our kitchen because they provided so many meals there at the hotel. It was about a 10 minute walk to Disneyland and if you walk right next door, you can catch the shuttles that were running all day.

Summary Heading: Comfort close to Disneyland! True Park and Ride!
Summary: My husband always stays at a Homewood Suites when he travels, and Iusually book Embassy so we  agreed to stay here.  I like the hotel room we got. It had a King bed and bunk beds with trundle. I have pictures below. I REALLY loved the room.  Some changes I would make are some coat hooks by the door for light jackets. I would have rather had another bathroom than a full kitchen, but it is how they are laid out.  The room was always clean an no surprises. We had a nice patio-had it been a warmer time of year I think we really would have utilized that.  Our room was on the first floor and close to all things. We find getting to use a bathroom down the hall is better when you have a #2 and a full room of guests. Out our patio is a basketball court and I would recommend to Hilton to

Wow!!  What a great place to stay when visiting Disneyland.  The hotel rooms were oversized, we had the family room with the bunk beds...great option for our kids.  Large room with seperate livgroom area so we could watch tv while the kids slept.   The staff was incredibly friendly and went above and beyond expectations from check-in to breakfast dining and manager reception times.  The hotel manager was super friendly and provided me with strawberries in the afternoon since I missed out at breakfast that morning.  Brought them to me poolside !!!  Awesome touch of class.  Pool was great and staff had towels supplied at all times.  If they ran out you were brought fresh warm towels.  Nice touch again.    Will return with my family again.

We stayed for 3 nights recently and the Homewood Suites definitely exceeded our expectations! Room was clean, comfortable. The daily breakfast was a hit (lots of choices: eggs, potatoes, sausage, pancakes/waffles, fruit, yogurt, oatmeal, cereal,etc). I liked the 24-hour coffee station. We also enjoyed the evening social- the food was very good (we had chicken&veggie stir fry, rice, bread and wine). It's worth coming back from the parks at 5 to enjoy a bite to eat and a drink, and take a rest in your room before going back out.  The biggest pro about this place is the excellent staff and service. All staff were professional and friendly. After check out our car wouldn't start and Ben Ly and Robert R were kind enough to help us troubleshoot the problem and give us a jump. A nice

Summary Heading: A truly fabulous place to stay
Summary: The location to Disneyland & restaurants was fabulous. It is hard to find a room that accommodates a family of 5 and Homemade King Suite delivered. Breakfasts and social hours were great. Being able to bar b que our supper allowed us to bring family traditions with us. Would stay here again and recommend it to everyone.

We stayed at this new Homewood Suite while visiting Disneyland in November. It was a great home base for a few days. The breakfasts were crowded but plentiful and the staff was always working hard to make sure everyone got enough food quickly. The pool and spa were lovely especially after a long day at the parks. We used them both. Our kids used the miniature golf as well as the game room a bit and I heard no complaints from them about anything. We had a few meals in the mini-kitchen and that saved us some money from eating out. The Disneyland parking lot shuttle picks up just next door to the Homewood so that was super convenient if we didn't want to walk a mile to the gates. The suites were spacious and we had plenty of room for our whole family. My only complaint would be the

Loved it! Great service from all of their staff. Check in was seamless . Upgraded us to Disney View suite without asking. Walked next door to grab free shuttle to the parks. Parking $18 per day. Free breakfast. Perfect quick stay with my kids.

The rooms were very clean and the amenities were good. My only complaint is that the walls are paper thin and you can hear everyone all the time. If you are close to the basketball court, you can hear basketball playing all night long or at least until you call and complain at 10 PM. The breakfast and dinner were a plus, and the walk to the park was a breeze. Even with my elderly parents. If you plan on going to bed early, you better hope that they are not playing basketball. I am not sure why the hotel would put a basketball court in the middle of a courtyard that amplifies the sound. If they got rid of it, it would be a plus! I am not sure that I will be back, I will look for something without a basketball court.
Manager Response: Hello Jonnybravo1207,  Thank you for the feedback. We will try to do whatever we can to improve in regards to the noise concerns that you mentioned. We greatly appreciate you taking special note of our breakfast/ dinner, and would love to accommodate you next time you are in town.

Summary: The hotel was excellent!  The staff couldn't have been nicer.  When we checked in, we asked if any bunk bed rooms were available, expecting to be told that we would have to pay more for the room.  However, the young lady at the desk said "we have one room left, it will be a much better fit for your famliy".  The bunk beds were great- my three kids loved it!  The breakfast was great, especially for the price!  The rooms are extremely clean and the outdoor space was great.  It was cold, but my kids still loved the heated pool.  The Disney Toy Story parking is right next door- just walk over and hop on the shuttle.  Could not have been more convenient.      Overall, it was an excellent trip, and I would recommend it to anyone.  Will stay again in the future.

We are a family of 6 and stayed 7 nights in December around Christmas time, in the king bunk bed room.  Good breakfast and evening social which we took advantage of twice during our stay. The kids liked the basketball court. Laundry facility was very handy.  Room service was very sloppy on the final night we were there, didnt make some of the beds - maybe the bunk bed was too hard to make up, and didnt empty the trash some days. We did leave tips which they took, and we generally left the place tidy before heading out for the day so it was disappointing to see the sloppy housekeeping. One of the worse we had seen from our travels (our third time in the usa and have visited other countries in Europe and Asia).   We also checked in online and chose a room (the system allowed a

By far the best hotel we have ever stayed in! The rooms are super clean, staff is friendly, food (both morning and evening) is exceptional, transportation service kind & quick, and affordably priced! Perfect for families!!

We were very pleased with our Homewood Suites stay. The staff was very polite and they have a good buffet breakfast. The rooms have a full kitchen and It's a very short walk to the "Woody" parking lot, where you can catch the Disney bus that takes you to the entrance.    I would recommend it highly.

Me and my family decided to switch it up from our regular hotel choice during our most recent Disneyland trip- nothing was wrong with our previous hotel of choice but we were offered the Homewood suites as part of a package deal so we decided to give it a try.  Very impressed. So first day we arrived quite early for normal check in but the staff was very courteous and gave us access to the pool and stored our luggage while we waited- within 30/40 mins our room was ready.   So that brings us to the room,I believed it was called s double queen suite- for two adults and two children (9&11). The room is perfect for this size of family or even bigger. Efficient kitchen space, desk/work space (perfect for me to catch up on emails) good size bathroom and enough bed/ sleeping options

Hotel right next to Disney parking and bus to Disneyland. Hotel clean. $16 for parking cannot be waived even for gold or diamond members per night. Free breakfast 630 to 930 am is actually quite good. Hotel is actually less than one mile from Disneyland if you do not care for the bus. I guess the $16 is less than the $18 Disney parking.

This hotel was very nice. The main pool, kiddie pool, hot tub, game room, basketball court, putting green, fire pit, and exercise room were plenty for our family to do.  We found the guest laundry room to be very convenient and so was the coffee/cocoa bar in the lobby.  Parking at the hotel comes with a fee but not too bad.  You may buy tickets to Disney Land at the hotel front desk. As for our room, we had a two queen bed suite. We travel a lot and this room is as one of my all time favorites!  We were in room 552 and it was so very quiet, clean, and very spacious!!  We had a full kitchen, desk area, living room area with plenty of seating and the sofa became a third bed if needed.  Our beds were very comfortable and the bathroom had wonderful lighting with a glass shower.  We

This was a great hotel. Clean, friendly staff.  The complimentary breakfast was great 7 days a week and the evening social was beyond what we expected but it is only M-TH.  Still, saved us money on meals that's for sure.   The other nice thing was that there is a free shuttle to Disneyland next door which was just a short walk so that was nice especially for families with young children!

Summary Heading: A great place to stay with your family
Summary: We spent four nights at this great hotel.  The staff went out of their way to help us, even rushing a clean up of a room for us as we arrived early and exhausted after our long flight from Australia.  It is a great hotel for families and the family suite was perfect for our family of five.  The breakfasts are great and very filling and the guest laundry was great to have on sight as was the kitchen in our room.  The Disneyland ToyStory carpark is right next door so you can jump on the free shuttle to get to Disneyland or is is just a short 10 minute walk down Harbour Blvd.

Awesome place to stay, great value for price and superb complimentary benefits. We stayed for 6 nights and enjoyed the facilities greatly. The staff was very friendly and the place is neat and clean and newly constructed. Very close to all the Disneyland activities which is anot added help.

The stay was great, services were good too. The buffet breakfast was wonderful. The breakfast items were different everyday during our stay (7 days) and i think they do make an effort to change the items everyday which in my opinion is something that we appreciate. It is near to Anaheim Convention Center and is about a 30 minutes walk to Disneyland. Will recommend to my friends if they are visiting Disneyland at Anaheim. Thank you Britney and colleagues for the help for my  early check-in after a long flight.

Was there with my family for a few days visiting Disneyland. This is an amazing hotel. The service is great and the parking facility is awesome. The hotel has great facilities such as a nice hot pool, a basket ball court, pool, gym and a nice place to sit and watch movies with the little ones.  The hotel even offered us a nice hot  breakfast and dinner which was just perfect. It's not a huge spread but just perfect after a long day at the park. Highly recommended

Next to a great shuttle lot straight to Disney!  Amazing breakfast and evening food!!!  Great secure parking for a small fee...Well worth it!  We had a wheelchair accessible room with a separate sitting room and kitchen that was well equipped!!

We stayed at this hotel for 4 weeks, we had a 2 queen bed room , which was great for my family of 4, with a lot of space, kitchen, shower, walk in rode, with a safe in it, all the amenities you'll need to make up the sofa bed. A hairdryer, plates and cutlery, cooking utensils. The hotel offered free breakfast every morning, it was great, waffles, pancakes, fresh fruit, muffins, bread, muffins, sausages, bacon, scrabble eggs, hash browns, potatoes.  Potatoes skins, cereals , milk, apple & orange juice, mocha latte, teas, coffee, hot chocolate, etc....everyday it was different. Mon -Thursday they offer light supper, but it was great every night was a different, one night it might be Asian night, next be sliders (chicken/Beef) , Salads, soups, taco nights, they also offered beer

Not very often I give a 5 rating, but it is deserved.  Used points for this stay. We had 2 rooms for 5 days, which were identical except one had two beds and one had a king.  There is a sofa sleeper if you need. Traveling with spouse and 17,18, and 19 age girls. The staff make the place, very professional and helpful when needed. The gym is one of best in my hotel stays anywhere, it looks new and hope they keep it up.   The rooms were clean, had a ceiling fan in the bedroom.  Beds were sorta away from the front door, it was like a bedroom with a door you could shut off from the main area so it was a tad quieter if needed. We didn't use the kitchen area, but there is a full fridge, microwave, two burner stove top and dishwasher.  Functional if you need it.  You can walk to the

Summary Heading: Hate to tell you about this place!
Summary: Best hotel experience in Anaheim ever!!!  My family of 5 drove down from Salt Lake City for our annual Disney vacation.  There is a parking fee here: 16$ per night.  Rooms are a bit smaller than expected but are good size and excellent layout.  We had the One bedroom suite with separate door to sitting area and kitchen and pullout sofa. Pullout was good enough for kids, but don't recommend adults.  Rooms are well lit, clean, and comfortable.  This room sleeps up to 6.  There are also bunk bed rooms and smaller studios.  Each I believe have full kitchens. Very comfortable and quiet rooms.  Breakfast: is ever-changing and very good.  Potatoes of some sort every morning, yum, Meats, French toast sticks, waffle makers, fruit, juices, milk, eggs toast, cereal.  You name it!

Summary Heading: 12 times Hhonors points for purchasing Disney tickets for Hhonors Diamonds.
Summary: First off, Thank you Homewood Suites!  Wonderful staff !  Wonderful stay !  I'll be back with the family.   If you are Hhonors Diamond using HHONORS AMERICAN EXPRESS, you can buy Disney Tickets at the Homewood Suites Anaheim and earn 12 times points for the Disney ticket purchase ! Incredible deal !  My purchase of Disney tickets on AmEx at the hotel essentially earned enough points to cover the cost of the room for one of our nights. Wow.   In addition, loved the "self-serve beer taps" at the evening reception.  Thank you Homewood Suites!  Thank you Hhonors. Thank you American Express.

What  a great hotel!  Just blocks from the main gates to Disneyland, clean, with wonderful service. Breakfast and dinner options are available as well. We travel to Disneyland a few times a year and this hotel will be our first choice on future visits.

On vacation with my 13 year old niece who unfortunately was sick on our third day. The staff were so kind and attentive. They brought us a delivery of sprite, water, pepto, and a signed get well card with encouraging words! We ended up in the Children's Hospital in the ER so it was so kind to receive such a special gift when we returned!! We are from KS and it was such a great feeling to be carded for so far from home! The service staff went above and beyond in cleaning our room for us!!! Thank you all!!

This hotel has everything your family will need close to Disneyland and the access to the convention ctr. buses over to Disneyland is free to ride buses and is a short walk.this hotel will not disappoint the complimentary brkft and eve dinner svs is excellent and healthy meals. the pool and arcade is excellent for kids. the rooms are big and kitchen area and reg. size frig. is the best. the staff are sooo nice!!!- Martinez family.

Summary Heading: A nice stay at a comfortable hotel
Summary: A two night stay at the Homewood suites for a quick trip to Disneyland in Anaheim. Hotel was everything you need for a quiet and comfortable nights sleep. Staff was friendly and helpful, room was clean, bed comfortable, and a/c was working nicely. Complementary water upon arrival. If you trying to sleep in, Guest can get noises in the morning with all the kids heading to Disney and bouncing off the walls. Not a deal breaker though. Enjoyed my stay here.

Service and quality were impeccable. I would absolutely stay with Homewood again. You an walk 3 blocks to the park or take the complimentary shuttle from Disney parking right next door on The Toy Story line. Breakfast was nice to have for long days at the park and there was a nice variety of hot and cold foods.

Perfect for big families...there are 8 of us and the bunk suite was perfect! The breakfast and dinner while maybe not the best were more than adaquet in filling you up (and saving a ton of money!) Proximity to Disney and Disney shuttle was great. Will be our go to hotel from now on.

Wow, what a great experience! Location - excellent! The staff told us about just walking next door to the Toy Story parking lot to get the free shuttle to Disneyland, which saved us a heap of money. The hotel itself - clean, spacious. Love love love the free breakfasts and night time dinner reception, they are both huge money savers. The rooms - awesome. So spacious and have every single thing you need and more. Beds and pillows lovely. Staff very friendly and accommodating. And the fresh baked cookies .. mmmm. I'd like to give a very big shout out to Kristi on the front desk for being so helpful and arranging a very late checkout for us so we could pack and shower before our 14 hour flight home to Australia, it was so very much appreciated. Thank you Kristi! We will definitely

Very clean and friendly hotel and staff. The complimentary breakfast was wonderful. The hotel has secured parking and it is close to Disneyland. There are nice restaurants nearby and easy access to the freeway. I would reccommend this to anyone. The family suit with bunk bed worked out great.

Excellent  stay the crew the hotel done great job  we enjoyed  and will be back again thanks. We walked to Disneyland and the breakfast is real good. The room was clean and nice  view to pool we need pay for parking but is ok we need pay for parking  every where.We enjoyed  our  stay  thanks.

Summary Heading: Great place when traveling with a family
Summary: This place has it all! Clean & Spacious. located nearby Disneyland. I loved the free breakfast & light dinner.  We had a 1 bedroom w/ 2 queen beds & kitchen. We felt like we were at home.. We will be back!!

All the staff were exceptional for our family stay. Great location. Quick free bus ride to Disneyland. Breakfast included every day was good as well. Good value for money for a family stay in Anaheim resort. Full size fridge in the kitchenette was the best.

Great staff and facilities. Rooms are spacious and impeccably clean.  Breakfast lacks fruit but the evening meal is ample. Lovely place, close enough to walk or take a free shuttle to Disney. Excellent!  Thank you to the lovely staff there. Wonderful people w great customer service, each and every one!

Great location and wonderful staff. They made our stay special! The breakfast and evening social hour made it great for families and small children. The selection was varied and something for everyone.

Summary Heading: Our Home away from Home - Excellent Stay!
Summary: This hotel has it all - Fantastic Staff, Quality Suites, Delicious Food, Luxurious Hotel, Pool, Rooms, and Amenities! My family and I were on an extensive stay at this hotel for weeks, and we enjoyed it everyday! The hotel is clean, our room was luxurious and comfortable. The pool, hot tub, community bbq, outdoor fireplace, mini golf, basketball, and game room were all excellent amenities! Gourmet breakfast buffet everyday and dinner on weeknights including beer and wine! Disneyland is only minutes from this hotel ... and for families on a budget this hotel is perfect especially considering the savings $$$ with breakfast and dinner! But beyond everything else I cannot say enough great things about the staff ... outstanding customer service, very well trained, always smiling and

We stayed here 2 nights on a thurs and fri night. My husband, daughter, and I had a room w 2 full beds. I won't repeat what others below have said, but I will add a few details.  Park your car there $16 a night and walk next door to catch the woody parking lot shuttle for Disney. The breakfast is the best variety and quality food I've had at a hotel! The staff was very attentive with wiping down tables and bringing out more food etc.  this hotel does have a lot of families staying there, so I recommend requesting the top floor (5th). We did have to listen to kids running down the halls, but that's not the hotels fault that's the parents!  The rooms were stocked with plenty of towels, but one suggestion if you might have 2-6 people in a room more than 1 bottle of shampoo and

Summary Heading: Staff needs better customer service training
Summary: Staff were not very welcoming. They were giggling and laughing obnoxiously at the front desk. Check-in was hurried. No explanation on what to expect. Parking is horrible, it was full and spaces are too tight.
Manager Response: Hello Heidi B,  Thank you for your detailed feedback. We sincerely apologize for the customer service that you experienced. Please feel free to contact me directly anytime you are coming back to Anaheim. We would love to make it up to you. (714)705-0531.  Best regards,  Mark Morihiro

Summary: Disneyland family trip 2016 was amazing and the hotel was very convenient and great price. The hotel has delicious breakfast and is very close to Disneyland entrance walking distance but also offers a shuttled

Free breakfasts, free evening cocktails (Mon to Thur), great location, great pricing, self sufficient apartments  - checked the box for a 6 nights stay for me.  Would be better if they had not charged parking.

Great location, nice rooms, staff is awesome! We love the free full breakfast and evening social hour after a long day at Disneyland! Located right next to Disney Toy Story Parking Lot, just hop on the shuttle, no need to pay for Disneyland parking!

Great hotel, close to Disney, and right next door to a Disney parking lot where you can use their buses to take you to Disney for free.  Breakfast is also free at the hotel and has many quality items to choose from.

A home away from home. Rooms are big enough for a family. ( especially if you have teenagers.) Breakfast was great. Different selections and the staff kept the food coming. Parking for Disneyland is right behind it. Can't go wrong.

This hotel is right next door to the Disney Toy Story Buzz Lightyear parking lot. Walk next door and get on the free bus and you are at Disney in a few minutes. The Disney gates are only a short walk as well if you prefer. The hotel had a free breakfast buffet with multiple options for all ages. It gets pretty busy from 8:30a-9:30a and it closes at 9:30a so be sure to get there early as things start to run out towards the end. Great service from all staff we encountered there. The parking lot seems to get pretty full quickly, but they had free valet service on the weekdays we were there. The rooms were nicely appointed with a large fridge/freezer, microwave, 2 burner stove, sink, dishes, and dishwasher. Great for a family stay while visiting Disney and the surrounding area. We

The staff was very friendly and informative. The rooms have a fridge, microwave, sink and very spacious. They even have a dimmer and a fan above the bed. Did I mention they served dinner and breakfast ? Not just a lousy continental breakfast but a FULL Breakfast!! I'm talkin eggs, sausage, home fried potatoes, french toast, waffles, coffee, juice and hot chocolate. Right next to shuttle service for Disneyland.. If you walk next door to Toy story parking they have free shuttles to Disney all day!! Keep that on the down low.  Great Hotel !!

Their parking lot shares a wall with the toy story parking lot (a 5 minute walk to the Disney trams there to take you to the park.) Free breakfast and very spacious rooms. Worth EVERY penny for a Disney trip. Also, close enough for a anaheim convention center stay.  Next time we will skip the car rental, given the proximity to everything- not needed.

This hotel is perfect. Right next to toy story parking lot. The staff was very nice and helpful. They offer "dinner" m-th at no additional cost. It was more than enough food plus beer or wine. The breakfast was really good and had a lot of variety to choose from. We stayed on the 5th floor so it was very quiet. Definitely would stay here again.

To be completely candid, if I was sans kid or kids and stayed here, I would be terrified.  The beautiful property is swarming with families.  That being said, we were there for a family trip to Disneyland for our daughter's third birthday.  While searching for a property within walking distance, Homewood Suites by Hilton popped up as having a full kitchen and bunk beds available for a very reasonable price.  The expedite the process, my wife called and the amazing customer service we received from Hilton had us booking the room in no time!  Their was plenty of room for all of our guests and it was great to be able to have the option to come back to our room and prepare meals in the fully stocked kitchen.  A full breakfast is included which is a huge perk.  WARNING:  the

Summary Heading: Solid choice other than breakfast staff
Summary: Brand new property in great condition. Super clean room and lobby, very friendly staff. Great location next to the disneyland toy story parking lot and across the street from the convention center area.   - I was surprised that I was not upgraded to a nicer room as a Diamond Member. But the hotel was very busy the week I visited so that was understandable and I got a great rate.   I took one point off the review for the total lack of a good breakfast. Each morning I arrived between 9 and 9:30 to find almost no food left and breakfast staff busy cleaning up and closing down rather than restocking. If the breakfast is advertised till 9:30, it should be fully stocked until 9:30. Especially at such a busy tourist oriented property.  This is not a complaint to the breakfast staff,

Summary Heading: Great stay for the Majic Kingdom
Summary: The room was clean and spacious and the staff was friendly. This is a short walk to the parking lot of Disneyland where you can hop on the bus for the front gate. Park at t he hotel during your stay for only $15.00.

Came here with my son on Monday 11/28 to stay for a day and wow this place is awsome! Was greeted by a man named Benjamin who was very nice and professional when booking my room. Place was steps away from Disneyland which is a plus. They have a cool arcade room for the kids as we as movies playing in the pool area at night. Dinner was delicious as well as breakfast. If your looking for nice atmosphere with great staff I recommend u stay at the homewood suites! I give it 2thumbs up !

Summary Heading: Outstanding hotel, highly recommended near Disneyland
Summary: Our family of 18 travelled to Anaheim from BC and Alberta, arriving at different times to the Homewood Suites Convention Centre, taking 5 QQ suites.  All of us were treated with a friendly smile, and great hospitality from the front reception.  During our 8 day stay, we were always treated with a greeting and a smile.  Victoria and Antonio always remembered our names, even with a large hotel, and were always there with knowledgeable area information and suggestions. The 7 days of breakfast, of fresh waffles, sausages, bacon, scrambled eggs, yogurts, all the juices you want.  The staff in this section of the hotel, were always pleasant, and were there to clean your tables off, and even offered to get you coffee.  Simply outstanding kitchen staff. The 4 dinners were enjoyed by the

We are Disneyland season pass holders and wanted a place to stay close by that wouldn't break the bank. We really like the evening social which we didn't find at any other hotel. Free wine and beer? Where are you going to find that? Our room was comfortable and had a full kitchen. We even requested some water and iced tea that was delivered to our room for free.

Right by the convention center and Disney. The hotel has spacious and comfortable rooms. The complimentary breakfast has everything. It's one of the biggest and best that I've seen.  I would stay again.

Summary Heading: Great hotel with great location and staff
Summary: We stayed here after having stayed at Disneyland properties the last two times and would stay here again. The rooms are quiet and well appointed. You can walk over to the Toy Story parking lot and catch a free bus to the parks. Staff was super friendly at the front desk and always welcomed us back.

Summary Heading: Great hotel near The convention center and Disney
Summary: My girlfriend and I stayed here for a convention. It is about a 5-8 minute walk to the center (easy and safe). The hotel has an interesting mix of business people and families for Disney. I wouldn't recommend the walk to Disney though, an Uber / taxi would be preferable. The rooms were ample, clean, and nice. The pool area was clean and very nice as well. The staff was overly accommodating, they are rock stars!!

I never review experiences or purchases (who has the time??), but this particular hotel experience was over the top. We do a lot of traveling and, like most people, value comfort, professionalism, convenience and value. For this trip to Disnelyland, we booked 2 rooms at Homewood Suites (one for me and 2 kiddos, one for the grandparents).  I chose Homewood because I was able to use points from our HHilton Honors and Southwest Airlines Rapid Rewards programs.      First, the staff is unbeatable.  Friendly, warm, accommodating, helpful and genuinely seem to enjoy their work and take pride in the hotel.  From front desk personnel, to cleaning staff, to dining room attendants.....not one sour person in the group.  Second, the accommodations were lovely.  We had a family suite that

From check in to check out, the experience was wounderful.  Nice staff and great full breakfasts and social hours!  Enjoyed the fire pit outside by the pool.  Very close proximity to fine restaurants and Disney attractions.

Summary Heading: Brand new with a terrific staff.
Summary: There are many places to stay near Disneyland. I've stayed at a lot of them, and currently, this is my top choice. The property is very clean, quiet, and brand new. It's a 15-20 minute walk through a nice neighborhood to get to the Disneyland Main Gate, and there's a free Disneyland shuttle that leaves from the parking lot one block away. Breakfast is reasonably good and varied, and there's also a nightly light dinner that we didn't try.  Working in this kind of busy tourist area can take its toll, so I was especially impressed by the young, energized staff. From the minute we arrived, tired from a long day of travel, Antonio and Christian at the front desk took care of us like we were old friends. They picked out the perfect room, gave us a map with nearby restaurants, and most

i booked 5 rooms for a project I was doing in San Diego and found this hotel. This hotel is so nice and very comfortable, grounds are beautiful, and the beds are absolutely perfect. Being a honors member I have stayed at Hilton hotels all over, the staff here is top notch!

Great hotel; clean building, big rooms. Breakfast was efficient even when busy and staff was very helpful. We had parents and 5 kids and room was great.  We have stayed at other Hiltons-this location is ideal. Close to shuttle. Close enough to walk to park and close Walgreens and CVS if you need anything.

Don't like that we have to pay for parking as we don't have a choice on where to park. Food should be more authentic if it's going to feel like home. Serving just a sale is mis leading to evening social.

This is a solid hotel, 1 block from the Anaheim convention center. It is set up as an extended stay and so room had kitchenette and a desk. The room was very modern with nice linens and a good bathroom. Hotel staff are great. There is free breakfast with the room that is quite good a mix of hot food and cereal and pastries; and there is a nightly buffet with heavy hors d'oeuvres and free wine and beer, so basically you could save money and eat 2 meals a day there. It was a quick walk in the am to the convention center. My room had a view of Disney fireworks every night. There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance, mostly chains, but some are good. There is also a gym with like 6 machines and some dumbbells and a pool. There seemed to be a ton of families in the hotel

Hard to beat if staying at Disney. Great location and the breakfast and dinners are both great and really handy for those on a budget. Good activities around the hotel with pool, jacuzzi and movies shown each night.

Our stay at the Disneyland Homewood Suites was excellent.  It was nice not have to worry about breakfast and dinner.  Because of their great food variety, our whole family was satisfied! The value of this place was the best. The staff was friendly, helpful and professional! I will stay here next time!

This is such a great place to stay when visiting Disneyland.  Not a long walk to Disneyland, great service with a kickback in the afternoon between 5-7pm of food and drink.  Breakfast is tasty and plentiful, rooms are very clean.  Certainly will stay here again when visiting Disneyland.

Honestly one of the best hotels I've stayed at near Disneyland. Decided to stay at this property since it's new and close to the parks, normally I choose the Embassy Suites down the road a little further. I am so happy we stayed here.  Parking is easy, there is a fee but you can unload your car out front before going into parking which is behind a ticketing post. This was a huge plus for me since as I mentioned we normally stay down the road at the ES which shares a parking lot with Bucca, Hampton Inn and Hilton Garden Inn so it can be really crowded and such tight parking spaces. So I was very happy with the parking here.    Check in was fast and simple. I believe Britney helped check me in with another really nice girl. They were both so sweet and engaged in small talk while

Summary Heading: Free breakfast AND dinner, close to Disney shuttle
Summary: Homewood Suites-Anaheim Convention Center is a wonderful hotel.  Clean suites, clean lobby, fantastic hot breakfast with plenty of space for dozens of guests to find a table, and free dinner M-Th, non-holidays!  Adjacent to Disney Parking Lot with free shuttle to Parks.  Also close to plenty of restaurants (we ate at Cheesecake Factory one night, yum!) and 2 drug stores.  We were busy at Theme parks all day so didn't use the pool, but it looked clean and many guests were enjoying it. Staff was friendly and helpful.  Good value for Disney area.  Highly recommended hotel!

We enjoyed our stay.  Very family friendly and close to Disney.  We had a nice kitchenette within our room.  We enjoyed the pool and the two different food services included in our stay.  We enjoyed a nice breakfast and dinner services.

Very good stay. Clean and very convenient. Didn't like having to re sign into wi if multiple times per day - needs to be improved. Great breakfast choices and variety. We would definitely stay in this hotel again. Very helpful front desk staff.

Summary Heading: Fabulous Base for Disneyland and Southern California vacay
Summary: 3 adults,1 child in a 2 queen suite. The location by the Anaheim Convention Center is walkable to Disneyland - it is a flat mile, restaurants, shops and the convention center. Beds were very comfortable and the fold out sofa was good. Room and grounds were VERY clean with lots of amenities - pool, hot tub, workout room, game room, basketball and putting green. The morning breakfast was good - some kind of eggs, sausage/meat, oatmeal, fruit, waffles, yogurt and cereal.  A nice job trying to rotate the breakfast hot dishes- tortillas one day for make your own breakfast burritos, croissants another day to make a sandwich and even enchiladas. The rooms were very clean and had everything you needed if you wanted to prepare your own meal.  The pool area had a very nice outdoor

We really enjoyed our stay. Our rooms were well appointed and very clean. The beds were extremely comfortable. Our destination was Disneyland and this was a great location. Would definitely recommend it.

What an amazing stay we just had with our kids and grand kids. We had two family suites, and one king suite, and everyone was thrilled with their rooms. We have been to Disneyland many many times and this is by far the best off-site hotel we have stayed in. Free breakfast (much more than just your usual bagel and coffee), free dinner (quite tasty as well), and free grocery pickup was fantastic. We came back from Disneyland a couple of nights to have the dinner and then went back to Disneyland! Being able to walk out the front door and into the adjacent Disney parking lot to catch a free shuttle was a big plus as well. Highly recommended! You may pay a little more to stay here but you get a lot in return.

We truly enjoyed the stay.  The beds were a dream after standing in lines in the hot sun for 10 hours.  The cleaning staff went above and beyond.  Warning there is no shuttle but there is a parking fee.  :(   The facility was clean, staff was friendly, and food was great.  We loved the room too.  Great setup!

This was our first time to Anaheim, the hotel was within walking distance to Disneyland, the staff were so obliging and couldn't do enough for you, the hotel is clean and everything you could possibly require.  The rooms and suites and fully equipped and very comfortable.  Thank you for a wonderful stay.

Summary Heading: Homewood Suites Excellent Stay for Disneyland!
Summary: We enjoyed our stay at the Hilton Homewood Suites in November 2016!  The suite was perfect for our Disney trip, this visit with one grandson.  We had a comfortable King bed in a beautiful new room.  Our grandson slept on a twin bunk, all fun for him with his own space.  The suite included a kitchenette with fridge, very convenient.  The front desk staff was so friendly and helpful.  The breakfast was excellent, a wonderful start to our long days in the parks.  We came in each evening to a spotless room.  We chose to Uber to the park each morning.  This Granny didn't need the extra steps TO the park before the many steps each day IN the park!  Others had reported the use of the free Disney bus from the "Toy Story" parking lot located next door to the hotel, but we found this lot

Excellent hotel, very family oriented.  There were ten of us on this trip and we were all so pleased with our entire stay.  We enjoyed the breakfast each morning, the pool, the hot tub, the movie in the pool area.  Had we been able to take advantage of the evening social hour I am sure we would have enjoyed it, along with the putting green and the arcade, but we were also enjoying Disneyland and had limited time.

The hotel is perfect for a laid back trip to Anaheim. Walking distance to both Disneyland and the Convention Center. Free breakfast, free happy hour, free newspaper, a pool/hot tub and even a little putt putt golf center.

We were in Anaheim for business and we loved having breakfast with families and being in the elevator with all of the kids who were either going or returning from Disneyland.  It was a respite  from the business at hand.  Well done Hilton

We took our two kids (7 and 9) to the famous Disneyland for the first time and stayed in this hotel for 8 nights and we all loved it so much. First of all the staffs (every where in the hotel) are very friendly and professional. Secondly this new hotel is spotless and have all the necessity for a family including laundry room, swimming pool, kids pool, an arcade, mini golf, basketball court and complimentary breakfast every morning and happy hour from Monday to Thursday which includes delicious simple meal and beer/wine. Last of all the room is so specious and well laid out with full size fridge and mini stove and a dishwasher. The free shuttle to Disney from around the corner was priceless for in and out access to the hotel. We'll definitely stay here again next time visiting
