The hotel is new and very clean, perfect location close to Disney and 2 blocks from ---Convention Center - The room had everything, king bed, pull out couch, full size refridgerator, kitchen, dishwasher, micro . loved the outdoor pool, hot tub, game room - favorite part was the great hot breakfast and light dinner served, that saved money and time of going out finding a place to eat.  The staff was very friendly I would come back - total perfection!  -11-16

Summary Heading: Nothing special. A clean overpriced room
Summary: The hotel is in a convenient location off of Harbor Blvd. The room was good sized and clean with a small kitchen. The bed was not very comfortable, but the linens were okay. The staff was friendly, but the fare they offered for a ride to the hotel from John Wayne Airport was much higher and less convenient than a taxi. The included breakfast was barely edible.
Manager Response: Hello Talawah26,  Thank you so much for the constructive feedback. We appreciate your comments in regards to our room size and cleanliness. We apologize that that the bed was less than perfect. We always want our guests to get as much rest as possible, because we understand most people have a lot on their agenda while they are here. We will follow-up with our team members in regards to the transportation referral and make sure we are offering the best possible transportation, for the best price.

Summary: I don't know where to begin! I took my family on a little 2 day trip to disneyland. When we checked in after a loooong day of walking and standing in 2 hour lines we were greeted like family! Before they even asked for my credit card the front desk agent was asking my son how his day at the park went.  That meant allot to me.  The housekeepers were very energetic and very helpful.  They offer a putting green, a arcade for the kids (i was in there too) and a basketball court.  And the free breakfast was perfect. This hotel treats their customers like family and are always there when you need assistance. You can also purchase a bus ticket at the counter. The bus drops you off directly in front of disneyland! Which saves you money on paying for parking! This hotel gets 100% from me.

This hotel was an ideal Disneyland solution for our 6 person family. Rooms aren't that big but at least they have plenty of beds and a nice little kitchen. The staff was friendly and they had many fun activities going on including movie night on the big screen by the swimming pool.  Transportation to Disneyland The hotel is within walking distance of Disneyland but you can also take the Disneyland parking lot shuttle which comes frequently.  Meals at the Hotel Breakfast was included with our room and there's quite the spread with options changing every day. The manager's reception for dinner (Monday - Thursday) meant one less meal to have to think about. And the free coffee in the lobby was a most appreciated.

Everything about this hotel exceeded our expectations. The location was within walking distance to Disneyland, but we often caught the Disney shuttle from the Toy Story parking lot next door. There were many amenities nearby (restaurants, pharmacy). The rooms were very spacious, clean and modern. The complimentary breakfast and evening social were a bonus. The kids enjoyed the night time movie by the pool after swimming. There were 4 people in our group fcelebrating birthdays and the staff put something special in their rooms to help celebrate. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Nice clean modern hotel. Breakfast was good and beds were very comfortable. Hotel pool is big and they have a kiddie pool and hot tub with lots of comfortable seating. I stayed at the hotel with my family during a trip to Disneyland, highly recommend.

This hotel is a newer hotel. This hotel is how hotels should be- super clean, fantastic service, the suite is spacious. The continental breakfast was a nice surprise- it was a real complete meal. Hotel has fire pit, heated pool to relax. I would absolutely stay here again!

I have never been to Anaheim before and was looking for a suite within a close distance to Disneyland. When I found this hotel and saw they had a family suite with bunk beds with a daily free breakfast it was a no brainer! After I booked this hotel I realized that 4 days a week they have a free supper with drinks as well. It had a nice pool area with a separate kids pool. Staff were super friendly! I would most definitely stay here again!!

Comfortable rooms nice location. Close to Disney and convention center. Garden walk within walking distance. Clean rooms pool and laundry area. Breakfast good. Pay to park is 16$ little pricey to park a car.  Valet service. Warm friendly greetings when you walk in the lobby. Treated with respect and care.

My husband, 4 kids and I stayed here from October 28 to November 2, 2016 and we came specifically to visit Disneyland and California Adventure.  We picked this hotel based on the many recommendations from TripAdvisor, and we were not disappointed!  This was low season for Disneyland and there were probably not many major conventions going on when we booked because we had gotten a great deal.  Plus, we got a kitchen with a full fridge; a full, hot breakfast every morning; a complimentary evening social from Monday to Thursday (this is where they have food available for supper-plenty of food to eat and you will get full but it's a simple supper.  Still very yummy and to feed a family of 6, it was a HUGE money saver); huge BBQ's around the pool that you are free to use (say, if you

We have stayed at a few different properties near Disneyland, and this is definitely our favorite hotel to stay at. On this visit, our room had a king-sized bed with the bunk beds and trundle bed. The room was clean and comfortable and we couldn't find anything to complain about. The kitchen had a microwave, cooktop, and fridge, which was great for preparing breakfast for our daughter with special dietary restrictions. The rest of the family enjoyed the complimentary breakfast, which included a wide variety of choices. We didn't allow time to enjoy the pool, but it looked inviting, and they project movies down near the pool in the evening. We walked a short distance to Disney's Toy Story parking lot each day to catch the shuttle to the park. One of the manager's found out it was

Summary Heading: This is the place to stay when in Anaheim!
Summary: My son and I stayed here for 4 nights while visiting Disneyland and Orange County. It is in a perfect location, close to interstate, right across from the convention center and close to Disneyland. I was visiting with my almost 9 year old and we felt completely safe, just being the two of us. Starting with the front desk, they were all friendly and helpful. The breakfast options changed each day as far as the hot bar, but the standards of oatmeal, cereal, toast and making your own waffles (which my son loved) were there each day. We were only there one night to enjoy the evening snacks, I had a wonderful salad along with some of the best macaroni salad I have ever had while my son played in the pool. We loved having the option of the pool, hot tub, putting green and basketball.

I've stayed at a number of hotels while going to BlizzCon, and this one was far and away the best one. The rooms are clean and spacious. Complimentary breakfast and even free dinner on Thursday made it really nice. It didn't feel overcrowded either. Really close to the convention center.   Definitely staying there for future cons.

What a wonderful hotel and value! I called the staff ahead of time to see if it would be ok to have one suite for our family of 9 (4 adults, 4 small children, one baby). Staff member said as long as we would be comfortable, that would be fine. We were able to sleep all 4 kids in the bunk bed, baby in a pack-n-play we brought, one adult on pullout trundle, 2 adults in king bed, and one adult on pull-out couch very comfortably. What a great room! We also loved the kitchenette for the microwave, sink, and fridge (also has a stove top and dishwasher!) The hotel was very clean, the staff was pleasant and efficient. The continental breakfast was really exceptional compared to what most hotels offer. It left us full and satisfied and ready for a long day at Disney. This should

Summary Heading: Great stay with just a few little issues
Summary: We really enjoyed our stay at the hotel. The staff and room were perfect for our family traveling to Disneyland. Our two rooms were connected by a living room which was great. The only small issues we had were that I turned a pillow case over and it was slightly dirty and the breakfast items were either missing or just didn't taste that good (we did enjoy the make your own waffles though). It was nice to be offered complimentary breakfast because we are HH members and weren't offered breakfast at our last HGI hotel.  Overall this was a good hotel stay.

We stayed here for 7 nights while going to Disneyland. Everything here was amazing. We stayed in a suite with bunk beds and a trundle bed, which allowed each of the kids to have their own bed.  Having a kitchen was great, especially the refrigerator. The staff was incredible, the free breakfast was extensive and with different most mornings, the free evening happy hour was great, the pool was perfect for the kids.one of the best aspects was that the Disneyland parking lot is across the street, so you don't need to pay for or spend your time waiting for shuttles, it was so convenient.  We will definitely be back next time.

Everything is good! The front desk staff are friendly. Whenever i have question they can answer me politely even though i know they are all tired. Food was good too! See you all again on January 2017!

We chose this hotel based on the other reviews and I am so glad we did!  I do not have one negative thing to say about this hotel. The set up was ideal for us - parents with a 4 year old.  Breakfast was delicious and there was plenty of it.  Any complaints about table being left dirty were bc guests are expected to help bus their tables. Which I think is perfectly acceptable considering this is not a restaurant but a complimentary breakfast.  The evening social was ideal and a nice treat.  Being right next to the Disney shuttle was also an added perk.  Bottom line- great hotel!  Clean, super friendly, spacious and priced right!

Summary Heading: Clean, comfortable, friendly and short walk to Disney
Summary: I stayed for 6 nights. The reception desk were very helpful in finding me a quiet room. Apparently all the king suites are on the first floor and there is no way of knowing that when making the reservation. All the breakfast and evening meal staff were friendly too.   Breakfast had a very good range of food including fresh fruit and hot food such as eggs and bacon. The weekday evening supper is good and includes a free drink. It‚Äôs fine if you don't want a big meal out.   My studio suite was spacious with a fridge, freezer, microwave and dishwasher. Comfortable desk chair and large desk. 2 TVs. My only disappointment was that my room wasn't serviced on the first day even though I'd left at 7:00am to go to Disney and had not returned until 10:00pm except for a couple of hours late

It was a Disneyland trip with my wife. We had one of the greatest experience. We came to the hotel, checked in around 8 in the morning, we got to our room and it was amazing, and then we off to Disneyland, came back around 10pm after watching those wonderful fireworks they had, and we took showers in the awesome bathroom, the room gave us such a warm feeling, and we rested peacefully that night. I would definitely recommend this to any of my friends. Thank you for the experience!!

Summary Heading: Great hotel for our Disneyland visit
Summary: Based on the Trip Advisor reviews, I booked this hotel for our recent multi-generational family visit to Disneyland. We stayed for six nights and had both a family suite and regular king room. Both rooms fully served our needs - all new and in great shape. The included breakfast was the reason we chose this hotel and the quantity and selection of food was excellent. We checked in mid-week and the bulk of hotel guests were convention attendees, so our first few breakfasts were low-key. But the place filled up with families on the weekend and breakfast became a chaotic and "I'm seriously questioning humanity" affair. Bless the staff's heart for continuing to churn out food to meet demand. And the coffee was really good.  All the staff were friendly and pleasant. They had a pumpkin

I have stayed at Homewood Suites several times and it is always a good experience. This was my first time with family on a pleasure trip and again I was happy! My wife and I had a comfortable experience and also enjoyed the good service and hospitality.

Summary Heading: Felt like we were at home
Summary: Given my past stays with Homewood Suites I decided to book this location for our family Disneyland trip.  We were not disappointed!  The complimentary breakfast and evening social were wonderful and helped save on cost.  We really enjoyed the movie by the pool and lounging in the common areas.  It was nice having more space in the suite than just two beds and a bathroom.  We didn't feel as though we were on top of each other.  The rooms and the whole property seem to be newly renovated, which was nice as well.  The staff was very friendly and helpful as well.  We even got to see the Disneyland fireworks from our room.  We would love to stay at this location again!

This was a birthday trip for my three year old granddaughter and it exceeded all expectations- only issue was breakfast area supplies and table being cleaned - no one we asked seemed to care we were being neglected

Summary Heading: Breakfast was a hit - but be prepared for long walks on Magic Mornings
Summary: Arriving to find out grocery order unpacked int he kitchen was fantastic.  The hotel worked well for a family traveling to Disneyland because of the kitchen and the great complimentary breakfast and evening social it was a money-saver. However, the breakfast doesn't start until 6:30am and if you are trying to make a 7am magic morning you won't have time to eat because it is a long walk to Disneyland.  The shuttle in the nearby Disney parking lot doesn't start running until 7am so your options to get to Disneyland involve paying for transport or walking.  I didn't mind the walk in the early morning hours, but in the blazing sun it was pretty long.  I wish this hotel had a shuttle to Disney and a slightly earlier breakfast and that would make it a perfect place for families

Summary Heading: A home away from home for Australian families
Summary: We booked a family suite for our 11 night stay in September and had a fantastic, comfortable stay. Our room had a brilliant , practical layout with room for 2 adults and 3 teens. It was always scrupulously cleaned and had everything we could need. We were able to catch the free shuttle next door to Disneyland that left almost immediately or we walked and it was only a 15 minute walk.  We had 10 day Disney Park Hopper tickets purchased in Australia which are amazing value. It was also easy to arrange other day trips and tours at the hotel. We did a Hollywood and Beaches day tour. There are Walgreens and CSV pharmacies on the walk to Disney and a Target which has groceries as well, about 15 minutes the other way down S Harbour Boulevard. Using our iPhones, we easily caught both

Nice hotel.  Easy walk üö∂ around the corner to free Disney shuttle bus. Nice breakfast daily and evening light supper on Monday they Thursday.  Nice family room with complete kitchen. I will definitely stay here again.

My family of 7 (2 adults, 3 teens, a toddler, and a grade schooler) stayed comfortably in one studio room.  Everything was clean and comfortable, and the complimentary breakfast made it an even better value.  We will definitely stay here again!

It is hard to find a hotel the accommodates a family of 5 comfortably, but this hotel super exceeded all of my expectations!  Super clean and spacious rooms (family suite) Very close to Disneyland, I think it was about a 5 minute walk to the shuttle and a 8 minute shuttle ride to the park.

Fantastic location! Short walk to Disneyland or hop the Toy Story bus right around the corner. The complimentary breakfast every day is amazing! Pancakes, eggs, breakfast sandwiches, Belgium waffles, egg burritos, fresh fruit, yogurt bar... and that's just a few! You won't need to eat until dinner! Also, Monday thru Thursday they have complimentary "appetizer" bar. It's really a meal! We had the nacho bar with carnitas and fajita chicken salads. They had wine and beer (Stella!) on tap. The beds were super comfy and the bunk beds with a trundle meant everyone had their own bed. When we added an extra night they adjusted our room rate because the rate had gone down; by $40 a night! Who does that?! Will definitely be back!

Good new hotel. Location perfect. Clean. Complementary breakfast and dinner with different offers. Nice pool, hot tube, kids pool and even place for sport etc. basketball.  Good selfparking opportunities for resonable price.

Our suite was comfortable, clean and had everything we needed.  The kitchen had a full sized refrigerator, couch and a second TV.    It was very convenient to have the Toy Story shuttle to Disneyland right next door to the hotel.    Breakfast was included every morning  and Monday through Thursday there was a social in the evening which included food, beer and wine.  The pool area was nice with a cozy fire pit.  In the evening movies are projected on the wall  by the pool. My husband was there for business and we enjoyed our stay.  We would definitely stay here again.

Nice rooms was able to get a good rate. Very large hotel but check in and out was easy. Walking distance from Disney or short cab ride. Room did not have a fridge so I asked and one was brought up with a microwave. Quiet room excellent staff services. Valet quick. Long lines at Starbucks during am. We had a pleasant stay. Quite uneventful which is good. Enjoyed walking in the on site store. Good for people watching as well. Plenty of sitting area in lobby. Lobby has a large bar as well

Came for a 2 night-2 day Disneyland weekend. Arrived very late at night after a long drive. Was greeted by the very friendly valet who took our stuff and car. The valet is free if you take the parking option. It was nice that we didn't have to deal with finding a parking spot after the long drive. We called the front desk earlier in the day and asked to have the sofa bed made out for us and indeed it was ready and waiting for the tired kids when we got there. Lovely, friendly and patient stuff throughout. Breakfast was abundant and refilled constantly. Pool looked clean and inviting but we didn't have a chance to enjoy it. Nice perk to be able to use the Toy Story parking lot shuttle. It is constant and reliable. Overall, when we come back to Disneyland in the future, we will

Stayed here to visit Disneyland with kids and grand kids.  Great location for that purpose and very nice hotel.  Quiet, well maintained, and had great service.  Fantastic included breakfast and very friendly and accommodating staff.

We chose this hotel because of it's proximity to Disneyland since some in our party were going to visit the Park and others weren't. It looks like a new or at least refurbished property and we were very happy with our choice.  The only down note was that the breakfast area was overcrowded every day we were there. Having said that, the staff was doing a phenomenal job under trying conditions, always smiling and ready to help with specific needs.  We would stay there again.

Stayed here for 1 night with a group of friends in the 1 bedroom 2 queen suite. It was spacious, clean and well equipped. We chose this hotel primarily because of the location being close to Disneyland. Breakfast was great and everything worked out.

Great value for loacation, and hotel amenities. Very clean and new. Kitchen with microwave, sink with disposal and refrigerator! Nice walk in shower. Comfortable bed and pillows. Great breakfast! Nice spacious car attival area.

My family and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in October.  Location: Next to the Toy Story Disneyland parking lot and free shuttle; 15min walk to Disneyland; 5min walk to the Anaheim Convention Centre Hotel: Brand new hotel; Great comfortable rooms; good complimentary breakfast and evening buffets; fantastic pool area; great hotel for families Staff: Excellent staff Would definitely recommend this hotel for business or family vacation

I stayed at this hotel during a trade show at the Anaheim Convention Center as it is within walking distance. The room was very large and quiet which is important after working a trade show for an entire day. Also, the hotel is located very close to Disneyland and I visited Downtown Disney for dinner. Also, you can get a great view of the Disney fireworks from the top floor facing the complex. Lastly, they offer an evening reception where I could get food and drinks. I would recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Anaheim/Disneyland.

This was the best hotel I have stayed at in a while.  All staff was extremely helpful and polite.  The complementary breakfast and evening social gathering that serve dinner was a nice surprise.  The pool and hot tub were kept very clean as well as all amenities within the hotel.

It is with great pleasure that I announce, this weekend my family received by far the very best valet service in all of my years of travel and vacationing! Homewood Suites has a gentleman working for them in Valet by the name of "Tim" who went above and beyond for my family during our stay for our Disneyland vacation. Everytime we saw Tim he greeted us all with a genuine warm smile. His very presence brought joy, assurance, and security to my whole family. Tim was very honest and knowledgeable of the surrounding area. When my girlfriend had an allergic reaction on our way back to the hotel, Tim came to her (our) rescue (provided much more than valet, but he was very kind, caring, and genuinely concerned about her health and over all well being). Tim is the kind of employee and

This hotel is great.  Great value. Grocery delivery service was so convenient for us. Pool was nice. Staff was great. Used the Toy Story Disney parking which is just a short walk around the corner from the front of the hotel.  Breakfast in the morning is very good.  It does get busy, but there are plenty of places to sit and easy to get food.  Evening reception was enough for a meal for us.   Very impressive. Will come back for next Disneyland trip.

In new condition, helpful staff, great location, clean, great breakfast, and also has an evening meal. We had a one bedroom and it had everything we needed and was clean and fresh feeling. Parking was easy and we enjoyed the pool area. Loved it here and would highly recommend. Walked to Disney on palm tree lined walkways.

Summary Heading: A TRUE HOME AWAY FROM HOME
Summary: This hotel truly made is feel at home.  The staff was warm and hospitable during our entire weeks stay.  We had a total of 20 in our group and the staff were very welcoming and accommodating when we used the lounge to watch MLB playoff baseball...even providing wine glasses for us while we chatted with visiting family from the area.    The daily breakfast was great, providing a full hot breakfast and the option to make your own waffles.  Definitely got our mornings started off on the right foot.  After a long day at Disneyland and sightseeing the Evening Social was a great way to wind down with a great spread of heavy appetizers and some beer and wine.  The onsite amenities were great.  Utilized the fitness center a few times but I think the highlight of these amenities is the

Summary Heading: Pleasant surprise, short walk to convention center & Disney
Summary: Stayed for 6 nights at the Homewood and had a great stay. Hotel is new and so well designed, with a large open and bright lounge. Excellent breakfast buffet and enjoyable evening happy hour, including stir fry among the selections. Each evening, sat out by the pool relaxing with a glass of wine and snacks. My suite was beautiful and service excellent. All the staff were friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay again!

Yes, I said it. I have found another true love in Anaheim. Homewood Suites was perfect! I am a dedicated fan of Candy Cane Inn, but we needed something with a little more room.  Big enough room for four adults, a kitchen and a nice big bathroom with an amazing shower! The beds were super comfortable, it was quiet, even the rooms on Harbor were quiet! My third requirement, clean! Very clean! There was a member of housekeeping cleaning the elevators! The staff was beyond amazing, very welcoming. Jonathan was fantastic. We came back from a long day playing in the parks, obviously a little punchy. We requested a late check out the next morning, granted and he recommended some awesome beer for us to try. It was very late and we did not want to hike down to the liquor store. Breakfast

Summary Heading: Clean - Comfortable - Great Customer Service - Disnleyland Trip
Summary: First time staying at a Hilton property in a while and hope to be back.  Two queen bedroom was very clean and comfortable for 2 adults and 2 children. Love the sink separated from shower/toilet area as this is a serious time saver and convenience when traveling with family - not many hotels offer this arrangement any longer.  All staff we encountered from maintenance to food service to management was very friendly and helpful.  Pay for parking is a huge bummer, but most of the hotels in this area are doing this now.  Free continental breakfast was good and enough to get us started of Disneyland every morning.  Although we've used the ART bus transportation to Disney in past years, we opted to save a few bucks and walk to the Toy Story parking lot next-door for the free Disney

Summary Heading: Great Stay and Close to Convention Cener
Summary: I chose this hotel because it's 12 minutes away from the Anaheim Convention Center.  It's a newer hotel and if you're familiar with the Homewood Suites chain, they provide a really good breakfast with plenty of food options.  Dinner is served from 5:00 - 7:00 pm with beer and wine.  I had booked a room on the second level via their online check-in, but when I arrived, they had booked me a room on the third floor (#321).  The room had a window looking out east toward the Disney park where you could see the Tower of Terror and nightly fireworks.  My only complaint was there were dirty spots in the shower, and a few areas where mold was noted.

Tripadvisor reviews spot on and makes sense its #1. Great alternative to dirty old hotels in the area. Great for the business traveler. Its a moderate upscale suit  Better than all the other suit hotels  A bit more expensive but free dinner teus thru thursday with wine and salad!! Love it love that its so clean  Good value too!!

This hotel was in the perfect location, the free Disney shuttle being right next door. The rooms were spacious, very modern with cooking facilities. We upgraded to a park view room and could watch the evening fireworks from our window. The food was average but breakfast was free as were the evening meals on the nights we stayed there. However I would recommend venturing elsewhere to eat if your looking for a more quality meal. I imagine this is ideal for younger children (however my girls are teenagers) the Disney movies by the pool is also a special touch. Great mid week stay if visiting Disney. No in house bar or restaurant though.

I stayed here with my husband, sister and two kids aged 5 and 1 for our Disneyland vacation and we will never stay anywhere else when we go back to Disney!  The rooms were clean, staff friendly and helpful and not only was there was free breakfast and happy hour/dinner Monday to Thursday evening - but the food was delicious!  The free shuttle to the park is just next door as well so great location. The only negative I would say is that there aren't any quick food places nearby to grab something in s hurry and there is no room service. Otherwise great!

Breakfast and dinner on the house, saved money on vacation instead of spending it. Meals had something most adults and kids would like. Great staff. Location is walking distance to other places to eat and also to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Not as nice as expected, but would stay there again.
Summary: Great location for Disneyland. Was a little surprised when we walked in as it was much smaller than it appears in pictures. Still having the extra room was a bonus.  For the most part the room was comfortable quiet and very clean. The biggest issue I had is the people above us had little kids running around till after midnight. Since you can hear regular footsteps above you, running nonstop for hours can drive you over the edge. I was suggest they not put families with small hyper children on the top floor! I did call down to the front desk and they were very nice and the noise quit in about 20 minutes (that night).  All the staff here were amazing, the pool was wonderful, the breakfast was great with lots of choices. One of the best things about this place is coffee is

This Hilton Homewood Suites is fresh and clean compared to some of the other hotels in the area I've stayed in, and priced competitively.  The staff and service was great. The room included a full fridge, stove & dishwasher + dishes, pots & pans, etc.  The bathroom featured a shower only - no tub - which was ok because I don't usually take a bath in a hotel tub, but this place was so new that I may have considered it.  I was on the 5th floor so it seemed quiet while I was sleeping and the King bed was comfy.    Breakfast items included something for everyone with a waffle station, eggs, potatoes, meat, cereal, breads, fruit, milk, juices, coffee & tea.  The dinner social was rice alternating with potatoes the next night, and meat, bread and salads.  Cookies were offered and

From the moment we walked in to the time we left it was wonderful! The staff at the front desk were very helpful and polite. The room was very clean and in good condition. Food and beverages were high quality not just the typical "continental" breakfast. The evening social was great!

Stayed at this Homewood for the second leg of a two and a half week trip & it was awesome! Very close to the Disney Woody Toy Story parking lot to catch a free shuttle to the entrance of Disney. Hotel is clean and beds in our one King, bunk bed suite were very comfortable. Will definitely stay here anytime I'm in the area.

We stayed here for our trip to Disneyland. The hotel is very modern and new. The staff has been very helpful and we're very courteous especially when dealing with everyone during the breakfast. Management was very accommodating when we asked for extra pillows and towels. I travel a lot and recommend this hotel to anyone if they are looking for great customer service.

Summary Heading: Clean, new, very convenient to Disneyland.
Summary: We stayed there for a few days to visit Disneyland.  The suites are nice, new and clean and perfectly suited to a family.  There is a small kitchen with a full size refrigerator, cooktop and microwave. There is a couch that opens into a bed and then a king size bed in the other room separated by a door.  It is nice to have a little quiet time and separation from the kids after a day at Disneyland. The breakfast was really well done, with lots of food choices and everything tasted great and was the right temperature.  (Hot things were hot and cold things were cold.)  The evening reception was a nice surprise with beer, wine and light snacks and on some nights it is enough for dinner.  The location on Harbor Blvd right next to the Disney Toy Story Parking Lot is perfect for a

Summary Heading: You would be Goofy (pun intended) not to stay here
Summary: This is a good family hotel. With the 2 king size beds, kitchenette, laundry facility, free breakfast and a free adult beverage time in the evening, this is a great place to stay. The rooms are clean, open and have plenty of room. The staff are extremely helpful and address any issues immediately. The proximity to Disney parking and pick up can not be beat. We observed multiple families utilizing the shuttle service to Disney. Each person we spoke with was happy with the hotel and had much the same opinion as my wife and I. You would be goofy not to stay here.

Summary Heading: Great stay for families headed to Disney
Summary: This place is great!  The free breakfast and weekday dinners are a win - especially for those with lots of mouths to feed.  Don't expect gourmet, but the food is good and there is a range of offerings.  The weeknight movies by the pool were a hit for my son.  The hot tub is huge (so you don't have to sit by the creepy guy if you don't want to) and the kiddie pool is perfect.  Fire pit is small but effective.  Easy walk to the Disney Toy Story Parking Lot if you want to hitch a ride on their shuttle. Hotel is pretty new and the staff was accommodating. They even helped us buy our resort tickets. Don't bother trying to check in early.  If you get a room on the long odd numbered side of the building you will have a great seat at your window for the evening fireworks at Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Luxury this isn't but convenient & family friendly
Summary: If you are looking for a modern luxury hotel then look elsewhere. However if you are looking for clean, comfortable & spacious rooms close to disney then this is perfect.  The suites have separate lounge areas which is ideal when travelling as a family. The rooms are spacious clean and beds comfy  (although decor is dated) The breakfast was included in the rate & has a great selection daily! The hotel is less than 2 miles from disney & a shuttle bus runs from the hotel every 30 minutes for only a few $pp! You can also purchase tickets for Disney here which id recommend to save you queuing at disney itself  I've rates this hotel as 3* based on the fact it needs a lot of modernisation compared to hotels nearby but we had a great experience here & would recommend to anyone
Manager Response: Dear katyl1,  Thank you for taking the time to let others know about our convenient and family friendly hotel. As a hotel that opened November 2015, I have to admit that it was a first for us to hear that the d√©cor appeared dated, as we haven't hit our one year anniversary date yet! I would love to have the opportunity to speak to you in more detail about the specifics. Please feel free to email me at keith.moses@hilton.com or call at 714.750.2010.

Summary Heading: Multiple days with no housekeeping service
Summary: We have been at this property for three days and we have only had housekeeping come one time. For two consecutive days we have been requesting service and have been told on numerous times (and by numerous employees) that they would have someone come up while we are gone.   After returning from Disneyland with our kids we come back to a room with nothing done. If we had wanted to stay like this we would have just reserved something on VRBO. I have been very disappointed in the way this has been handled and don't think I will be staying here again. I feel like I way overpaid for what I am getting.
Manager Response: Dear Adam M.,  I want to thank you for letting us know about the issues that occurred during your stay with us. Please know that this is by no means the norm and I cannot apologize enough for the inconvenience. I would appreciate the opportunity to speak to you directly to ensure I follow up appropriately with our housekeeping department and to be able to allow us the opportunity to regain your loyalty. Please feel free to contact me at 714.750.2010 or email me at keith.moses@hilton.com. I look forward to hearing from you!

Summary: this hotel is a rare find -- the breakfast and happy hour is unbelievable. the rooms are spacious and clean and the amenities --pools especially were GREAT. i could not believe how accessible everything was--great food options, a nearby mall, and right next to a disney shuttle stop!

We spent 3 nights in this hotel and were very pleased. The hotel is brand new and is very clean and in excellent condition. The room was clean and comfortable with a full kitchenette. The breakfast which was included daily had a good selection, a very nice perk. The hotel was a 10 minute taxi ride to Angels stadium. We were able to walk to the downtown Disney area in about 25 minutes, or we used the hotels car service at a cost of $10 to Disneyland. Pool area looked very nice although we did not use it. The hotel offers a grocery delivery service and there are also Walgreens and CVS pharmacies nearby.

Summary Heading: Good stay at a nice, newer Anaheim hotel
Summary: We stayed a few nights in a second-floor room facing the pool. This wasn't out first choice, but it turned out okay and the front desk did their best to make it up to us. The room was clean and modern, with a nice king bed and bunk-beds for the kids. Tile in the kitchen and bath was nice; bathroom sink area is small but tub/shower area was good-sized.  The breakfast was as good or better than most, with real eggs (scrambled, boiled, and in patties), sausage, potatoes, fresh cut fruit (a plus in my book since you don't get that most places), and much more.  We enjoyed the pool a lot.  Also, this hotel is just south of Disney-owned parking, so you can walk right over to the lot and get on the Disney shuttle and be taken right to the parks.

Our family of four stayed here two nights for our annual visit to Disneyland. It was our first time at this property though. The hotel is very clean and well kept. The employees were also friendly and helpful. They offer a free breakfast buffet which offers a nice variety but I have come to realize I don't have the patience for all the other guests at breakfast that can't make up their minds, are rude or seem to be blind to the other guests trying to get their food. I would recommend this hotel if you are going to Disney but be aware the check in feature on the email they send does not work. I received and email with the option to check in and pick my own room. I did and I know I did because when I went to check if I could add another night it said I was already checked in and

Great hotel for family trips to visit  Anaheim. The rooms were good and the complementary B/Fast was a good start to the morning. The staff are friendly and the GM adds that special touch to ensure he engages with his guests.

Perfect if you have a family and are going to Disneyland.  The room was perfect with the bunk beds, and there is a shuttle right next door that will drop you off at Disney.  When we come back next year I'm already looking forward to staying at this property.

Summary Heading: Best place for families visiting Disney parks
Summary: This hotel offers an adjoining room with foldout sleeper and full kitchen to the main bedroom with two comfy queen beds plus free hot complimentary and best of all  is just south of the toy story parking lot.  Just walk through the bu Big hedge in the walkway bridge and to the woody stop to ride direct to the main gate of Disneyland and California adventure without paying the daily eighteen dollar daily rate, my only complaint about this otherwise great hotel is their  parking fee which I think is sixteen bucks a day,

We stayed here for a quick two day Disneyland trip in July. Spacious suite right next to the Woody and friends parking lot. The breakfast buffet was excellent and the rooms were clean and modern. We loved this hotel and will be back.

We had an amazing stay at this Hotel. Staff was amazing and accommodating. Highly recommend Homewood Suites to all my family and Friends. The complimentary breakfast was very good and coffee always available in the lobby was a plus!

This hotel exceeded my expectations in every way. I have stayed at Cortona and the Hilton Anaheim on my two previous trips to Disneyland. This was our first stay at the Homewood Suites and it was WAY BETTER than any hotel I have stayed at in Anaheim.   The front desk staff was super friendly and fast. The lobby and elevators are CLEAN. Our room was spotless and the bathroom was huge and had amazing lighting.   The hotel is located right by the Toy Story Parking Lot which has free shuttle service to Disneyland.   The complimentary breakfast was crazy, they had pancakes, waffles, eggs, potatoes, cereal, muffins, bagels EVERYTHING.   The price is crazy good for the quality. I am definitely making this my go-to hotel for future Disneyland trips.

Stayed here for a weekend Disneyland trip on 9/30 thru 10/2. Proximity to the Disneyland Shuttle (Toy Story parking lot) was very helpful. The Hotel was brand new, so everything was in great condition. Staff was helpful and courteous. Value was outstanding (given that we stayed in the off-season).

I wouldn't stay anywhere else after staying here.  From the arrival to the departure the staff was all super friendly and kind.  Always smiling and accommodating.  This hotel was walking distance to the convention center & to Disneyland and a quick trip at that.  The breakfast was great each morning and we never got around to dinner but I'm sure it was good too.

Decent clean hotel. Breakfast was the usual Homewood Suites variety. They rotate every other day so if you're here for a week, you'll get sick of it quickly. Pool area was nice. Suite was clean, spacious. We had a couple of bulbs that were not working but it's no big deal. Couch cushions could use some dry cleaning though. But I guess it's bound to happen. They need wine glasses in the cupboard. Location is awesome as its close to the convention centre and 5 min drive to Disney.

Spent two weeks at the hotel in September   Checking was a very simple process, which was nice after a long days travelling.  We had a room on the 5th floor which was nice and quiet, our room over looked the pool but some look towards the Disney parks and some the main road.  The room was superb, it had all the facilities we expected. Being from Europe these 'suite' type hotels are not all that common so it was really nice to have a kitchen where we could cook food and store drinks. The fridge freezer was excellent and kept everything nice and cool. There are ample stores close to the hotel that you can get food from, there is a target just down the road and also a Pharmacy that sells a lot of food.  There was a good supply of sockets in the room which is handy in this day and

Summary Heading: Great stay, walking distance to Disneyland and Convention Centre
Summary: We spent a week at the Homewood suites and had a great stay. We were visiting the area for a conference and spent sometime at Disneyland. The walk to Disneyland is very doable and takes about 15 minutes. The Disney Toy story parking lot next store is very convenient if you don't feel like walking.   The room was clean and had lots of space for the 3 of us, we were in a Queen suite. We ate a couple mornings at the breakfast buffet and a couple evenings at the evening social. The wifi was good and easy to get on. The location is great for restaurants and shopping. It was about 5-10 minute walk to the convention centres. All the staff we spoke to were very friendly and helpful. Great stay would recommend.

My brother in law set us up with these rooms and I didn't know what to expect. I was more than pleased with the results! I wouldn't change a thing! My kids where happy and the rooms clean and comfortable. easy access to Disneyland!

By far best hotel and Hilton ever stayed at. We are diamond members and stay frequently at Hilton hotel chains through U.S. and Canada. The service the staff provided was superior. Room was great. Won't stay anywhere else whenever we return to Disneyland

Summary Heading: Great location for anaheim disneyland and convention center
Summary: Stayed here for the Minion convention. Everything clean and convenient with kitchen in the room. spacious gymnasium and small enough to get around. Most of it looked very new. 10 minute walk to convention center; 15 minute walk to disneyland.

We came with our 12, 11 & 9 year old for the Minecon Convention. We got the family suite which was worth every penny.  My kids loved the bunk beds.  The breakfast was awesome ( coming from a mom who hates cooking )  The kids loved the pool and hot tub area. The one thing that I really loved about this place was the transportation they provided with a private driver.  We used them to drive us to Downtown Disney and a few other places.  We plan on going back to this area of California to see more and we would stay here again.

I attended a convention across the street and this place was in walking distance of the convention center, tons of restaurant and the Disneyland parking, which you can take the bus to downtown Disney for free.  The hotel is new so the rooms, pool and lobby area are in great condition. Rooms are very comfortable and rooms quiet.  Because of the resort location, Hilton Honors members be aware that you will most likely not get an early check-in.

I stayed at the Homewood Suites in September 2016 while attending a conference at the Anaheim Convention Center. It is an easy 5 minute walk to the convention center. While the convention had special rates for the Hilton and Marriott, I Wanted a 2 room suite for my wife and 3-year old. This hotel also had complimentary breakfast and free WiFi so overall it was a bargain. This is one of the newer hotels in the area and the lobby and rooms were nice. The rooms do have 2 rooms with a kitchen that has a full size fridge, microwave, and stove. The main room has a dining table and couch with TV. The bedroom is nice - we had a king bed and there was a built-in bunk-bed with trundle underneath, so you could easily fit 3 kids there. The bathroom was a bit small and the sink and mirror

Summary Heading: Another wonderful stay for our Disney trip
Summary: Stayed here Sept.18-20th, 2016.  This is our go to hotel when planning our trip to Disneyland.  It's one of the newer updated hotels.  The check in and check out process has always been efficient.  They do charge a parking fee, which quite a lot of hotels near Disneyland are doing now.  The room is like a huge studio with 2 queen beds, living room, and kitchenette.  The open area of the living room and beds make this room so much bigger and more space for everyone to spread out.  It's clean and the beds are super comfy.  The kitchen has everything you need if staying several days or those with toddlers.  A big refrigerator and small stove top.  The vanity is outside of the bathroom.  The bathroom is good size.  The free breakfast is a plus and I liked the happy hour in the

Summary Heading: Clean rooms, great amenities, good location
Summary: I stayed here for Minecon with my husband and 4 kids (2 were mine). The hotel was extraordinarily clean (its brand new), great size rooms with 2 king beds, a separate sitting area and small kitchen. Just perfect for a 2-night stay or even longer! Everything worked just as it was supposed too. Breakfast was great for kids, a little light on the fresh fruit so I went somewhere else the second day. I am more picky than most. Plenty of coffee, tea available throughout the day. Staff friendly and efficient. Free WiFi fine for streaming movies. We got a great deal too! Will definitely stay here again.

Can walk to convention center, Disney from here without getting mugged.  Only unusual restaurant nearby was Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles, and they fill a grown man up.  Little Saigon is within driving distance.  Staff at hotel helpful.  Nice breakfast, and nice dinner on weeknights.  Easy computer access without extra charges.  Can see Disney fireworks from some windows.  Nice pool with movie for kids.  Some customer was complaining that this place doesn't supply water so they gave him a  bottle of water, but if it was me working there I would have been fired as I would have told the customer to turn on the tap, that water is free so shut up.  But the guy behind the counter was very patient.

Hotel staff was friendly.  Breakfast was great and always stocked...  didn't get to enjoy the evening social as we were at Disneyland but is a nice feature...  rooms are clean and large.  Stayed in king bunk suite for 5 of us... only downfall was no shuttle to park but the ART runs right our front, but last bus is 930 and drops across the street...  pool is nice and they have a movie each night for the kids....

We just spent 5 days at this hotel to attend a medical convention. We had a 1 BR unit which has a king size bed and 2 really cool bunk beds. It is really close to Disney Land, and Knottsberry Farms with free shuttles. They have a good breakfast but only from 7:30 To 9:30 so it's crowded and the staff has trouble keeping the food items and everything else supplied. They do have very nice parties in the evenings-food, games, soda, wine, beer etc. Great restaurants in every direction. It is a very safe, fun, upscale environment. If you fly in plan on going to John Wayne Int. Airport only about 15 min away. Lax is only 35 miles but it takes 2 hours+ to drive it - each way!  Taxi is at least $100-$200 each way. We rented a car and self parking is $16/night. Easy walk to the

We stayed here for our Disneyland vacation.  It took us about 20 to 25 minutes to walk to the park which is a straight shot.  Breakfast was usually very packed unless you get there early.  However the breakfast was pretty good; after all it is free.  There are many restaurants when walking to and from the park if you aren't feeling food in the park.  Room was spacious and clean.  The only downside is you have to pay for parking which is the norm around there.

Summary Heading: All the staff went an extra mile to make me and my family feel welcome
Summary: Anytime something was needed, we just asked and the staff would get us whatever it was we needed. The staff seemed genuine and never made us feel like we were inconveniencing them.  Even when our son was sick in the vehicle, they provided cleaners and air fresheners for us to use.

Just arrived home after 14 wonderful nights at the Homewood suites (Hilton) Fantastic vale for money - the breakfast varieties were enormous - something for everyone know matter what your taste : yoghurt, toast, waffles, fruit, bacon, eggs, muffins etc  The Mon-Thur complimentary social evenings were an added bonus : most of the nights the food wasn't probably what I would normally eat however there were usually soup and salad items in addition to the burgers, stir fry, nachos etc on offer. The staff were truly lovely on the occasions we went.  Reception staff were all very professional and very friendly.  Security was very visible at night which is great.  The beds were very comfortable and the toiletries were of very good quality. A couple of times our room wasn't made up or

This is a wonderful hotel close to Disneyland and the convention center.  Staff is great.  I was very happy with my stay here.  Newer hotel.  Very clean, safe, family friendly, good breakfast.  I would highly recommend.  I would guess less then a mile walk to gates of Disneyland.  Easy in the morning, less so at end of day but still very close overall.

This place is great for families. It was just my husband and myself, but our room boasted a king sized bed, 2 (twin) bunk beds, a trundle bed, and a sleeper sofa in the living room. The kitchen is convenient and has the basic amenities you'd need to prepare simple meals. The hotel was clean, check in was easy and staff was polite.  We'll recommend this place to people looking for a quality stay at a more moderate price than the Disney hotels.

Summary Heading: Very Close & Conveinient to Disnyland Resort
Summary: When choosing a hotel for our recent trip to Disneyland, I did quite a bit of research and decided on this one.  I was looking for something in the Hilton family of hotels so that we could earn point in their honors program , but it also needed to be close enough to Disneyland that we wouldn't need to rent a car.  This particular Homewood Suites is situated immediately next to the Toy Story parking lot owned by Disney.  The offsite lot provides bus shuttle service directly to Disneyland on a very regular basis.  The hotel is also within walking distance of the resort if you'd like to make the trip that way.   In fact, one night we may have returned to the hotel faster if we had walked instead of waiting for the shuttle at park closing!   We needed some things at the drug store

Good hotel. Our room was next door to a housekeeping closet/room which was pretty noisy in the mornings.  Rooms were clean and nice. About a 15-20 min walk to Disneyland. Nice breakfast. Pool says heated but it was freezing. Will possibly stay here again next year.

Summary Heading: The Start Of Our 9 Day Vacation Started Off WONDERFUL!
Summary: We stayed here before our Disneyland days and we loved this resort.  Our room wasn't ready until about an hour after check in time, but the staff directed us to the basketball court where we played for awhile.  We were pleasantly surprised by the managers reception.  The food and drinks were wonderful and enough for dinner.  The staff was friendly, grounds were clean, large outdoor pool and the room was great for a family of 5.  I highly recommend this hotel.  As a travel agent, I'm always looking for exceptional and affordable stay for my clients.  This is one of them!

I'm a business traveler averaging over 200+ nights a year, the majority of which are spent in Hilton or IHG branded properties throughout California and Nevada.  I just completed a 4-night stay at this Homewood Suites for a vacation to Disneyland, staying on Hilton Honors Points. It was my first time staying at this recently-opened Homewood property. Over the past ten years or so, I've stayed at various hotels for my Disneyland trips including the old Sheraton, HoJo, Clarion, Doubletree Suites and I once even splurged on the Disneyland Hotel.   There's simply no comparison to staying in a Disneyland property, vs off property - one allows you the luxury of never leaving Disney property and easily returning to your room during the day as much as you'd wish, the other, well...does

Had to go for a business trip. Got to the hotel easy check in. Rooms were amazing. Full kitchen was a great addition to the room. Gave you two meals a day with free drinks at dinner. Staff was on point.

We had a wonderful stay during our trip to DisneyLand. Staff was friendly and accommodating. Hotel is new and clean. Family arrived one day earlier than us and we were able get a room across from them.    Room: Our room had a small kitchenette with a small fridge which is all we needed. Our family had a suite with a full fridge. They used the car service to go to grocery shopping for snacks and lunch/ dinner items instead of shopping service provided. It's just easier picking items in front of you then selecting from a list.  Our room faced the parking lot which was fine and as an added bonus we had a perfect view of Disney's fireworks on the Sunday.Almost a better view than the night before while at the park.   Pool: Pool area is fantastic and there are 3 gas bbq's to use so we

Summary Heading: Highly recommended - great accommodation, staff, and location!
Summary: We have just returned to New Zealand after 9 nights at this hotel, and found this to be an ideal place for families. Our daughter has food allergies which is the reason we looked for a hotel with kitchen facilities - fantastic amenities, the accommodation was very modern and the pool area/games room/golf and bball areas were fantastic. The complimentary breakfasts provided so many options, and the kitchen staff, front desk staff, and housekeeping were so helpful and accommodating. We found it easy getting the shuttle next door to and from disney, and will definately look to re-book next time! Happy to recommend this hotel to friends and family back home. Thank you for a great stay!

This is our 2nd time staying at this hotel, always loved it!! Rooms are clean, very spacious, food is ok (breakfast). Close trip to disneyland and groceries. Will always stay at this hotel everytime we go to Disneyland.

Great hotel only 1 mile from Disneyland, we walked everyday in 15 mins, we could see the fireworks from our hotel windows. The food was great just what you needed to start the day. Suite we was in was better for a younger family (my children are 12, 15, and 17) we could do with 2 bedrooms

Starting with the staff.  Very accommodating and helpful.  Everyone we encountered was pleasant.  We were here for our honeymoon.  They left a nice gift in our room and made sure we could check in early.  As we had traveled all night that was so appreciated.     We took Uber everywhere local. $5 or $6 for us to get to Disney or Angels Stadium. Faster and cheaper than ART.  And direct!  The breakfast is good.   As good or better than any breakfast buffet.  Smart thing is 4 waffle makers.    We enjoyed the evening reception as well.  The room is a standard size studio with a small kitchenette.  Nice bathroom with a good shower and proper lighting.  Comfy bed.  Not the best pillows.    Nice TV with HDMI so we can watch Netflix.   We would stay here again and will recommend to

The room was great! Full size fridge, cooking area. Definitely a place that felt like home. I came in and stayed for business but this is where I would stay the next time I visit for a family vacation. The cleaning staff did an excellent job. Everyday the room looked fresh and welcoming. The front desk staff was absolutely amazing. They provided world-class service. Victoria, Kimberly and Bruce all had personal interactions with myself and co-workers, going above and beyond to make our stay spectacular. They made you feel like family welcoming you into their home. This hotel has some great amenities. The pool area is a relaxing place to come back to after a long day of walking a round and the hot tub really helped relax those aching muscles. Easy walk to Disney and surrounding

I had a wonderful stay at this hotel location.  I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone especially for families.  The rooms are comfortable, CLEAN and cozy. The rooms are also equipped with a kitchen area (Stove top, Refrigerator..etc.) My room had a walk in shower (which I love) and the bed is very comfortable.  The hotel also offers complimentary breakfast and dinner which is a plus for people who have kids.  I'm definitely going back not just for business but for leisure as well.  The staff is wonderful and very friendly!

Summary Heading: A relaxing hotel with a resort-like feel
Summary: We had a wonderful stay at the Homewood Suites. We stayed for 6 nights and had fun at Disneyland and the beach. We loved the outdoor pool and lounge area so much that we spent 2 of our vacation days at the hotel instead of venturing out! Our kids loved the pools, we loved the evening socials and the movies they turned on outside at night. This is an extremely family friendly hotel. Our suite had bunks which made it ideal  for all our kids to have their own bed to sleep in. It was the perfect place to stay for our long vacation!

This is a nice hotel and very convenient.  The shuttle to Disney is just a short walk from the hotel.  The breakfast was good and coffee was great.  The only complaint I had was the housekeeping.  We left in the morning and returned late afternoon to find our room still had not been cleaned.  I called down to the office and continued to be place on hold for several minutes   I finally went downstairs to find a long line of people checking in and no one to help.  We finally found someone to give us towels and gave up on cleaning room.  The bunk beds are hard to get on top bunk.

The front desk staff Antonio was friendly and helpful. The staff who work in the breakfast area were also very accommodating. The rooms were clean and very  spacious. Great place to take the family for our stay.

Summary Heading: Best place to stay for disneyland and family holiday in anaheim
Summary: We stayed for 10 days, very impressed with the very helpful and friendly staff, was very clean and breakfast dinner was great too would recommend to anyone and definatly would come back next time we come to anaheim

Summary Heading: Beautiful new hotel - Great for a race!
Summary: My sister (25) and I (28) were in town for the Disneyland Half-Marathon Weekend. Last year, in Nov. 2015, we stayed across the street but that hotel wanted significantly more this time. I'm very happy we chose Homewood Suites. It was literally brand new and the rooms were very nicely appointed.   We made it for breakfast on Saturday after the 10K and I'm not sure the staff new so many runners would be there! They were very busy but very nice and professional. Breakfast was very good and I highly recommend it!  The hotel does not have room service but it does offer breakfast during the morning (I believe 6:30 - 9:30 AM) and has a dinner service schedule. Due to our early morning wake up (2:30 AM) we ordered lunch and dinner via delivery so we could tuck in early.   Great

The King Suite and King Studio rooms were huge and provided ample space for the family. The dual power sockets on each table lamp were appreciated for all the gadgets that need charging. Loved the fact that coffee and tea were available around-the-clock. The breakfast spread was amazing and so were the themed dinners. The evening movie screening by the pool kept the kids entertained. Even with what appeared to be a full house, the pool was never too crowded.

We had a good experience at this hotel. The staff were super friendly and the buffet was great!! The hotel is a 20 min walk from the main gate (there is a shuttle next door) but the name is a bit misleading. The pool, bbq, hot tub and putting area were very utilized by our family.

My sister and I stayed here for the Disneyland Half Marathon weekend. It was the only hotel close enough to the park that wasn't charging an outrageous amount for three nights. The hotel is practically brand new and the rooms are very spacious and clean. The continental breakfast was a huge plus when we got back from our 10k ready to eat everything in sight! The area surrounding the hotel is extremely walk-able, no need for a rental car. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you were in town for a Run Disney event or just visiting the parks.

We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights during our June US holiday and was surprised at how good it was like many commented here. Large cosy room, free coffee/tea near reception waiting area, bus stop right in front of a next door property and just few stops to Disney, parking is not free, free breakfast and quick dinner meals were okay and no fuss. Will recommend this hotel!

This was our family's first trip to Disneyland. The hotel was clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly and attentive. The location is great, next to Disneyland parking lot with access to free shuttle. The room was bigger than the standard rooms on the Disneyland property and at a great price!

We stayed at the Homewood Suites Anaheim-convention centre for seven nights for our trip to Disneyland.  I definitely recommend this place.  The staff were extremely helpful and accommodating.  The one bedroom suite with the two double beds was plenty big enough and quite comfortable for our family of four.  The breakfast was pretty decent.  There's a fair amount of items to choose from.  Our daughters loved the waffle station.  My only complaint is how busy the dining room gets and how messy it can get.  This isn't really a knock on the hotel because the staff are running around like crazy trying to keep up.  It's more of a complaint against the fellow patrons who are too lazy to clean up after themselves.  How hard is it to clear your table of your dishes?  Especially when you

Great hotel. You can tell they've put a lot of time into creating a "Family" feel with the convenience of a chain. FREE evening social meals throughout the week weere fantastic. Free beer and wine to go with your meal as well! About a 15 minute walk to Disneyland and 7 minute walk to the nearest CVS for shopping. Although we'd never come back to Disneyland if we ever needed to go to Anaheim again we'd stay here in a heartbeat. Fantastic.

Summary Heading: Lovely hotel very close to Disney!
Summary: We always stay at Homewood Suites in Garden Grove but decided to try the new Homewood Suites this year. We had a lovely stay (9 nights) and breakfast was great. When we were checking out the receptionist overcharged us for parking. When I queried this she gave me the money overcharged back. No apologies....nothing. I expected better as I'm sure there have been plenty of other tourists that wouldn't catch on. Because of this experience I think I'll book Garden Grove next year.

Summary Heading: Great value, less than 10 mins from Disney
Summary: We had a fantastic stay at this hotel.  The family friendly facilities were spot-on.  The kids loved the pool. The room was large and comfortable (we had a family room with a king sized bed plus bunk beds).  And the complimentary breakfast and evening social made it extremely good value.  Would 100% recommend!

Will recommend this hotel to anyone heading to Disneyland. Firstly, the location is great. A 15-20min walk to Disneyland. Several restaurants surround the area.  A Disneyland carpark is also next door, so you can always walk in there and catch the bus directly to Disneyland.  The hotel is new. We chose to self-park and easily got a spot. Boomgates protect the carpark for security.  The service was fantastic!! Seriously some of the best staff we've encountered. Professional, but very friendly and helpful.  Our room was fantastic. We had a 1bedroom suite (having been upgraded due to our diamond status).  The suite was spacious, and perfect for a short or long stay.  It had everything you required. I particularly liked that it had a decent range hood in the kitchen!! We generally

We stayed here for two nights in August in order to go to Disneyland.  I could have stayed longer!  The front desk was quite professional and stored our bags.  Our check in could not be moved up but we understood the hotel was busy.  It is very close to Disney and the breakfast buffet was a great way to start our day.  The room was large which is so nice for a family to spread out.  The room was quiet and well decorated.  We could not have asked for more!  Maybe more time to use the pool which looked very inviting!

Summary Heading: Great 1st night but, the second was very noisy.
Summary: Great location, good breakfast and customer service the first day but, have to say something about the noise level through the floors. We could hear a kids gone wild running party above us until 1 AM. We called the front desk and an hour later with loud parents finally intervening it quieted down. I thought the management would say something about our sleepless night but they did not.

I came to this hotel because I had business in the area. It was very busy with families as it close to Disneyland. Despite that fact, the room I had was very quiet. I was towards the back of the property away from the elevators and ice machine. The room was spotless and very roomy. It's also located within walking distance to many restaurants. They do have a breakfast buffet AND an evening buffet, which seemed really popular with the families staying there. I chose to eat breakfast in the room since it's set up with a table and kitchenette and ate out both nights I was there. The staff was friendly and helpful in helping me choose a room. Check in was very fast even though the hotel was busy. Great stay!

Summary Heading: Stole my business from the Candy Cane Inn!
Summary: My family and I have stayed at the Candy Cane Inn for the last 5 years. We decided on this trip to go out on a limb and try a new hotel. We chose Homewood Suites even though they were further from Disneyland than the Candy Cane Inn because they offered a full complimentary breakfast as well as dinner for a cheaper price.   I will say that the Candy Cane Inn has the edge with regards to location and vintage type charm. Also, you don't have to pay to park at the CCI, but as we didn't drive down, that wasn't a factor for us. Parking at this hotel cost $18 a night. Still, I have to admit that we were very impressed with our total experience at Homewood. The grounds were very clean and well lit. It is definitely a newer hotel compared to many of the other hotels around Disneyland.

Love this hotel.  We stayed opening weekend and my kids request it each time we come down, particularly the bunk bed rooms.  The pool is large enough and a large hot tub.  There is half court basketball, and small putting green, and game room.  They show movies at the pool area each night.  This is a great place to stay with kids when traveling in the Anaheim area.  It is also right next to the Toy Story parking lot for Disneyland you walk right around the corner and hop on the shuttle to Disneyland.

The hotel was excellent for our family of four. We loved having the extra space of the lounge room and kitchenette. The walk to Disneyland was only about 15 minutes along the flat, wide path and it was no trouble catching the Disney shuttle home in the afternoon to the carpark next door. The breakfast was lots of pancakes, waffles and cakes - not what we are used to in Australia hotels. The "evening complimentary" could be dinner if you were happy to eat more unhealthy food - hot dogs, sliders, kettle chips. The option to have groceries picked up and delivered free by the hotel staff was an excellent service. We were able to get salad items and a cooked chicken for less than $35 which lasted for 2 lunches and a dinner.   The hotel had a great family feel to it.  We had a great

Great family stay at very clean hotel!  Morning breakfast was excellent and very friendly staff.  Take advantage of the evening socials (complimentary dinner meals Mondays to Thursdays 5-7pm) when possible.

Professional pictures tell true story as this hotel is less than one year old so everything is fresh, new, modern, and clean.   Great location next to Toy Story parking lots and free shuttles to Disneyland.  Was in room 529 facing Disney thus could enjoy fireworks nightly from comfort of lying in bed.   This was my second trip to Anaheim and honestly I enjoy watching fireworks from comfort of the hotel bed far ,far ,far more than straining neck to stare up at fireworks in the park while fight the mobs and mobs and mobs of people.  Large rooms with small kitchen providing free teas and things of that nature. Quality products provided including soap (nuetrogena), large fridge, dish soap to wash dishes.  Nice place to relax pool side in the evenings.  Bought tickets here for disney

Letty was very friendly and helpful. This whole Resort is absolutely fantastic. Great location and convenient to shuttle services. Pool and Hot tub and evening movies,Monday-Thursday, very nice. Breakfast and evening social is wonderful.
Manager Response: Dear debrahV6180BY,  Thank you so much for letting us know what you enjoyed your stay here at our hotel. We cannot wait to welcome you back.   Sincerely, Melissa F.

Summary: Loved it!!  Excellent 2 queen bed suite!  Very comfortable room and beds. Lots of electrical outlets for charging devices, good water pressure on the shower, great full kitchen!! Since we were only there 2 nights, we declined housekeeping service since we had enough towels for the 2 of us.  Really liked the neutragena soaps, shampoo, and conditioner in the bathroom. Kudos to Victoria at the front desk. She is real sweetheart, very friendly and customer oriented.  Really enjoyed the breakfast and happy hour/dinner.  Excellent dinner.   Tuesday night I had 2 complimentary glasses of wine with my chicken strips, salad, veggies, and potato wedges.  Then a quick 20 minute walk ( no I didn't stagger) back to California adventure and I got my best score ever on Toy Story Midway Mania!!
Manager Response: Dear Dawn S,  Thank you so much for taking the time to review our hotel. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay. Also, thank you for mentioning our new Front Desk Supervisor Victoria, we are absolutely proud to have her as a part of our Homewood Family. We cannot wait to welcome you back.  Sincerely, Melissa F.

Summary: My family & I enjoyed our stay so much that we will definitely be returningüòä   We got a better night's sleep than we do at home.    The staff were friendly, informative & helpful. The pools were great, as was the barbecue. The breakfast was delicious & I wish we'd made it in time for the evening reception.
Manager Response: Dear Nikki J,  A big thank you for such a kind review! We would love to be your Home away from Home when in the Disneyland Resort Area. Feel free to contact me directly to book your next stay. Until next time!!  Sincerely, Melissa F.

Summary: Hotel room was clean and spacious.  A bit of a walk to Disney, but we took the shuttle.  Breakfast was pretty good, but gets very busy and sometimes the staff is a bit slow in refilling the food.  We had a bit of a problem with the heat/ air con controller as it did not work properly and called 3 times for it to get fixed and it was never resolved.  Hard to sleep when cold air is constantly blowing on you.  Housekeeping also hardly every gave us face towels as we had to call down almost everyday for them.  Otherwise a good hotel when visiting Disney.
Manager Response: Dear JGL88,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. I would like to apologies for the issues with the HVAC unit. Please reach out to me at Melissa.ferree@Hilton.com to give me further information. We absolutely intend to make this right.  Sincerely,  Melissa F.

Summary: Originally booked a Disney hotel but after receiving an email from Hilton with a 25% discount, I researched every hotel in the area and Homeward Suites lived up to the hype. Rooms were clean, all staff was very nice. It was an easy walk to the Toy Story Parking lot to get a Disney Shuttle.  Room was a suite (which I believe most are) so that was really nice for people like me who get up earlier then everyone else! We had a "Disney view" room which would have been good for fireworks, however we were never in the room at that time. Pool area was nice, and free breakfast was good.  We will be back for sure!
Manager Response: Dear BEH2965,  Thank you so much for taking a chance on us. We are beyond thrilled that Hilton Hhonors Members are taking advantage of the Stop Clicking Around Promotion. When you come back feel free to reach out to me.  Sincerely, Melissa F.

Summary: Hotel is great.  But beware of shuttle.  This property relies on the ART shuttle service.  This is a very unreliable service and is never on time.  Not to mention they like to take frequent "breaks" after being substantially late.  This is tough to manage with kids.
Manager Response: Dear Kevin W,  First I want to take the time to apologies for the experience you had with the Anaheim Resort Transit (ART Shuttle). This is not managed by the hotel so I have passed along your concerns to them. Being that you were our guest, I would like you to reach out to me in the future to make sure you are well taken care of. We look forward to being of assistance.  Sincerely, Melissa F.

Summary Heading: Oh how I loved this place
Summary: Walked into the room and it smelt brand new. There's a lot of space for a family of six, the blankets and pillows were brand new, and the full kitchen was well stocked. Where this hotel really shines is the morning breakfast and nightly socials. I'm a travel writer so I take the family along with me when I go on these trips, and this was the first hotel where my husband was happy thanks to the nightly snacks and free beverages. The pool area is big, has a fire pit and BBQs, and so relaxing. They offer nightly movies, mini golf, and a basketball court too. Although parking is not included in the nightly rate you save money by leaving your car in the lot and walking to the Toy Story Parking Lot. I will definitely be back to stay at this Homewood.
Manager Response: Dear MrsShellyW,  We are thrilled we could impress such a well traveled person. We absolutely pride ourselves by the amenities we offer, as well as our guests' experience. We cannot wait to welcome you back! Feel free to reach us anytime!  Sincerely, Melissa F.

Summary: Great stay, awesome staff!! Thank you Kristy and Melissa for making the experience easy and classy!  Very clean rooms, many amenities. A all you can eat breakfast that was delicious! Highly recommended.
Manager Response: Dear Sammy G,  Thank you for taking the time to write us a review. I invite you to email or call me next time you are thinking of coming back to Disneyland!  Sincerely, Melissa F.

Summary: We stayed here from June 25th-July 2nd and had an amazing time. The hotel is pretty new and located within walking distance to Disneyland. We took our 1 yr old son for his first trip to Disneyland and were able to walk to the park each morning in about 10 mins. The staff at the hotel were amazing and very friendly. There is free breakfast offered every morning, but it gets crowded quickly. There is also a nice pool, basketball court, arcade and putting green. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the area. Can't wait to return.
Manager Response: Dear RobertT0729,  We are so honored you picked us to be part of such a wonderful memory. The first time to Disneyland is so magical and to be part of that is really a compliment. We are happy we lived up to the expectations. One small tip for next time though is to come down to breakfast before 8:30 am. Typically our busiest times are from 8:30 am to 9:30 am (closing). Please feel free to reach out to me to book your next stay.  Sincerely, Melissa F.

Summary Heading: Great hotel within 15 minute walk of Disneyland
Summary: This hotel is very nice. The had a large offering for their continental breakfast as well as a large seating area. The rooms were very clean and very nice. The suite was spacious with a nicely stocked kitchen.  The pool are was extremely nice. They had a large pool, kiddie pool, hot tub, basketball court, putting greens, game room and outdoor kitchen with 3 grills. There was plenty of seating as well as an outdoor fire area.
Manager Response: Dear ihawkfan,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are thrilled you enjoyed everything from the rooms to our complimentary breakfast buffet and then our Suite Outdoors area. We await the chance to welcome you back. Feel free to reach out to us to book your next stay!  Sincerely, Melissa F.

Summary: It was beautifully designed- classy, wonderful layout. Christian helped us at the front desk. Because of his suggestion, we upgraded to a quieter suite (room 417). The beds however, need to be replaced. I only weigh 95 pounds, and I got in bed and it felt like a hammock. The full breakfast was impressive and even included chicken enchiladas. The day manager Ben Lee was exceptional and very responsive to our needs. I would recommend staying here- especially if you are a family.
