Manager Response: Dear M7Maguire,  Thank you for giving us such a glowing review. Christian and Ben are knocking out this customer service thing like no others! We cannot wait to welcome you back to your new Home away from Home. Feel free to call us to get you a great room at a great rate!  Sincerely, Melissa F.

Summary: What a wonderful hotel, for the value you can not go wrong. Would stay again in a heart beat. Friendly staff, great rooms, great food. All together my family could not have asked for anything more from our resent stay
Manager Response: Dear V8063FYbrianc,  Thank you so much for the great grade! We are thrilled to be top of the class with you and we invite you to reach out to us in the future to book your next stay  Sincerely,  Melissa F.

Summary: Stayed for 2 nights while visiting Disneyland. The hotel is relatively new and very clean. A great location right next to the shuttle car park for the theme parks. The rooms are very good and have lots of space, beds are super comfy. Front desk staff are also very friendly and helpful. My only small complaint was the quality of the food in the breakfast buffet. It was a bit tasteless and very processed. Other than that this is a great hotel and we would definitely stay again.  NB: you can buy tickets to Disneyland and charge them to your room, very handy.
Manager Response: Dear Domoliscious,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. While you enjoyed our customer service and found our rooms to be well maintained, we always welcome feedback. Rest assured, we will be reviewing the items served at breakfast to see how we can incorporate more fresh flavors. We hope next time you stay with us you will find every aspect wonderful. We cannot wait to welcome you back!  Sincerely, Melissa F.

Summary: Perfect service, very good free breakfast, and right next to Toy Story parking lot so you can walk in to that lot and take the free tram back and forth.  We did a 3-day park-hopper pass which included an early morning.  So that morning we walked the whole way as Toy Story lot wasn't open yet.   If memory serves it was about a 10-15 minute walk with my 9-year old.  In particular I was happy with check-in.  I got in crazy early due to my flight from Maui.  Think I arrived at the hotel around 8 am.  I asked if they could hold my bags and check me in during the day or just hold the bags until I got back that night from the resort.  They had a room and let me check in right then!  It was great to get a hot shower in after a long day in Maui followed by an overnight flight.  Also the
Manager Response: Dear Nabil M,  Thank you so much for showcasing how we really try to get our guests in early. When possible, and availability allows, we will always try to get our guests in. We hope to see you and your family next time you come to the Anaheim area. Until then, we will be happy to be your home away from home!  Sincerely, Melissa F.

Summary: Catching an early flight to LAX we arrived at the hotel very early in the morning with only the expectation of getting our luggage held at the hotel until regular check-in time. The front desk tried to find us a room for a very early check-in, however there were no rooms of our reservation type ready. They did try to accommodate us, and were very welcoming.   The hotel is located just a block away from the Woody Toy Story shuttle and we took advantage of this every day. Another plus is that this free shuttle runs every couple of minutes, so we never had to wait for a ride.   Breakfast each morning was great, they changed breakfast choices daily. The free appies/snacks for the Monday to Thursday social evenings could be considered a dinner. The night we ate there, the buffet had
Manager Response: Dear Bonnie L,  Thank you so much for taking the time to review our hotel. We are happy you found all of our amenities useful; from breakfast, dinner, home office, and our location. We cannot wait to welcome you back. Feel free to reach out to us to get you the best rates possible.   Sincerely, Melissa F.

Summary: The Homewood suites, in Garden Grove has a good location to a lot of stores, restaurants and them parks. The staff, worked hard and they should all be commended. We all know about the plethora of items offered for breakfast and this Homewood did not disappoint.

Summary Heading: Excellent stay for Disney and surrounding areas!
Summary: Very clean hotel.  Great breakfast in the morning.  Walkable to Disneyland.  My wife, 21 month old and I enjoyed our 5 day stay.  Extremely friendly and welcoming staff, from the front desk to the breakfast servers to housekeeping.  Well done Homewood Suites Anaheim!
Manager Response: Dear George Y,  Thank you so much for the kind words. We hope to welcome you and your growing family year after year. Please feel free to contract me directly to start a tradition of making this your Home Away from Home.  Sincerely,  Melissa F.

Summary Heading: New hotel with excellent service and facilities
Summary: 2 words - highly recommended!  This hotel is fantastic.  It is relatively new (and therefore very clean and fresh), in a close enough location to the parks and the staff are always willing to help.  The food at complimentary breakfast and evening social (5-7pm Monday to Thursday) are good, and the beer in the latter is fantastic.  The pool area is awesome.  Never over crowded - with beds and towels a plenty by the poolside.  The hot tub is really refreshing.  The BBQ is a bonus, which seemed to have availability most of the time and the hotel provide grilling utensils so you need only the food and you are good to go.  All are open until 10pm which is great after a long day in the parks.  If like us you had no car, you won't miss it as the parks, shops and decent restaurants are

Summary Heading: Disney fanatics, close to Disney bus transportation, enjoyed hot breakfast,social hour was great
Summary: But limited on alcoholic drinks , our family of 11 would stay again we saved quite a bit of money due to having breakfast & light dinner provided in hotel stay & was able to take food to suites and save in a full size refrigerator

Before making a reservation for this hotel,  I had thoroughly checked out the other options which included the Marriott Residence Inn, Doubletree and Hyatt that were all located across the road from the Homewood Suites. We were very pleased with our choice. We were a family of 5 and had booked  suites - 1 double double queen bed 1 bedroomed suite and one king size suite.  They were both great. Plenty of space to spread out and the kitchen was great - even though we didn't use them - it is great to have a full size fridge and microwave and a 2 ring hob. Breakfast was good but as per other guests comments can get very busy with lots of families. One of the receptionists was extremely helpful - we think her name was Gwyn! But all staff were extremely friendly and efficient.

Rooms were spacious and clean. Housekeeping service was very promptly perfect. Everyone in my family including kids just loved the hot breakfast. Daily parking available on fair rate. I wish to have shuttle to Disneyland....

This hotel is wonderful. Clean, spacious rooms with kitchen facility. Gorgeous pool & pool area. Staff are friendly, courteous & extremely helpful - reception, breakfast, cleaning & pool area staff. Next door to a Disney car park where you can get a shuttle bus to the parks or a 15 minute walk away. Short walk to Garden walk - plenty of restaurants. I would recommend & go back to this hotel.

I'm not a kid person and to say that visiting Anaheim is not my favorite place for business is an understatement.  This hotel managed to balance the business/family flow flawlessly.  The hotel is new - the ONLY issue that I noticed is that housekeeping left a pile of linens outside of the laundry room overnight.  Other than that - friendly staff, awesome pool, great FREE breakfast and dinner, and no noise between rooms.

This hotel was awesome.  The complimentary breakfast was delicious and was above and beyond most complimentary breakfasts.  The staff was courteous and helpful. Overall I was very impressed for the price!

This was a great hotel for our family of 4. We stayed in the 1 bedroom suite so that our 1 year old had some space to crawl around. It was nice because the room was a corner room. We were able to shut the door and let the kids sleep after a long day at Disneyland while the adults stayed in the living room to wind down before bed. Getting to Disneyland takes about 15 minutes if you take the shuttle from the Toy Story parking lot right next door. You can also walk to the park which is about a 20 minute walk (we also did this one night and the walk wasn't bad at all). The breakfast was great.... try to get there before 9:00am to beat the rush. The only downside I can think of was the fact that I can hear our neighbors footsteps above but it definitely would not deter me from

Summary Heading: This place has thought of everything
Summary: So you know those hotels you go to and all they have is a bed and a TV? This is not that place. Hilton has outdone themselves with their level of hospitality found at this hotel. First, and most important for us, was its proximity to Disneyland; with the right room you an view the fireworks display from your room.   So I know what you're thinking when you look at the price and believe me, I understand. But let me tell you what you get: a nice, large, clean room. We chose a 1 bedroom that has 2 queen beds and a sofa sleeper. This room has a living room area, a kitchen with table and chairs, a large bathroom with tub and shower and huge bedroom with beds, dresser, closet, TV and safe. Oh and there is another TV in the living room.   Our kids loved the large pool, plus the kid's

Other people have written glowing reports about the Homewood Suites Anaheim Convention Center.  Those reports are true. This is a fantastic hotel for families.  Not only are the facilities great, but the staff are all wonderful as well. Our family of 10 stayed for one week (August 3 - 10 ) at this Homewood Suites. We had 3 one bedroom suites.  As many before us have commented, the suites were spacious, clean and comfortable.  The kitchen with a full sized fridge was very useful.  The beds were comfortable.  The location was ideal for Disneyland and other attractions. The pools were great. The breakfast room was spacious and accommodated everyone comfortably.  The breakfast was plentiful with lots of choices, well prepared and well presented.  The food was constantly being

We stayed for 4 nights in a kids suite. We wanted to be close to Disney, ideally within walking distance and stay in a chain where we know what we are getting. The room was more spacious than expected - we had really wanted a two bedroom apartment but these seem scarce and overpriced elsewhere in Anaheim. Our family, two adults and kids aged 17 and 15 had plenty of space for luggage (4 large cases worth). To get to Disney you have 2 choices - walk the 15 minutes down the road or walk next door to the Toy Story parking lot and take the free bus to Disney. Breakfast was good and not overcrowded and the hotel was immaculately clean and tidy. Having had a look at some of the other hotels we considered I would stay at the Homewood Suites if visiting again. Parking was free although I

Christian at the front desk was great! The hotel was awesome. A lot of great amenities for families. Could make changes to some breakfast items but overall great stay. Very close to Disneyland. About a $5 uber ride. Very convenient.

Summary Heading: New Hotel with great customer service from the Top down and nice amenities
Summary: We researched a lot before choosing this hotel, and we are really glad we chose it. There was a few hiccups during our stay but the overall experience was still just great. I would say the areas of improvement that are slightly needed are with housekeeping. Our room wasn't ready when we first arrived and we waited well over an hr, we went to the front desk and it still wasn't ready. I asked if they could just switch us to a different room that was ready and they did, so we finally were able to check in. We ended up hearing loud footsteps till 3am in the room above us so the 1st night wasn't so great. I asked the front desk reservations supervisor if she could possibly see if there was a room like ours on a top floor so we wouldn't have to listen to foot steps again. She was not

Visited and stayed at the Homewood Suites by Hilton Anaheim resort/Convention Center for family mini VACAY and dropping son off to University.  NOTE: When making reservations, make sure you select the correct Homewood Suites in Anaheim. Their are 2:  1.  Homewood Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center (This is where I stayed)  2.  Homewood Suites by Hilton Anaheim - MainGate Area.   One of the BEST hotels my family and I have stayed at. The location is prime. Centered around Disneyland, Angel Stadium, Convention Center, Dining, shopping establishments, etc.  Upon arrival, the staff at the Homewood Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort/Convention Center greeted me with Exceptional service. The Checkin process was smooth, parking was seamless ($16.00 daily) which was worth

We stayed here for 9 nights.  It was our first time at this hotel and we were very impressed and happy with our stay.   There were so many extras with this Homewood Suites that were a great bonus ... in addition to the breakfast and evening reception -  the putting green, basketball area, movies played at night by the pool. The hotel was also very clean and the rooms had lots of space.  Ours was a 2 queen bed studio and was big enough for us.  The only thing lacking was a dresser but we improvised !! It is a short walk to the Toy Story parking lot which we took to Disneyland.  They run every couple of minutes so there is no waiting.

Good family hotel; room was large, I was disappointed that it wasn't a 2 room suite.  Room was clean and nice evening reception with soup and better selection than Embassy.  But no mixed drinks; only wine and  beer. A lot of family with kids. Not ideal for couple but I will book again when travelling with our kids.

This hotel is an excellent family choice.  Our family of 4 enjoyed eveything.  The pool is great.  The breakfast is amazing.  The evening dinner is very healthy.  The staff is so friendly and helpful.  What really makes this hotel excellent is it's location.  It's right next to the Disney Toy Story parking lot so in a five minute walk you can catch a free shuttle that takes you right to the Disney gates.  The shuttles run from early morning until midnight.   Saved 25 minutes of walking to the park.  The only downside to all the resort hotels os their proximity to groceries.   But if you need the basics (snacks and water for the park) there's a CVS up the road about 10 min walk and soon to open Walgreens across from that.  By the way ... we bought our Disney souvenirs at CVS and

Summary Heading: Excellent accommodation option close to Disney
Summary: We stayed at the Homewood with our two young children for a week in August. I can not speak highly enough of this hotel. The rooms are spacious and clean. Beds are super comfy. It is quiet and easy to relax here. The only noise you will get in the evening is the sound of the fireworks at Disneyland! We had a room facing the toy story parking lot and we were lucky to see the fireworks from our window every night!  Breakfast was great, different options every morning. We also ate at the evening social function most evenings which is set in the breakfast area and is also a great facility after a massive day at the theme parks. It's an easy 5 minute walk to the toy story car park which has a free shuttle to the Disney parks. The shuttle doesn't open until after 8am, so if you are

If you are visiting Anaheim then stay here! We visit Anaheim once a year. We have always stayed at a similar suite style resort. Where we have stayed for the past 8 years was getting run down so we wanted to try some where new. This new place caught our eye. We booked a family suite with the bunk beds and it was perfect. The breakfast was a great start to our day and the evening social hour an added bonus. All of the amenities from the pool to fitness room to the mini golf area were perfect. Every staff member we interacted with was pleasant and helpful. This hotel is our new favorite place to stay in Anaheim and we will be returning for sure!

The hotel was great. We had a room with bunk beds for the kids which was perfect. They didn't have to share a bed and there is a pull out bed under the bunk bed, so you can sleep 3 kids in there. You add that, plus the king bed and the sleeper couch, the room can accommodate a large family or multiple families.   The waffle bar was great to have. The other food offered was okay; typical buffet style food. I can complain too much cause it was free. Make sure you get down to breakfast early to avoid the crowd.   The evening social was a light meal. We definitely still ended up getting food when we went back to Disneyland to supplement our meal.   The hotel is located right next to the Disneyland Toy Story parking lot. We were able to take advantage of the location and walk over to

I stayed here for work, and I enjoyed it so much that this will be where I stay from now on when I'm in the area for business or family trips. The rooms are clean and modern, it is free to self park, and the staff is very helpful. My only wish is that there were more fresh fruit options for breakfast. Stop at a Trader Joes on your way to the hotel to grab some, and store them in the full size fridge in your room.

Summary Heading: Great Location...Great Place To Stay For Disneyland Visit
Summary: Stayed at this hotel for a week in the middle of August.  Arrived early in morning and staff was able to put us in a room by 10:00 am.  Staff was very friendly, the room was immaculate and we had a great view of the fireworks at night.  Pretty good breakfast and the evening socials were not bad and included beer and wine.  If you are going to Disneyland, this is the place that I would recommend.

Summary Heading: Newly Renovated, Great Location, Excellent Service
Summary: I travel alot, especially to the Anaheim CA area, sometimes with family, sometimes without. Would stay here over and over again with my family without hesitation. I'm extremely picky on hotels (cleanliness issues), and this one met my approval/satisfaction even.

Where do I start...  My family gave me a big thumbs up for choosing this hotel. From the outside the hotel looked like a modern condo/apartment complex. On the inside, they did a great job with the decor, textures, and colors. They took care of the little details that shows how much they care about the design.   We stayed in a 1-bedroom, 2-queen bed suite. This suite had a kitchenette that was equipped with a microwave, dishwasher, refrigerator, sink and disposal. They also provide dishes and cups in the kitchen cabinets.   The living room had a sofa bed that comfortably sleeps two. There was a television in the living room.   The bedroom and bathroom area was separated from the living room. There was a television in the bedroom. (Both rooms had their own A/C). The vanity was

The room was very spacious, nicely appointed and clean. The full kitchen was really nice to have. All the staff we encountered were pleasant and helpful. Every staff member greeted us warmly. The breakfast exceeded our expectations and was better than most free hotel breakfasts. There is an offsite parking lot for Disneyland right next door and we were able to take the bus (only a 5 minute trip) from there for free. The only negative of our entire stay was that the $16/day parking charge was not mentioned either in the reservation or the check-in process. I noticed it on the bill when we checked out. I didn't feel the charge was unreasonable given the location, but it should have been mentioned. That being said, we would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: New, clean, very good of kind
Summary: Close to convention center. Good but not great breakfast buffet.  Early evening light dinner/snacks mediocre. Room was clean.  Good for families or other who intend to cook some meals.   Front staff was quite friendly. Hotel is big and my room was a far walk from entrance. It would have been more convenient to be closer to front of the hotel.

So far this is the perfect hotel were looking for its all complete..the hotel satisfy our needs..staff were very accomodating..breakfast and light supper is a bonus..my kids enjoyed the pool, free movie in the evening

Loved the location of this hotel. Staff was friendly and very helpful. Breakfast was great and the light dinner was a great way to save money rather than eating at the parks. It was great being close to the parks within walking distance or taking the disney shuttles back after a long day. Our family studio suite was very clean and quiet. Nice views of the pool area. Nothing was run down in the hotel other than the back elevators could use a cleaning once in a while. Sorry I should have reported it to the staff and I am sure it would have been taken care of. If we are back in the area I will not hesitate to stay here again.

Summary Heading: Contact Melissa Ferree for a wonderful stay BE SURE TO REQUEST 2010 S Harbor location
Summary: We were a group of friends with children on our way to San Diego. Some had flown into LAX so we decided to spend one night here instead of driving with the kids to San Diego after they had been on a 5 hour flight that morning. This hotel was exceptional. The prices are a bit higher than we expected, but we figured it was because of the excellent location and proximity to the freeway. Our rooms each had a king bed and 2 bunk beds. There was a sleep sofa, but no one used that. The room comes with a full kitchen, fridge and a full living area. We didn't have time to use all those amenities as we arrived after dinner and left after breakfast (which was included) The hotel was very clean and modern. The breakfast deserves a review of it's own!  There was everything you could ask for

Great location for the convention center. convenient location to the following: .5 mile walk to Anaheim Convention Center. .5 mile walk to CVS Store for snacks, drinks etc. 1.0 mile to Disneyland  1.0 mile to Anaheim Gardenwalk Shopping center

Fabulous hotel, great suite. Comfy beds, practically a full kitchen and full size fridge.  Very clean room and hotel. Television in both rooms, nice towels, had a view of the Disney fireworks. Perfect trip!

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disneyland
Summary: We booked last minute for this hotel as there weren't any rooms available until a couple days before our stay as this is a very popular hotel in Anaheim.  The hotel is very new which also means it's still very clear and well organized.  We tried to check-in early but there weren't any rooms ready yet so we headed to Disney.  We tried back at 2pm and out room still wasn't available but the front desk was nice enough to give us keys to the pool area.    The pool is nice clean and well laid out.  There are bathrooms in the back which were clean and very roomy.  There is no shower in them but was a nice area to be able to change into our suits.  There is a main pool that can easily hold 70 people plus a kiddie pool that is about 10'x10'.  The temperature of the pool was perfect for

Summary Heading: Great hotel, made even better by amazing staff!
Summary: My husband and I have travelled quite a bit for business over the years, and have stayed at some very nice, fancy hotels. I have to say that 4 and 5 star hotels have nothing on this Homewood Suites! We recently stayed there for a week. My husband had a 3 day conference to attend (which was only a short 5 minute walk away), and my 5 year old son and I came with him for a vacation. We were not disappointed! The staff at this hotel are amazing! I know that it's their job to be helpful and friendly, especially with kids because they are only a couple blocks from Disneyland, but the staff members that we saw every day really went above and beyond what they had to. They treated my 5 year old son with such kindness and patience.   We stayed in a one bedroom suite, and stopped at the

Summary Heading: Great family hotel near Disneyland in Anaheim, close to Huntington Beach
Summary: Awesome staff were always very helpful and friendly (day or night); our family was there for PGF Nationals fast pitch softball tournament.  They provide a great breakfast and dinner during the week.  Having a kitchen area available in our room was great as well.  Limited onsite parking, but love that it required key card for entry.

Very nice hotel but beware if you want peace and quiet look elsewhere. The room has a full kitchen, sink, microwave, refrigerator. Standup shower. We arrived early so we were given a room close to elevators. The problem with that is by being close to the ice maker we heard doors slam all night long. There were kids running through the halls all night. I was actually woken up at 3 am due to the noise.

I would recommend this hotel for your trip to Disneyland.  Great location, convenient shuttle.  Nice clean roomy suite.  Comfortable quiet and safe.  Very enjoyable staff always helpful from recommendations, directions and meeting individual requests such as Fireworks view room, extra rollaway bed and late check out.

GLC 2016  We had an incredible time everything was amazing!   We're looking forward to coming again!   Only suggestion is that maybe there's a need for more parking.    The cookies at night are very nice touch.

Very close to Disney, we walked to toy story lot and rode shuttle to park.  Room was spacious and hotel is in brand new condition.  Breakfast was ok, but very busy.  Evening social was very good, great selection and complimentary wine and beer.  I would recommend staying here.

Summary Heading: Family fun and a quality stay!
Summary: Comfortable, clean and close to activities! The front desk staff was great and the place looked very inviting. With a family of six, there was not one complaint in our group, of this hotel. The complimentary breakfast was top notch as well.

This hotel is in great location.  It is next to the parking lot of Disney so you can just walk to the Disney parking and take the Disney shuttle to the parks.  The hotel just 2 big blocks from the parks.  Hotel offers great hot breakfast, the only thing is that they offer it from 6-10am and by 9:30 they are removing everything. Rooms are big and very comfortable. Kitchen has everything since microwave, stove, dishes, pans for cooking, dishwasher, big refrigerator etc.

Summary Heading: Roomy, Contempory Hotel close to Disney
Summary: A suite hotel with a kitchen and separate bedroom. Don't worry one does not need to cook. We enjoyed a tasty breakfast every morning. Juanita and the dining staff in addition to the manager were extremely helpful. Monday through Thursday evening we enjoyed a light evening meal. The pool area was very relaxing and the hotel has a nice area for laundry. Some rooms on the 5 th floor even offer a partial view of Disney Fireworks! A hotel that was accommodating for the very young to the senior citizen and everyone in between.

Great location within walking distance of Disneyland,  restaurants,  and shops. Staff are friendly and extremely helpful.  Place clean and inviting.  Staff members,  Hon, Julieta, Irene, Brittany, and others were absolutely wonderful.

Summary Heading: Perfect location to convention center. Perfect stay!
Summary: Stayed here during Siggraph convention.  Perfect location.  Staff excellent as was breakfast.   Evening reception was also a plus.   Will stay here again.  Great beds. Clean and comfortable.  Would recommend without hesitation.

This hotel was ideal for our Disney trip. The Toy Story parking lot is right next door which means frequent free shuttles. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful and we enjoyed cooling off in the pool. Some families were even having a BBQ by the pool. Very nice!! We only wished the breakfast hot food had been even a little bit better. (Various egg preparations were worse than airplane food. Disgusting.) That said, there's plenty love about this hotel - including the kitchenette, so you can prepare your own:)

this hotel is on the main street by Disneyland and there are a lot of hotels.  The hotel is nice and clean.  They offer a free breakfast in the morning.  Room was nice and updated and clean.   No complaints.   Staff at the front desk were very nice and friendly.  Would definitely stay here again if in the area.

We spent one night here. July 28th 2016. I cant say enough about how perfect the hotel is. It's brand new and spotlessly clean. The breakfast was ample, and the evening cocktail hour was nice. Ice cold Stella Artois on draft along with some wine went well with the complimentary grilled burgers and chicken sandwiches. The hotel has a putting green and basketball court along with a nice pool / outdoor fire pit. Christian at the front desk went above and beyond to help us.

Pros: Staff is most accommodating, no matter how big or small the request.  Suites are well equipped.  Bed/bedding was good.  Always left extra towels.  Suite was clean, housekeeping was through.  Breakfast was okay.  Evening snacks (more like a small meal) was decent.   Cons: Room was not ready at check in time. We told 45 minutes, then 25 more minutes then not ready for another 20 (ready at 4:25).  This is a solid run property.  It is a fair walk to Disneyland, 20 to 30 minutes, but lots of transport options near by.  Was a very pleasant and comfortable stay.

My family and I stayed there 8 days, we felt very welcoming, the staff was super nice, we had a little issue with the cleaning of the room, but we talked to the supervisor and they were so nice to help us resolve it. The manager and staff were willing to help us out on our stay. Very appetizing breakfast and dinner. The manager is very friendly, he would come up to us all the time to great us and he did that with every person at the hotel. He takes care of any issues you have. I highly recommend this hotel. Well centered place, close to restaurants, gas stations, and about 3 blocks away from Disney. Very comfortable room , with kitchen, living room, well spaced living room and bed room. I would come back to this hotel when I visit California for the next years.

This was a wonderful choice for our family's DisneyLand vacation.    Great location!  - It was a nice 20 min walk to Disney's gates (with small kids + stroller). - It was also very easy to take a Disney Toy Story bus if you aren't up to the walk.  Terrific Food! - Breakfast quality was wonderful and kept very clean and well stocked. - Night time snacks were a great addition. We were able to make the "snacks" our dinner for two nights during our stay!  Clean & Friendly! - The staff was very welcoming and friendly. - The hotel was obviously busy with many families but was still kept very clean.  This was super impressive!

Absolutely loved this hotel. The morning breakfast was great, and we truly enjoyed the evening social that was provided Monday through Thursday. Everybody there was extremely kind and willing to do anything to make our stay perfect. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: Homewood suites staff made our vacation memorable
Summary: The staff was so very friendly from the minute we called with questions till checkout. We are definitely staying here again. Despite other guests being rude and demanding, the staff remained calm and courteous.

My family and I from New Zealand recently stayed at the Homewood Suites as part of our holiday in the USA It was easily the best accommodation that we encountered during our stay and would have no hesitation in returning at our next visit, staff , facilities , dining, service and advice .. fantastic !!!

Stayed here for three nights as the family went to Disneyland.  The rooms were very spacious for a family of four and were very clean as the hotel is fairly new.  We walked to the Toy Story Parking Lot both days we were at Disney and had not issues.  Staff was very friendly and our boys enjoyed the basketball court.  Breakfast was good.  I would definitely recommend this hotel.    The one con is the $16 a night Peking fee, but with such great access to Disney parking it was worth it.

Truly recommend.  We were extremely satisfied with everything, made our stay feel like we were at home.  Close by to everything.  Complimentary breakfast was great.  Room service and cleaness was great.  Recommend worth evey penny.

Stayed here with my son and some friends, the hotel is very new and clean, friendly staff, great breakfast and evening reception (with beer and).  The location is great and right next to Disney (Toy Story) parking lot with free bus ride to the parks! It's about a $6-$8 Lyft ride to Disney if you don't want to do the 5 min walk to the bus stop Nice pool, spray ground, arcade room and hot tub (didn't need this one since it was mid 90s everyday) Had a few minor problems with our AC and room location, Christian at the front desk went out of his way to make them right, even though the hotel was full.

A group of 12 people share 2 suites for 6 nights. Adjoining rooms were clean and quiet. All employees were helpful and smiling. The hot breakfast and evening meal saved us at least $120 a day. We had fun in the pool and playing basketball and mini golf. Enjoyed every minute of our stay.

Great location; walking distance to Disney Park(s). Room was a decent size and well kept although shower did leak a bit onto the bathroom floor.  Room had a kitchen area, sofa area (sofa folded out to extra bed) and 2 doubles.  Pool area small but nice.  Extensive morning breakfast (included) with seating inside and out.  Tended to be busy some mornings but a good selection that varied a little bit each day over our 4 day stay.  Parking on site available (extra). Coffee/tea available 24/7 was a nice touch.  Friendly staff.  Would recommend.

They are remodeling this hotel so the back elevator is not as nice as the front and the downstairs was kind of messy, but since they were remodeling it can be excused. The hotel's staff was very friendly always welcoming us back from a long day at Disneyland. The shuttle was always right on time! The shuttle cost a total of $89 for an unlimited pass to and from Disneyland's front door for 3 days for 7 people.  The shuttle is air conditioned and the only time it was crowded was when we left at 9PM on the last night which was Friday. The best part of this hotel is the free breakfast which was amazing and the free reception from 4PM to 7PM which we called dinner was fantastic. The beds were comfortable, and the room was clean. The room we stayed was a suite it had a full kitchen,

Summary Heading: Clean and Modern, close to transportation
Summary: This hotel is sharp and clean.  Everything is fresh and new, and it was a pleasure returning here each evening after our Disney days.  The room was actually a bit smaller than I had imagined, we had a one bedroom, but it suited our needs just fine.  The breakfast was good, not great. All 5 days we were there the only breakfast meat was kielbasa/smoked sausage, which I had never seen served anywhere as a breakfast item.  The staff did a prettyn good job keeping the food stocked.  The evening reception food became repetitive as well, but since it's free, no complaints.  The hotel is about a 15-20 minute walk, which you would need to do for Magic Mornings, but the Toy Story lot next door will be fine for your regular (8am or later) park opening days.

We stayed here on Monday and Tuesday with our 2 kids for a trip to Disneyland.  We arrived early on Monday around 9:30 am just hoping that we could park are car so we could go to the park.  When I got to the desk, the woman at the front desk said she was actually able to check us in right then.  Wow!  Nice little bonus.  While my husband waited in the car, he got the low down from the bell hop on parking, how to get to Disneyland via the Toy Story lot, and what was around. Great customer service. We stayed in a 2 queen suite. Everything is new and clean. Plenty of room for us, but we were thinking it would be tight if you planned on using the sofa bed in the living room.  Not sure where all the other furniture would be moved to. The breakfast was more than expected.  The area

We had the most amazing 10 days at the hotel from the 20th of June, the the check in to the check out the staff were so helpful, always with a smile on their faces and never a bother to help you with your needs.  The amenities of the hotel are first class, the breakfast, dinner, pool everything.  I would also like to mention Melissa Ferree (CTA Reservations Supervisor Homewood Suites By Hilton Anaheim Resort-Convention Center) she was excellent wit her assistance at making our reservation and making as welcome.  Before you book any other hotel I would really strongly consider booking this one because you will have a fabulous time here.  I can say I will be staying here again and referring my friends and family here.  Thanks Homewood Suites. |

Stayed there for seven nights and our request to be moved to a better view, I think have not been taken seriously. The walking distance to the park as it was claimed in the ad meant more than mile. The food was good though, although dinner time should be extended to 8 pm.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel! Please know that we pride ourselves in our service and amenities and the last thing we want is for someone to leave with the perception that we are average. I assure you that the hotel always attempts to meet the room location requests of all our guests, however there are times when this is just not as feasible as others due to our continuous high occupancy. I am so sorry that you felt we did not take it seriously, as we do take all requests seriously. We will take into account your request for a change of time for our Evening Reception, with a two hour window for this, we feel that 5pm - 7pm time we allow (which includes a complimentary light dinner, beer, wine, iced tea, and lemonade), is the ideal window for most of our guests. We hope we have the opportunity to have you back our guest in the future and you leave feeling we are Outstanding!

Summary: Loved our stay!! It had a resort feel to it! Loved the kiddy pool with movie projection. Valet parking and where assisted with our luggage, impeccable room, free cookies at check-in. Complimentary breakfast. Attentive staff. Extra pillows in room. Bang for your buck!

Our family chose the Homewood Suites for a visit to Disneyland and California Adventure Park and had no regrets. The park(s) was within walking distance (roughly 20 minutes to the entrance) as the hotel was located adjacent to one of the remote parking lots.  Our room was fairly large and had full amenities including a fridge, microwave and kitchen sink in a studio setup. The bathroom was large and had a walk-in shower with glass doors. Wifi was fast and worked well throughout our stay.  The breakfast area was a zoo every day so I would recommend getting there early to avoid the mayhem. They had a variety of hot & cold options, but lacked great choices for a healthy eater. The property also had a fitness center and pool. They also sell beer/wine in the lobby for an affordable

My family stayed at this Homewood property for a family vacation to Disneyland. The staff and property along with the room are the best ever. I will not stay at any other from now on. It is located a little away from the crowds. This is one of the things we liked. We purchased a shuttle pass to get us to the park. Never any problems with the shuttle. The shuttle drivers were great as well. Don't pass up this hotel

Fantastic accommodations; great price and shares a parking lot with Toy Story shuttle to the front door of Disneyland. Great coffee and each room is a suite with a mini-kitchen so that you can maintain family routine. Also has bunk beds (bottom has extra trundle), which our kids liked very much. Rooms are comfy and WIFI is provided. Pool, fitness room, and even mini-golf and basketball court. Staff is very nice as well as helpful and rooms are kept clean.

The hotel was fantastic.  The pool area was wonderful for relaxing in the evenings.  Although we did not have young children with us, the kiddie poolside movie was a very nice touch.  The complimentary breakfast and weekday evening social really helped to cut down on the cost of meals.

My family of four stayed at this hotel last weekend for two night and I really can't think of anything negative to discuss.  My family came in early for a little vacation before I moved on the Thousand Oaks for business.  We stayed in an upper floor family room (with bunk).  Pricy, yes.  But it felt like a good value.  The staff was helpful and the property seemed to run efficiently.  This property is walking distance from Disneyland so you would expect an overflow crowd at breakfast.  No one seemed disappointed both in terms of quality and variety.  Our room was clean and spacious.

Our recent stay at Homewood Suites was great.  The hotel itself is brand new and very nice.  Our room had a kitchen (almost full sized fridge, 2 burners, sink, dishwasher and cabinets full of kitchen supplied and utensils), a dining table, a small living room (sofa bed, coffee table and TV).  The adjoining room had a king sized bed, 2 bunk beds, TV, and a nice bath.  WiFi is free.  I was not expecting that much for the price.  My husband and I have stayed in so many hotels here in Aneheim and I've never once written a review for any of them because it's the usual "pay a lot, get a little" as we've become so accustomed to. After this stay, however, I couldn't wait to review it. I was taken by surprise by how friendly the staff was from the front desk, to the maid we shared an

Extremely comfortable rooms.  Hotel facilities were superb, offering full resort style options. Breakfast was substantial and offered a wide variety of choices. Dinner was a perfect end to a busy and tiring day at Disneyland or by the Pool. Staff were friendly, professional and helpful. I highly recommend this property;.

We went for a quick trip to see a baseball game at Angel Stadium and were fortunate to stay at this hotel.  It was outstanding!  Clean and convenient and great rooms and space.  The thing I noticed most was how friendly the staff was!  In the hallways every employee we walked by smiled, engaged with us and said hello.  Without question we would stay here again.  The market in the lobby was great as we had a kitchenette in our room, a king bed and two bunk beds for the kids which they enjoyed.  Breakfast area was large and well staffed.  Note, breakfast ends at 9:30am which seems a tad early on the weekend, but quality was very good and staff was once again, very friendly.  This hotel and team should be proud of what they are accomplishing in such a short time.  Typically, we

Summary Heading: Great stay at the Homewood Suites
Summary: What a great Hotel to stay in.  Not only are the staff so helpful  especially Antonio, the rooms are spotless, the pool was magnificent and the whole experience perfect for a family. The breakfast facilities are wonderful and the evening complimentary diner great after a big day out doing a tour.

I would stay again, preferably in a higher room away from the exit door. I kept hearing it open and shut, but that's to be expected on the first floor. Room I had was a king bedroom suite, comfortable bed, cute tiny kitchen, and very clean. Loved the breakfast and the dining area as well. Every employee I interacted with was friendly.

Summary Heading: Clean, New & Convenient by Disney Land
Summary: This hotel is brand new, clean, and right next to the Disney Land Parking lot. Our room had a kitchenette and ceiling fan! The mattress/bedding was comfortable. The bathroom is a good size but vanity small. Shower was large and a walk in, not tub combo. We had a view of fireworks from room. There are nice outdoor ammenities: pool, fire pit, outdoor movie, basketball, & putting green. Coffee/tea available in lobby all times, not just breakfast. Breakfast was the typical but fine. Room was surprisingly quiet for being next to a busy road.

We stayed two nights here while visiting Disneyland. We booked a family suite for our family of 6 (2 adults and 4 kids). The room has bunk beds with a trundle, a king size bed, and a separate living room area with a pull out couch. There is a small full size refrigerator and freezer in the room, so we were able to bring lunch meat to make sandwiches to take to the park. Free breakfast was great, and there is also free appetizers during dinner time, but we did not try those. The only issue I had during the stay was the shortage of linens in the room. There were not enough pillows for everyone, and the pillows collapsed into a tiny size when you laid on them. There were also not enough towels for a larger group, but we had brought beach towels and were fine using our own. The

Not sure why this hotel is ranked that high, location is OK, you can take the ART to disney or you can walk to the nearby disney parking and take the shuttle for free (its about 10 minutes walk). Rooms were note cleaned to our satisfaction and there were no towels in the room, we had to call 3 times till finally they actually sent the towels. Staff was not professional and couldn't answer basic questions, also they were not rude but not too nice. When we checked in I asked if we have Disney view when in fact we were facing S Harbor Blvd, when I asked again in the following day the front desk lady told me that you can see some of the fireworks from there also.. needless to say it wasn't true. Breakfast was pretty good. I wouldn't recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Hello Royiabr,  Thank you for the detailed review. We feel terrible that you had a sub-par experience at our hotel. We always strive to give people the best impression of our hotel and staff and it appears you have recognized a couple opportunities for improvement. Please know that we take your comments to heart and will work hard to improve in the meantime and prepare for your next stay with us. We look forward to hopefully having you come back and stay with us again! We will make sure you next visit is better.

Summary: Amazing spot if your attending something at the convention center but don't what stay drowning in it. Totally walkable in about 10mins. Parking is expensive but can looped into your room rate. It's clearly a family property, but as a business traveler I appreciated all the space to spread out for work. My room was a studio with a kitchenette (full fridge, stove, microwave, sink etc).  A desk that doubles as a dining island, a pull out couch coffee table, large counter dresser, king bed. The shower/toilet were separate from the sink which o like. The counter around the sink was uber tight and faucet too close the sink edge so watch thAt do everything doesn't get soaked. The closet with iron is opposite the sink and pretty small. Complimentary breakfast in the large lobby dining

We stayed for 7 days, 4 of us 2 adults, 1 teenager, 1 child. The front desk staff was very friendly and accommodating. We used the online check in and it went smoothly. The 1 bedroom suite was exactly as posted on the website. The pool was salt water and very refreshing and clean as was the hot tub. Towels are provided by the pool. The only con of our stay was housekeeping. It could've been better. Our room was forgotten one day. We had to request towels and toilet paper and our request for the turning on of the dishwasher was ignored once. But our overall experience was very pleasant. Its quite a walk to Disneyland but once we got a hang of the bus shuttle it was very easy.

Summary Heading: The nicest Homewood Suites I have stayed in
Summary: This hotel seems brand new.  The rooms are clean and well decorated.  The location is excellent, within walking distance to  Disneyland.  The pool area is well designed and big enough to handle the size of the hotel.  I've stayed in many Homewood Suites and this was the nicest by far.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the wonderful review! We are thrilled that we reached the top or your list when it comes to Homewood Suites! We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: Loved my room and the amenities. The room was very clean and well kept.  My family enjoyed everything about this hotel. I will be back to stay again, and will advise my friends and family to stay there also.

We had a group of women stay in a 2-queen bed suite. The room was very spacious. We loved the free (delicious) breakfast, and free wine and dinner the nights we were there (Monday-Wednesday). Beds were comfy and it's a short minute walk to the Disney Toy Story parking lot to take the shuttle bus for free. All in all, a great experience and we'd stay again.

Love Homewood and especially this one!  Great location in proximity to Disneyland, free breakfast and large rooms!  Thank you Antonio again for helping on our reservation and for giving us a great room!!  They have  a small putting green, a basketball court, a game room and a large pool, with grills to cook out as well.  You have that wonderful at home feeling when you are there.  I will go back there in a heartbeat.  Everyone, including Valet, were wonderful!   Thank you so much!

What a great place to stay with a family. The hotel was very clean and well staffed. The room we stayed in had 2 queen beds in one room and a pullout bed in the other room with a full kitchen that was stocked with dinnerware. The breakfast menu was different ever morning with a basic but tasty selection. There were 2 ladies that would keep the tables clean and pick up after people left which we noticed many people didn't appreciate. People! Give the hard working  staff a simple thank you or leave them a tip. The lobby area is next to the seating area which makes it pretty big. The lobby has complimentary coffee and tea and the there are 3 computers with printer in the business are. The pool area has a gas fire pit, 3 bbq grills, a separate kiddy pool and hot tub. There is also a

Had a great experience at this fairly new hotel. The complimentary breakfast was a highlight. Extremely good service. Short walking distance to Disney. Even shorter walk to the Disney Toy Story parking lot, from where you can hop on to the free parking shuttles that drop you off at the entrance of the theme parks.

The staff was very helpful and the hotel was exceptionally clean, new,staff friendly(Christian) the nicest young man we have dealt with, very upscale and would highly recommend this hotel, loved it's area.

It's a brand new place with good size rooms, almost complete kitchen, location is not walking distance to DL but it's besides Disney Land parking lot so you can leave the car at the hotel and take free shutle to parks, breakfast is not very tasty but acceptable, if you are not staying right by the parks take advantage of this place while it's still new

Avoid room on first floor. Lots of foot traffic in the first floor hallway. Third floor where we stayed was very peaceful. Elevators were fast. Staff was helpful and polite. Parking seemed to be a little bit scarce but we always found a spot close to our room. Breakfast had good variety. Lots of kids in the hotel. Would recommend for families.

Summary Heading: Staff(John) threatened to call security for no reason. Dirty sofa bed sheets/blanket
Summary: Everything was good until we found that the sofa bed sheets/blankets looked dirty so we called and asked for new ones. They did not come so we called again and they still failed to come after waiting a good amount of time. The 3rd time I called, I said "when are you bringing it, tomorrow?" Then whomever on the staff is named John threatened to call security because he THINKS I cussed.... Like what, absolutely NOT?! I just wanted some new blankets/sheets, and he was threatening to call security. Very disrespectful assumption and horrible staff service. The manager failed to do anything about the situation. I called for sheets/blankets for my family, JOHN acted if I was some sort of criminal. I thought security was for the safety of the people at the hotel, not to threaten people
Manager Response: Hello Ahmad R,  Thank you so much for your detailed feedback. I sincerely apologize for any negative interaction that you experienced. We always strive to have guests have the best possible experience with us and we will make sure to use this comment as a training opportunity for our team. Thank you again for sharing all of your stay details, and we look forward to hopefully accommodating you next time you are in town.

Summary: This was our family's first trip to California and I'm so glad we chose Anaheim.   It was centrally located to so many areas we wanted to visit.   The furthest we drove was an hour to the Santa Monica Pier.   I chose this Homewood Suites hotel based on other reviews and because it's fairly new.  We were not disappointed!!!  It's a beautiful hotel,  clean, very friendly staff and great free breakfast and a week night light dinner reception.  There was a minor issue with our room after we got to it but the front desk staff quickly rectified the situation beyond our expectations.   We ended up in a corner room which was great.   Housekeeping was fantastic... very thorough and honored my request for extra towels,  etc.   (Don't forget to tip housekeeping daily during your stay!

Great location for the Convention Center and to catch Disneyland (Toy Story) Bus to go to the parks.  Rooms was nice, breakfast and happy hour were great. Kid friendly with basketball court, mini golf and movies in the evening for the kids.  Housekeeping could be a little more consistent on the times they come to clean one morning they came at 8am and the other days they came after 3pm. Had to turn them away couple of times because my daughter was taking a nap. :(  I extended stay a day and was told that I was going to get same rate when I checked out was charged a higher rate had to have them redo the invoice. They also called me on the day that I was supposed to check out when I was at Disneyland to ask me what time I was going to check out, I had to tell them I extended it

Wonderful stay for our family vacation. Everyone we met was professional and helpful. We appreciated Melissa for taking our grocery lists and for Ben for shopping for us and having all our groceries placed in our correct rooms.  We loved the warm chocolate chip cookies at the front desk. Food staff did an awesome job, considering we were there over July4th and the hotel was very busy. Food was great, plenty of healthy choices served at both meals. Beds were very comfortable, we slept really well. Halls were quiet. Perfect place to stay.

Great hotel everything was nice. Clean, nice and close to everything. Pool was nice too. Breakfast was great. Alot to choose from. We will be back again soon. Great customer service. Everything up to date.

Summary Heading: Wonderful experience in late June/early July 2016
Summary: Homewood Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort ‚Äì Convention Center has everything we need: wifi, nice hot breakfast, extra space, sitting and dining area, full kitchen, and a safe. We were lucky to be able to stay in a corner room on the 5th floor with a decent view. The room was bright and clean. We stayed for 3 nights and went to Disneyland and California Adventure. Because of the superb location, we were able to go back to our hotel room to rest in the middle of the day when the sun is harsh and the theme parks are packed. Best of all, they have wonderful staff. Special thanks to Britney who answered our questions and helped us getting around the area. She always greets us with her pretty California sunshine smile. We look forward to staying in Homewood Suites soon!

Very nice new hotel! This was our second time staying here! And plan on staying here again!! Like the fact the hotel is next to Disneyland's parking lot so we just walked thru the parking lot to the bus Which take you to the park!

Summary Heading: Best hotel I have stayed at
Summary: I was really impressed with this hotel. It is down the street from Disneyland and we actually walked to Disneyland. They have so much for the kids to do, there's a movie room, arcade, basketball court, putting green, bbq are with pits and swimming pool. They even let the kids play games on the computers. The rooms were very nice, stainless steel appliances and very roomy. The staff was awesome as well. You do have to pay for parking, but the have Valet Sevice that is included for no additional charge. I can't wait to go back to California, we will be staying back there again.

Summary Heading: Wonderful stay for a family of 5 or any size
Summary: What a great place to use as your home base while visiting Anaheim. Our family of 5 was able to spread out in our roomy suite, sleep well in great beds, relax in the pool or basketball court and enjoy a great breakfast to start each day. The evening social meals and wine/beer were a nice way to cap of the day (M- Th).  The staff were friendly and so helpful. A great stay!

Excellent hotel to stay in for a great Disneyland experience. Not too far from the park, Clean,spacious and comfortable rooms. Full kitchen was a plus with kids and babies, but breakfast buffet really made the stay over the top. Heading to Disneyland after a full hot breakfast was key in a great Day!..excellent value & made for a great week vacation. I would definitely stay here again.

We love this hotel! Our room was very clean and the staff are friendly and helpful. We will definitely recommend this hotel to our friends and families. Thank you Homewood suite for the excellent accommodations!

Summary Heading: Perfect for a Disney Park visit
Summary: I turned to Tripadvisor when searching for a place to stay near Disneyland.  Homewood Suites exceeded my expectations and more.  Check-in was effortless.  The room with fireworks view was worth it.  One of life's simple pleasures is watching Disney fireworks while feasting on In n' Out Burgers. The room was clean and having a kitchenette is very convenient.  A big help likewise is the coin laundry in the hotel.  Breakfast is standard.  I am not picky.  It is helpful that there were several stations to make your own waffles.  Our first breakfast had a limited selection of meats -- only bacon.  There were additional options on the second morning.  We did not get to try the evening selections but there was an offering as well.  There is a fee for parking and this is understandable.

Summary Heading: Wonderful place to stay. Highly recommend
Summary: LOVE this hotel. Wonderful staff. Excellent breakfast. Highly recommend this hotel. The breakfast was delicious. We stayed for 7 days and had a wonderful selection each day. The laundry facilities were clean. Rooms are new and clean. Loved the kitchen area.

One of the best hotels. The serve complimentary breakfast and dinner Sun-Thursday. the staff were very friendly. I definitely recommend this hotel. The pool was very clean. It's not too far from Disney land.

We stayed at the Homewood for three nights for our trip to Disneyland. We had a King suite which had a King bed and bunk beds with a trundle which was perfect for our family of 5. The beds and pillows were comfortable and we all slept really soundly. (and I am a light sleeper) The bathroom sink is separate from the bathtub with shower and toilet which made it easy for everyone to get ready in the am.  Our room was on the second floor and faced the parking lot and we had no issues with noise.  The free breakfast was great.  It does get really hectic after 8:30 but the staff works hard to keep up with demand. I would recommend going early if you can. There were several hot food items, make your own waffles, oatmeal, cereals, muffins and fresh fruit. It was a substantial breakfast

I took my family of 5 to Disneyland for 3 days, and stayed at this hotel. Rooms were clean, and spacious. Hotel is family oriented. Since I had my 2 grandchildren they loved the activities that were available to them. The breakfast was the best I've had at a hotel. So many choices! I plan to return.

We stayed four nights here and were impressed with location and the amenities. Had no clue that they served food in the evening time (not every night) so check when making your reservation. The breakfast is a nice addition also from waffles, French toast, pancakes, eggs to many other items they really a wonderful job and man is it busy.. The location to the park is really convenient also, from the free shuttle bus nearby or pay for the bus ( we chose the pay bus) much more convenient for the family. All in all great place to stay. Also lots of good food with walking distance.. Good eats nearby.. If your wanting to stock up on treats and eats bring with with you, you have a nice kitchen with full size refer, but if you forget to stock up there is a cvs pharmacy with lots of food.

If you are going to spend time at Disney you won't need to spend money to get to the park.  The Disney buses are just right around the corner and free to the park. The hotel restaurant has a large assortment of food both hot and cold.  Best to eat before 8:30.a.m.  They close at 9:30 a.m.  They do have coffee and hot water available all day long in the entrance. If you have a car it will cost $16 a day.  I found this to be a bargain since they have only Valet parking. The beds were comfortable and the room quiet for a restful nights sleep. Two t.v.s one in the bedroom and the other in the living room.  Nice kitchen if you prefer to do your own preparations and a decent size refrigerator.

I can say without reservation that the staff and facilities at the Homewood Suites Anaheim Convention Center are amazing! Every employee I interacted with, from the front desk staff to the housekeeping staff to the staff that helps with breakfast in the mornings was helpful and friendly. The room was clean and my family and I had no problems with anything during our stay.    Before our stay I had emailed the hotel about the view from our room (we got to see the Disney fireworks YAY!!) and found her to be quick to respond and extremely helpful!  The pool area is clean and well stocked, there is a game room with video games in that area along with rest rooms so parent or kids can "go" without having to return to your room. They show movies outside at night in the pool area so I go

It was a really spacious room, with a kitchen, living, bathroom, and bedroom with 2 queens. Definitely big enough for a family of 4. Close, walkable distance to Disney. Actually, theres a parking lot right next to the hotel that has a tram that runs to Disney very frequently which was super helpful. There is valet parking for free, parking is charged anyways.

Great location, you can walk to Disneyland Very convenient for families, including coin leundry  Very friendly staff  Very clean and quiet rooms  Had  a view where we could see the fireworks from the room Breakfast busy in the mornings - they know how to handle the crowds  Lots of variety for breakfast

I think the hotel was beautiful and well kept. I thought the staff was very helpful, friendly, and professional. I would definitely stay again and recommend it to others. There were several entry and exit door that makes it easy to come and go as needed. I felt very safe walking around the hotel inside and outside. The full kitchen was equipped with everything you need and more.

We took the Disney Resort Express to the hotel from the LAX which stopped off at the BW Plus Raffles Inn & Suites which is right next to Homewood Suites.  We arrived @ 930am hoping for an early check-in which they were able to accommodate @ 12pm, we enjoyed the pool while we waited.  Kids enjoyed the pool which also had a game room and mini putt which we took advantage of.  Towels readily available pool side.  Room was great for this family of 4 (2 adults, 5 & 8 year old).  Full kitchen had utensils and plates provided.  I just washed the items in the dishwasher with the provided soap, sanitize mode before first use.  Beds were comfortable.  Loved how there was a separate area for the living from the bedroom.  Free breakfast in the morning  was filling and started early enough

A really good hotel for families visiting Disneyland and doing other stuff while visiting LA. Great pool, rooms, service and staff. Free breakfast and dinner does not include what vegetarians need, but hey its free!

This hotel has everything you need. The pool was big, jacuzzi was perfect. The room are very clean and spacious. Full size kitchen. Social hour and dinner was also great....full breakfast with everything.

Stayed in 2 queens one bdrm for four nights while visiting Anaheim (two adults and three kids).  All in all everything was very convenient for our family: + Hotel is quite new and everything is still in good shape + The parking lot was easy to drive, big enough and not too expensive + Rooms were good Homewood standard and big enough + Liked the outdoor amenities: pool & basketball court + Coin operated laundry was good + Disney parking lot is next to hotel and if you are willing to walk about 800 meters you get free ride to Disney and back nonstop + "Free" breakfast is always a positive thing  Some issues that could be done better: - Breakfast (and evening reception) are little chaotic and I felt that there wasn't enough staff to clean up the eating areas and putting food on

We stayed here during our Disneyland trip and we were very happy that we did! We had a double queen bed suite, full kitchen, desk, and even a living room space with a foldout couch! The suite also has a large 40" plus sized TV including Directv and a ceiling fan, which isn't common to me but a wonderful touch nonetheless. The bathroom had a separate vanity from the shower room, a definite plus in my book. The glass shower enclosure was very large and accommodating as well. The accommodations alone were great but the hotel also treats their guests to a delicious full breakfast in the morning and an awesome dinner including alcoholic beverages! The hotel also has a huge heated pool, jacuzzi, arcade, gym, and outdoor hangout area with a basketball court. The hotel is a little too

We stayed at this hotel while on vacation to Disneyland. This place far exceeded my expectations. It is very conveniently located. We never took out the car once we arrived. The tram to Disney is literally in the parking lot next to it. We walked to a variety of restaurants down the street. The hotel itself is all brand new. Rooms are very roomy. We had little kids with us and because there was a kitchen/living room we were able to put them to bed and still hang out in the other room with the door shut. The entertaining area was awesome. They have a pool, spa, basketball court, putting green and game room all together. We spent a lot of time there when we weren't at Disney. I plan to go back and recommend this hotel highly.

I can't say enough about this hotel. It was the perfect homebase for our family of 5. After a loooong day at Disneyland (very conveniently located next to the toy story shuttle stop), the kids loved jumping into the family-friendly pool and having dinner poolside while watching the good dinosaur on the outdoor pool movie screen. The staff were friendly, the room was spacious and well-appointed with a kitchenette and full sized fridge (a major plus for a family of 5)!! They really have thought of everything!

We stayed for a convention and Disney activities. The location is great. The bunk room is a super sweet deal. The breakfast buffet could feed 50 Shaq's. The cocktail hour was nice. Rooms were big and clean. Staff was nice. Price is in between high end and fleabag, but this is no fleabag... this is my new top choice in Anaheim.
Manager Response: Thank you for letting others know about our hotel! I do have to say that the picture of 50 Shaq's heading into our breakfast area, makes me feel really short! We hope to see you soon and look forward to replacing your four stay review with a five star review!

Summary: This Homewood Suites was truly designed to provide its guests with the best possible experience.  Our kids voted this the coolest hotel room ever, and they have stated in several.  One actually said that her bunk bed was more comfortable than her bed at home--that never happens.  The family suite was so specious especially the bedroom area with nice separation from the parent/child sleeping space.  And again, the bunk beds were awesome!  Only about a 5 minute walk to get on the Disney shuttle from the Woody parking lot; very convenient.  Breakfast offered so many great options each day.  Most of all, the customer service from the front desk as well as the valet were outstanding.  Top notch experience!

Summary Heading: Wonderful Hotel with Best Staff Ever
Summary: This was a beautiful hotel with all of the amenities. The staff was so friendly and more than accommodating to any requests we had. The pool area was fantastic. My daughter loved being able to watch a Disney movie on the movie wall out by the pool. She wanted to leave Disneyland to go back to the hotel! Would highly recommend anyone to stay there.

We joined a few other families here in April to have a full Disneyland experience, even though we are local.  The customer service from start to finish was wonderful.  The kids loved the pool!  We ordered in dinner and the adults sat around the firepit and chatted while the kids watched the outdoor movie.  The room was extremely comfortable and had every amenity we could need.  The hotel is right next to a shuttle stop so getting to/from the parks was a breeze.  I can't recommend this hotel highly enough, especially if you are traveling with kids.

Summary Heading: Maybe best hotel experience I've ever had
Summary: Hotel was immaculate. Staff were consistently friendly and helpful - even when I had crazy requests and needs. Breakfast buffet was easily a 7 or 8 (outta 10). Weekday evening beer/wine and food was just what I needed. Proximity to Disney can't be beat. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

We stayed there last month with friends and our/their 5 kids (ages 1-6).  There are so many great things about this hotel that it's impossible to name them all, but I'll name a few: (a) amazing staff that prides themselves on customer service; (b) incredible FREE breakfast (lots to chose from) for entire family every day (huge money-saver when visiting Disneyland); (c) awesome pool deck for adults and kids, with a game room, a movie wall, BBQs, fire pit--it's a great place to unwind after a long day at Disneyland; (d) excellent location--a 5 minute walk to the free Toy Story parking lot shuttles to Disneyland; short walk to Garden Walk restaurants; it's even a very-doable walk to Disneyland; (e) the hotel is brand new; rooms are big, comfortable, clean and kid-friendly (you can

My family and I had a wonderful stay at the Homewood Suites! The staff was truly focused on their guests and went out of their way on several occasions, both prior to our arrival and during our stay, to make sure our visit was perfect. The rooms are clean, the beds are comfortable and the breakfast and dinner options are excellent. I only had one complaint and recently shared it in a survey sent to me directly by the hotel. My issue was that the hot tub was not truly hot tub temperature. It was warm, but just warm enough that all of the children would run over to it from the pool and jump in to warm up. I have nothing against well behaved children in the Jacuzzi, but these areas are generally more for the adults. When a Jacuzzi is the proper temperature, it takes most people a

I was so happy with my stay here this week. I was working an event at the convention center and had loads of luggage and supplies with me, and the staff helped me lug my things several times between the truck and my room, and back down again. And every time with a smile. All the staff are super friendly, the hotel is very clean, comfortable, and the price is very reasonable, especially considering they give you a huge FREE breakfast every morning! Not your typical cereal & muffins, they have a waffle bar, always eggs and some type of breakfast meat, potatoes, hash browns, fruit, yogurt, oatmeal, toast, coffee, juices, etc. This morning they had make your own croissant sandwiches.  It's very generous.  The location is perfect if you have any business (or fun) planned in the area,
Manager Response: We are totally excited about your stay with us and your extremely positive review. Thank you so much for taking the time to let others know about the service, amenities, and value you received staying with us! We look forward to seeing you again soon!

Summary Heading: Great for our family trip to Disney
Summary: Great location for visiting Disneyland. It's about a 5 minute walk to the shuttles in the Toy Story parking lot next door. There are entrances to the parking lot right off the sidewalk and we never had any trouble walking right in.You COULD walk to Disneyland, but we never did. I would guess it'd take about 30 minutes.   Our room was great, with a separate living room and kitchen area. I appreciated the nice big safe for locking up valuables while we were gone for the day.  Kids loved the pool area and the golf.   We also took advantage of the free grocery delivery, which was helpful, although they lost our list and it took a bit longer than we anticipated. Make sure you're not depending on groceries for the first day just in case.   Only one star off for the breakfast. It was
Manager Response: It seems that you enjoyed the overall accommodations and location for the hotel and we are pleased you decided to stay with us! I would like to address some of the issues you had. Please know that the grocery delivery we provide at no cost we is a service that sets us apart from others, and we take great pride in providing to our guests. Since we have opened I have not had any incidents of deliveries not returning on time. I just want to ensure people do not lose trust in this as your experience was an anomaly. Also, I am so sorry you did not enjoy our Suite Start breakfast, in particular our eggs. I do want to point out that the eggs are not powdered, they are in fact liquid eggs cooked for the masses. We are always striving to make it better for our guests, so your feedback is appreciated and will be addressed with the appropriate department heads. We want to thank you again for staying with us and hope to see you again in the future!

Summary: This was our first time staying at Homewood Suites and it was a memorable experience.  From making our reservations to checking out we had nothing but excellence service.  Melissa  made sure we had the rooms we wanted.  We needed connecting rooms and we wanted a higher floor.  Melissa gave us suggestions on ordering food from Von's  with free delivery and how to get the shuttle.  The hotel made sure our delivery was put in our room and in the freezer, since it arrived before we checked in.  Grandson loved making his own waffles in the morning.  It was fast and easy.  They have a happy hour with a light dinner, you can save a lot of money. We are a family of  4 adults and 1 teenager.  Hot tub, pool 2 thumbs up.  It is an easy walk to Disneyland, but get the shuttle back after a

Highly recommend this hotel.  It was very clean as it is a new construction.  Great breakfast with lots of choices.  We have stayed at several hotels in this area and this has been by far the best we have come across for the price.

For a family of five, this was a perfect place to stay!  Friendly and helpful staff, clean and comfortable rooms, great extras. Would definitely stay at this hotel again while traveling with our family.

Newly reopened Homewood Suites hotel across from the Convention Center. The staff was overwhelmed by the number of people staying at the hotel. Noise was very loud between the rooms. The breakfast was a zoo. Not enough hotel parking. Still, the overall amenities, cleanliness and ambiance were nice.
Manager Response: Hello markbU8155PU,  Thank you for staying with us, and for the detailed feedback. We have already follow-up with our team and know how we can handle the volume better. We also have systems in place now to minimize noise issues. We would love to have you give us another chance. I'm sure your next stay will be much better!

Summary Heading: Family vacation to Disneyland and Universal.
Summary: Great central location and very family friendly atmosphere.  We really appreciate the evening socials and breakfast.  The pool facilities and gym were top excellent--just right for families.  There's a movie viewing screen by the pool as added entertainment for kids.  You can barbecue by the pool and hang out by the fire pit.  Love it!  Free shuttle ride to Disney right next door.  You can even talk the service desk to waive the parking.
Manager Response: We are pleased that you and your family enjoyed everything the hotel had to offer! Our complimentary Suite Start breakfast and Evening Reception are definitely something have come to enjoy with us. Our Suite Outdoors area leaves plenty of options for the family. We hope to see you again in the future!

Summary: So impressed. Very friendly staff. Clean hotel (still smelled new). Great amenities. Great for family Disneyland trip. Very quiet. I don't think I ever heard any other guests when we were there. Highly recommend!!!
Manager Response: There is nothing quite like that new hotel smell! We are thrilled that you enjoyed everything that the hotel and to offer and appreciate the glowing recommendation!

Summary Heading: Nice, new hotel. Breakfast is crazy!
Summary: Just returned from this hotel. Room was clean, bed was comfy as was the sofa sleeper per my son. Layout of room worked well for our family of 3. Loved the pool area, just wish it was open later. Only two negatives: I had to call 3 times to verify the room I selected online was the one we would get. Each time I received different info about whether the room had a sofa sleeper or not. Staff didn't seem familiar with the room choices. When that was finally fixed I was sort of surprised that I was not offered a discount or something since they ended up putting us in a room that was more per night than what I had arranged on line. Second issue: the breakfast was chaotic. Per the front desk, the hotel was not fully booked but by the looks of the dining area, you would have thought it
Manager Response: We are glad that you enjoyed the room and our Suite Outdoors area. We keep the pool open until 10:00pm, because of it's proximately to guest rooms and the noise level that can come from the area. I apologize for the issues you had at breakfast. We do let people know about the busier times, but what you experienced definitely seems a bit out of the norm. I would be more than happy to review any kind of rate discrepancies with you. Please feel free to email me keith.moses@Hilton.com or give me a call at 714.750.2010.
