The hotel is nicely decorated with little conveniences around and even though we do not have children it was obvious it would be a great place for a family to stay.  The staff ALL just seemed to go out of their way to help and smile and say Hello .  We will definitely come back to this Homewood Suites wherever we are in the Anaheim area.  It is definitely, in our opinion, first class
Manager Response: Dear Barb S,  Thank you for taking the time to give us a 5 star review. We will gladly welcome you back anytime. :)  Sincerely, Melissa F.

Summary: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel in a 2 queen 1 bedroom suite Dec. 2 & 3, 2015 for a quick trip 3-day trip to Disneyland, and I wanted to check out this new hotel as well.  I was really impressed with how genuinely friendly and helpful everyone was at the hotel.  From the moment we stepped in the door until the moment we departed, it was a great stay.  Our room was very large with comfortable beds and equipped with a full kitchen.  I would definitely recommend this hotel for families looking for a hotel which will accommodate more than 4 people in 1 room.  Having a suite with extra bedrooms and a full kitchen is great.    The included breakfast was excellent with lots of choices to choose from and the food was great.  The hotel is close enough to walk to Disneyland, a
Manager Response: Dear Monica M,  Thank you so much for the kind words. Our team is genuinely happy to assist all guest and welcome them to their Home Suite Home while on vacation!  Next time you come down please let us know.  Sincerely, Melissa F.

Summary Heading: Nice New hotel, has some kinks
Summary: Very nice new hotel.  Staff were always friendly.  We also got a great deal on this hotel. The rooms were very nice and quiet, they play movies outside for the kids, and have a hot breakfast.   You can walk (although its a bit far with small kids), use the ART, or go to the Disneyland Toy Story lot next door and ride their bus for free to Disneyland.   Downsides to this hotel are that we couldn't check in until after check in time (almost an hour late), even though we checked in online 27 hours prior.  Parking is $16 a day, which I think it's ridiculous for any hotel to charge for parking.  We found dirty underwear under the chair in our room, garbage behind the can, and old soap containers next to the vanity.  The pool could be a bit warmer, it was too chilly for most people
Manager Response: Dear rachealt1420,  We truly appreciate the feedback from your stay. I would like to apoligize if we were not up to the standard you expected. If you could reach out to me at Melissa.Ferree@hilton.com I would love to go over your overall expereience. We hope to win you over and welcome you back in the future.  Sincerely, Melissa F.

Summary: We stayed for 5 nights and loved everything about this property.  We had a beautiful two room suite with full kitchen, living room and separate bedroom with two queens.  We were on the 4th floor and were able to see the fireworks from the park every night. Location was great and we could walk to the park in about 15 minutes - sometimes longer if we didn't hit the crossing lights just right. Most of the time we took the free shuttle from the Toy Story parking lot next door.  The breakfast was very good and offered numerous options - scrambled eggs, omelets, potatoes, a different meat every day.  Fruit, juice, cereal, waffles, French toast and more. The evening reception was a nice perk - soup and salad one night, Chinese food another and sliders another. Wine and beer as well.
Manager Response: Dear pdxgrammy,  Thank you so much for the great review. We are really proud of what we have to offer here. When you come back to the Disneyland Resort Area please let me know and we will take care of you.  Sincerely, Melissa F.

Summary: We decided to stay here with a family of five as we have stayed at this brand in other markets.  Stayed in the 2 room suite with two queen beds and pullout sofa.  It is a new hotel and staff is very friendly.  We have stayed at many of the hotels on Harbor Blvd over the years as well as all three resort hotels.  In terms of off resort site  properties, this is a fantastic choice.  Hotel is located directly next door to Disney parking lots so you can walk next door and catch the Disney shuttle to park entrance at no charge.  Rooms have full kitchens as well.  Breakfast was marginal but nice to have if you like.  We had a couple of hiccups with our room due to working out some issues with a new hotel.  The staff was very accommodating for this and corrected quickly.  Five star
Manager Response: Dear Jlouik,  We are happy to have been a part of your vacation. I promise the next time you come it will be smoother since we are continuously working on the kinks. Please feel free to reach out to me directly in the future so I can assist you in getting you the best room for your family.  Sincerely, Melissa F.

Summary Heading: Truly a home away from home.
Summary: We have stayed at Homewood Suites in various cities .  We always find the stay pleasant, comfortable and "easy".  This particular stay was at a "New" facility.  They went the extra mile to make sure everyone was "at home".
Manager Response: Dear H. Gary S,  Thank you for noticing that our team goes above and beyond for our guests. We welcome you to call this your Home suite Home when in Anaheim!  Sincerely, Melissa F.

Summary: We spent three nights at the Homewood Suites and absolutely loved it. The hotel is brand new and in a great location. It was about a 15 minute walk to Disneyland. We stayed in a family suite with a king bed, bunk beds, kitchen and living room. It was more than enough room for our family of four. The staff at the front desk were amazing and bent over backwards to make us feel welcome. We loved this hotel and will be back again the next time we visit Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear Chamittleman,  Thank you so much for the glowing review. We look forward to seeing you again next time you come to the Disneyland Resort area.  Sincerely, Melissa F.

Summary: We stayed there the second day it was open and I honestly expected there to be more problems than we had since it was so new. The room was really nice and obviously very clean. We were in town for the Avengers Half Marathon weekend. The staff was nice, but not all there. I had to call downstairs multiple times to find out if a portable crib was available for my daughter. I think the staff should have been a little better about following up with me instead of the opposite. Aside from that, the stay was great. I would have preferred the entire bathroom to have a door rather than just the shower and toilet as getting ready earlier than my entire family meant I had to be very quiet and basically in the dark. The breakfast area was nice and the food was fine. The hotel is on Harbor
Manager Response: Dear tanoshegir, Thank you for giving us a chance during our grand opening. Our Front Desk has really come a long from having their first day jitters. If you come to the area again please feel free to reach out to me. I‚Äôll be more than happy to help you with your reservations. Sincerely,  Melissa F.

Summary: We were so eager for this hotel to open as we have had great experiences with other Homewood suites. The hotel is clean and has great amenities and the best customer service in Anaheim. Unfortunately that was not enough to make us enjoy our stay because the noise in the hotel was unbearable. A bathroom exhaust fan runs continuously all night and all day. The walls are paper thin and we could hear the people above us. We slept poorly because of the noise and checked out early to find a more quiet hotel.
Manager Response: Dear 4realmomz, We are happy you enjoyed the amenities and service of our hotel and hotel team. I sincerely apologize for the poor night‚Äôs sleep. We hope you will give us another chance so that we may try to meet your standards for Homewood Suites. Sincerely, Melissa F.

Summary: The Homewood Suites was wonderful! The hotel staff bent over backwards to make you feel at home and be a help. The entire hotel is beautiful, clean and welcoming. Being able to see the fireworks at Disneyland from my hotel room was just an added bonus! I would highly recommend this hotel and, in fact, am hoping to return for a leisure trip with my family!
Manager Response: Dear Crystal C,  Thank you for being a supporter of our hotel. We are happy we could accommodate you with a view of the fireworks, as we know those are bound to be popular in the summer months!  Can't wait until you return on your next vacation!  Happy Holidays! Melissa

Summary: Stayed in room 252 Dec 2-4, 2015.  The hotel opened 3 weeks ago.  I would have rated this place 5 stars but there were 4 cons in my opinion.    The pros - The property is nice on the outside, and very nice on the inside.  Parking lot is very safe and plenty of spaces.  Parking fee is $16 which is average for hotels around Disney.  If you just walk up a block to the Toy Story parking you could jump on the free shuttles & it will save you plenty of time and money.  Otherwise you have to wait for the ART (Anaheim Resort Transportation) which runs several times an hour.  The room I stayed in was the 2 Qns/studio/suite.  This is a huge open floor plan with fully stocked kitchen.  (Microwave, full size fridge, small twin burner cook top, dishwasher, utensils, pots/pans, coffee maker,
Manager Response: Dear azdisneyfan,  Thank you so much for the super flattering review. We love that our guest feel the warmth from our staff. Let me know next time you come down; we will definitely take care of you!  Happy Holidays!! Melissa

Summary Heading: Homewood Suite Is One Of Anaheim's Treats
Summary: Very happy with this hotel. The only thing lacking is a nice lounge like the more upscale hotels in the Hilton chain. I was on business, but this is a very family friendly hotel just down the street from the entrance of Disneyland and the other parks. I had a room on the south side on the fifth floor overlooking the basketball court and putting green. It was a very quite room. This was a good value for a king suite with fold-out couch, kitchen with full refrigerator, plates, cups, flatware and other equipment for making a light meal. But, you probably won't need it. The breakfasts are full and hearty and have everything from oatmeal,fruit and cereals, to eggs, bacon, sausages, and do it yourself waffles. In the evening, they serve wine, beer, soft drinks and heavy appetizers
Manager Response: Dear HappyTraveler0109,  Thank you so much for the kind review. We definitely invite guest to join us in the lobby and the Suite Outdoors lounge (once it's not freezing) to come and relax. We hope to have you stay with us in the future. Please feel free to reach out to me for assistance.  Sincerely, Melissa F.

Summary: This hotel is very close to Disneyland (.6 miles, 15 minutes walking) and the Convention Center (5 minutes walking). For those who do not want to walk 15 minutes, there is a Disneyland Parking Lot next to the hotel. You may walk tot he parking lot next door and hop on their Free Shuttle (20- Toy Story Line). Pick up is at Woody Stop, but you may exit Woody or Buzz Lightyear.  The hotel staff are very nice and helpful. Free breakfast is included (eggs, starch, oatmeal, fruits and waffle station everyday).  The dinner light reception is good if you can make it on time. The dinner I was able to attend was Asian night (rice, chicken teriyaki, soup, salad) and please note FREE wine and beer was offered. Such a pleasure to come home to all of that after a long day of walking around
Manager Response: Kae S,  Thank you for making us your "Home away from home." I am very happy to read that your recent stay with us was a great one! We cannot wait to welcome you home again very soon!

Summary: Excellent value. Great location for Disney. Highly recommended. The breakfast is amazing and always plenty of food.  Great variety for the manager's reception.  You can't go wrong if you are traveling with a family to stay here. Very clean and quiet.  Within walking distance to Disney.

Summary Heading: Too many miss/disappointments with this property
Summary: I am starting this review by stating this is a review from a business traveler perspective, not as a family traveling to the Disneyland resort area. This property is brand new, less than a month old and a huge step up from the Homewood Suites in the Garden Grove area within a mile or so away which has become a dump! I am not sure if this is a corporate or franchise property, but nonetheless I am disappointed. I will also preface my review with the fact that I am a huge fan of Residence Inn, by Marriott, with several of these in the immediate area as well as a new one under construction right up the street. They will still be my first choice, but I wanted to check out this property. The name is Homewood Suites, it has the word ‚Äúsuites‚Äù in its name, yet the King room option on
Manager Response: Dear TravelingMan5989,  I am so sorry we didn‚Äôt make a good impression. Please feel free to call the hotel and ask for me. I would love to see what we can do to make it right for the last trip and how we can be proactive for the next trip.  Sincerely, Melissa F.
